Sense.DEF: the fifth letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第五个字母

Sense.DEF: the third note in the scale of C major or the musical key based on this note
Sense.TRAN: E音〔C大调音阶的第三音〕﹔E 调

Sense.DEF: a mark given to a student’s work to show that it is of very low quality

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=eartha connection between a piece of electrical equipment and the ground地线〔电器与地面连接的导线〕
the abbreviation of 缩写=E numberE数
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=east or 或 eastern东﹔东方(的)

Sense.DEF: used before another word to mean something that is done on or involves the Internet
Sense.TRAN: 电子的〔表示通过因特网做成某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: e-shopping
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 网上购物
Sense.EXAMPLE: e-commerce
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子商务

Sense.DEF: every one of two or more things or people, considered separately
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个或两个以上物或人中的〕每个﹐各
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had a bottle in each hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她两只手上各拿着一个瓶子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Grill the fish for five minutes on each side.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把鱼的两面各烤上五分钟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each member of the team is given a particular job to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 队里的每个成员都有特定的工作要做。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We each have our own skills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每个人都有自己的技能。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the children arrive, you give them each a balloon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们到后﹐你给他们每人发一个气球。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are four bedrooms, each with its own shower and WC.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有四间卧室﹐每间都有独立的淋浴器和抽水马桶。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tickets cost £20 each each ticket costs £20.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 票价为20英镑一张。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You get two cookies each every one of you gets two cookies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们每人可以拿两块甜饼干。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m going to ask each of you to speak for three minutes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想请你们每人作三分钟的发言。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There are 250 blocks of stone, and each one weighs a ton.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有250块大石头﹐每块重一吨。

GramExa.GLOSS: on each day, in each week etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a disease that affects about 10 million people each year
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年约有一千万人感染的一种疾病

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are talking about every person or thing in a group
Sense.TRAN: 每一个﹐无例外〔用于加强语气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: These are issues that affect each and every one of us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些问题影响到我们每一个人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Firemen face dangerous situations each and every day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防队员每一天都面临危险的情况。

Sense.DEF: used to say that we all have different ideas about how to do things, what we like etc, especially when you do not agree with someone else’s choice
Sense.TRAN: 各人有各人的想法〔尤指不同意他人的选择〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d have chosen something more modern myself, but each to his own.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我自己会选一些比较现代的东西﹐但各人有各人的想法。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Each is used before a singular noun. Use a singular verb after it. each
F2NBox.TRAN: 用于单数名词前﹐其后要用单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Each item was thoroughly checked.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 每一项都仔细核对过了。
F2NBox.EXPL: Even when each comes before ‘of’ and a plural noun, the verb should be singular.
F2NBox.TRAN: 即使each用于of加复数名词之前﹐动词也应该用单数
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Each of these people has some useful talent or experience.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些人个个都富有才干或经验。
F2NBox.EXPL: Each is usually used with a singular pronoun or determiner (he, she, it, his, himself etc).
F2NBox.TRAN: each通常和单数代词或限定词 (he, she, it, his, himself等)连用
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Each component can be replaced separately if it breaks.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 每一个零件如果坏了都可以单独更换。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Each child assembles his or her project with help from the teacher.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个孩子都将在老师的帮助下拼搭自己的作业项目。
F2NBox.EXPL: However, you can use ‘they’, ‘them’, ‘their’ etc when you do not want to say whether people are male or female.
F2NBox.TRAN: 但如果不想表明谈及的人是男性还是女性﹐可以使用they,them,their等
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Each individual has the opportunity to put into practice their newly acquired skills.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都有机会将新学会的技能付诸实践。
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use each in negative clauses.Use none.
F2NBox.TRAN: each不能用于否定分句﹐要用none
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: None of the answers was correct (NOT 不说 Each of the answers was not correct).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有一个答案是正确的。
F2NBox.HEADING: each, every
F2NBox.EXPL: It is often correct to use either each or every,but they have slightly different meanings.
F2NBox.TRAN: 使用each或every往往都是正确的﹐但意思上略有差别。
F2NBox.EXPL: Use each when you are thinking about the people or things in a group separately, one by one.
F2NBox.TRAN: 当人或物作为个体看待时﹐用each
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Each student came forward to receive a medal.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生们一个个走上前来领取奖牌。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Each time you exercise, you get a little stronger.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你每锻炼一次﹐都会强壮一点。
F2NBox.EXPL: Use every when you are thinking about the whole group of people or things together, with no exceptions.
F2NBox.TRAN: 当人或物作为整体看待时﹐要用every
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Every student was given a prize.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 每一个学生都领了奖。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: You have to enter your password every time you log on.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 每次登录都要输入密码 。
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use each after words such as ‘almost’, ‘nearly’, or ‘not’. Use every.
F2NBox.TRAN: almost,nearly﹐not等单词后不能用each﹐要用every
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Almost every window was broken.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎每一扇窗子都破了。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Not every child enjoyed the party.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 并非每个孩子在派对上都玩得开心。

Head.GRAM: not used as the subject of a sentence

Sense.DEF: used to show that each of two or more people does something to the other or others
Sense.EXAMPLE: Susan and Robert kissed each other passionately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏珊和罗伯特深情地亲吻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The girls looked at each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩们互相看了看。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They enjoy each other’s company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他俩很喜欢待在一起。

Sense.DEF: if you bettry to win money by guessing the winner of a race money each way, you will win if the horse or dog you choose comes first, second, or third
Sense.TRAN: 一注三赢〔下注之马或狗获得前三名便赢〕

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 十英镑的一注三赢赌注

Sense.DEF: very keen and excited about something that is going to happen or about something you want to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was eager to get back to work as soon as possible.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我渴望尽早回来工作。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a bright kid and eager to learn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个聪明的孩子﹐热爱学习。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a very hard worker and very eager to please.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她工作很卖力﹐而且很希望别人满意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A crowd of eager young students were already waiting outside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群急不可待的青年学生已经在外面等着。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: fans eager for a glimpse of the singer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 急于看一眼歌手的歌迷们

Sense.DEF: someone who is too keen and works harder than they should
Sense.TRAN: 过分热心的人﹔过于勤奋的人

RunOn.EXAMPLE: They’re eagerly awaiting the big day.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在翘首企盼这个大日子。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: People were pushing each other out of the way in their eagerness to get to the front.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们互相推搡着﹐拼命想挤到前面去。

Sense.DEF: a very large strong bird with a beak like a hook that eats small animals, birds etc
two strokes less than parthe usual number of strokes for a hole in a game of golf
Sense.TRAN: 老鹰球〔高尔夫球中比标准杆少击两杆入穴的成绩〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is watching carefully or is likely to notice something
Sense.TRAN: 锐利的目光﹐敏锐的观察
Sense.EXAMPLE: They carried on working, under the eagle eye of the owner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在主人的严密注视下继续干活。

Sense.DEF: to use two strokes less than the usual number of strokes for a hole in a game of golf
Sense.TRAN: 鹰击入〔穴〕〔高尔夫球中比标准杆少击两杆入穴〕

Sense.DEF: very good at seeing or noticing things
Sense.TRAN: 目光锐利的﹔观察敏锐的
Sense.EXAMPLE: One eagle-eyed passerby noticed that the window was slightly open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个眼尖的过路人注意到窗户是微微开着的。

Sense.DEF: a young eagle
the teaching of English to people who live in an English-speaking country, but whose first language is not English
Sense.TRAN: 作为附加语言的英语教学

Sense.DEF: one of many humorous films, mostly in black and white, made at Ealing Studios in London during the 1940s and 1950s, in which many well-known British actors appeared
Sense.TRAN: 伊灵喜剧〔20世纪40至50年代伦敦伊灵电影制片厂拍摄的喜剧片〕

Sense.DEF: another form of the suffix -an
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keynesean economics according to the ideas of Keynes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯恩斯经济学

Sense.DEF: the teaching of English to people whose first language is not English and who need English for studying at a college or university
one of the organs on either side of your head that you hear with
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tucked her hair behind her ears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把头发拢到耳朵背后。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a long-eared rabbit
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 长耳兔

Sense.DEF: the top part of a plant such as wheat that produces grain

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an ear of corn
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玉米穗

Sense.LEXUNIT: smile/grin etc from ear to ear
Sense.DEF: to show that you are very happy or pleased by smiling a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: She came out of his office, beaming from ear to ear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走出他的办公室﹐笑得合不拢嘴。

Sense.DEF: if something reaches someone’ears, they hear about it or find out about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The news eventually reached the ears of the king.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消息最终传到了国王耳朵里。

Sense.DEF: used when saying how something sounds to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: It sounds odd to the ears of an ordinary English speaker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这在一般说英语的人听来怪怪的。

Sense.DEF: the ability to learn music, copy sounds etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔学习音乐﹑模仿声音等的〕听力﹔辨音能力

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shehasnoearfor languages at all.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对学习语言一点也不在行。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a good ear for dialogue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 善于倾听

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone listens sympathetically to what someone is saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s always prepared to lend a sympathetic ear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是愿意倾听别人的心声。

Sense.DEF: to refuse to listen to bad or unpleasant news
Sense.TRAN: 拒听坏消息[令人讨厌的消息]
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t just close your ears to their warnings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可不能对他们的警告置之不理。

Sense.DEF: to be very keen to hear what someone is going to tell you
Sense.TRAN: 全神贯注地听﹐洗耳恭听
Sense.EXAMPLE: As soon as I mentioned money, Karen was all ears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一提到钱﹐卡伦马上就竖起了耳朵。

Sense.DEF: to be forced to leave a job,organization etc,especially because you have done something wrong
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因犯错〕被迫离职[退出某组织]
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’d better start working harder,or you’ll be out on your ear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好开始加把劲﹐否则将被开除。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be up to your ears in work/debt/problems etc
Sense.DEF: to have a lot of work etc

Sense.LEXUNIT: have sth coming out (of) your ears
Sense.DEF: to have too much of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve got pumpkins coming out our ears this time of year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年这段时间我们南瓜吃得太多了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: keep your/an ear to the ground
Sense.DEF: to make sure that you always know what is happening in a situation
Sense.TRAN: 保持关注〔以确保知晓某事态的发展动向〕

Sense.DEF: to always be listening in order to find out what is happening or to hear some useful information
Sense.TRAN: 时刻注意〔在发生的事或有用的信息〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope you’ll all keep your eyes and ears open for anything unusual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望你们大家都能密切注意任何不寻常的事情。

Sense.LEXUNIT: go in (at) one ear and out (at) the other
Sense.DEF: informal if information goes in one ear and out the other,you forget it as soon as you have heard it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know why I tell her anything.It just goes in one ear and out the other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我干吗要告诉她呢﹐反正我的话她也只是当作耳边风。

Sense.DEF: to hit someone on the ear
Sense.EXAMPLE: Behave yourself or I’ll give you a thick ear!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 规矩点﹐要不我抽你了！

Sense.DEF: to be trusted by someone so that they will listen to your advice,opinions etc
Sense.TRAN: 获得某人信任﹐忠告[意见等]被某人接纳
Sense.EXAMPLE: He claimed to have the ear of several top ministers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他声称自己在几位高级部长面前说话管用。

Sense.DEF: to play music that you have heard without having to read written music
used to say that someone thinks that people are talking about them
Sense.TRAN: 某人耳朵在发烫〔用于表示感到有人在背后议论自己〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is trying to listen to your private conversation

Crossrefto.REFLEX: send sb off with a flea in their ear

Collocate.EXAMPLE: African elephants’ ears are bigger than those of Indian elephants.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 非洲象的耳朵比印度象的大。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: soft and hanging down loosely, rather than being stiff
Collocate.EXAMPLE: a rabbit with big floppy ears
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只耷拉着大耳朵的兔子

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The dog has short pointy ears.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那狗的耳朵又短又尖。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She is deaf in her right ear.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她右耳聋了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the parts inside your ear, which you use to hear sounds
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’ve got an infection in my middle ear.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我中耳感染了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He whispered something into his wife’s ear.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在妻子耳边轻声说了几句。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: have a hole put into the skin, so that you can wear an earring
they are noticeable because they do not lie flat against someone’s head
the pressure in them changes suddenly, for example when you go up or down quickly in a plane
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人突然耳胀〔如飞机快速上升或下降时〕

Sense.DEF: a pain inside your ear
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got terrible earache and a sore throat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我耳朵疼得厉害﹐喉咙也痛。

Sense.DEF: a small earphone
liquid medicine to put in your ear
a tight thin piece of skin over the inside of your ear which allows you to hear sound
to tell someone how angry you are about something they have done
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave me a real earful about being late so often.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他狠狠骂了我一顿﹐说我经常迟到。

Sense.DEF: your ear
a man with a high social rank
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Earl of Warwick
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沃里克伯爵

Sense.DEF: the rank of an earl
the land or property belonging to an earl
no earlier than the time or date mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: Work will begin in October at the very earliest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最早在10月份开始工作。

Sense.DEF: the soft piece of flesh at the bottom of your ear
in the first part of a period of time, event, or process
Sense.TRAN: 〔时间﹑事件或过程〕早期的﹐初期的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the early morning sunshine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清晨的阳光
Sense.EXAMPLE: an afternoon in early spring
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个早春的午后
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the early days, the railways mainly carried goods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最初﹐铁路主要用于运输货物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is in her early twenties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她20岁出头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the recession of the early 1980s
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪80年代初的经济衰退
Sense.EXAMPLE: The money could be paid as early as next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钱款最早可以在下周支付。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spent the early part of his career at St John’s Hospital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在圣约翰医院度过了他的早期职业生涯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the experiences of early childhood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幼年的经历
Sense.EXAMPLE: the early works of Shakespeare
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莎士比亚的早期作品
Sense.EXAMPLE: My earliest memories are of fruit trees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最早的记忆和果树有关。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Early signs are encouraging.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早期的征兆鼓舞人心。

Sense.DEF: arriving or happening before the usual or expected time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bus was ten minutes early.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车早到了十分钟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was a few minutes early for my appointment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我比约定时间早到了几分钟。

Sense.EXAMPLE: David decided to take early retirementstop working before the normal age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维决定提前退休。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She drank herself into an early gravedied younger than is normal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因酗酒而过早去世了。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something has just begun, especially when you do not know how it will develop
Sense.TRAN: 早的〔用于强调某事刚开始〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s too earlyto say what will happen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在说会发生什么还为时过早。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s early days yet. I don’t want to make any predictions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在还言之过早﹐我不想作出任何预测。

Sense.DEF: being one of the first people, events, machines etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Early motor cars had very poor brakes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早期的汽车车装置很差。
Sense.EXAMPLE: fossil evidence of early man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原始人类的化石证据

Sense.DEF: the time between midnight and morning
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t finally get to bed until the early hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我直到凌晨才终于上床睡觉。

GramExa.PROPFORM: in the early hours of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The attack happened in the early hours of Sunday morning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 袭击发生于星期日凌晨。

Sense.DEF: a start made very early in the day because you have a lot to do, far to go etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔因工作繁重﹑路途遥远等〕一大早就开始[出发]
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to make an early start tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们明天一大早就得出发。

Sense.DEF: when you are very young, or starting when you were very young
Sense.TRAN: 年少[早年]时/自年少[早年]时起
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s played tennis from a very early age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从小就打网球。

Sense.DEF: if you have an early night, you go to bed earlier than usual

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think I’ll get an early night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想今晚早点睡觉。

Sense.DEF: someone who always gets up very early in the morning

Sense.LEXUNIT: the early bird catches the worm
Sense.DEF: used to say that if you do something early or before other people, you will be successful
Sense.TRAN: 捷足先登﹔早起的鸟儿有虫吃

Sense.DEF: potatoes etc that are ready to be picked before any others

Exponent.DEF: arriving or happening before the usual or expected time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: For once, the train arrived early.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车难得一次提前到达。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Let’s have an early lunch before we go.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们提前吃个午饭再走吧。

Exponent.DEF: early enough, so that you do not have to rush, or so that you have time to get ready
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Everything was ready for the party in good time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 聚会所需的一切都及时准备就绪。

Exponent.DEF: arriving somewhere or happening at the right time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bus was on time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车很准时。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The project was finished on time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目按时完成了。

Exponent.DEF: earlier than the time when you have arranged to do something or than when you need something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The building work was completed ahead of time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 施工提前完成。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some of the food can be prepared ahead of time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些食物可以事先准备好。

Exponent.DEF: earlier than the officially agreed time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Prime Minister called the elections early, five months ahead of schedule.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相提前了五个月举行选举。

Exponent.DEF: arriving somewhere or finishing something before the time when you have to arrive or finish
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We got to the airport with plenty of time to spare.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们早早就到了机场。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I finished the test with time to spare.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我提前完成了测验。

Exponent.DEF: immediately after you get up, or as soon as you start work
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll telephone her first thing tomorrow.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天我一起床就给她打电话。

Sense.DEF: before the usual, arranged, or expected time
Sense.EXAMPLE: We arrived early.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们提早到了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They must have come home early.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们肯定提早回到家了。

Sense.DEF: near the beginning of a period of time, event, process etc
Sense.TRAN: 在早期﹐在初期﹐在开展阶段

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She went out early in the morning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一早就出去了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was sent off early in the game.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛开始后不久他就被罚下场。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The building should be finished early next year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢楼应在明年初完工。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The restaurant opened earlier this month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家餐馆本月早些时候开业了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We want to start as early as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们想要尽早开始。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The disease is easy to treat if diagnosed early.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种病如果在早期就诊断出来﹐是很容易治疗的。

Sense.DEF: at an early stage in a relationship, process etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔关系﹑过程等〕在初期﹐开始不久
Sense.EXAMPLE: I realized early on I’d never pass the exam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始不久我便意识到﹐我绝对通不过考试。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We encountered problems early on in the project.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在项目初期便遇到了难题。

Sense.DEF: early in a football match or season; used especially by football players and managers when they are talking to journalists on the radio or television
Sense.TRAN: 〔足球赛或赛季的〕开局〔尤为足球运动员或主教练在电台或电视台的采访中使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were well on top early doors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在赛季之初排名高居榜首。

Sense.DEF: a system or equipment which tells you that something bad, especially an enemy attack, is going to happen
to decide that something will be used for a particular purpose or have something done to it in the future
Sense.TRAN: 指定…的用途﹔预先安排〔未来要做的事情〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: 85% of foreign aid is earmarked by Congress for specific purposes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 85%的外援物资被国会指定作特殊用途。

Sense.EXAMPLE: schools earmarked for closure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被指定关闭的学校

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had been earmarked as a potential leader.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被指定为未来的领袖。

Sense.DEF: two pieces of material joined by a band over the top of your head, which you wear to keep your ears warm
to receive a particular amount of money for the work that you do
Sense.EXAMPLE: He earns nearly £20,000 a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他每年挣近20,000英镑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You don’t earn much money being a nurse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当护士挣钱并不多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He did all sorts of jobs to earn a living.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为谋生什么活都干。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was the only person in the house who was earning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是家里唯一上班挣钱的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was earning good money at the bank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在银行工作﹐收入不错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chris will pay – he’s earning a fortune.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯会付款的﹐他在挣大钱。

Sense.DEF: to make a profit from business or from putting money in a bank etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The movie earned £7 million on its first day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影上映首日便大赚700万英镑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You could earn a higher rate of interest elsewhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在别处可以获得更高的利率。

Subsense.DEF: to do something or have qualities that make you deserve something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I think you’ve earned a rest.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你应该休息一下了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He soon earned the respect of the players.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很快赢得了那些运动员的尊敬。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He hopes to earn a place in the team.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他希望在队中获得一席之地。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The company has earned a reputation for reliability.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司赢得了值得信赖的美名。

Subsense.DEF: if your actions or qualities earn you something, they make you deserve to have it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That performance earned her an Oscar as Best Actress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在那部影片中的演出使她赢得了奥斯卡最佳女演员奖。

Subsense.DEF: to do jobs in return for being given a home and food
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We older children were expected to earn our keep.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们大一点的孩子要自己谋生。

Subsense.DEF: to be useful enough to be worth the time or money spent
Subsense.EXAMPLE: These aircraft are still earning their keep.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些飞机依然物有所值。

Exponent.DEF: to be paid a particular amount of money for your work.Earn is more formal than get or make.
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A newly-qualified teacher can expect to earn about £20,000 a year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新取得教师资格的教师每年可以挣约20,000英镑。

Exponent.DEF: to earn a particular amount of money every hour, week etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How much do you get an hour?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一小时挣多少？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She gets more than I do.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她挣得比我多。

Exponent.DEF: to earn money, especially a lot of money, or money that is not from regular employment
Exponent.TRAN: 挣得﹐获得〔大笔钱或非固定工作收入〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You can make a lot of money in banking.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 从事银行业能挣大钱。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jo makes a bit of extra money by selling his paintings.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔卖自己的画挣些外快。

Exponent.DEF: to earn a particular amount of money each year. This is the most common way of talking about someone’s salary in British English.
Exponent.TRAN: 工资为…〔这是英国英语中表示工资的最常用说法〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How much are you on?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你工资多少？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some chief executives are on huge salaries.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些总裁的薪水极高。

Exponent.DEF: to receive money for work that you do for an employer, not by working for yourself
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Workers are paid around $500 a month.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人每月薪水大约500美元。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I get paid monthly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每月领工资。

Exponent.DEF: paid a lot of money/not much money for the work that you do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: well-paid lawyers working in the city
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在城市工作的高薪律师
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was boring badly-paid work.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这工作很枯燥﹐工资也低。

Exponent.DEF: to earn a particular amount of money after tax etc has been taken away from your pay
Exponent.EXAMPLE: After tax and other deductions, I only take home £200 a week.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 扣除税款及其他费用之后﹐我每周实得工资只有200英镑。

Sense.DEF: someone who earns money for the job that they do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Private childcare is still too expensive for the average earner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对普通工薪阶层来说﹐雇家庭保姆照顾孩子还是太贵。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He is the only wage earner in the family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是家里唯一挣工资的人。

Sense.DEF: a business or activity which makes a profit
Sense.EXAMPLE: the country’s biggest export earner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国利润最高的出口商品

Sense.DEF: something that earns you a lot of money
Sense.TRAN: 使人赚大钱的东西﹐摇钱树

Sense.DEF: very serious and sincere
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rather earnest young man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相当认真的一个年轻人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Matthews was in earnest conversation with a young girl.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马修斯在和一个年轻姑娘认真地谈话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an earnest desire to offer something useful to society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为社会做贡献的真诚愿望

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 认真的表情/神情/声音等

Sense.DEF: if something starts happening in earnest, it begins properly – used when it was happening in a small or informal way before
Sense.EXAMPLE: On Monday your training begins in earnest!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期一你的训练就正式开始了！

Sense.DEF: to really mean what you are saying, especially when expressing an intention or wish
Sense.TRAN: 是认真的﹐是诚挚的〔尤指在表达意图或愿望时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wasn’t sure whether he was in earnest or not.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她吃不准他是不是认真的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Although he smiled, Ashley knew he was in deadly earnest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然他在微笑﹐但阿什利知道他是极其认真的。

Sense.DEF: the money that you receive for the work that you do
Sense.EXAMPLE: an employee’s average weekly earnings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇员的平均周薪
Sense.EXAMPLE: He claimed compensation for loss of earnings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他要求对工资的损失作出补偿。

Sense.DEF: the profit that a company or country makes
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s earnings have dropped by 5% in the first quarter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司第一季度的利润下降了5%。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oil provides 40% of Norway’s export earnings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油为挪威提供了40%的出口利润。

Sense.DEF: relating to the amount of money that you earn
Sense.EXAMPLE: an earnings-related pension scheme
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与收入挂钩的退休金计划

Sense.DEF: a small piece of equipment connected by a wire to a radio, personal stereo etc, which you put in or over your ears so that only you can listen to it
a small piece of equipment that you put into your ear to hear a recording, message etc
one of the two pieces at the side of a pair of glasses that go round your ears
the part of a telephone that you listen through
a small piece of rubber that you put inside your ear to keep out noise or water
a piece of jewellery that you wear on your ear

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was wearing a pair of beautiful diamond earrings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她戴了一对漂亮的钻石耳环。

Sense.DEF: near enough to hear what someone is saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone within earshot soon knew her opinion of Reggie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能听到她说话的人很快就都知道了她对雷吉的看法。

Sense.DEF: not near enough to hear what someone is saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: I waited for her to get out of earshot before laughing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等她走远再也听不见我声音了﹐我才笑起来。

Sense.DEF: very loud
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was an ear-splitting crack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传来一阵震耳欲聋的爆裂声。

PIC.HEADING: EARTH 地球
PIC.PICCONTENT: axis 地轴；Arctic circle 北极圈；line of longitude 经线；northern hemisphere 北半球；southern hemisphere 南半球；tropic of Capricorn 南回归线；South Pole 南极；Antarctic circle 南极圈；North Pole 北极；line of latitude 纬线；tropic of Cancer 北回归线；equator 赤道；crust 地壳；outer mantle 外地幔；inner mantle 内地幔；outer core 外地核；inner core 内地核

Sense.DEF: the planet that we live on
Sense.EXAMPLE: the planet Earth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地球

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The earth revolves around the sun.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地球绕着太阳公转。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: 71% of the earth’s surface is sea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地球表面71%的面积是海洋。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the origin of life on Earth
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地球上生命的起源

Sense.DEF: the substance that plants grow in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: footprints in the wet earth
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 湿土中的脚印

Sense.EXAMPLE: a lump of earth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一团泥土

Sense.DEF: the hard surface of the world, as opposed to the sea or air
Sense.TRAN: 陆地﹔地面〔与海洋或天空相对〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The earth shook.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大地晃动了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They watched the kite fall back to earth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们望着风筝落回地面。

Sense.DEF: used to ask a question when you are very surprised or angry
Sense.TRAN: 究竟﹐到底〔用于询问令人惊讶或生气的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What on earth did you do that for?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你那么做究竟为了什么？

Sense.DEF: to cost etc a very large amount of money
Sense.TRAN: 花费/支付/收取一大笔钱
Sense.EXAMPLE: It must have cost the earth!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一定花了很多钱！

Sense.DEF: the biggest etc example of something that exists
Sense.TRAN: 世界上最大的/最高的/最贵的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: the most powerful man on earth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界上最有影响力的人

Sense.DEF: used in religion to refer to the time when people are alive as opposed to being in heaven or hell
Sense.TRAN: 尘世﹐人间〔与天堂或地狱相对〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jesus’ time on earth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 耶稣在人世间的时候

Sense.LEXUNIT: come back/down to earth (with a bump)
Sense.DEF: to stop behaving or living in a way that is not practical
Sense.EXAMPLE: She soon brought him back down to earth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很快使他从幻想中清醒过来。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you mean nothing at all
Sense.TRAN: 绝对没有什么〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nothing on earth would have persuaded me to go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绝对没有什么可以说服我去的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no reason on earth why you should tell him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你绝对没有理由要告诉他。

Sense.LEXUNIT: look/feel etc like nothing on earth
Sense.DEF: to look or feel very strange
Sense.TRAN: 看上去/感觉等非常奇怪
Sense.EXAMPLE: The next morning I felt like nothing on earth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天早上我感觉非常奇怪。

Sense.DEF: a wire that makes a piece of electrical equipment safe by connecting it with the ground
Sense.TRAN: 地线〔电器与地面连接的导线〕

Sense.DEF: the hole where a wild animal such as a fox lives
to hide in order to escape from someone who is chasing you
to find someone, especially by looking in many places
Sense.TRAN: 四处搜寻最终找到某人/某物

Sense.DEF: to make electrical equipment safe by connecting it to the ground with a wire
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure that the machine is properly earthed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要确保机器妥善接地。

Sense.DEF: unable to move away from the surface of the Earth
Sense.TRAN: 不能离开地球表面的﹔附着于土地的

Sense.DEF: having very little imagination and thinking too much about practical things
Sense.TRAN: 缺乏想象力的﹔太实际的

Sense.DEF: an earthen floor or wall is made of soil
an earthen pot etc is made of baked clay
an earthenware pot, bowl etc is made of very hard baked clay
a human – used in science fiction stories
Sense.TRAN: 地球人〔用于科幻小说中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The earthlings were taken up into the spaceship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些地球人被带上了宇宙飞船。

Sense.DEF: no reason, use etc at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: I see no earthly reason why he shouldn’t come.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不明白为什么他不该来。

Sense.DEF: connected with life on Earth rather than in heaven
Sense.EXAMPLE: our earthly pleasures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们尘世间的欢乐
Sense.EXAMPLE: an earthly paradise
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人间乐园

Sense.DEF: a woman who has all the qualities expected of a mother and is especially interested in simple natural ways of living
Sense.TRAN: 纯朴且深具母性的女人

Sense.DEF: a sudden shaking of the earth’s surface that often causes a lot of damage
Sense.EXAMPLE: An earthquake measuring 6.1 on the Richter scale struck southern California on June 28.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 6月28日加州南部地区发生了里氏6.1级地震。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city is in an earthquake zone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该市位于地震带。

Sense.DEF: a science, such as geology, which involves the study of the physical world
Sense.TRAN: 地球科学﹐地学〔如地质学〕

Sense.DEF: surprising or shocking and very important
Sense.TRAN: 惊天动地的﹐震惊世界的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an earth-shattering event
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 惊天动地的事件

Sense.DEF: towards the earth’s surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: The missile fell earthwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 导弹落向地面。

Sense.DEF: a large long pile of earth, used in the past to stop attacks
a common type of long thin brown worm that lives in soil
tasting, smelling, or looking like earth or soil
Sense.EXAMPLE: earthy colours
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泥土的颜色

Sense.DEF: talking about things that are often considered rude, especially sex and the human body, in a relaxed direct way
Sense.EXAMPLE: earthy language
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粗俗的语言

Sense.DEF: a type of tube that is wide at one end, used by old people in the past to help them hear
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时老年人用的〕号角状助听器

Sense.DEF: a long brown insect with two curved pointed parts at the back end of its body
a tune that you keep thinking about in your head, even when you do not want to
Sense.TRAN: 总在脑海中回荡的曲调

Sense.DEF: if you do something with ease, it is very easy for you to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: They won with ease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们轻松获胜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The security codes could be broken with relative ease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 破译那些安全密码相对容易。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was impressed by the ease with which the information could be retrieved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 资料能够轻易检索到﹐这让我印象深刻。

Sense.DEF: feeling relaxed, especially in a situation in which people might feel a little nervous

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt completely at ease with Bernard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和伯纳德在一起感到很自在。

GramExa.GLOSS: make someone feel relaxed
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had an ability to put people at their ease.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有能力让人们感到自在。

Sense.DEF: not relaxed
Sense.EXAMPLE: You always look ill at ease in a suit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你穿套装看上去总有些不自在。

Sense.DEF: how easy something is to use etc, or the quality of being easy to use etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: It emphasizes the software’s convenience and ease of use.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它强调了这种软件的方便易用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bowl is removable for ease of cleaning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个碗状物可取出以方便清洗。

Sense.DEF: the ability to feel relaxed or behave in a natural relaxed way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a natural ease which made him very popular.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他优雅从容的风度使他深受欢迎。

Sense.DEF: a comfortable life, without problems or worries
used to tell soldiers to stand in a relaxed way with their feet apart
if something unpleasant eases, or if you ease it, it gradually improves or becomes less

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’ll give you something to ease the pain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他会给你一些药镇痛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This should ease the burden on busy teachers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这应该能让忙碌的教师减轻负担。

Sense.EXAMPLE: measures to ease congestion in the city
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改善城市拥堵状况的措施
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her breathing had eased.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的呼吸平缓下来。

Sense.DEF: to make a process happen more easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: The agreement will ease the way for other countries to join the EU.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该协议将为其他国家加入欧盟扫除障碍。

Sense.DEF: to move yourself or something slowly and carefully into another place or position
Sense.EXAMPLE: She eased her shoes off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她小心翼翼地脱下鞋子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He eased himself into a chair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他轻手轻脚地坐到椅子上。

GramExa.PROPFORM: ease your way past/through etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He eased his way through the crowd.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他缓缓穿过人群。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Jean eased back on the pillows and relaxed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼轻轻靠到枕头上休息。

Sense.DEF: to hold something less tightly
Sense.TRAN: 放松〔对某物的〕把持﹐松手

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel less worried about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would ease my mind to know you had arrived safely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 知道你已安全到达我就会放心了。

Sense.DEF: if you ease yourself or someone else into a new job etc, you start doing it gradually or help them to start
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the baby, she eased herself back into work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生完孩子她又重新开始工作了。

Sense.DEF: if something, especially something that you do not like, eases off, it improves or gets less
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rain had eased off a bit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨下得小一点了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you wait until the traffic eases off a little?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么不等到路上车少一些再走？

Sense.DEF: to stop being unpleasant to someone or asking so much from them
if a vehicle eases out, it slowly moves forward into the traffic
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车〕缓慢驶入车道﹐慢慢上路

Sense.DEF: to make someone leave a job, a position of authority etc, in a way that makes it seem as if they have chosen to leave
to work less hard or do something with less energy than before
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just relax and ease up a little.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放松一下干慢点。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something less

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You should ease up on the whisky.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该少喝点威士忌酒。

Sense.DEF: to improve or get less
Sense.EXAMPLE: The snow was easing up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雪下得小了。

Sense.DEF: a wooden frame that you put a painting on while you paint it
without problems or difficulties
Sense.EXAMPLE: They won quite easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们赢得相当轻松。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We found the house easily enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们轻轻松松就找到了房子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The castle is easily accessible by road.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 开车去城堡很方便。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s easily recognised by its bright blue tail feathers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 它那鲜蓝色的尾羽使人很容易认出它来。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is possible or is very likely to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first signs of the disease can easily be overlooked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疾病的早期症状很容易被忽略。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gambling can all too easily become an addiction used to say that something bad is very possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赌博极易成瘾。

Sense.DEF: definitely the best etc
Sense.TRAN: 绝对是最好的/最大的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is easily the most intelligent person in the class.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她绝对是班上最聪明的。

Sense.DEF: in a relaxed way
Sense.EXAMPLE: His son grinned easily back at him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的儿子向他轻松地咧嘴回笑。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of being relaxed and comfortable with someone
when something is not difficult
the direction from which the sun rises, and which is on the right if you are facing north
Sense.EXAMPLE: Which way is east?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪边是东？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He turned and walked away towards the east.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他转身往东走去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To the east of the pier were miles of sandy beaches.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 码头的东面是数英里的沙滩。

Sense.DEF: the eastern part of a country or area
Sense.EXAMPLE: housing problems in the east
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 东部的住房问题

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the east of Scotland
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏格兰东部

Sense.DEF: in the east or facing the east
Sense.TRAN: 在东方的﹐东部的﹔向东的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know the east coast well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不太熟悉东海岸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was born in East Jerusalem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他出生在东耶路撒冷。

Sense.DEF: an east wind comes from the east
towards the east
Sense.EXAMPLE: We drove east along Brooklyn Avenue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们沿布鲁克林大街往东行驶。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a small farming community 18 miles east of Paris
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴黎以东18英里处的一个小型农业社区

Sense.EXAMPLE: an east-facing bedroom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朝东的卧室

Sense.DEF: to or in the countries in Asia, especially China and Japan
Sense.TRAN: 去[在]东方〔指亚洲国家﹐尤指中国和日本〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The drug is being used all the time out east.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这药一直在东方使用。

Subsense.DEF: the countries in Asia, especially China and Japan
Subsense.TRAN: 亚洲国家﹐东方国家〔尤指中国和日本〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Martial arts originated in the East.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 武术起源于东方国家。

Subsense.DEF: the countries in the eastern part of Europe and Central Asia
Subsense.EXAMPLE: American relations with the East
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国和东欧及中亚国家的关系

Subsense.DEF: the part of the US east of the Mississippi River, especially the states north of Washington DC
Subsense.TRAN: 美国东部地区〔密西西比河以东地区﹐尤指华盛顿特区以北各州〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She was born in the East but now lives in Atlanta.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她生在东部﹐但现在住在亚特兰大。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He was born in Utah but went to college back East.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他生在犹他州﹐但到东部上的大学。

Sense.DEF: political relations etc between countries in eastern Europe and those in western Europe and North America
Sense.TRAN: 东西方关系/贸易等〔指东欧国家与西欧及北美洲国家之间的政治关系等〕

Sense.DEF: travelling or leading towards the east
Sense.EXAMPLE: A crash on the eastbound side of the freeway is blocking traffic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高速公路东向一侧发生的车祸正阻碍着交通。

Sense.DEF: the part of the US that is next to the Atlantic Ocean, especially those states north of Washington DC
Sense.TRAN: 美国东海岸地区〔尤指华盛顿特区以北各州〕

Sense.DEF: the eastern part of London, north of the River Thames
a Christian holy day in March or April when Christians remember the death of Christ and his return to life
Sense.EXAMPLE: on Easter Sunday
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在复活节星期日

Sense.DEF: the period of time just before and after Easter Day

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll probably go away at Easter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 复活节我们可能会外出度假。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We spent the Easter holidays in Wales.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在威尔士度过了复活节假期。

Sense.DEF: an imaginary rabbit that children believe brings chocolate eggs at Easter
Sense.TRAN: 复活节兔子〔小孩子认为该虚构的兔子会在复活节时带来巧克力蛋〕

Sense.DEF: a chocolate egg bought or given as a present at Easter
Sense.TRAN: 〔作礼物用的〕复活节巧克力蛋

Sense.DEF: an egg that has been coloured and decorated to celebrate Easter
Sense.TRAN: 〔经彩绘和装饰的〕复活节彩蛋

Sense.DEF: towards or in the east
Sense.EXAMPLE: We drove off in an easterly direction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们驾车向东驶去。

Sense.DEF: an easterly wind comes from the east
a wind that comes from the east
in or from the east of a country or area
Sense.TRAN: 在〔某国家或地区〕东部的﹔来自东部的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the eastern shore of the island
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 岛的东岸
Sense.EXAMPLE: farmers in eastern England
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰东部的农民

Sense.DEF: in or from the countries in Asia, especially China and Japan
Sense.TRAN: 在东方国家的﹔来自东方国家的〔尤指中国和日本〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eastern religions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 东方宗教

Sense.DEF: in or from the countries in the east part of Europe, especially the countries that used to have Communist governments
Sense.TRAN: 在东欧国家的﹔来自东欧国家的〔尤指东欧前共产主义国家〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eastern Europe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 东欧

Sense.DEF: someone from the eastern US, north of Washington DC
Sense.TRAN: 〔华盛顿特区以北地区的〕美国东部人

Sense.DEF: furthest east
Sense.EXAMPLE: the easternmost part of the country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的最东端

Sense.DEF: towards the east
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ship continued sailing eastwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船继续向东行驶。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: We followed an eastward course up the river.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们向东往河的上游驶去。

Sense.DEF: not difficult to do, and not needing much effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: The test was easy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考试很容易。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Finishing the task will not be easy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 完成这项任务并不容易。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There must be an easier way to do that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定有更容易的方法去做那件事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a great car, and very easy to drive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这车真不错﹐开起来很容易。

Sense.EXAMPLE: instructions that are easy to follow
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 易于掌握的使用说明
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would have been easy for the team to lose the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队本来是很容易会输掉这场比赛的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The software makes it easier to download music.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该软件使下载音乐变得更加容易。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Having you here does make things a lot easier for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对我来说﹐有你在这里事情的确好办多了。

GramExa.PROPFORM: as easy as pie/ABC/falling off a log
GramExa.GLOSS: very easy

Sense.EXAMPLE: The station is within easy reach of close to the town centre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车站离市中心不远。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The park is within easy walking distance close enough to walk to.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公园很近﹐步行便可到达。

Sense.DEF: comfortable or relaxed, and without problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: On the whole, Dad has had an easy life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总而言之﹐爸爸过着安逸舒适的生活。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had a nice easy day at home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在家里舒舒服服地过了一天。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You can have an easy time of it now that the kids have all left home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们都离开了家﹐你日子可以过得轻松了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t we make life easy for ourselves and finish it tomorrow?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们干吗不让自己的日子好过点﹐明天再把它做完不好吗？

Sense.DEF: not feeling worried or anxious
Sense.EXAMPLE: We talk more openly when we feel easy and relaxed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们感到气氛轻松﹑不受拘束时﹐谈话就会更放得开。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can leave the children with my mother with an easy mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以安心地把孩子留给我母亲照看。

Sense.DEF: friendly and pleasant with other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is gentle and easy to be with.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很和蔼﹐也容易相处。

Sense.DEF: able to be hunted or attacked without difficulty
Sense.TRAN: 易受追猎的﹔易受袭击的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The soldiers on the streets are an easy target for terrorists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 街上的士兵容易成为恐怖分子袭击的目标。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tourists are easy prey for thieves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游客易成为小偷下手的对象。

Sense.DEF: to end a situation in a way that seems easy, but is not the best or most sensible way
Sense.TRAN: 采取省事的做法〔但不是最佳或最明智的做法〕以摆脱困境
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just took the easy way out and gave him some cash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就用了个简单的办法解决﹐给了他一些现金。

Sense.DEF: to have no problems or difficulties
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s not been having an easy time of it financially.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她手头一直不宽裕。

Sense.DEF: money that you do not have to work hard to get
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can buy them for $10 and sell them for $25 – easy money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以把它们以10美元买下﹐再25美元卖掉——这钱来得容易。

Sense.DEF: pleasant to look at or listen to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Soft colours are easy on the eye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柔和的颜色很悦目。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it’s/that’s easy for you to say
Sense.DEF: used when someone has given you some advice that would be difficult for you to follow
used when saying that it is difficult to find a good way of dealing with a problem
Sense.TRAN: 很难找到好的解决办法

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not mind what choice is made
Sense.TRAN: 我随便﹐我无所谓〔即无论哪种选择都可以〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What would you like to do now?’ ‘I don’t know, I’m easy.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “现在你想做什么？” “不知道﹐我随便。”

Sense.DEF: to be in a situation in which you have plenty of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I get this new job, we’ll be living on easy street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我得到这份新的工作﹐我们的日子就好过了。

Sense.DEF: if you buy something on easy terms, you pay for it with several small payments instead of paying the whole amount at once
Sense.EXAMPLE: New settlers in the west could buy land on relatively easy terms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西部的新移民可以用相对优惠的分期付款方式购买地产。

Sense.DEF: eggs cooked on a hot surface and turned over quickly before serving
a woman who has sex with a lot of men
someone, especially a woman, who is easy has a lot of sexual partners

Exponent.DEF: not difficult to do, and not needing much effort
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an easy task
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不费力的任务
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The house was easy to find.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那房子很容易找。

Exponent.DEF: easy and not complicated – used about things such as instructions and explanations, or about machines and systems
Exponent.TRAN: 〔使用说明或机器﹑系统等〕简单的﹐容易的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The system is relatively simple to operate.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个系统操作起来相对简单。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a simple recipe for chocolate cake
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 制作巧克力蛋糕的简单方法

Exponent.DEF: easy to understand or do, and unlikely to cause you any problems
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a straightforward explanation
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 简单易懂的解释
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The calculation is fairly straightforward.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算挺简单的。

Exponent.DEF: easy to use – used especially about computers or written information about how to do something
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指计算机或书面操作说明〕易使用的﹐易掌握的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Their website is very user-friendly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的网站很容易使用。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a user-friendly guide to owning a dog
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 易懂的养狗指南

Exponent.DEF: easy because it does not take a lot of effort
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was an undemanding role for someone of his experience.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这工作对有他这样经验的人来说并不难。

Exponent.DEF: a cushy job is easy to do and needs very little effort – often used when you are envious of the person who has it
Exponent.TRAN: 〔工作〕轻松的﹐容易的〔常用于对做某工作的人表示羡慕〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a pretty cushy job – all she has to do is drive a nice car around.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的工作太轻松了﹐只要开着好车四处转悠就行。

Exponent.DEF: so easy that you can do it without thinking – used especially when it makes you feel bored
Exponent.TRAN: 无需动脑筋的〔尤指枯燥乏味〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: mindless tasks
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 机械的工作

Exponent.DEF: without any difficulties or problems – used especially when you expected something to be much worse
Exponent.TRAN: 不费力的〔尤用于表示原以为某事要难得多〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Finding the carhire place at the airport was relatively painless.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 找机场的租车处没费多大劲。

Exponent.DEF: to be easy and with no problems that you have to deal with
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Things should be plain sailing from now on.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 从现在起一切都该一帆风顺了。

Section.SECHEADING: INFORMAL PHRASES MEANING VERY EASY 表示“非常简单”的非正式短语

Exponent.DEF: to be very easy to do, especially compared to doing something else
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This test was a piece of cake compared to the last one.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次测验和上次相比是小菜一碟。

Exponent.DEF: to be surprisingly easy, or much easier than something else which is very difficult or dangerous
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Getting such details is child’s play when you know how to do it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要掌握了方法﹐获取此类信息就再容易不过了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Climbing in England is child’s play compared to climbing in the Himalayas.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在英格兰登山与攀登喜马拉雅山相比简直如儿戏一般。

Exponent.DEF: to be very easy to do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The software is a doddle to use.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个软件很容易使用。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that something is very easy to do or understand, and you do not need to be intelligent to do it
Exponent.TRAN: 那并不是难做的事〔表示不必很聪明就能做成或理解某事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Making your PC run faster isn’t exactly rocket science.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 让个人电脑运行得更快一些并非什么难事。

Subsense.DEF: to relax and not do very much
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Take things easy for a few days and you should be all right.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休息几天你就没事了。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone to become less upset or angry
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Just take it easy and tell us what happened.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别急﹐告诉我们发生了什么事。

Subsense.DEF: used to say goodbye

Sense.DEF: to not use too much of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go easy on salty foods such as bacon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 熏猪肉等咸的食物不要吃得太多。

Sense.DEF: to be more gentle and less strict or angry with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go easy on Peter for a while – he’s having a hard time at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这阵子对彼得好一点吧﹐他眼下在学校里日子不好过。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something would be very difficult to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Finding the perfect house was easier said than done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要找到十全十美的房子谈何容易。

Sense.DEF: to stop worrying
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can rest easy now – we’ve got everything under control.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们现在不用担心了﹐一切尽在掌控之中。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to be more careful and slow, especially in moving
Sense.TRAN: 〔告诉别人﹐尤其是搬东西的人〕小心点

Sense.DEF: informal to escape severe punishment for something that you have done wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rich could hire good lawyers and get off easy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有钱人可以聘请好律师﹐逃脱惩罚。

Sense.DEF: used when something, especially money, was easily obtained and is quickly used or spent
Sense.TRAN: 来得容易﹐去得快〔尤指钱财〕

Sense.DEF: an order telling soldiers who are already standing at ease to relax more
a large comfortable chair
not easily upset, annoyed, or worried
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her easy-going nature made her popular.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她生性随和﹐人缘很好。

Sense.DEF: music that is relaxing to listen to and has nice tunes, but is not very interesting
a word meaning very easy, used especially by children
Sense.TRAN: 极容易的〔尤为儿童用语〕

Sense.DEF: to put food in your mouth and chew and swallow it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Felix chatted cheerfully as he ate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 费利克斯一边吃一边兴奋地聊天。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A small girl was eating an ice cream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个小女孩在吃冰激凌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had plenty to eat and drink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有很多吃的喝的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s important to eat healthily when you are pregnant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怀孕的时候吃得健康很重要。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I exercise and eat right and get plenty of sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我做运动﹐饮食得当﹐睡眠充足。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like something to eat?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想吃点什么吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: She can eat like a horse and never put on weight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她可以吃得很多﹐但体重从来不会增加。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stopped at McDonalds to get a bite to eat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在麦当劳停下来吃点东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good eating habits are the best way of preventing infection.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 良好的饮食习惯是预防感染的最佳方法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: foods such as deli meats and cheeses
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 肉类熟食﹑奶酪等即食食品

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘More cake?’ ‘No thanks, I couldn’t eat another thing.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “再来点蛋糕？” “不要了﹐谢谢。 我再也吃不下了。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: No chicken for me. I don’t eat meat I never eat meat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不要鸡肉﹐我不吃肉的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does Rob eat fish?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗布吃鱼吗？

Sense.DEF: to have a meal
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s eat first and then go to a movie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们先吃饭然后再去看电影吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re eating breakfast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在吃早餐。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We could not afford to eat at Walker’s very often.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没钱经常去沃克餐馆用餐。

Sense.DEF: to admit that what you said was wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going to make you eat your words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要让你承认自己说错了话。

Subsense.DEF: used to say, especially humorously, that something is very good
Subsense.EXAMPLE: That’s a great drawing. Pablo Picasso, eat your heart out!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幅画真棒﹐比毕加索强多了！

Subsense.DEF: to be unhappy about something or to want someone or something very much
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If you had any sense you’d forget him, but eat your heart out if you want to.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你有点理智就把他忘掉﹐但如果你非要这样你就难受去吧。

Sense.LEXUNIT: eat sb alive/eat sb for breakfast
Sense.DEF: to be very angry with someone or to defeat them completely
Sense.TRAN: 对某人大发脾气﹔彻底打败某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t tell him that – he’ll eat you alive!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能告诉他那件事﹐他会气得活吞了你！

Sense.DEF: to use a very large amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: This car eats petrol.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这车耗油太多。

Sense.DEF: to admit that you were wrong and say that you are sorry
used to emphasize that you think something is not true or will not happen
Sense.TRAN: 我才不信〔强调认为某事不是真的或不可能发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the Democrats win the election, I’ll eat my hat!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果民主党选举赢了﹐我把脑袋给你！

Sense.LEXUNIT: have sb eating out of your hand
Sense.DEF: to have made someone very willing to believe you or do what you want
Sense.TRAN: 使某人俯首听命﹐使某人百依百顺
Sense.EXAMPLE: He soon had the client eating out of his hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很快就使客户言听计从了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: eat sb out of house and home
Sense.DEF: to eat a lot of some-one’s supply of food, so that they have to buy more – used humorously
used to ask why someone seems annoyed or upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s eating Sally today?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天萨莉怎么了？

Sense.DEF: used to say you are very hungry
used to tell someone that you are not angry with them and they need not be frightened
Sense.TRAN: 〔别怕〕我/我们不会把你吃了的

Sense.DEF: used to say that you will be healthy if the food you eat is healthy

Crossrefto.REFLEX: have your cake and eat it

Exponent.DEF: to put food in your mouth and chew and swallow it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Experts recommend eating plenty of fruit and vegetables.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 专家建议多吃蔬菜和水果。

Exponent.DEF: to eat a particular food
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘What do you usually have for breakfast?’ ‘I usually just have coffee and toast.’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “你早餐一般吃什么？” “一般就是咖啡和吐司。”
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We had the set meal.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们吃的是套餐。

Exponent.DEF: to eat a particular kind of food – used when talking about animals
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Foxes feed on a wide range of foods including mice, birds, insects, and fruit.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 狐狸的食物种类繁多﹐包括鼠类﹑鸟类﹑昆虫及水果。

Exponent.DEF: to eat or drink something – used especially in scientific or technical contexts
Exponent.TRAN: 吃﹔喝〔尤用于科技文体中〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Babies consume large amounts relative to their body weight.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 相对其体重而言﹐婴儿食量很大。

Exponent.DEF: to eat something with big continuous movements of your mouth, especially when you are enjoying your food
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was munching on an apple.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在大口吃着苹果。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They were sitting on a bench munching their sandwiches.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正坐在长椅上大嚼三明治。

Exponent.DEF: to eat something by biting off very small pieces
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If you want a healthy snack, why not just nibble on a carrot?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 想吃健康零食的话﹐怎么不啃根胡萝卜呢？

Exponent.DEF: to eat only a small amount of your food because you are not hungry or do not like the food
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因不饿或不喜欢而〕挑挑拣拣地吃某物
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Lisa was so upset that she could only pick at her food.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉萨心情很不好﹐只是勉强吃了一点。

Exponent.DEF: to eat so much food that you cannot eat anything else
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s always stuffing himself with cakes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是一个劲地吃蛋糕。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We gorged ourselves on my mother’s delicious apple tart.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没命地吃妈妈做的美味苹果馅饼。

Exponent.DEF: to eat soup, noodles etc with a noisy sucking sound
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In England it’s considered rude to slurp your soup, but in some countries it’s seen as a sign of enjoyment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在英格兰﹐咕嘟咕嘟地喝汤被认为没礼貌﹐但在有些国家却被认为是吃得高兴的表现。

Section.SECHEADING: TO EAT SOMETHING QUICKLY 快速吃某物

Exponent.DEF: to eat something very quickly, especially because you like it very much or you are greedy
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因太喜欢或贪婪而〕狼吞虎咽﹐大嚼某物
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You’ve gobbled up all the ice-cream!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你几口就把冰激凌全都吃完啦！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The children gobbled it down in no time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们不一会儿就把它吃光了。

Exponent.DEF: to eat food quickly, especially because you are very hungry or in a hurry
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因太饿或赶时间而〕狼吞虎咽地吃某物
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The boy wolfed down everything on his plate and asked for more.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小男孩把盘子里的东西一扫而光后还要吃。

Exponent.DEF: to eat food very quickly, especially because you are in a hurry
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He bolted down his breakfast and was out of the door within 5 minutes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 五分钟之内他就吞下早餐出了门。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t bolt your food down like that.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你吃东西不该这样狼吞虎咽的。

Exponent.DEF: to eat all of something quickly because you are very hungry
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In a very short time, the snake had devoured the whole animal.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛇很快便将那动物囫囵吞下。

Sense.DEF: to gradually remove or destroy something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stones are being eaten away by pollution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石头正受到污染侵蚀。

Sense.DEF: to gradually remove or reduce the amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: His gambling was eating away at their income.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的赌博在逐渐败光他们的收入。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel very worried over a long period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The thought of mother alone like that was eating away at her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一想起母亲孤身一人的情景﹐她心里就不好受。

Sense.DEF: to eat at home instead of in a restaurant
to gradually reduce the amount of time, money etc that is available
Sense.EXAMPLE: John’s university fees have been eating into our savings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰的大学学费一点点花掉了我们的积蓄。

Sense.DEF: to gradually damage or destroy something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Acid eats into the metal, damaging its surface.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酸腐蚀金属﹐损坏其表面。

Sense.DEF: to eat in a restaurant instead of at home
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you eat out a lot?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你常下馆子吗？

Sense.DEF: to eat all of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, eat up, there’s a good girl.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加油﹐全都吃完﹐这才是乖女孩。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s made a cake and wants us to help eat it up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她做了个蛋糕﹐要我们帮忙把它吃完。

Sense.DEF: to use a lot of something, especially until there is none left
Sense.EXAMPLE: Big cars just eat up money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开大车只会把钱造光。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be eaten up with/by jealousy/anger/curiosity etc
Sense.DEF: to be very jealous, angry etc, so that you cannot think about anything else
in a good enough condition to be eaten
someone who eats a lot, not much, only particular things etc
Sense.TRAN: 食量大/食量不大/挑食等的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never been a big eater.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向来吃得不多。

Sense.DEF: a restaurant or other place to eat
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the best eateries in town
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城里最好的餐馆之一

Sense.DEF: an apple that you eat raw rather than cooked
a medical condition in which you do not eat a normal amount of food and are ill because of this
food, especially for a party
Sense.EXAMPLE: You get the drink, and I’ll organize the eats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你安排喝的﹐我去弄吃的。

Sense.DEF: a sweet-smelling liquid used to make you feel fresh and smell nice
a liquid containing a small amount of perfume, used by women to make them feel fresh and smell nice
the edges of a roof that stick out beyond the walls
Sense.EXAMPLE: Birds had nested under the eaves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸟儿在屋簷下筑了巢。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately listen secretly to other people’s conversations
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was Helena eavesdropping outside the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海伦娜当时在门外偷听。

Sense.DEF: a website which people use to buy and sell things, especially by auction
Sense.TRAN: eBay 网〔网上购物及拍卖网站〕

Sense.DEF: the flow of the sea away from the shore, when the tide goes out
to be in a bad state or condition
Sense.TRAN: 处于低潮﹔处于衰退状态
Sense.EXAMPLE: His confidence is at a low ebb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的信心很低落。

Sense.DEF: a situation or state in which something increases and decreases in a kind of pattern
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ebb and flow of the conversation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时高时低的谈话声
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ebb and flow of passengers in the station
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车站里时多时少的客流

Sense.DEF: if the tide ebbs, it flows away from the shore
to gradually decrease
Sense.EXAMPLE: Linda’s enthusiasm began to ebb away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琳达的热情开始减退。

Sense.DEF: a virus that causes bleeding from many parts of the body and usually causes death
Sense.TRAN: 埃博拉病毒〔会引起人体内出血而致死〕

Sense.DEF: a hard black wood
black
Sense.EXAMPLE: her ebony hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她乌黑的头发

Sense.DEF: a book that you read on a computer screen or on a special small computer that you can hold in your hands, and that is not printed on paper
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机或掌上阅读器上阅读的〕电子书

Sense.DEF: very happy and excited
Sense.EXAMPLE: My father is a naturally ebullient personality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲生性开朗。

Sense.DEF: the former name for the EU
Sense.TRAN: 欧洲共同体〔欧盟的旧称〕

Sense.DEF: money used to buy things on the Internet, but that does not exist in a physical form or belong to any particular country
Sense.TRAN: 电子现金〔用于因特网购物〕

Sense.DEF: behaving in a way that is unusual and different from most people
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eccentric behaviour lost him his job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他古怪的行为使他丢了工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Aunt Nessy was always a bit eccentric.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内西姑妈总是有点古怪。

Sense.DEF: eccentric circles do not have the same centre point
someone who behaves in a way that is different from what is usual or socially accepted
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was regarded as something of an eccentric.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时人们认为我行为有些古怪。

Sense.DEF: strange or unusual behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kate’s mother had a reputation for eccentricity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特的母亲是个出了名的怪人。

Sense.DEF: an opinion or action that is strange or unusual
Sense.TRAN: 古怪的想法﹔怪异的动作
Sense.EXAMPLE: I found his eccentricities amusing rather than irritating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他的怪癖挺好笑﹐并不烦人。

Sense.DEF: a round cake filled with currantstype of dried fruit
a priest, usually in the Christian church
relating to the Christian church or its priests
Sense.TRAN: 基督教会的﹔基督教士的
Sense.EXAMPLE: ecclesiastical history
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基督教教会史

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that records electrical changes in your heart
a drawing produced by an electrocardiograph
a rank or level of authority in an organization, business etc, or the people at that level

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the upper echelons of government
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府高层

Sense.EXAMPLE: Their clients are drawn from the highest echelons of society.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的客户是从社会最高层吸引来的。

Sense.DEF: a line of ships, soldiers, planes etc arranged in a pattern that looks like a series of steps
Sense.TRAN: 〔船只﹑士兵和飞机等的〕梯形编队

Sense.DEF: a wild purple or white flower commonly found in the US. It is often used as a herb or as a medicine.
Sense.TRAN: 紫锥菊﹐松果菊〔常见于美国﹐可用作香料或药物〕

Sense.DEF: if a sound echoes, you hear it again because it was made near something such as a wall or hill
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sound of an engine echoed back from the thick forest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从茂密的森林里传来引擎的回声。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He could hear eerie noises echoing through the corridors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听见恐怖的声响在走廊里回荡。

Sense.DEF: if a place echoes, it is filled with sounds that are repeated or are similar to each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house echoed with the sound of children’s voices.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋子里回荡着孩子们的说话声。

Sense.DEF: to repeat what someone else has just said
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You bet,’ she said, echoing his words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “当然啦。她重复着他的话。

Sense.DEF: to repeat an idea or opinion because you agree with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The article simply echoed the NRA’s arguments against gun control.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇文章只是附和了全国步枪协会反对枪支管制的观点。

Sense.DEF: a sound that you hear again after a loud noise, because it was made near something such as a wall
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her scream was followed by a loud echo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的尖叫声过后是响亮的回声。

Sense.DEF: something that is very similar to something that has happened or been said before
Sense.TRAN: 十分相似的东西﹐如出一辙的事物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The article contains echoes of an earlier report.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇文章与先前一篇报道如出一辙。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This idea finds an echo in many African countries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种观念在许多非洲国家引起了共鸣。

Sense.DEF: a long cake covered with chocolate and filled with cream
Sense.TRAN: 〔外涂巧克力内填奶油的〕长条酥卷

Sense.DEF: praise and admiration
Sense.EXAMPLE: Miller’s new play has been greeted with great éclat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米勒的新剧赢得一片喝彩。

Sense.DEF: a way of doing something with a lot of style, especially in order to attract attention
including a mixture of many different things or people, especially so that you can use the best of all of them
Sense.TRAN: 兼收并蓄的﹔博采众长的
Sense.EXAMPLE: galleries with an eclectic range of styles and artists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收藏各个流派和艺术家作品的美术馆
Sense.EXAMPLE: an eclectic mixture of 18th and 19th century furniture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兼有18和19世纪风格的家具

Sense.DEF: someone who chooses the best or most useful parts from many different ideas, methods etc
an occasion when the sun or the moon cannot be seen, because the Earth is passing directly between the moon and the sun, or because the moon is passing directly between the Earth and the sun
Sense.EXAMPLE: an eclipse of the sun
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日食
Sense.EXAMPLE: a total eclipse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全食

Sense.DEF: a situation in which someone or something loses their power or fame, because someone or something else has become more powerful or famous
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people expected the growth of television to mean the eclipse of radio.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人预计电视业的发展会使广播业黯然失色。

Sense.DEF: less famous or powerful than you should be
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Bosanquet’s novels are now in eclipse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 博赞基特夫人的小说现在已经湮没无闻。

Sense.DEF: if the moon eclipses the sun, the sun cannot be seen behind the moon, and if the Earth eclipses the moon, the moon cannot be seen because the Earth is between the sun and the moon
Sense.TRAN: 遮住〔太阳﹑月球〕的光﹐出现〔日食﹑月食〕

Sense.DEF: to become more important, powerful, famous etc than someone or something else, so that they are no longer noticed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The economy had eclipsed the environment as an election issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济作为竞选话题已经盖过环境问题。

Sense.DEF: the path along which the Sun seems to move
relating to the environment
Sense.EXAMPLE: eco-warriors people who try to stop damage to the environment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境卫士〔指致力于环境保护的人〕

Sense.DEF: the gradual destruction of a large area of land, including all of the plants, animals etc living there, because of the effects of human activities such as cutting down trees, using pesticides etc
not harmful to the environment
Sense.EXAMPLE: eco-friendly products
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对环境无害的产品

Sense.DEF: a type of bacteria that can make you very ill if it is in any food that you eat
connected with the way plants, animals, and people are related to each other and to their environment
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ecological disaster
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生态灾难

Sense.DEF: interested in preserving the environment
Sense.EXAMPLE: ecological groups
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生态保护组织

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种对生态无害的生产过程

Sense.DEF: the amount of land needed by a person, group of people, or a society in order for them to have enough food or resources to live and continue to exist
Sense.TRAN: 生态足迹〔指人类生存所需的土地〕

Sense.DEF: a scientist who studies ecology
the way in which plants, animals, and people are related to each other and to their environment, or the scientific study of this
Sense.EXAMPLE: the natural ecology of the Earth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地球的自然生态
Sense.EXAMPLE: plant ecology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 植物生态学

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写=e-commerce电子商务

Sense.DEF: the activity of buying and selling goods and services and doing other business activities using a computer and the Internet
Sense.EXAMPLE: e-commerce applications such as online ticketing and reservations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 网上售票﹑预订等电子商务应用

Sense.DEF: relating to trade, in-dustry, and the management of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Economic growth is slow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济增长缓慢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the government’s economic policy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的经济政策
Sense.EXAMPLE: Economic reform is needed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济改革势在必行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the current economic climate conditions, we must keep costs down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在当前的经济形势下﹐我们一定要控制好成本。

Sense.DEF: an economic process, activity etc produces enough profit for it to continue
Sense.TRAN: 产生经济效益的﹐可赚钱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is no longer economic to run the service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经营这项服务不再有利可图了。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse with economical(=cheap or not wasteful).不要与 economical(经济的﹐节约的)混淆。

Sense.DEF: using money, time, goods etc carefully and without wasting any
Sense.EXAMPLE: A small car is more economical to run.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开小型汽车比较省油。
Sense.EXAMPLE: good-quality clothes at economical prices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 物美价廉的衣服

Sense.DEF: used humorously to say that someone is not telling the truth
in a way that is related to systems of money, trade, or business
Sense.EXAMPLE: In economically advanced countries, women marry later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在经济发达国家﹐女性结婚比较晚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Economically, capitalism has transformed societies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从经济上来说﹐资本主义改变了社会。

Sense.DEF: in a way that uses money, goods, time etc without wasting any
Sense.EXAMPLE: We produce food as economically as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们生产食品时力求节省。

Sense.DEF: the study of the way in which money and goods are produced and used
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Harvard professor of economics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈佛大学的经济学教授

Sense.DEF: the way in which money influences whether a plan, business etc will work effectively
Sense.TRAN: 经济情况﹐经济因素﹔经济意义
Sense.EXAMPLE: the economics of the scheme
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该计划的经济情况

Sense.DEF: someone who studies the way in which money and goods are produced and used and the systems of business and trade
to reduce the amount of money, time, goods etc that you use

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Higher taxes encourage people to economize on fuel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 较高的赋税促使人们节省燃料。

Sense.DEF: the system by which a country’s money and goods are produced and used, or a country considered in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a successful economy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发展成功的经济
Sense.EXAMPLE: the slowdown in the Japanese economy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日本经济的减缓

Sense.DEF: something that you do in order to spend less money
Sense.EXAMPLE: The council must make economies to meet government spending targets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市政会必须采取节约措施以达到政府的开支指标。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not insuring your belongings is a false economy it is cheaper but could have bad results.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不给个人财产投保实际上并不划算。

Sense.DEF: the careful use of money, time, goods etc so that nothing is wasted
Sense.EXAMPLE: The gas fire was turned low for reasons of economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了节省﹐把煤气取暖器开小了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company announced that it would cut 500 jobs as part of an economy drive a way to save money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司宣布将裁员500人﹐作为节省开支的措施之一。

Sense.DEF: technical the financial advantages of producing something in very large quantities
Sense.TRAN: 规模经济〔因生产规模扩大而成本降低〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The new government inherited a strong economy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 新政府接手的是一个经济繁荣的国家。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 疲软的/不景气的/萧条的
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The economy is weak and consumer confidence is low.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济疲软﹐消费者信心低迷。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: weak and likely to become worse
steady, rather than being strong then weak
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The economy has been relatively stable for the last two or three years.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近两三年来经济相对稳定。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: bad and not progressing or improving
starting to become weaker
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government must take action to boost the flagging economy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府必须采取措施振兴萎靡的经济。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: extremely strong and successful
Collocate.EXAMPLE: What can we learn from China’s booming economy?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们能从中国迅速发展的经济中学到什么？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Rising oil prices threaten the world economy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 油价上涨威胁世界经济。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in one particular country or area
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The new factory has given a massive boost to the local economy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 新工厂大大推动了当地经济。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: the world’s two most powerful economies
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界上两个最强大的经济体

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Small economies like Kenya might struggle to survive in a global recession.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 像肯尼亚这样的小型经济体可能要在全球经济衰退中挣扎求存。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is based mainly on industries producing goods or materials
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Expectations for growth in the main industrial economies remain low.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于主要工业经济体增长的预期依然很低。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is based mainly on farming
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The early 1920s saw a rapid expansion in the American agricultural economy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪20年代初美国的农业经济迅速增长。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is based mainly on selling services such as insurance or tourism
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Britain has shifted from a manufacturing to a service economy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国已从制造型经济转为服务型经济。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: based on companies producing and selling products freely, without restrictions
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Eastern European countries were gradually making the transition to a market economy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 东欧国家正逐渐向市场经济转型。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: based on a capitalist or socialist political system
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 资本主义/社会主义经济
Collocate.EXAMPLE: the large capitalist economies of western Europe
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 西欧资本主义经济大国

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: business activity in which people buy and sell goods illegally, without paying tax

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Governments are judged on how well they manage the economy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 通过管理经济的能力来对政府进行评估。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make it stronger
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It is hoped that the Olympic Games will boost the country’s economy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们希望奥运会能促进国家经济。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make it less successful
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Sanctions have damaged the economy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 制裁措施使经济蒙受了损失。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The floods last year destroyed the region’s economy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年的洪水摧毁了该地区的经济。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: becomes more successful
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The economy grew by 3% last year.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年经济增长了3%。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: becomes very successful very quickly

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The US economy is slowing down after a long period of growth.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国经济长期增长后正逐渐放缓。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: returns to normal condition after a period of trouble or difficulty

Sense.DEF: a product that is cheaper because you are buying a larger amount
Sense.TRAN: 经济装﹐实惠装〔指比标准包装量大而便宜的包装〕

Sense.DEF: the cheapest type of seats in a plane
a serious illness in which people get blood clots because they have been sitting for a long time in a very small space on a plane
all the animals and plants in a particular area, and the way in which they are related to each other and to their environment
when someone tries to stop or harm organizations or companies that do things that are bad for the environment

the business of organizing holidays to natural areas, especially areas that are far away such as the rain forest,where people can visit and learn about the area in a way that will not hurt the environment
a new town that the government builds in a way that makes it not harmful to the environment
a small group of homes where people try not to harm the environment, for example by using renewable energy or living in a simple way
someone who takes action in order to stop damage to the environment
Sense.TRAN: 生态卫士﹐环境卫士〔指致力于保护环境的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eco-warriors are trying to stop the new road being built.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境卫士正在尽力阻止这条新公路的修建。

Sense.DEF: a pale brown colour
a feeling of extreme happiness

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was in an ecstasy of love.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她爱得如痴如狂。

GramExa.GLOSS: become very happy and excited

Sense.DEF: an illegal drug that gives a feeling of happiness and energy. Ecstasy is especially used by people who go out to dance at clubs and parties.
feeling extremely happy and excited
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ecstatic welcome from the thousands who lined the streets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数千人狂热的夹道欢迎

Sense.DEF: a reviewan opinion about a film, play etc that appears in a newspaper or magazine, praise etc that says that something is very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: The exhibition attracted thousands of visitors and ecstatic reviews.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 展览会吸引了成千上万的参观者﹐并获得狂热的评论。

Sense.DEF: electro-convulsive therapy; another word for electric shock therapy
someone with a naturally thin body
the removing of a particular part of someone’s body by an operation
Sense.EXAMPLE: an appendectomy removing the appendix
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阑尾切除手术

Sense.DEF: a pregnancy in which an unborn baby develops outside its mother’s uterus, usually in a fallopian tube
supporting the idea of uniting the different branches of the Christian religion
Sense.TRAN: 支持基督教(不同教派)大联合的

Sense.DEF: a condition in which your skin becomes dry, red, and swollen

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写=education教育
Sense.EXAMPLE: Higher Ed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高等教育

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=edited, edition, or 或 editor编辑过的﹔版本﹔编辑

Sense.DEF: forms the regular past tense and past participle of verbs. The past participle form is often used as an adjective.
Sense.TRAN: 〔构成规则动词的过去式和过去分词﹐其中过去分词常用作形容词〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want, I wanted, I have wanted
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想
Sense.EXAMPLE: I show, I showed, I have shown
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我出示
Sense.EXAMPLE: He walked away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走开了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sound that echoed through the room
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在房间中回荡的声音
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wanted criminal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通缉犯

Sense.DEF: having a particular thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bearded man a man with a beard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 留着胡子的男人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a kind-hearted woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好心的女人

Sense.DEF: a type of yellow cheese from the Netherlands
Sense.TRAN: 埃丹奶酪﹐荷兰球形奶酪〔呈黄色〕

Sense.DEF: a circular movement of water, wind, dust etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔水等的〕漩涡﹔〔风﹑尘土等的〕旋涡
Sense.EXAMPLE: The racing river caused swirling eddies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 湍急的河水形成了许多漩涡。

Sense.DEF: if water, wind, dust etc eddies, it moves around with a circular movement
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mist eddied round the house.
