Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 薄雾旋绕在房子周围。

Sense.DEF: in the Bible story, the garden where Adam and Eve, the first humans lived, often seen as a place of happiness and innocence
Sense.TRAN: 伊甸园〔《圣经》故事中人类始祖亚当和夏娃最初居住的园子﹐常被认为是纯洁清净的乐园〕

PIC.HEADING: EDGE 边缘
PIC.PICCONTENT: border 饰边；edge 边缘；rim 边缘；margin 页边

Sense.DEF: the part of an object that is furthest from its centre
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put the eggs in the centre of the dish, with the vegetables and herbs around the edge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把鸡蛋放在盘子中间﹐盘边一圈放些蔬菜和香草。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the right hand edge of the page
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该页的右手边
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jennifer walked to the edge of the wood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮弗走到树林的边上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Billy sat on the edge of the bed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比利坐在床边。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He stood at the water’s edge staring across the lake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站在水边﹐凝视着湖对面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A leaf was on the ground, curling up at the edges.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地上有一片叶子﹐叶边卷曲着。

Sense.DEF: the thin sharp part of a blade or tool that cuts
Sense.EXAMPLE: a knife with a sharp edge
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刀刃锋利的小刀

Sense.DEF: something that gives you an advantage over others
Sense.EXAMPLE: Companies are employing more research teams to get an edge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各家公司都在雇用更多的研究团队以占取优势。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The next version of the software will have the edge over its competitors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该软件的下一个版本会比竞争对手更胜一筹。

Sense.DEF: nervous, especially because you are expecting something unpleasant to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul felt on edge about meeting Lisa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要与莉萨见面﹐保罗感到紧张不安。

Sense.DEF: a quality in someone’s voice that makes it sound slightly angry or impatient
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was an edge of hostility in Jack’s voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克的话音里流露出敌意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Desperation lent an edge to her voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的话音中透着一丝绝望。

Sense.DEF: an area beside a very steep slope
Sense.EXAMPLE: She walked almost to the edge of the cliff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她几乎走到了悬崖的边缘。

Sense.DEF: close to the point at which something different, especially something bad, will happen
Sense.TRAN: 某事快要发生〔尤指不好的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their economy is on the edge of collapse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的经济濒临崩溃。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is on the edge of despair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她几近绝望。

Sense.DEF: a special quality of excitement or danger
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school’s campaign has been given an extra edge by being filmed for television.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校的这一运动被拍成电视﹐这为其增添了一分别样的色彩。

Sense.DEF: to make something less bad, good, strong etc
Sense.TRAN: 使某物减弱﹐减轻某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pascoe was drinking whisky to take the edge off the pain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕斯科在喝威士忌酒来缓解疼痛。

Sense.LEXUNIT: on the edge of your seat
Sense.DEF: giving all your attention to something exciting
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film’s ending had me on the edge of my seat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影片的结尾让我非常激动。

Sense.DEF: to be behaving in a way that makes it seem as if you are going crazy
Sense.TRAN: 举止疯癫﹐行为几近疯狂

Exponent.DEF: the part of something that is furthest from its centre or nearest the place where it ends
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He got up quickly, knocking his plate off the edge of the table.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一下子站起身﹐碰落了桌边的盘子。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the outer edge of the village
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 村子的外围

Exponent.DEF: the part of something that is near its left or right edge
Exponent.EXAMPLE: On the left side of the garden there was an old stone wall.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 花园左侧有一面旧石墙。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They parked by the side of the road.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把车停在路边。

Exponent.DEF: the edge of something circular, especially the top of a cup or glass, or the outside edge of a pair of glasses
Exponent.TRAN: 〔圆形物体﹐尤指茶杯﹑玻璃杯的〕边沿﹔眼镜框
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a white cup with a gold rim
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 镶金边的白色杯子
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was looking at me over the rim of her spectacles.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从眼镜框上方看着我。

Exponent.DEF: the empty space at the side of a page that has writing on it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My teacher had marked my essay and made some comments in the margin.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师批改了我的文章﹐在页边空白处写了几句评语。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Leave wide margins on both sides of the page.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 页面两边都要留出宽裕的空白。

Exponent.DEF: the edge of a piece of cloth that is turned under and stitched down, especially the lower edge of a skirt, trousers etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指裙脚﹑裤脚处的〕褶边﹐卷边
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If you want the dress a bit shorter, I can easily turn up the hem.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你想让裙子短一点﹐我来把裙边折上去就行了。

Exponent.DEF: the edge of the pavement (=raised path) at the side of a road
Exponent.TRAN: 〔人行道的〕道缘﹐路缘﹐马路牙子
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A big black car was parked at the kerb.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆黑色大汽车停在马路边。

Exponent.DEF: the areas of a city that are furthest away from the centre
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The new station was built on the outskirts of the city.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新车站建在市郊。

Exponent.DEF: the outside edge around an enclosed area of land such as a military camp or a prison
Exponent.TRAN: 〔军营或监狱等封闭区域的〕四周﹐周边
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Security guards patrol the perimeter night and day.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 保安人员日夜在四周巡逻。

Sense.DEF: to move gradually with several small movements, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tim was edging away from the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆慢慢地从人群中走开。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She edged closer to get a better look.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她慢慢地靠近﹐想看得清楚一些。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He edged her towards the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他慢慢地把她往门口推。

GramExa.PROPFORM: edge your way into/round/through etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Christine edged her way round the back of the house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯蒂娜慢慢地绕过房子的后面。

Sense.DEF: to put something on the edge or border of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city square was edged by trees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市广场树木环绕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tablecloth is edged with lace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这块桌布镶着蕾丝花边。

Sense.DEF: to change gradually, especially so as to get better or worse

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Profits have edged up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利润增加了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The paper has edged ahead of been more successful than its rivals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报纸越办越好﹐超过了竞争对手。

Sense.DEF: to cut the edges of an area of grass so that they are tidy and straight
to defeat someone by a small amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: Italy edged out France by two points.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意大利队险胜法国队两分。

Sense.DEF: to gradually force someone to leave their job or an area of activity

an area at the edge of a large city that has its own businesses, shops, offices etc, so that many of the people who used to live there while working in the large city now both live and work in the edge city
Sense.TRAN: 〔兴建于大城市市郊的〕边缘城市﹐卫星城

Sense.DEF: sideways
something that forms an edge or border
Sense.EXAMPLE: a white handkerchief with blue edging
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 镶蓝边的白手帕

Sense.DEF: nervous and worried
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s been edgy lately, waiting for the test results.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她最近一直心绪不宁﹐在等测验结果。

Sense.DEF: aware of the newest ideas and styles and therefore considered very fashionable
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band has developed an edgy new image.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该乐队换上了前卫的新形象。

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写=electronic data interchange电子数据交换

Sense.DEF: something that is edible can be eaten
Sense.EXAMPLE: These berries are edible, but those are poisonous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些浆果可以吃﹐但那些有毒。

Sense.DEF: an official public order made by someone in a position of power
Sense.EXAMPLE: The emperor issued an edict forbidding anyone to leave the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皇帝下令禁止任何人出城。

Sense.DEF: any order – used humorously
a building, especially a large one
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their head office was an imposing edifice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的总部大楼是一幢宏伟建筑。

Sense.DEF: to improve someone’s mind or character by teaching them something

RunOn.EXAMPLE: For our edification, the preacher reminded us what ‘duty’ meant.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为对我们的教导﹐传道人提醒我们“责任”的意义。

Sense.DEF: an edifying speech, book etc improves your mind or moral character by teaching you something – sometimes used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 教诲的﹔启迪的﹔陶冶情操的〔有时为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a morally edifying film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陶冶情操的电影

Sense.DEF: to prepare a book, piece of film etc for printing or broadcasting by removing mistakes or parts that are not acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: The newspaper edits letters before printing them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家报社刊登读者来信前先作校订。

Sense.DEF: to prepare a book or article for printing by deciding what to include and in what order
Sense.EXAMPLE: a collection of essays edited by John Gay
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由约翰·盖伊编辑的论文集

Sense.DEF: to prepare a film by deciding what to include and in what order
to be responsible for the information that is included in a newspaper, magazine etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She used to edit the Observer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她曾担任《观察家报》的主编。

Sense.DEF: to remove something when you are preparing a book, piece of film etc for printing or broadcasting
Sense.TRAN: 〔在编辑﹑剪辑等过程中〕删除﹐去掉
Sense.EXAMPLE: The interviewer’s questions have been edited out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 采访者的提问都被删掉了。

Sense.DEF: the form that a book, newspaper, magazine etc is produced in
Sense.EXAMPLE: a paperback edition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平装本
Sense.EXAMPLE: the US edition of Marie Claire magazine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《嘉人》杂志的美国版

Sense.DEF: the copies of a book, newspaper etc that are produced and printed at the same time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The textbook was first published in 1858 and is now in its 39th edition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该课本初版于1858年﹐现在已经是第39版了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A limited edition of 2,000 copies has been published.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已有2,000册限量版面世。

GramExa.GLOSS: the first copies of a particular book, that are often valuable

Sense.DEF: a newspaper, magazine etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Martin was reading the early edition of the Evening News.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马丁在看《新闻晚报》的早间版。

Sense.DEF: a television or radio programme that is broadcast regularly or is part of a series
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视或广播节目﹑系列节目的〕一集﹐一辑
Sense.EXAMPLE: the early evening edition of Scotland Today
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 傍晚播出的一辑《今日苏格兰》

Sense.DEF: the person who is in charge of a newspaper or magazine, or part of a newspaper or magazine, and decides what should be included in it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the editor of the Daily Telegraph
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 《每日电讯报》的主编

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 经济/体育/政治等栏目的编辑

Sense.DEF: someone who prepares a book or article for printing by deciding what to include and checking for any mistakes
someone who chooses what to include in a book on a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: the editor of a book of essays on modern poetry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代诗歌论文集的编者

Sense.DEF: someone who prepares a film, television programme, or sound recording for broadcasting by deciding what to include and checking for any mistakes
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影﹑电视节目或录音的〕编辑﹐剪辑者
Sense.EXAMPLE: a TV script editor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视剧本编辑

Sense.DEF: someone who reports on a particular subject for a radio or television news programme
Sense.TRAN: 〔电台或电视台的〕记者﹐通讯员
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here is John Simmonds, our Diplomatic Editor, with the latest news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在由我们的外交记者约翰·西蒙兹报道最新消息。

Sense.DEF: a computer program that allows you to make changes to saved information
relating to the preparation of a newspaper, book, television programme etc for printing or broadcasting
Sense.EXAMPLE: an editorial assistant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 编辑助理

Sense.DEF: expressing the opinion of a particular newspaper editor rather than just giving facts
Sense.EXAMPLE: the paper’s editorial column
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸的社论栏

Sense.DEF: a piece of writing in a newspaper that gives the editor’s opinion about something, rather than reporting facts
to give your opinion and not just the facts about something, especially publicly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The BBC is not supposed to editorialize about the news.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国广播公司报道此新闻时不应加入评论。

Sense.DEF: the position of being the editor of a newspaper or magazine, or the time during which someone is an editor
Sense.TRAN: 〔报纸﹑杂志的〕编辑职位﹐主编职位﹔编辑任职期﹐主编任职期
the abbreviation of 缩写=eau de toilette〔女士用〕淡香水
the abbreviation of 缩写=educational institution, used in Internet addresses for schools, colleges etc 教育机构〔用于因特网地址﹐表示学校等〕

Sense.DEF: able to learn or be educated
Sense.EXAMPLE: At that time, deaf children were not considered educable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当时认为失聪的儿童无法教育。

Sense.DEF: to teach a child at a school, college, or university
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Ormerod School educates handicapped children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥默罗德学校的教育对象为残疾儿童。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was educated at Bristol University.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在布里斯托尔大学上的学。

Sense.DEF: to give someone information about a particular subject, or to show them a better way to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a campaign to educate teenagers about HIV
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育青少年了解艾滋病病毒的运动

Sense.DEF: having been well taught and learned a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly educated woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很有修养的女子

Sense.DEF: having had a particular type of education
Sense.TRAN: 受过大学教育的/受过良好教育的/受过私立教育的等

Sense.DEF: a guess that is likely to be correct because it is based on some knowledge
Sense.EXAMPLE: Investors must make an educated guess as to the company’s potential.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 投资者对公司的潜力必须作出有依据的猜测。

Sense.DEF: the process of teaching and learning, usually at school, college, or university
Sense.EXAMPLE: She also hopes her children will get a good education.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她也希望她的孩子可以受到良好的教育。
Sense.EXAMPLE: efforts to improve girls’ access to education
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为增加女孩受教育机会所作的努力

Sense.DEF: the teaching of a particular subject
the institutions and people involved with teaching
Sense.EXAMPLE: the local education authority
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地方教育当局

Sense.DEF: an interesting experience which has taught you something – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 有教益的经历〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Having Jimmy to stay has been quite an education!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 留吉米住在这儿﹐真是让人受益匪浅！

Collocate.EXAMPLE: All parents want a good education for their children.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有父母都希望孩子接受良好教育。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not very good
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She had a poor education, and left school without qualifications.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没受过良好教育﹐没拿到文凭就辍学了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: including a balance of lots of different subjects
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The school offers a good all-round education.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所学校提供良好的综合教育。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: spending every weekday in a school or college
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Children must stay in full-time education until the age of 16.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童必须接受全日制教育﹐直至16岁。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: provided by the government of a country
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The state of California guarantees free public education to all children.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 加利福尼亚州保证向所有儿童提供免费公立教育。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that people have to pay for
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I don't agree with the principle of private education.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不赞同私立教育的观念。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: from teachers at school or college, rather than learning by yourself
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She had no formal education and was brought up by her grandmother.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没受过正规教育﹐是由祖母抚养长大的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: for children aged between 5 and 11
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government has announced plans to improve the quality of primary school education.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府已宣布计划﹐提高小学教育质量。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: for children aged between 11 and 18
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She hopes to start a teaching career in secondary education.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有志投身中学教育。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Do you have a university education?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你受过大学教育吗？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: at a college or university
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I did a carpentry course at the further education college.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在进修学院读了木工工艺课程。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: for adults
relating to skills needed for a particular job
for children aged under 5

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The women have had little education.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些妇女没受过多少教育。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Some children grow up without receiving any education.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些孩子从小没有受过任何教育。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The school aims to provide a good general education.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校旨在提供良好的普通教育。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: start going to school, college etc
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The number of students entering higher education has risen.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 高等教育入学人数有所增加。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: stop going to school, college etc
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She left full-time education at the age of 16.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她16岁时结束全日制教育。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the way education is organized and managed in a country
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Is the British education system failing some children?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的教育体制是否对有些儿童无益？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the government organization that makes decisions about education
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Newcastle City Council’s education department
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽卡斯尔市政会的教育部门

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a government organization that makes official decisions about education in one particular area
all the government organizations that work together to provide education
political plans for managing an education system
changes that a government makes to the education system in a country

Sense.DEF: relating to education
Sense.EXAMPLE: the educational development of children
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童的教育发展

Sense.DEF: teaching you something you did not know before
Sense.EXAMPLE: educational games
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寓教于乐的游戏

Sense.DEF: someone who knows a lot about ways of teaching and learning
something that is educative teaches you something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The educative process needs to begin early in a child’s life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育过程需要在婴幼儿时期就开始。

Sense.DEF: a teacher or someone involved in the process of educating people
an educationalist
films, television programmes, or computer software that educate and entertain at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 寓教于乐的电影[电视节目﹐计算机软件]

Sense.DEF: relating to the time of King Edward VII of Britain (1901-1910)
Sense.TRAN: 英王爱德华七世时代的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an Edwardian house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英王爱德华七世时代的房子

Sense.DEF: someone who is being treated in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: the payee someone who is paid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受款人﹐收款人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a trainee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受训者
Sense.EXAMPLE: an employee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇员

Sense.DEF: someone who is in a particular state or who is doing something
Sense.TRAN: 处于某种情况下的人﹔行动者
Sense.EXAMPLE: an absentee someone who is absent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺席者
Sense.EXAMPLE: an escapee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 逃亡者

Sense.DEF: the former name for the EU
Sense.TRAN: 欧洲经济共同体〔欧盟的旧称〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that records the electrical activity of your brain
a drawing made by an electroencephalograph
an expression of sudden fear and surprise
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eek! A mouse!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 呀！ 一只老鼠！

Sense.DEF: a long thin fish that looks like a snake and can be eaten

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= even
the short form of 缩略式= ever

Sense.DEF: someone who does or makes a particular thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: an auctioneer someone who runs auction sales
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拍卖商
Sense.EXAMPLE: a profiteer someone who makes unfair profits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牟取暴利者

Sense.DEF: strange and frightening
Sense.EXAMPLE: the eerie sound of an owl hooting at night
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜间猫头鹰那怪异恐怖的叫声

Sense.DEF: problems that people have as a result of using computers too much or for too long, for example tiredness at work or a lack of communication
Sense.TRAN: 〔人们因过度使用计算机而引起的〕电子疲劳〔如工作疲惫或缺乏交流〕

Sense.DEF: swearing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you hear her effing and blinding at him?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你听见她咒骂他吗？

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to go away instead of saying fuck off
to destroy or remove something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nothing can efface the last picture I have of them from my mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有什么能抹去他们在我脑海中留下的最后印象。

Sense.DEF: to behave in a quiet way so that people do not notice or look at you
Sense.TRAN: 使(自己)不引人注目﹔不露锋芒

Sense.DEF: a change that is caused by an event, action etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My parents’ divorce had a big effect on me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母离婚给我带来了很大的影响。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the harmful effects of modern farming practices
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代农耕方式的不良后果

Sense.EXAMPLE: the long-term effects of the drug
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种毒品的长期影响
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could feel the effects of the thin mountain air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能感觉到山上稀薄空气产生的影响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This ingredient also has the effect of making your skin look younger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种成分还有使皮肤看上去更年轻的效果。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A system failure has a knock-on effect throughout the whole hotel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 系统故障会给整个酒店带来连锁反应。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the cumulative effect of human activities on the global environment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类活动对全球环境日积月累的影响
Sense.EXAMPLE: A much lower dose of the painkiller can still produce the desired effect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量减少该止痛药的服用剂量依然能产生预期的效果。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In mental illness, there is a complex relationship between cause and effect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神疾病有复杂的因果关系。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse with the verb affect (to have an effect on something). 不要与动词affect(影响)混淆。

Sense.DEF: to make a plan or idea happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: It won’t be easy to put the changes into effect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 落实这些变革不会是件容易的事。

Sense.DEF: to start to produce results
Sense.TRAN: 开始起作用﹔开始产生效果
Sense.EXAMPLE: The morphine was starting to take effect and the pain eased.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吗啡开始起作用﹐疼痛减轻了。

Subsense.DEF: if a law, rule, or system takes effect or comes into effect, it officially starts
if a law, rule, or system is in effect, it is being used now

Sense.DEF: starting to happen immediately, or from a particular date
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hoskins is appointed manager, with immediate effect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍斯金斯被任命为经理﹐此任命立即生效。

Sense.DEF: used when you are describing what you see as the real facts of a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: In effect, we’ll be earning less than we were last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实际上﹐我们挣钱会比去年少。

Sense.DEF: used to show how successful an action is
Sense.TRAN: 效果良好/富有成效/毫无效果等
Sense.EXAMPLE: We tried to wake him, but to no effect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们想把他叫醒﹐但没有用。

Sense.DEF: used when you are giving the general meaning of something, rather than the exact words
Sense.TRAN: 有这样的意思/有那样的意思/大意是
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim told me to go away, or words to that effect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆叫我走开﹐或说了类似的话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The letter said something to the effect that she was no longer needed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信中表达的大意是﹐不再需要她了。

Sense.DEF: an idea or feeling that an artist, speaker, book etc tries to make you think of or to feel
Sense.TRAN: 〔艺术家﹑演讲者﹑书等给人的〕印象﹐感受

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Turner’s paintings give an effect of light.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 特纳的画表现出光的效果。

Sense.DEF: if someone does something for effect, they do it in order to make people notice
Sense.EXAMPLE: She paused for effect, then carried on speaking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她略为停顿以吸引大家注意﹐然后继续演讲。

Sense.DEF: the things that someone owns
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’s few personal effects were in a suitcase under the bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唐的几件个人物品在床下的手提箱里。

Sense.DEF: an unusual or impressive sound or image that is artificially produced for a film, play, or radio programme

Exponent.DEF: a change that is caused by an event, action etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The people in this area are still suffering from the effects of the famine.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区人民仍在遭受饥荒。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The treatment had little or no effect.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 治疗几乎没起什么作用。

Exponent.DEF: an effect that happens as a result of something important, especially a big and permanent effect
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指大的﹑永久性的〕影响﹐作用
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Changes in technology have had a massive impact on the way we work.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 科技变革对我们的工作方式产生了巨大影响。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the environmental impact of industrial activity
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 工业活动对环境产生的影响

Exponent.DEF: the effect that something has on people’s opinions or behaviour, or on how something develops
Exponent.TRAN: 〔对人的思想﹑行为或某事物发展产生的〕影响(力)﹐作用
Exponent.EXAMPLE: American television has had a big influence on popular culture in the west.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国电视对西方流行文化产生了很大影响。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His ideas had a lot of influence at the time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的观点在当时有很大影响力。

Exponent.DEF: an unwanted and unplanned effect that something has – used especially about drugs and medical treatment
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Common side effects of the drug may include headaches and muscle pains.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药的常见副作用可能包括头痛和肌肉疼痛。

Exponent.DEF: bad effects that continue for a long time after the thing that caused them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A traumatic experience can have severe psychological after-effects.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 痛苦经历可能造成严重的心理后遗症。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the after-effects of the war
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争的后遗症

Exponent.DEF: the effects that happen later as a result of an event or decision, especially a range of effects that continue for a long time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The scandal could have serious repercussions for her career.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这桩丑闻可能会对她的事业造成严重影响。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The judge’s decision is likely to have important repercussions for future cases of this kind.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官的裁决可能会对今后此类案件的判决产生重要影响。

Exponent.DEF: used when something has an effect on something, which then has an effect on something else
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Higher oil prices have a knock-on effect on other fuels.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 油价上涨对其他燃料产生连锁反应。

Exponent.DEF: the effect that human activities have on the environment, caused by using up its natural resources, pollution, waste etc
Exponent.TRAN: 足迹〔指人类活动对环境造成的不良影响〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Businesses all over the world must attempt to reduce their environmental footprint.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 全球企业都必须努力减少环境足迹。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The house has a low carbon footprintit uses very little energy from carbon and therefore is good for the environment
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢房屋的碳足迹很低。

Sense.DEF: to make something happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many parents lack confidence in their ability to effect change in their children’s behaviour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多父母对自己是否有能力改变子女的行为缺乏信心。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse with the verb affect(=to have an effect on something). 不要与动词affect(影响)混淆。

Sense.DEF: successful, and working in the way that was intended
Sense.TRAN: 有效的﹔产生预期效果的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cheaper drugs are just as effective in treating arthritis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 较便宜的药品对治疗关节炎同样有效。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the painting’s highly effective use of colour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绘画中得心应手的色彩运用
Sense.EXAMPLE: Training is often much less effective than expected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 训练的效果往往远低于预期。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the most effective ways of reducing inner city congestion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 减少旧城区交通拥挤最有效的办法

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that something works (well) , rather than say that it is effective.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们表达某事物有效时﹐一般说work (well)﹐不说effective
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The cheaper drugs work just as well .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 较便宜的药物同样有效。

Sense.DEF: if a law, agreement, or system becomes effective, it officially starts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cut in interest rates is effective from Monday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利率下调从星期一起生效。

Sense.DEF: real rather than what is officially intended or generally believed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rebels are in effective control of the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反叛者实际上已控制了该市。

Sense.DEF: in a way that produces the result that was intended
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children have to learn to communicate effectively.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子应该学会有效地沟通。

Sense.DEF: used to describe what you see as the real facts of the situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Effectively, it has become impossible for us to help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事实上﹐我们已不可能帮忙了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the urban poor are effectively excluded from politics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市里的大部分穷人实际上都没法参与政治。

Sense.DEF: producing the result that was wanted or intended
a man who is effeminate looks or behaves like a woman
a liquid that effervesces produces small bubbles of gas
someone who is effervescent is very happy, excited, and active
Sense.TRAN: 兴高采烈的﹔充满活力的﹐活泼的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an effervescent personality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 活泼乐观的个性

Sense.DEF: a liquid that is effervescent produces small bubbles of gas
weak and powerless in a way that you dislike
Sense.EXAMPLE: effete intellectuals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 软弱的知识分子

Sense.DEF: an effete man looks or behaves like a woman
working in the way you intended
Sense.EXAMPLE: an equally efficacious method of treatment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同样有效的治疗方法

Sense.DEF: the ability of something to produce the right result
the quality of doing something well and effectively, without wasting time, money, or energy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the efficiency of the train service
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车服务的效率

Sense.EXAMPLE: considerable advancements in energy efficiency
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能源效率的显著提高

Sense.DEF: the amounts of money, supplies etc that are saved by finding a better or cheaper way of doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: operating efficiencies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运营功效

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company is taking steps to improve efficiency and reduce costs.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司正在采取措施提高效率﹐降低成本。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: develop or encourage efficient ways of doing something

Collocate.EXAMPLE: In a search for greater efficiency, the two departments have merged.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了寻求高效﹐两个部门合并了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the most that is possible
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The boat’s design helps it to move with maximum efficiency.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条船的设计有助其以最大效率行驶。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: using fuel in an efficient way
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Better fuel efficiency can be achieved by driving more slowly.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 缓慢驾驶可提高燃料效率。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: using energy in an efficient way
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Energy efficiency can play a huge role in reducing pollution.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 能源效率可在减少污染方面发挥巨大作用。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: increases in efficiency
Collocate.EXAMPLE: New technology introduced by the company has brought efficiency gains.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司推行的新技术提高了效率。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: money saved by being more efficient
changes introduced to make something more efficient

Sense.DEF: if someone or something is efficient, they work well without wasting time, money, or energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very efficient secretary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 效率高的秘书
Sense.EXAMPLE: an efficient use of land
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 土地的有效使用
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lighting is now more energy efficient.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今的照明设备更加节能。

Sense.DEF: a statueof a famous person

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an effigy of Saint Francis
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣方济各的雕像

Sense.DEF: a roughly made, usually ugly, model of someone you dislike
Sense.EXAMPLE: a threat to burn the president in effigy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威胁要焚烧总统模拟像

Sense.DEF: an offensive word used to emphasize that you are angry and to avoid saying the swear word ‘fucking’ directly
Sense.TRAN: 该死的〔用于表达说话者的愤怒﹐且避免直接使用fucking这一咒骂语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s gone to effing bingo again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她又去玩该死的宾戈游戏了。

Sense.DEF: the action of something forming and developing, or the period of time when this happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was an efflorescence of scientific publication in the period 1645–1660.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1645年至1660年﹐科学出版呈现一片繁荣景象。

Sense.DEF: liquid waste, especially chemicals or sewage
Sense.TRAN: 废水〔尤指化学废液〕﹔污水

Sense.DEF: the physical or mental energy that is needed to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lou lifted the box easily, without using much effort.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卢没费多大力气就把箱子搬了起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Frank put a lot of effort into the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰克办这次聚会花了不少精力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Learning to speak another language takes effort.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学说外语要下功夫。

Sense.DEF: an attempt to do something, especially when this involves a lot of hard work or determination
Sense.EXAMPLE: please make an effort to be polite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请尽量礼貌些。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tom’s efforts to stop smoking haven’t been very successful.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆戒烟的努力不太成功。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Church leaders are prepared to meet the terrorists in an effort to in order to try to find peace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为寻求和平﹐教会领袖准备与恐怖分子会面。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Further efforts at negotiation have broken down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为谈判所作的进一步努力已经失败了。

GramExa.GLOSS: because of their efforts
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The money was raised largely through the efforts of parents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔钱主要是通过家长的努力才筹集到的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Despite all our efforts we lost the game 1—0.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然我们尽了最大努力﹐但还是以零比一输掉了比赛。

Sense.DEF: to be difficult or painful to do
Sense.TRAN: 是费力的事﹔是痛苦的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was so weak that even standing up was an effort.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我虚弱得连站起来都很费力。

Sense.DEF: work that people do to achieve something in a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: the fundraising effort
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 筹款活动
Sense.EXAMPLE: the international relief effort
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际赈济行动
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone did what they could to support the war effort.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都尽力支持那次战争行动。

Sense.DEF: something that has been done well, badly etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not a bad effort for a beginner!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对一个新手来说不错了！

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: try
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She made an effort to change the subject of the conversation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她尽力想转移话题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: try hard to do something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Let’s try again, only put more effort into it this time.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们再试一次吧﹐这次可要再加把劲。

Collocate.COLLOC: take the effort out of sth
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make it easy
Collocate.EXAMPLE: An automatic car takes the effort out of driving.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 自动变速汽车令驾驶更轻松。

Variant.LEXVAR: it takes effort to do sth

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: you have to try hard
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It takes a sustained effort to quit smoking.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 戒烟需要坚持不懈的努力。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it takes effort

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Their efforts were successful, and they won the contract.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们得到了那份合同﹐努力没有白费。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Efforts to save the hospital from closure have been unsuccessful.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 为拯救医院不被关闭而作的努力落空了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: having no chance of succeeding, and therefore not worth doing
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Doctors knew that any effort to save his life would be futile.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生知道任何努力都救不了他的命。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government has made a big effort to tackle the problem of poverty.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府为解决贫困问题付出了很大努力。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a lot of effort
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The police put considerable effort into finding his car.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方费了很大的劲为他找车。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a very big effort
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was only with a supreme effort that Roger controlled his temper.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗杰好不容易才捺住性子。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that you do not normally make
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I made a special effort to be nice to the children.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我特别努力要对孩子们好。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that you continue making for a long time
one that you concentrate on in order to achieve something
showing a lot of determination
one you make when you are in a very bad situation
involving a lot of different actions, or a lot of people working together
involving a group or team of people
do sth that requires some effort
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I felt too tired to go to a party, but decided to make the effort.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得太累﹐不想去参加聚会﹐但还是决定去了。

Collocate.COLLOC: make every effort to do sth
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: try very hard
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I made every effort to see their point of view.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我极力去理解他们的观点。

Collocate.COLLOC: make no effort to do sth
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not try at all
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They make no effort to speak the local language.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没有尝试去说当地话。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used to say that something is worth doing even though it is hard
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s a difficult place to get to, but it’s well worth the effort.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 到那地方不容易﹐不过很值得一去。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a big effort to do something that you find difficult because of the way you feel
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It took a huge effort of will not to cry.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 好不容易才没哭出来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: trying very hard
Collocate.EXAMPLE: With great effort, he managed to keep quiet.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拼命忍住没出声。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: easily, without trying hard

Sense.DEF: something that is effortless is done in a very skilful way that makes it seem easy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alexei rose to his feet with a single effortless movement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿列克谢轻巧地一跃而起。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He dived effortlessly into the turquoise water.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他轻松地一头跳入碧水之中。

Sense.DEF: rude behaviour that shocks you because it is so confident

GramExa.PROPFORM: have the effrontery to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had the effrontery to ask me for more money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她还有脸跟我再要钱。

Sense.DEF: beautiful and bright
a liquid or gas that flows out of something, or the act of flowing out
Sense.EXAMPLE: a massive effusion of poisonous gas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒气的大量逸出

Sense.DEF: an uncontrolled expression of strong good feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: He greeted the guests with effusion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他热情地迎接客人。

Sense.DEF: showing your good feelings in a very excited way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our host gave us an effusive welcome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主人热情地欢迎我们。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dotty was effusive in her thanks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 多蒂极尽感谢之词。

Sense.DEF: a picture, made by using a computer, of a person who the police think was responsible for a crime, which they show on television or the Internet in order to try and catch the person
Sense.TRAN: 〔由计算机制作并在电视或因特网上公示的〕疑犯画像

Sense.DEF: the teaching of English to people whose first language is not English, and who do not live in an English-speaking country
Sense.TRAN: 作为外语的英语教学﹐非母语的英语教学
the abbreviation of 缩写=electronic funds transfer电子资金转账
the abbreviation of 缩写=for example例如
Sense.EXAMPLE: citrus fruits, e.g. oranges and grapefruit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柑橘属水果﹐例如橙子和葡萄柚

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In formal contexts such as essays or business letters, people usually avoid using the abbreviation e.g. , and write for example in full.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在论文﹑商业信函等正式文体中﹐人们一般避免使用e.g.这个缩写形式﹐而是完整写出for example
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They might use local health care facilities, for example clinics and district hospitals.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们可以使用当地的医疗保健设施﹐例如诊所和地区医院 。

Sense.DEF: based on the belief that everyone is equal and should have equal rights
Sense.EXAMPLE: an egalitarian society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人平等的社会

PIC.HEADING: EGGS 蛋
PIC.PICCONTENT: boiled eggs 煮蛋；fried egg 煎蛋；poached egg 荷包蛋；scrambled eggs 炒蛋

Sense.DEF: a round object with a hard surface, that contains a baby bird, snake, insect etc and which is produced by a female bird, snake, insect etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blackbirds lay their eggs in March.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乌鸫在3月产蛋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ostrich egg
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸵鸟蛋
Sense.EXAMPLE: The eggs hatch break open to allow the baby out in 26 days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些蛋要26天才能孵化。

Sense.DEF: an egg, especially one from a chicken, that is used for food
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joe always has bacon and egg for breakfast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔早餐总是吃熏肉加蛋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whisk the egg white the white part until stiff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把蛋白打到黏稠状。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beat in two of the egg yolks the yellow part.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把其中两个蛋黄打进去。

Sense.DEF: something the same shape as an egg
Sense.EXAMPLE: a chocolate Easter egg
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 复活节巧克力蛋

Sense.DEF: a cell produced by a woman or female animal that combines with spermmale cell to make a baby
if someone, especially someone in authority, has egg on their face, they have been made to look stupid by something embarrassing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Pentagon’s been left with egg on its face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五角大楼颜面尽失。

Sense.LEXUNIT: put all your eggs in one basket
Sense.DEF: to depend completely on one thing or one course of action in order to get success, so that you have no other plans if this fails
Sense.TRAN: 把一切希望寄托于一件事上﹔孤注一掷
Sense.EXAMPLE: When planning your investments, it’s unwise to put all your eggs in one basket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在计划投资时﹐把所有钱投往一处的做法是不明智的。

Sense.DEF: to fail or be unsuccessful at something that you are trying to do
someone who you can depend on to be honest, kind etc

Crossrefto.REFLEX: kill the goose that lays the golden egg

Sense.DEF: to encourage someone to do something, especially something that they do not want to do or should not do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bob didn’t want to jump, but his friends kept egging him on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍勃不想跳﹐可他的朋友一个劲地鼓动他。

Sense.DEF: a small container that holds a boiled egg while you eat it
someone who is very intelligent, and only interested in ideas and books
a drink made from eggs, sugar, milk, and alcohol, drunk at Christmas
a large vegetable with smooth purple skin
a spring roll
the hard outside part of a bird’s egg
a type of paint, used especially on wood, that is not shiny when dry
Sense.TRAN: 蛋壳漆〔尤刷于木头上﹑干后无光〕

Sense.DEF: a small glass container with sand in it that runs from one part to the other in about three or five minutes, used for measuring the time it takes to boil an egg
Sense.TRAN: 煮蛋计时器〔用于计量煮蛋时间的小沙漏〕

Sense.DEF: the opinion that you have about yourself

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Richard has the biggest ego thinks he is very clever and important of anyone I’ve ever met.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 理查德是我所见过的最自负的人。

Sense.EXAMPLE: That promotion really boosted her ego made her feel better about herself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次晋升确实增强了她的自信心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need someone to massage my bruised ego when you feel less confident than before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要有人来安抚我受挫的自信心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fragile ego
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脆弱的自尊心

Sense.DEF: the part of your mind with which you think and take action, according to Freudian psychology
thinking only about yourself and not about what other people might need or want
Sense.TRAN: 以自我为中心的﹔自私自利的

Sense.DEF: someone who thinks that they are very important, and does not care whether they upset other people in order to get what they want
to look on the Internet to see how many websites mention your name
Sense.TRAN: 自我搜寻﹐自我冲浪〔在因特网上搜索有多少个网站提及自己的名字〕

Sense.DEF: the belief that you are much better or more important than other people
someone who likes to talk about how great and important they think they are
Sense.TRAN: 自我主义者﹔自高自大者

Sense.DEF: someone who is egotistical likes to talk about how great and important they think they are
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a selfish, egotistical individual!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个自私又狂妄自大的人！

Sense.DEF: if someone is on an ego trip, they think that what they do makes them more important than other people – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 自我表现﹐自我陶醉〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their singer’s on a real ego trip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的歌手完全是在自我表现。

Sense.DEF: an egregious mistake, failure, problem etc is extremely bad and noticeable
Sense.TRAN: 〔错误﹑失败﹑问题等〕极其严重的﹐令人震惊的

Sense.DEF: the act of leaving a building or place, or the right to do this
a bird that lives near water and has long legs and long white tail feathers
relating to Egypt or its people
someone from Egypt
used when you want someone to repeat something because you did not hear it
Sense.TRAN: 嗯﹐啊〔表示未听清﹐请对方重复一遍〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eh? She’s got how many children?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗯？ 她有几个孩子？

Sense.DEF: used when you want someone to reply to you or agree with something you have said
Sense.TRAN: 是吗﹐好吗〔表示希望对方应答或同意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maybe teenagers aren’t as clueless as everyone thought, eh?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许十几岁的孩子没有人们想象的那么无知﹐对吧？

Sense.DEF: used when you are surprised by something that someone has said
Sense.TRAN: 啊﹐嗯〔表示对对方的话感到惊讶〕

Sense.DEF: one of two important holidays in the Muslim religion
Sense.TRAN: 开斋节﹐宰牲节〔伊斯兰教的两个重大节日之一〕

Sense.DEF: a thick warm cover for a bed, filled with duck feathers
a religious festival that muslims celebrate at the end of the haj in order to remember that the Prophet Ibrahim was willing to kill his son for Allah
Sense.TRAN: 宰牲节〔穆斯林在麦加朝觐过后庆祝的节日﹐以纪念先知易卜拉欣愿意杀儿献祭给安拉〕

Sense.DEF: a religious festivalthat muslims celebrate at the end of ramadan. Special prayers are said in the mosque, and children and women are given presents.
Sense.TRAN: 开斋节〔穆斯林庆祝斋月结束的节日。在清真寺内要做特别的祈祷﹐儿童和妇女会得到礼物〕

Sense.DEF: the number 8
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s only eight days till Christmas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还有8天就到圣诞节了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They woke at eight eight o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们是8点钟醒的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My parents died when I was eight eight years old.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我8岁时父母就去世了。

Sense.DEF: a team of eight people who row a racing boat, or the boat that they row
Sense.TRAN: 〔划船比赛中的〕八人划船队﹔八桨划船

Sense.DEF: the number 18
Sense.EXAMPLE: At least eighteen bullets were fired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 至少射出了18颗子弹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim was eighteen 18 years old.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆18岁。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I’m planning to leave on the eighteenththe 18th day of the month

Sense.DEF: coming after seven other things in a series
Sense.EXAMPLE: in the eighth century
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在8世纪
Sense.EXAMPLE: her eighth birthday
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的8岁生日

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I’m planning to leave on the eighththe eighth day of the month.

Sense.DEF: one of eight equal parts of something
a musical note that continues for an eighth of the length of a whole note
the number 80
the years from 1980 to 1989
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band was incredibly successful in the eighties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支乐队在80年代红透半边天。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their troubles began in the mid eighties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的麻烦开始于80年代中期。

Sense.DEF: to be aged between 80 and 89
Sense.TRAN: 在八十到八十九岁之间﹐是八十多岁

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hilda Simpson was a woman in her early eighties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 希尔达·辛普森是个80岁出头的妇人。

Sense.DEF: if the temperature is in the eighties, it is between 80 degrees and 89 degrees

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The temperature is expected to remain in the low eighties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 气温预计会保持在80度多一点。

Sense.DEF: an event in Wales at which there are competitions in singing, poetry, and music
Sense.TRAN: 威尔士诗歌音乐比赛大会

Subsense.DEF: used to begin a list of two or more possibilities
Subsense.TRAN: 或者…或者〔用以引出两个或多个可能的事物〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You add either one or two cloves of garlic.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你加入一两瓣大蒜。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She’s the kind of person you either love or hate.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是那种让你非爱即恨的人。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that if one thing does not happen then something else will have to
Subsense.TRAN: 要么…要么〔表示非此即彼〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s your choice! Either she leaves or I will!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看着办吧！ 要么她走﹐要么我走！
Subsense.EXAMPLE: £75 seems a lot to pay for a starter motor, but it’s either that or a new car!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花75英镑换一个发动机启动装置似乎很贵﹐但要是不换的话就得换辆新车！

Subsense.DEF: a situation in which you cannot avoid having to make a decision or choice
Subsense.TRAN: 非此即彼的情况﹔必须作出决定[选择]的情况

Sense.DEF: one or the other of two things or people
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s tea or coffee – you can have either.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有茶和咖啡﹐你可任选一种。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can offer a comfortable home to a young person of either sex.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以为年轻的男性或女性提供舒适的住处。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Could either of you lend me five pounds?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你俩谁能借我五英镑？

Sense.DEF: used to show that a negative statement is true about both of two things or people
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve lived in New York and Chicago, but don’t like either city very much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在纽约和芝加哥住过﹐但两个城市我都不太喜欢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were two witnesses but I wouldn’t trust either of them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有两个目击者﹐但我都信不过。

Sense.DEF: both sides, ends, hands etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sat in the back of the car with a policeman on either side.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坐在汽车后座上﹐两边各有一名警察。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are shops at either end of the street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 街的两头都有商店。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that something will be the same whichever of two things happens or is true
Subsense.TRAN: 〔两种方式中的〕任何一种方式
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You can get to Edinburgh by train or plane, but either way it’s very expensive.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以坐火车或飞机到爱丁堡﹐但两种方式都很费钱。

Subsense.DEF: more or less than a certain amount or measurement
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A few marks either way can make the difference between a pass and a fail.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多几分或少几分就有及格与否的区别。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that someone or something does not firmly support or want either one of two things
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘All right, let’s do that,’ said Camille, who didn’t care either way.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “好﹐我们就干吧。”卡米尔说。 她无所谓﹐怎么都行。

Sense.DEF: if a situation could go either way, both possible results are equally likely
Sense.EXAMPLE: The latest opinion poll suggests the vote could go either way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的民意调查显示两种投票结果都有可能。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Either is used before a singular noun. Use a singular verb after it. either
F2NBox.TRAN: 用于单数名词前﹐其后要用单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Either explanation is reasonable.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个解释都有道理。
F2NBox.EXPL: Either of is used before a plural noun or pronoun. In formal speech and writing, use a singular verb. either of
F2NBox.TRAN: 用于复数名词或代词前﹐在正式讲话和文章中﹐要用单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Has either of them called yet?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他俩有谁打过电话来吗？
F2NBox.EXPL: In informal speech and writing, you can use a plural verb.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在非正式讲话和文章中﹐可以用复数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Have either of them called yet?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他俩有谁打过电话来吗？

Sense.DEF: used to show that a negative statement is also true about another thing or person, or to add a different negative statement about something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t seen the movie and my brother hasn’t either he also has not seen it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没看过这部电影﹐我弟弟也没看过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I can’t swim.’ ‘I can’t either.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不会游泳。”“我也不会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not an easy car to drive, and at $40,000 it’s not cheap either.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这车不容易开﹐而且要价4万美元﹐也不便宜。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a negative statement is also true about you
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I don’t have any money right now.’ ‘Me either.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我现在没钱。”“我也没有。”

Sense.DEF: when a man ejaculates, semen comes out of his penis
to suddenly shout or say something, especially because you are surprised
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因惊奇而〕喊出﹔突然说出

Sense.DEF: to make someone leave a place or building by using force

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The demonstrators were ejected from the hall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 示威者被赶出大厅。

Sense.DEF: to make someone leave a job or position very quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: 420 workers have been ejected from their jobs with no warning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 420名工人在没有任何先兆的情况下被辞退。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly send something out
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two engines cut out and the plane started to eject fuel as it lost height.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个发动机突然熄火﹐飞机在下降的同时开始喷出燃料。

Sense.DEF: if a pilot ejects, he or she escapes from a plane, using an ejector seat because it is going to crash
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞行员从将要坠毁的飞机中〕弹射出来

Sense.DEF: if you eject a tape or disk, or if it ejects, it comes out of a machine after you have pressed a particular button
Sense.TRAN: 〔按键将磁带或光盘从机器中〕弹出

Sense.DEF: a special seat that throws the pilot out of a plane when it is going to crash
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机即将坠毁时将飞行员从中弹出的〕弹射座椅

Sense.DEF: to manage to live with very little money or food
Sense.TRAN: 勉强度日﹐竭力维持生计
Sense.EXAMPLE: They eke out a miserable existence in cardboard shacks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在纸板棚屋中凄惨度日。

Sense.DEF: to make a small supply of something such as food or money last longer by carefully using small amounts of it
Sense.TRAN: 精打细算地维持﹔尽量节省使用
Sense.EXAMPLE: How did she manage to eke out the food?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是怎样想方设法节省食物的呢？

Sense.DEF: an ecg
having a lot of small parts or details put together in a complicated way
Sense.EXAMPLE: pure silks embroidered with elaborate patterns
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绣有精美图案的真丝衣服

Sense.DEF: carefully planned and organized in great detail
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very elaborate telecommunications network
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常精密的电信网络

Sense.DEF: to give more details or new information about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He said he had new evidence, but refused to elaborate any further.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他声称有新证据﹐但拒绝进一步详细说明。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: McDonald refused to elaborate on his reasons for resigning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦克唐纳拒绝细说他辞职的原因。

Sense.DEF: a style that is full of energy and confidence
Sense.EXAMPLE: The attack was planned and led with great élan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 进攻计划制订得雄心勃勃﹐将帅领军作战异常勇猛。

Sense.DEF: if a particular period of time elapses, it passes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several months elapsed before his case was brought to trial.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了几个月他的案子才开审。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The assignment must be completed within an overall elapsed time of one week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项任务总的时限为一周﹐必须按时完成。

Sense.DEF: a type of rubber material that can stretch and then return to its usual length or size
Sense.EXAMPLE: a piece of elastic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一根橡皮带

Sense.DEF: made of elastic
Sense.EXAMPLE: an elastic cord
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弹力绳

Sense.DEF: a material that is elastic can stretch and then go back to its usual length or size
Sense.EXAMPLE: the horny elastic pad in a horse’s hoof
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马蹄上粗硬而有弹性的肉掌

Sense.DEF: a system or plan that is elastic can change or be changed easily
Sense.TRAN: 〔系统或计划〕灵活的﹐有伸缩性的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Demand for this type of holiday will probably be fairly elastic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这类假期的需求可能有相当的弹性。

Sense.DEF: if a piece of clothing is elastic, it is made with material that can stretch
Sense.EXAMPLE: children’s pants with an elastic waist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有松紧腰带的童裤

Sense.DEF: if a piece of clothing is elasticated, it is made with material that can stretch
Sense.EXAMPLE: skirts with elasticated waists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有松紧腰带的裙子

Sense.DEF: a thin circular piece of rubber used for fastening things together
the ability of something to stretch and go back to its usual length or size
Sense.EXAMPLE: the skin’s natural elasticity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮肤天生的弹性

Sense.DEF: the degree to which a change in the price of something leads to a change in the amount of it that is sold
Sense.TRAN: 需求弹性〔指价格变动导致需求量变化的程度〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of thin material that is stuck to the skin to cover cuts and other small wounds
extremely happy and excited, especially because of something that has happened or is going to happen
Sense.TRAN: 兴高采烈的﹐欢欣鼓舞的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt elated and mildly drunk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他感到欢欣鼓舞﹐而且喝得有点醉了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was elated at the prospect of a holiday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想到要度假就特别高兴。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of great happiness and excitement
the joint where your arm bends
the part of a shirt etc that covers your elbow
hard work and effort, especially when cleaning or polishing something
Sense.TRAN: 费力的工作〔尤指擦洗等累活〕

Sense.DEF: to tell someone that you no longer like them or want them to work for you and that they should leave
enough space in which to move easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s more elbow room in the restaurant since they extended it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 餐馆扩建后宽敞多了。

Sense.DEF: a curved part of a pipe
to push someone with your elbows, especially in order to move past them

GramExa.PROPFORM: elbow your way through/past/into etc sth
GramExa.GLOSS: move through a group of people by pushing past them
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He elbowed his way to the bar and ordered a beer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他挤到吧台前要了一杯啤酒。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She pushed through the crowd, elbowing people out of the way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用手肘把人们推开﹐从人群中挤了出来。

Sense.DEF: the elder of two people, especially brothers and sisters, is the one who was born first
Sense.TRAN: 〔两人中〕年纪较长的〔尤指哥哥或姐姐〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His elder son Liam became a lawyer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的大儿子利亚姆当了律师。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah is the elder of the two.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两人当中萨拉年纪较长。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘elder than someone’.Say 而要说 older than someone: She was two years older than me. 她比我大两岁。

Sense.DEF: to be older than someone else

GramExa.PROPFORM: be two/ten etc years sb’s elder
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Janet’s sister was eight years her elder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮特的姐姐比她大八岁。

Sense.DEF: people who are older than you and who you should respect
a member of a tribe or other social group who is important and respected because they are old
Sense.EXAMPLE: a meeting of the village elders
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 村里长辈们的集会

Sense.DEF: someone who has an official position of responsibility in some Christian churches
the crime of harming an old person
a small wild tree that has white flowers and black berries
the fruit of the elder tree
used as a polite way of saying that someone is old or becoming old
Sense.TRAN: 年老的﹔渐老的〔委婉用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-dressed elderly woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿着考究的老妇人

Sense.DEF: people who are old
Sense.EXAMPLE: a retirement village for the elderly
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 供老人退休后居住的村子

Sense.DEF: someone old and respected, especially a politician, who people ask for advice because of his or her knowledge and experience
Sense.TRAN: 年高德劭的人〔尤指政界元老〕

Sense.DEF: the eldest of a group of people, especially brothers and sisters, is the one who was born first
Sense.TRAN: 年龄最大的〔尤指大哥和大姐〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My eldest daughter is 17.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的大女儿17岁了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was the eldest of six children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 六个孩子当中他是老大。

Sense.DEF: a place of very great wealth, especially a place that people travel a long way to find, or an imaginary place that does not really exist. El Dorado comes from the ancient story of the king of a South American tribe who covered himself in gold dust and dived into a lake. Some people believed that the king’s city, El Dorado, really existed and tried to find it.
Sense.TRAN: 黄金之城﹐黄金国〔人们长途跋涉寻找的富庶之地﹐或想象中的富饶城邦〕

Sense.DEF: to choose someone for an official position by voting
Sense.EXAMPLE: the country’s first democratically elected government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国第一个民主选举产生的政府
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new method for electing the leader of the party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选举党领导的新方式

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was elected to a US state governorship.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他当选美国州长。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In 1768, John Wilkes was elected as their Member of Parliament.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1768年﹐约翰·威尔克斯当选为他们地区的议员。

Sense.DEF: to choose to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can elect to delete the message or save it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以选择删除或者保存信息。

Sense.DEF: the person who has been elected as president etc, but who has not yet officially started their job
Sense.TRAN: 候任[当选而尚未就任的]总统/州长/首相等

Sense.DEF: when people vote to choose someone for an official position
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Labour Party won the 2001 election by a huge majority.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党在2001年选举中以巨大优势获胜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elections for the state governorship will be on November 25.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 州长选举将于11月25日举行。

Sense.DEF: the fact of being elected to an official position
Sense.EXAMPLE: Within three months of his election he was forced to resign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他当选后不到三个月就被迫辞职。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his election to Parliament
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他入选议会

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government plans to hold an election in November.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府计划于11月举行选举。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: arrange for an election to happen
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The Prime Minister would be unwise to call an election now.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相如现在就宣布大选是不明智的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Who do you think will win the election?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为谁会当选？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: If the party loses the election, they may decide they need a new leader.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是该党败选﹐他们可能会决定更换领导人。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: take part in it and try to win
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Three independent candidates are also planning to contest the election.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有三名独立候选人也在计划参加竞选。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: try to become elected
Collocate.EXAMPLE: If you plan to stand for election to the committee, you must be nominated by three members.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你打算入选委员会﹐就必须获得三名委员的推荐。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with no unfair advantage to one person or group
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The ruling party has promised that the elections will be fair.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 执政党承诺选举将是公平的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with everyone allowed to vote for who they want
Collocate.EXAMPLE: These will be the country’s first free multi-party elections.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这将是该国首次自由的多党选举。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The unions are calling for democratic elections.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会要求民主选举。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one in which the whole country votes to elect a government
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Labour’s victory in the general election gave them a huge majority.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党在大选中取胜﹐获得了明显多数票。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The Green Party increased its share of the vote in the French regional elections.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 绿党在法国地区选举中得票率有所提高。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: to elect a new president
to elect a new leader for a political party
to elect people to a congress or parliament
to elect a federal government
to elect a new mayor

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He became prime minister after a decisive election victory.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在选举中获得决定性胜利后当上首相。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The election results have been coming in all night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 选举结果彻夜接连产生。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The election campaign got off to a bad start.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 竞选活动开局不利。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone trying to be elected in an election
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Local party members choose the election candidates.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 地区党员选出候选人。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is made while a person or party is trying to be elected
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government has broken all its election promises.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府违背了所有的竞选承诺。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a programme by a party saying why people should vote for them in an election
a public meeting to support a politician or party before an election
a year in which there is an election
the day or night when people are voting and the votes are being counted
the period of time before an election
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There have been violent street protests in the run-up to the elections.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 选举前夕发生了几起街头暴力抗议。

Exponent.DEF: an occasion when people choose a government or leader by voting
Exponent.EXAMPLE: American presidential election
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国总统竞选
Exponent.EXAMPLE: South Africa held its first multi-racial elections in 1994.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 1994年南非举行首次多种族大选。

Exponent.DEF: an occasion when the members of an organization vote by marking what they want on a piece of paper, especially to make sure that it is secret
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The result of the ballot showed that nurses were not in favour of a strike.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 无记名投票结果显示﹐护士不赞成举行罢工。

Exponent.DEF: an occasion when everyone in a country votes on an important political subject
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In the Danish referendum, the people voted ‘no’ to joining the European single currency.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹麦人在全民公决中投票反对加入欧洲单一货币。

Exponent.DEF: the process of voting in a political election – used especially in news reports
Exponent.TRAN: 〔政治选举〕投票〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: 4,500,000 voters went to the polls in eight provinces to elect six governors.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 八个省共450万选民参加投票﹐选举六位省长。

Exponent.DEF: an act of voting informally for something by the people in a group raising their hands
Exponent.EXAMPLE: May I have a show of hands from all those in favour of the proposal?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 请赞成这个提议的人举手好吗？

Sense.DEF: speeches and other activities that are intended to persuade people to vote for a particular person or political party
an elective position or organization is one for which there is an election
Sense.EXAMPLE: the 34 elective seats in the National Assembly
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国民议会中的34个选举席位

Sense.DEF: elective medical treatment is treatment that you choose to have, although you do not have to
Sense.EXAMPLE: elective surgerysuch as hip replacements
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 髋关节置换术等非必需的手术

Sense.DEF: an elective course is one that students can choose to take, although they do not have to take it in order to graduate
a course that students can choose to take, but they do not have to take it in order to graduate
someone who has the right to vote in an election
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over 36% of electors did not vote at all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超过36%的选民放弃了投票。

Sense.DEF: relating to elections and voting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our electoral system strongly favours two-party government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的选举制度非常有利于两党轮流执政。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a campaign for electoral reform
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 倡导选举制度改革的运动

Sense.DEF: a group of people chosen by the votes of the people in each US state, who come together to elect the President, or a similar group in other countries
Sense.TRAN: 〔由美国各州人民选出的代表组成的〕总统选举团﹔〔其他国家的〕领袖选举团

Sense.DEF: an official list of the people who are allowed to vote in an election
all the people in a country who have the right to vote
Sense.EXAMPLE: A majority of the electorate oppose the law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数选民反对这项法规。

Sense.DEF: needing electricity to work, produced by electricity, or used for carrying electricity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the heat from a small electric fire
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小型电暖器产生的热量

GramExa.GLOSS: a flow of electricity

Sense.EXAMPLE: an electric blanket one with electric wires in it, used for making a bed warm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电热毯

Sense.DEF: making people feel very excited
Sense.TRAN: 扣人心弦的﹐高度刺激的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The atmosphere in the courtroom was electric.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭上的气氛十分紧张。

Sense.DEF: relating to electricity
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fire was caused by an electrical fault.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大火是电力故障引起的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an electrical engineer a person who designs and makes electrical equipment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电力[电气]工程师

Sense.DEF: using electricity

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 电气设备/电气商品/电器等

Sense.DEF: a violent storm with a lot of lightning
a very bright blue colour
a chair in which criminals are killed using electricity, especially in the US, in order to punish them for murder
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指美国处决谋杀犯用的〕电椅﹔电刑
Sense.EXAMPLE: He faces death by the electric chair in a Florida state prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在佛罗里达州监狱面临电刑处决。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to connect or repair electrical wires or equipment
the power that is carried by wires, cables etc, and is used to provide light or heat, to make machines work etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The farm was very isolated, but it had electricity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个农场非常偏远﹐但有电力供应。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of excitement
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was electricity in the air between the two of them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能感觉到他俩之间来电。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We need to find cleaner ways of generating electricity.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要找到更清洁的发电方式。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: produce electricity and make it available to people
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The dam will provide water and electricity for 30 million people.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座水坝将为3,000万人供水供电。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The system uses electricity to heat the water.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个系统用电将水加热。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: In an emergency, the hospital can be powered by electricity from a generator.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家医院在紧急情况下可由发电机供电。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used of a substance – allow electricity to travel along or through it
stop the supply of electricity
electricity provided to homes and businesses
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The storms have disrupted the electricity supply to some areas.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴风雨造成一些地区停电。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the amount of electricity that is needed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There has been a dramatic growth in electricity demand.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 用电需求急剧增长。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the process of producing electricity, or the amount produced
the amount of electricity that is used
a bill you have to pay for electricity you have used
electricity supplied to a building from the national electricity supply
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The cottage has no mains electricity.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座农舍没有通电。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: electricity that collects on a surface, for example on your clothes or a balloon

Sense.DEF: the parts of a machine that use electrical power
a sudden shock to your body, caused by electricity
a method of treatment for mental illness that involves sending electricity through someone’s brain
Sense.TRAN: 〔医治精神疾病的〕电休克治疗

Sense.DEF: if a performance or a speech electrifies people, it makes them feel very interested or excited
Sense.EXAMPLE: She would sit at the piano and sing, electrifying us all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她会边弹钢琴边唱歌﹐使我们大家兴奋不已。

Sense.DEF: to change a railway so that it uses electrical power, or to supply a building or area with electricity
Sense.TRAN: 使〔铁路〕电气化﹔向〔某建筑或地区〕供电
Sense.EXAMPLE: The west coast main line has been electrified.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西海岸铁路干线已经电气化了。

Sense.DEF: relating to electricity or made to work by electricity
Sense.TRAN: 电的﹔与电有关的﹔用电的
Sense.EXAMPLE: electrocute to hurt or kill someone by electricity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使触电受伤[身亡]
Sense.EXAMPLE: an electromagnet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电磁体﹐电磁铁

Sense.DEF: electric and something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: electro-chemical
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电化(学)的

Sense.DEF: an ecg2
an ecg1
if someone is electrocuted, they are injured or killed by electricity passing through their body
Sense.EXAMPLE: Last week a housewife was electrocuted by her washing machine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上周有个家庭主妇被洗衣机电死了。

Sense.DEF: to kill someone using electricity
a small piece of metal or a wire that is used to send electricity through a system or through a person’s body
Sense.EXAMPLE: The monkeys have electrodes implanted into the brain to measure their brain activity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些猴子的脑中植入了电极﹐以监测其大脑活动。

Sense.DEF: an eeg2
an eeg1
the process of separating a liquid into its chemical parts by passing an electric current through it
the process of using electricity to destroy hair roots and to remove unwanted hairs from your face etc
a liquid that allows electricity to pass through it
a piece of metal that becomes magneticable to attract metal objects when an electric current is turned on
relating to both electricity and magnetism, or having both electrical and magnetic qualities
Sense.EXAMPLE: electromagnetic waves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电磁波

GramExa.GLOSS: different waves of energy, including light, heat, radio waves, and x-rays

Sense.DEF: the relationship between electricity and magnetism, and the effect that they have on each other
a very small piece of matter with a negative electrical charge that moves around the nucleuscentral part of an atom
electronic equipment, such as computers and televisions, uses electricity that has passed through computer chips, transistors etc
Sense.TRAN: 电子的﹐用电子操作的﹔电子器件的
Sense.EXAMPLE: electronic games
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子游戏
Sense.EXAMPLE: an electronic organizer a small piece of electronic equipment that you can use to record addresses, phone numbers etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子记事本

Sense.DEF: using or produced by electronic equipment
Sense.TRAN: 使用电子设备的﹔由电子设备产生的
Sense.EXAMPLE: electronic music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子音乐
Sense.EXAMPLE: electronic banking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子银行业务
Sense.EXAMPLE: electronic publishing a system of producing books, magazines etc in a form that can be read on a computer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子出版(业)

Sense.DEF: a general word for various different types of electronic dance and listening music
a service provided by banks that allows people to pay money from one account to another, pay bills etc using the Internet
money that can be used to buy things on the Internet, but that does not exist in a physical form or belong to any particular country

a way for companies and banks to send information to each other by computer using an agreed format so that the company receiving the documents can easily read them on their computer and print them out on paper
when money is moved from one bank account, business etc to another using only computer systems
money that can be used to buy things on the Internet, but that does not exist in a physical form or belong to any particular country
a small piece of electronic equipment that you can use to record addresses, telephone numbers, dates of meetings etc

a thin sheet of special material, like a piece of paper, that is completely covered in very small round marks that can turn either black or white when attached to an electrical connection, and which then show up as words on the page
the business of producing books, magazines, or newspapers that are designed to be read using a computer
the study or industry of making equipment, such as computers and televisions, that work electronically
Sense.EXAMPLE: an electronics engineer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子工程师

Sense.DEF: electronic equipment
Sense.EXAMPLE: the market for consumer electronics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子设备消费品市场

Sense.DEF: a type of code that is used in an electronic document to prove who wrote it
a system of attaching a small piece of electronic equipment to a criminal, which allows the police to know where he or she is
Sense.TRAN: 〔警方用于追踪罪犯的〕电子标识跟踪系统﹐电子追踪系统

Sense.DEF: a service provided by airlines that allows people to buy their tickets on the Internet and usually does not give them tickets in the form of paper
Sense.TRAN: 〔航空公司的〕网上购票(服务)﹐电子票务

Sense.DEF: a very powerful microscopescientific instrument used for looking at small objects that uses electrons instead of light to make things look larger
to put a very thin layer of metal onto the surface of an object, using electrolysis
the waves or forces produced by electrical equipment such as mobile phones and computers, which some people believe make them ill
Sense.TRAN: 电子烟雾﹐电磁污染〔指手机﹑计算机等电子设备释放的电磁场﹐有人认为会致病〕

Sense.DEF: beautiful, attractive, or graceful
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tall, elegant young woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身材高挑﹑举止优雅的年轻女子
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can dine in elegant surroundings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以在雅致的环境中进餐。

Sense.DEF: an idea or a plan that is elegant is very intelligent yet simple
Sense.EXAMPLE: an elegant solution to the problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 解决问题的一个巧妙方法

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the style and elegance of the designs

Sense.DEF: showing that you feel sad about someone who has died or something that no longer exists
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spoke of her in elegiac tones.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以悲伤的口吻谈到了她。

Sense.DEF: a sad poem or song, especially about someone who has died
one part or feature of a whole system, plan, piece of work etc, especially one that is basic or important

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Honesty is a vital element of her success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 诚实是她取得成功的一个重要因素。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the primary element in the country’s economy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国经济的主要部分

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Besides ability, the other essential element in political success is luck.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治上的成功除能力以外﹐另一个必不可少的因素便是运气。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Business and management elements are built into the course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本课程加入了商务和管理方面的内容。

Sense.DEF: an amount, usually small, of a quality or feeling
Sense.TRAN: 几分惊奇/真实/风险/怀疑等
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is an element of truth in your argument.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的论点有些道理。

Sense.DEF: a simple chemical substance such as carbon or oxygen that consists of atoms of only one kind
a group of people who form part of a larger group, especially when the rest of the group does not approve of them
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指遭团体中其他人非议的〕一伙人
Sense.EXAMPLE: the hard-line elements in the party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 党内的强硬派

Sense.DEF: the weather, especially bad weather
Sense.EXAMPLE: sailors battling against the elements
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与恶劣天气搏斗的水手

Sense.DEF: the part of a piece of electrical equipment that produces heat
the most simple things that you have to learn first about a subject
Sense.TRAN: 某事物的基础[原理﹐纲要]
Sense.EXAMPLE: She doesn’t even know the basic elements of politeness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她甚至连基本的礼貌都不懂。

Sense.DEF: one of the four substances (earth, air, fire, and water) from which people used to believe that everything was made
Sense.TRAN: 元素〔旧时人们认为土﹑空气﹑火﹑水是构成一切物质的四大元素〕

Sense.DEF: to be in a situation that you enjoy, because you are good at it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Graham was in his element, building a fire and cooking the steaks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷厄姆生火﹑做牛排﹐干得得心应手。

Sense.DEF: to be in a situation that makes you uncomfortable or unhappy
Sense.TRAN: 不自在﹐处于不舒服的环境
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was out of her element in this dull little town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活在这个沉闷的小镇里她很不适应。

Sense.DEF: simple, basic, and important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Love and fear are two of the most elemental human emotions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱和恐惧是人类最基本的两种情感。

Sense.DEF: existing as a simple chemical element that has not been combined with anything else
Sense.EXAMPLE: elemental sulphur
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 元素硫

Sense.DEF: simple or basic
Sense.EXAMPLE: the elementary principles of justice and democracy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正义和民主的基本信条
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve made a very elementary mistake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你犯了一个非常基本的错误。

Sense.DEF: concerning the first and easiest part of a subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m only familiar with the subject at an elementary level.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对这门学科的了解只是初级水平。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know a little elementary science.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我懂一点基础科学。

Sense.DEF: relating to elementary school
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小学教育

Sense.DEF: people sometimes use this expression humorously to say how easy something is to solve. Some people think that the phrase comes from the Sherlock Holmes stories by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle. Holmes says this to his friend Watson when explaining how easy it is to understand something about a crime. In fact, the phrase does not appear in the books.
Sense.TRAN: 这很简单﹐我亲爱的华生。〔幽默用法﹐表示某事非常容易解决﹔有人认为此短语出自福尔摩斯系列故事﹐但书中其实并无此语〕

Sense.DEF: one of the types of pieces of matter including electrons, protons, and neutrons that make up atoms
a school in the US where basic subjects are taught for the first six years of a child’s education
a very large grey animal with four legs, two tuskslong curved teeth and a trunklong nose that it can use to pick things up
an important subject or problem that everyone knows about but no one mentions
Sense.TRAN: 众所周知却被刻意回避的问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: The race issue is the elephant in the room in this election.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这次选举中﹐重要的种族问题被刻意回避了。

Sense.DEF: slow, heavy, and awkward, like an elephant
Sense.TRAN: 〔似象一样〕迟缓的﹐笨重的﹐笨拙的
Sense.EXAMPLE: elephantine footsteps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 笨重的脚步声

Sense.DEF: to move someone or something to a more important level or rank, or make them better than before
Sense.EXAMPLE: Language has elevated humans above the other animals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言使人类高于其他动物。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their purpose is to elevate AIDS to the top of government priorities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的目的是使政府优先考虑艾滋病问题。

Sense.DEF: to lift someone or something to a higher position
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gradually elevate the patient into anupright position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把病人慢慢托到直立的位置。

Sense.DEF: to increase the amount, temperature, pressure etc of something
Sense.TRAN: 增加﹐提高〔数量﹑温度﹑压力等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: These drugs may elevate acid levels in the blood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些药物可能增加血液的酸度。

Sense.DEF: elevated thoughts, words etc seem to be intelligent or of high moral standard
Sense.EXAMPLE: elevated philosophical language
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满智慧的哲学语言

Sense.DEF: an elevated position or rank is very important and respected
raised off the ground or higher up than other things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The train runs on an elevated track.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 列车在高架轨道上行驶。

Sense.DEF: elevated levels, temperatures etc are higher than normal
Sense.EXAMPLE: elevated blood sugar levels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偏高的血糖水平

Sense.DEF: a railway that is above the streets in a town
making you feel interested in intelligent or moral subjects – sometimes used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔使人〕增长知识的﹔提升思想道德水平的〔有时为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an elevating experience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 增进修养的经历

Sense.DEF: a height above the level of the sea

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The road climbs steadily to an elevation of 1,400 feet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公路缓缓上升到海拔1,400英尺。

Sense.DEF: an act of moving someone to a more important rank or position

GramExa.EXAMPLE: her sudden elevation to international stardom
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一举成为国际明星

Sense.DEF: an increase in the amount or level of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sudden elevation of blood pressure
