Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 血压的突然升高

Sense.DEF: an upright side of a building, as shown in a drawing done by an architectperson who plans buildings
Sense.EXAMPLE: the front elevation of a house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子的正面外观

Sense.DEF: the angle made with the horizon by pointing a gun
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cannon was fired at an elevation of 60 degrees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大砲以60度仰角射击。

Sense.DEF: a machine that takes people and goods from one level to another in a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to take the elevator.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只好坐电梯了。

Sense.DEF: a machine with a moving belt and containers, used for lifting grain and liquids, or for taking things off ships
Sense.TRAN: 〔运送粮食﹑液体或卸船的〕升降机﹐起卸机

Sense.DEF: the type of music that is played in shops and public places, and is usually thought to be boring
Sense.TRAN: 背景音乐〔在商店等公共场所播放的音乐﹐通常被认为很乏味〕

Sense.DEF: the number
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was sent to jail for eleven months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被判入狱11个月。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never go to bed before eleven 11 o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从不在11点钟以前上床睡觉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: James had worked every summer since he was eleven 11 years old.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯自11岁起每年夏天都打工。

Sense.DEF: a team of 11 players in football or cricket
Sense.EXAMPLE: He plays regularly in the first eleven the best team of 11 players.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他经常作为首发阵容上场。

Sense.DEF: an examination that all children in Britain used to take at the age of 11 in order to decide what kind of secondary school they should go to. In some areas, children still take this examination.
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国过去十一岁儿童参加的〕升中学甄别考试〔现仍在部分地区实行〕

Sense.DEF: a cup of coffee or tea and a biscuit, that you have in the middle of the morning
coming after ten other things in a series
Sense.EXAMPLE: in the eleventh century
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在11世纪
Sense.EXAMPLE: her eleventh birthday
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的11岁生日

Sense.DEF: the last moment before something important happens
Sense.TRAN: 〔重大事件即将发生前的〕最后一刻﹐最后时刻
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the eleventh hour the government decided that something had to be done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府在最后一刻决定采取行动。

Sense.DEF: one of eleven equal parts of something
an imaginary creature like a small person with pointed ears and magical powers
Sense.TRAN: 小精灵〔传说中的精灵﹐形似小人﹐耳尖〕

Sense.DEF: someone who looks elfin is small and delicate
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had an elfin face and wide grey eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她长着一张小巧玲珑的面孔和一双灰色的大眼睛。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in getting information or a reaction from someone, especially when this is difficult
Sense.TRAN: 〔从某人处〕套出〔信息〕﹔引起〔某人的反应〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: When her knock elicited no response, she opened the door and peeped in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敲门没有回应﹐她便推开门往里张望。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The test uses pictures to elicit words from the child.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项测试用图片诱导孩子说话。

Sense.DEF: to leave out the sound of a letter or of a part of a word
Sense.TRAN: 省略〔一个字母或音节〕的发音
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most English speakers elide the first ‘d’ in ‘Wednesday.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数说英语的人会省略Wednesday中第一个d的发音。

Sense.DEF: someone who is eligible for something is able or allowed to do it, for example because they are the right age

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Students on a part-time course are not eligible for a loan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 非全日制课程的学生没有资格申请贷款。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Over 500,000 18-year-olds will become eligible to vote this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年将有超过50万人年满18岁﹐获得投票资格。

Sense.DEF: an eligible man or woman would be good to marry because they are rich, attractive, and not married
Sense.TRAN: 〔作为婚姻对象〕合意的﹐合适的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stephen was regarded as an eligible bachelor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯蒂芬被认为是一个钻石王老五。

Sense.DEF: to completely get rid of something that is unnecessary or unwanted

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The credit card eliminates the need for cash or cheques.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有了信用卡就不需要使用现金或支票了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is no solution that will totally eliminate the possibility of theft.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有办法可以完全杜绝盗窃案的发生。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fatty foods should be eliminated from the diet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮食中应该避免摄入高脂肪食物。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say get rid of rather than eliminate .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说get rid of﹐而不说eliminate
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It is almost impossible to get rid of the problem.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 要摆脱这个问题几乎是不可能的。

Sense.DEF: to defeat a team or person in a competition, so that they no longer take part in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our team was eliminated in the first round.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们队第一轮就被淘汰了。

Sense.DEF: to kill someone in order to prevent them from causing trouble
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ruthless dictator who eliminated all his rivals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铲除所有异己的残酷独裁者

Sense.DEF: if the police eliminate someone from their enquiries, they decide that that person did not commit a particular crime
Sense.TRAN: 〔警方〕将某人排除在调查对象之外

Sense.DEF: the removal or destruction of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the elimination of lead in petrol
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 除去汽油中的铅

Sense.DEF: the defeat of a team or player in a competition, so that they may no longer take part
the act of killing someone, especially to prevent them from causing trouble

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The killings are part of a campaign of elimination of the political opposition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这几起谋杀是铲除政敌行动的一部分。

Sense.DEF: the process of getting rid of substances that your body no longer needs

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the elimination of toxins from the body
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从体内排除毒素

Sense.DEF: a special diet used by doctors to discover whether certain foods are making someone ill. It involves not eating foods that might be causing the problem. Later you start to eat each of these foods again separately over a period of time until one of them makes you ill.
Sense.TRAN: 排除饮食〔用以排查引发疾病的食物〕

Sense.DEF: a group of people who have a lot of power and influence because they have money, knowledge, or special skills

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the domination of power by a small political elite
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被少数政治精英掌控权力

Sense.EXAMPLE: a struggle for power within the ruling elite
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 统治阶层内部的争权夺利

Sense.DEF: an elite group contains the best, most skilled or most experienced people or members of a larger group
Sense.EXAMPLE: an elite group of artists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一批出类拔萃的艺术家
Sense.EXAMPLE: elite universities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精英大学

Sense.DEF: an elitist system, government etc is one in which a small group of people have more power and advantages than other people
Sense.TRAN: 精英统治的﹔精英主义的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an elitist education system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精英教育体制

Sense.DEF: a magical liquid that is supposed to cure people of illness, make them younger etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the search for the elixir of life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寻找长生不老药

Sense.DEF: something that is supposed to solve problems as if by magic
Sense.EXAMPLE: The current new wave of technology should prove an economic elixir.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当前的新技术浪潮将成为解决经济问题的灵丹妙药。

Sense.DEF: relating to the period 1558-1603 when Elizabeth I was queen of England
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国女王〕伊丽莎白一世时代的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elizabethan drama
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊丽莎白一世时代的戏剧

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The Earl of Essex was a famous Elizabethan.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃塞克斯伯爵是伊丽莎白一世时代的一位名流。

Sense.DEF: a very large brown North American, European, and Asian animal with wide flat horns
a large North American deer
a curved shape like a circle, but with two slightly longer and flatter sides

when words are deliberately left out of a sentence, though the meaning can still be understood. For example, you may say ‘He’s leaving but I’m not’ instead of saying ‘He’s leaving but I’m not leaving.’
Sense.TRAN: 〔不影响意义的句子成分的〕省略

Sense.DEF: the sign (…) used in writing to show that some words have deliberately been left out of a sentence
having the shape of an ellipse
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kepler published his discovery of the elliptical orbits of planets in 1609. 1609
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年开普勒公布他的发现﹐认为行星轨道为椭圆形。

Sense.DEF: elliptical speech or writing is difficult to understand because more is meant than is actually said
Sense.EXAMPLE: The language is often elliptical and ambiguous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言经常是隐晦和模棱两可的。

Sense.DEF: a type of large tree with broad leaves, or the wood from this tree
good clear speaking in public, involving voice control, pronunciation etc
Sense.TRAN: 口齿清晰的演讲﹔演讲术

Sense.DEF: to become longer, or make something longer than normal
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her legs were elongated by the very high heels which she wore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿的高跟鞋非常高﹐使她的腿显得长了。

Sense.DEF: longer than normal
Sense.EXAMPLE: The picture shows two elongated figures dancing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 图片上是两个拉长的﹑正在跳舞的人影。

Sense.DEF: to leave your home secretly in order to get married
Sense.EXAMPLE: My parents didn’t approve of the marriage, so we eloped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母不赞成这桩婚事﹐所以我们就私奔了。

Sense.DEF: able to express your ideas and opinions well, especially in a way that influences people
Sense.TRAN: 雄辩的﹐有口才的﹐能言善辩的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an eloquent appeal for support
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极具说服力的求助呼吁

Sense.DEF: showing a feeling or meaning without using words
Sense.TRAN: 〔不用文字〕清楚表明的﹐形象显示的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The photographs are an eloquent reminder of the horrors of war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些照片清楚地提醒人们不要忘记战争的恐怖。

Sense.GRAM: used after words beginning with ‘some-’, ‘every-’, ‘any-’, and ‘no-’, and after question words
Sense.GRAMTRAN: 用于以some-﹐every-﹐any-和no-开头的单词后﹐或疑问词后

Subsense.DEF: besides or in addition to someone or something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There’s something else I’d like to talk about as well.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还有其他事情要谈一谈。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’d like you to come, and anyone else who’s free.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想请你过来﹐其他人有空也可以来。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He was awake now, as was everyone else.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在已经醒了﹐其他人也都醒了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Who else was at the party?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还有谁参加了聚会？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Two coffees, please.’ ‘Anything else?’ ‘No, thanks.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “请来两杯咖啡。”“还要别的吗？”“不要了﹐谢谢。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Above all elsemore than any other things she was seeking love.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她追求爱情胜过一切。

Subsense.DEF: used to talk about a different person, thing, place etc
Subsense.TRAN: 别的﹐另外的〔用于表示不同的人﹑事物﹑地方等〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to live anywhere else but here.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别的地方我都愿意住﹐只要不是这里。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If I can’t trust you, who else can I trust?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要是不能相信你﹐还能相信谁呢？

Sense.DEF: spoken

Subsense.DEF: used to say that there will be a bad result if someone does not do something
Subsense.TRAN: 否则﹐要不然〔用于表示会有不好的结果〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Hurry up or else we’ll miss the train.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点﹐否则我们要赶不上火车了。

Subsense.DEF: used to say what another possibility might be
Subsense.TRAN: 要不〔用于表示有另一个可能〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The salesman will reduce the price or else include free insurance.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 推销员会降低价格﹐要不就会附送免费保险。

Subsense.DEF: used to threaten someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Hand over the money, or else!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把钱交出来﹐不然的话要你好看！

Sense.DEF: used after a question word to say that the thing, person, or place you have mentioned is the only one possible
Sense.TRAN: 还能有别的…〔用于疑问词后﹐表示刚提及的事情﹑人或地方是唯一的可能〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What are you doing?’ ‘Waiting for you, what else?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你在干什么？”“在等你呗﹐还能做什么？”

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is impossible to do or say anything apart from what has been mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 某人还能做/说什么？〔用于表示除了刚提到的事情﹐不可能做[说]别的了〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Will you really sell the house?’ ‘What else can I do? I can’t live here.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你真的要把房子卖了？”“还能怎么办？我不能住在这里了。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: When you want to use the possessive form of ‘someone else’, ‘anyone else’, or ‘no one else’, you should add ’s to else , not to ‘someone’ etc. someone else ﹑ anyone else
F2NBox.TRAN: 或 no one else的所有格形式是在else后面加’s ﹐不是在someone等词后面加
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Don’t use someone else’s ideas (NOT
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 不说 … someone’s else ideas). 不要用别人的想法。

Sense.DEF: in, at, or to another place
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is becoming famous in Australia and elsewhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在澳大利亚和其他地方渐渐出名了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kerala has less crime and alcoholism than elsewhere in India.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喀拉拉邦的犯罪和酗酒现象少于印度的其他地区。

Sense.DEF: the teaching of the English language to people whose first language is not English
Sense.TRAN: 〔对英语并非母语者的〕英语教学

Sense.DEF: to explain something that is difficult to understand by providing more information
Sense.EXAMPLE: The full picture has not yet been elucidated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 详细情况还没有解释清楚。

Sense.DEF: to escape from someone or something, especially by tricking them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He eluded his pursuers by escaping into a river.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他逃到河里﹐甩掉了追踪他的人。

Sense.DEF: if something that you want eludes you, you fail to find or achieve it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She took the exam again, but again success eluded her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她再次参加了考试﹐可还是没有及格。

Sense.DEF: if a fact or the answer to a problem eludes you, you cannot remember or solve it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The exact terminology eludes me for the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 确切的术语我一时想不起来。

Sense.DEF: an elusive person or animal is difficult to find or not often seen
Sense.TRAN: 〔人或动物〕难找的﹐不常见到的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She managed to get an interview with that elusive man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她设法采访到了那个行踪飘忽的人。

Sense.DEF: an elusive result is difficult to achieve
Sense.EXAMPLE: She enjoys a firm reputation in this country but wider international success has been elusive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在这个国家享有稳固的声誉﹐但却一直难以在国际上取得更大的成功。

Sense.DEF: an elusive idea or quality is difficult to describe or understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: For me, the poem has an elusive quality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对我来说﹐这首诗有点难以捉摸。

Sense.DEF: the plural of elf
a place of complete happiness. According to ancient Greek stories, Elysium is the place where good people go after their death.
Sense.TRAN: 极乐世界﹐至福之境〔古希腊传说中好人死后的归宿〕

Sense.DEF: the form used for en- before b, m, or p
Sense.EXAMPLE: embittered made to feel extremely disappointed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怨恨的
Sense.EXAMPLE: empowerment when someone is given control of something
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 授权

Sense.DEF: sometimes used as a short form of ‘them’
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go on, Bill, you tell ’em!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你说吧﹐比尔﹐告诉他们！

Sense.DEF: extremely thin from lack of food or illness
Sense.TRAN: 〔因饥饿或生病〕极其消瘦的﹐憔悴的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prisoners were ill and emaciated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 囚犯们疾病缠身﹐骨瘦如柴。

Sense.DEF: a system that allows you to send and receive messages by computer
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s usually best to contact him by email.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一般最好是用电子邮件和他联络。

Sense.DEF: a message that is sent from one person to another using the email system
Sense.EXAMPLE: Send me an e-mail when you have any news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一有消息就发电子邮件给我。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Can you send me an email with all the details?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把详情用电子邮件发给我好吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Within seconds, I got an email confirming the booking.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 不到几秒钟﹐我就收到了确认预订的电子邮件。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It took most of the morning to read my emails.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 早上我大部分时间在看电子邮件。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Jack spent the evening writing emails and surfing the Internet.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚上杰克都在写电子邮件和上网。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She did not bother replying to his email.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她懒得给他回电子邮件。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The first thing I do every morning is check my email.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每天早上第一件事就是查电子邮件。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: send an email you have received to someone else
send it quickly, especially because you are angry about something
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔尤指愤怒时〕匆忙发送电子邮件

Collocate.EXAMPLE: What’s your email address?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的电子邮件地址是什么？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I can send email messages on my phone.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以用手机发电子邮件。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a computer file sent in an email
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Don’t open an email attachment unless you know who sent it.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要打开不认识的人发给你的电子邮件附件。

Sense.DEF: to send someone an email
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you e-mail me about it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能就此事给我发个电子邮件吗？

Sense.DEF: to send someone a document using email
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you email me the proposal by the end of today?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能在今天下班前把提议用电子邮件发送给我吗？

Sense.DEF: to produce a smell, light etc, or to show a particular quality
Sense.TRAN: 发出〔气味﹑光等〕﹔表现出〔某种品质〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He emanates tranquility.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身上散发着一种恬静气质。

Sense.DEF: to come from or out of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wonderful smells were emanating from the kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从厨房传来诱人的香味。

Sense.DEF: to give someone the political or legal rights that they did not have before
Sense.TRAN: 解放﹐给〔某人〕政治[法律]权利
Sense.EXAMPLE: Slaves were emancipated in 1834.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奴隶于1834年获得了解放。

Sense.DEF: socially, politically, or legally free
Sense.TRAN: 解放了的﹔不受〔社会﹑政治或法律的〕束缚的

Sense.DEF: an emancipated woman is not influenced by old-fashioned ideas about how women should behave
Sense.TRAN: 〔妇女〕思想解放的﹐不受传统观念束缚的

Sense.DEF: to make a man feel weaker and less male
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some men feel emasculated if they work for a woman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在女人手下工作﹐有些男人会觉得没有男子气。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something weaker or less effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bill has been emasculated by Congress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会削弱了这个法案的效力。

Sense.DEF: to remove all or part of a male’s sex organs
to treat a dead body with chemicals, oils etc to prevent it from decaying
Sense.TRAN: 〔用化学品﹑油等〕对〔尸体〕进行防腐处理

Sense.DEF: a wide wall of earth or stones built to stop water from flooding an area, or to support a road or railway
an official order to stop trade with another country

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an embargo on wheat exports
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小麦出口禁令
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an embargo against the country
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对该国的贸易禁令

GramExa.GLOSS: start or end one
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many allies are pushing to lift the embargo.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多盟国在努力推进取消贸易禁令。

Sense.DEF: to officially stop particular goods being traded with another country
Sense.TRAN: 禁止〔与另一国家〕贸易﹔下令禁运
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several countries embargoed arms shipments to Yugoslavia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好几个国家对南斯拉夫实行武器禁运。

Sense.DEF: to stop information from being made public until a particular date or until permission is given
Sense.TRAN: 〔在某日期前或取得批准前〕禁止发表〔资料〕

Sense.DEF: to go onto a ship or a plane, or to put or take something onto a ship or plane
to start something, especially something new, difficult, or exciting
Sense.TRAN: 开始﹐着手〔尤指新的﹑困难的或令人激动的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He embarked on a new career as a teacher.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始了教书的新生涯。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel ashamed, nervous, or uncomfortable, especially in front of other people
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在社交场合〕使尴尬﹐使窘迫
Sense.EXAMPLE: He didn’t want to embarrass her by asking questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不想提问让她尴尬。

Sense.DEF: to do something that causes problems for a government, political organization, or politician, and makes them look bad
Sense.TRAN: 给〔政府﹑政治组织或政治人物〕出难题﹔使…陷入困境
Sense.EXAMPLE: The revelations in the press have embarrassed the government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸披露的事实让政府很难堪。

Sense.DEF: feeling uncomfortable or nervous and worrying about what people think of you, for example because you have made a silly mistake, or because you have to talk or sing in public
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lori gets embarrassed if we ask her to sing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要是请洛丽唱歌﹐她就会难为情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked embarrassed when I asked him where he’d been.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我问他去了哪里﹐他显得很窘迫。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Michelle was acutely embarrassed very embarrassed at having to ask for money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 米歇尔不得不开口要钱﹐觉得难堪极了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ken gave her an embarrassed grin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯尴尬地朝她咧嘴一笑。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was an embarrassed silence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出现了一阵尴尬的沉默。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was embarrassed to admit making a mistake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他十分难堪地开口承认犯了一个错误。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I felt embarrassed about how untidy the house was.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家里太乱了﹐我感到难为情。

Sense.DEF: having no money or having debts

Exponent.DEF: feeling uncomfortable or nervous and worrying about what people think of you, for example because you have made a silly mistake, or because you have to talk or sing in public
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was really embarrassed when I arrived at the party an hour early.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我提前一个小时到了聚会的地方﹐觉得非常尴尬。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s no need to be embarrassed – you’ve got a lovely voice.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 用不着难为情﹐你的嗓音很美。

Exponent.DEF: embarrassed about your body or the way you look or talk
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因顾虑自己的外表或谈吐〕忸怩的﹐害羞的﹐不自然的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Paul had always been self-conscious about his big feet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗对自己的大脚一直都很在意。

Exponent.DEF: unable to relax because you are embarrassed and not sure what to say or do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was a long silence and everyone at the table looked uncomfortable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 出现了长时间的沉默﹐在座的每个人都显得很不自在。

Exponent.DEF: feeling embarrassed because you are in a situation in which it is difficult to behave naturally
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Teenagers often feel awkward in formal social situations.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 十几岁的孩子在正式的社交场合中往往会感到不自在。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There were some awkward moments when neither of us knew what to say to each other.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有好几次我们俩都不知该跟对方说些什么好﹐场面很尴尬。

Exponent.DEF: slightly embarrassed because you know that you have done something silly or because you feel a little guilty
Exponent.TRAN: 局促不安的﹐窘迫的﹐尴尬的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Nigel came in late looking sheepish and apologetic.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 奈杰尔来迟了﹐脸上带着不安和歉意。

Exponent.DEF: embarrassed or ashamed – used mainly in newspaper reports
Exponent.TRAN: 尴尬的﹐羞愧的〔主要用于新闻报道〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A judge was left red-faced when his mobile phone rang in court.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有位法官的手机在法庭上响了﹐他很尴尬。

Exponent.DEF: extremely embarrassed and ashamed because you realize that you have done something very silly or wrong
Exponent.TRAN: 失面子的﹔羞愧的﹔难堪的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He said he was mortified at the way his comments had been reported in the papers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说自己的言论被如此这般刊登在报纸上﹐令他难堪。

Sense.DEF: making you feel ashamed, nervous, or uncomfortable
Sense.TRAN: 令人尴尬的﹐使人难堪的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She asked a lot of embarrassing questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她问了许多令人尴尬的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an embarrassing situation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人难堪的处境

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This incident is deeply embarrassing for the government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一事件让政府非常难堪。

Sense.DEF: the feeling you have when you are embarrassed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She suffered extreme embarrassment at not knowing how to read.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不识字﹐这让她难堪极了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He could not hide his embarrassment at his children’s rudeness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他无法掩饰自己孩子的无礼给他带来的难堪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To her embarrassment, she couldn’t remember his name.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想不起他的名字﹐感到很尴尬。

Sense.DEF: an event that causes a government, political organization etc problems, and makes it look bad
Sense.TRAN: 使〔政府﹑政治机构等〕为难的事

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The allegations have been an acute embarrassment serious and severe embarrassment to the Prime Minister.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些指控令首相极其头痛。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The scandal was a further source of embarrassment to the government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丑闻让政府进一步陷入困境。

Sense.DEF: someone who behaves in a way that makes you feel ashamed, nervous, or uncomfortable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tim’s drinking has made him an embarrassment to the whole family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆的酗酒让全家人都为他难堪。

Sense.DEF: debts or a lack of money that causes problems for you
so many good things that it is difficult to decide which one you want
Sense.TRAN: 〔好东西〕多得不知道选哪个好

Sense.DEF: a group of officials who represent their government in a foreign country, or the building they work in
Sense.TRAN: 大使馆全体外交官员﹔大使馆
Sense.EXAMPLE: the American Embassy in Paris
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国驻巴黎大使馆

Sense.DEF: an embattled person, organization etc has many problems or difficulties
Sense.TRAN: 问题缠身的﹔困难重重的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The embattled president had to resign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 处境艰难的总统不得不辞职。

Sense.DEF: surrounded by enemies, especially in war or fighting
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在战争或战斗中〕被敌人包围的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The embattled army finally surrendered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陷入重围的军队最终投降了。

Sense.DEF: to put something firmly and deeply into something else, or to be put into something in this way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A piece of glass was embedded in her hand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块玻璃扎在她的手上。

Sense.DEF: if ideas, attitudes, or feelings etc are embedded, you believe or feel them very strongly
Sense.TRAN: 使〔思想﹑态度﹑感情等〕扎根于
Sense.EXAMPLE: Feelings of guilt are deeply embedded in her personality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 负罪感在她的性格里根深蒂固。

Sense.DEF: to put something such as a graphic into a computer program or page on the Internet
Sense.TRAN: 将〔图表等〕嵌入〔计算机程序〕﹔把…放入〔网页内〕

Sense.DEF: an embedded journalist
a journalist who stays with a unit of the armed forces during a war in order to report directly about the fighting
to make something more beautiful by adding decorations to it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dress was embellished with gold threads.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 连衣裙用金线作了装饰。

Sense.DEF: to make a story or statement more interesting by adding details that are not true
Sense.TRAN: 给〔故事或敍述〕添枝加叶﹔对…加以渲染
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave an embellished account of what had happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她添油加醋地把发生的事描述了一番。

Sense.DEF: a piece of wood or coal that stays red and very hot after a fire has stopped burning
Sense.EXAMPLE: glowing embers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发光的余烬

Sense.DEF: to steal money from the place where you work
Sense.TRAN: 盗用﹐挪用﹐贪污﹐侵吞〔款项〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two managers were charged with embezzling $400,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名经理被控挪用了40万美元。

Sense.DEF: angry, sad, or full of hate because of bad or unfair things that have happened to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sick, embittered, and lonely old man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病魔缠身﹑满腹牢骚的孤独老人

Sense.DEF: if something is emblazoned with a name, design etc, it has that design on it where it can easily be seen
Sense.TRAN: 印有〔名字﹑图案等〕标志的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a T-shirt emblazoned with a political slogan
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 印有政治口号的T恤衫

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sponsor’s name is emblazoned on the players’ shirts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 赞助商的名字印在了球员的运动衫上。

Sense.DEF: a picture, shape, or object that is used to represent a country, organization etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用来代表国家﹑团体等的〕标志﹐徽章﹐纹章

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The national emblem of Canada is a maple leaf.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加拿大的国家象征是枫叶。

Sense.DEF: something that represents an idea, principle, or situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔代表一种观念﹑原则或情况的〕标志﹐象征

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Expensive cars are seen as an emblem of success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 豪华汽车被视为成功的标志。

Sense.DEF: seeming to represent or be a sign of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Vespa scooter became emblematic of sophisticated urban culture across Europe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伟士牌踏板摩托车在欧洲各地都成了时尚都市文化的象征。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that represents or is very typical of an idea or quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is the embodiment of evil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是邪恶的化身。

Sense.DEF: to be a very good example of an idea or quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: She embodies everything I admire in a teacher.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她具备了我所钦佩的教师该具备的一切素质。

Sense.DEF: to include something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The latest model embodies many new improvements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最新的款式包含了许多新的改进。

Sense.DEF: to give someone more courage
Sense.EXAMPLE: Emboldened by her smile, he asked her to dance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的微笑让他鼓起勇气邀请她跳舞。

Sense.DEF: something such as a hard mass of blood or a small amount of air that blocks a tube carrying blood through the body
having a surface that is decorated with a raised pattern

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was given a Bible embossed with her name.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她得到了一本凸印有她名字的《圣经》。

Sense.EXAMPLE: embossed stationery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有凸起图案的文具

Sense.DEF: to put your arms around someone and hold them in a friendly or loving way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack warmly embraced his son.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克热情拥抱他的儿子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maggie and Laura embraced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛吉和劳拉拥抱在一起。

Sense.DEF: to eagerly accept a new idea, opinion, religion etc
Sense.TRAN: 欣然接受﹐乐意采纳〔新思想﹑意见﹑宗教等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We hope these regions will embrace democratic reforms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望这些地区会乐意接受民主改革。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most West European countries have embraced the concept of high-speed rail networks with enthusiasm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数西欧国家都表现出极大的兴趣﹐欣然接受修建高速铁路网的想法。

Sense.DEF: to include something as part of a subject, discussion etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: This course embraces several different aspects of psychology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课程涉及心理学的几个不同方面。

Sense.DEF: the act of holding someone close to you, especially as a sign of love

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They held each other in a tender embrace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们温柔地拥抱在一起。

Sense.DEF: to decorate cloth by sewing a pattern, picture, or words on it with coloured threads

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dress was embroidered with flowers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条裙子上绣着花。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A colourful design was embroidered on the sleeve of the shirt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 衬衫的袖子上绣了一个色彩鲜艳的图案。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a richly embroidered jacket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刺绣华美的夹克衫

Sense.DEF: to make a story or report of events more interesting or exciting by adding details that are not true
Sense.TRAN: 对〔故事或报道〕加以渲染

Sense.DEF: a pattern sewn onto cloth, or cloth with patterns sewn onto it
the act of sewing patterns onto cloth
imaginary details that are added to make a story seem more interesting or exciting
to involve someone or something in a difficult situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I became embroiled in an argument with the taxi driver.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我与出租车司机起了争执。

Sense.DEF: an animal or human that has not yet been born, and has just begun to develop
at a very early stage of development
Sense.TRAN: 在胚胎阶段﹔在萌芽时期
Sense.EXAMPLE: The system already exists in embryo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该体系已具雏形。

Sense.DEF: the scientific study of embryos
at a very early stage of development
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plans are still only in embryonic form.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计划还只是在酝酿之中。

Sense.DEF: relating to an embryo
Sense.EXAMPLE: embryonic development
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胚胎的发育
Sense.EXAMPLE: embryonic cells
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胚胎细胞

Sense.DEF: someone who introduces the performers on a television or radio programme or at a social event
Sense.EXAMPLE: a game show emcee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游戏节目主持人

Sense.DEF: to remove the mistakes from something that has been written
a valuable bright green stone that is often used in jewellery
a bright green colour
to appear or come out from somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flowers emerge in the spring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花儿在春天开放。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sun emerged from behind the clouds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳从云层后露了出来。

Sense.DEF: if facts emerge, they become known after being hidden or secret
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eventually the truth emerged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真相终于大白。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Later it emerged that the judge had employed an illegal immigrant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后来查明﹐那个法官雇用了一名非法移民。

Sense.DEF: to come out of a difficult experience

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She emerged from the divorce a stronger person.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走出离婚的阴影﹐变得更加坚强。

Sense.DEF: to begin to be known or noticed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a religious sect that emerged in the 1830s
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兴起于19世纪30年代的一个宗教派别

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Local government has recently emerged as a major issue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地政府近来成为人们关注的主要问题。

Sense.DEF: when something begins to be known or noticed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the emergence of new evidence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新证据的出现

Sense.DEF: when someone or something comes out of a difficult experience

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the company’s emergence from bankruptcy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司摆脱破产

Sense.DEF: an unexpected and dangerous situation that must be dealt with immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lifeguards are trained to deal with emergencies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 救生员接受过应对紧急情况的训练。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The staff need to know what to do in an emergency.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工需要了解紧急情况下该怎么办。

Sense.EXAMPLE: In case of emergency, press the alarm button.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遇到紧急情况﹐请按报警按钮。

GramExa.PROPFORM: emergency exit/supplies etcused in an emergency
GramExa.EXAMPLE: $500,000 of emergency aidfor the victims of the earthquake
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 向地震灾民提供的50万美元紧急援助

Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane had to make an emergency landing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那架飞机不得不紧急着陆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government called an emergency meeting to discuss the crisis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府召开了紧急会议﹐讨论这次危机。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment in a car that you pull up with your hand to stop the car from moving
a chain that a passenger pulls to stop a train in an emergency
a part of a hospital that immediately helps people who have been hurt in an accident or who are extremely ill
official organizations such as the police or the fire service, that deal with crime, fires, and injuries
Sense.TRAN: 〔警察局﹑消防队等处理犯罪﹑火灾﹑伤害的〕应急服务机构

Sense.DEF: in the early stages of existence or development
Sense.TRAN: 新出现的﹔处于萌芽阶段的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the emergent nations of the world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界上新成立的国家

Sense.DEF: in an early state of development
Sense.EXAMPLE: the country’s emerging oil industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国新兴的石油工业

Sense.LEXUNIT:
emeritus professor/director etc
or 或
professor/director etc emeritus
Sense.DEF: a professor,director etc who is no longer working but has kept his or her previous job title as an honour
a very hard mineral that is used for polishing things and making them smooth
a narrow piece of stiff paper with emery on it, used for shaping your nails
something that you eat or drink in order to make yourself vomitbring up food from your stomach
someone who leaves their own country to live in another
to leave your own country in order to live in another country

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He emigrated to Australia as a young man.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他年轻时移居澳大利亚。

Sense.DEF: someone who leaves their own country to live in another, usually for political reasons
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常因政治原因移居外国的〕流亡者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Russian émigrés living in Paris
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 住在巴黎的俄国流亡者

Sense.DEF: the quality of being famous and important

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a scientist of great eminence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出类拔萃的科学家

Sense.DEF: a title used when talking to or about a cardinalpriest of high rank in the Roman Catholic Church
Sense.TRAN: 阁下﹐大人〔对天主教红衣主教的尊称〕

Sense.DEF: a hill or area of high ground
someone who has unofficial power, often secretly, through someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Borusa had no wish to become president, instead preferring to operate as an eminence grise behind the scenes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 博鲁萨无意当总裁﹐而是更喜欢做一个幕后操纵者。

Sense.DEF: an eminent person is famous, important, and respected
Sense.EXAMPLE: an eminent lawyer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰出的律师

Sense.DEF: the right of the US government to take private land for public use
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国政府对私有土地的〕征用权

Sense.DEF: completely and without a doubt – use this to show approval
Sense.EXAMPLE: Woods is eminently suitable for the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伍兹完全适合做这份工作。

Sense.DEF: a Muslim ruler, especially in the Middle East
Sense.TRAN: 埃米尔〔尤指中东地区的穆斯林统治者〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Emir of Kuwait
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科威特的埃米尔

Sense.DEF: the country ruled by an emir, or his position
someone who is sent with an official message or to do official work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Japan is sending two emissaries to Washington to discuss trade issues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日本将派两位特使去华盛顿商讨贸易问题。

Sense.DEF: a gas or other substance that is sent into the air
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain agreed to cut emissions of nitrogen oxide from power stations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国同意减少发电站氮氧化物的排放量。

Sense.DEF: the act of sending out light, heat, gas etc
official permission to produce a particular amount of a substance that can harm the environment, which is given to a company by a government or organization or bought by a company
Sense.TRAN: 〔有害物质的〕排放配额〔由政府﹑机构发放给企业或由企业购买〕

Sense.DEF: the practice of buying or selling emission credits
Sense.TRAN: 排放交易〔有害物质的排放配额的买卖〕

Sense.DEF: to send out gas, heat, light, sound etc
Sense.TRAN: 散发﹐发出〔气﹑热﹑光﹑声音等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kettle emitted a shrill whistle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水壶发出了刺耳的鸣笛声。

Sense.DEF: a US prize given each year for special achievements in television. There are Emmys for actors, writers, directors etc, and the prize is a small statue.
Sense.TRAN: 艾美奖〔美国电视界一年一度颁发给演员﹑编剧﹑导演等的奖项〕

Sense.DEF: a type of punk music whose song lyricswords are full of emotion
Sense.TRAN: 情绪摇滚〔一种朋克摇滚乐〕

Sense.DEF: making something, especially your skin, softer and smoother
Sense.EXAMPLE: Almond oil is renowned for its soothing, emollient properties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杏仁油以其舒缓和滋润功效闻名。

Sense.DEF: making someone feel calmer when they have been angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: an emollient reply
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安抚的回答

Sense.DEF: money or another form of payment for work you have done
to clearly show emotion, especially when you are acting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Siskind encourages the children to emote to the music as they dance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西斯金德鼓励孩子们跳舞时要根据音乐表现出情感。

Sense.DEF: a special sign that is used to show an emotion in email and on the Internet, often by making a picture. For example, the emoticon :-) looks like a smiling face and means that you have made a joke.
Sense.TRAN: 〔在电子邮件和因特网上使用的〕表情符号

Sense.DEF: a strong human feeling such as love, hate, or anger
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her voice was full of emotion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的声音充满了激情。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sara listened with mixed emotions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉听着﹐百感交集。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She was good at hiding her emotions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很会掩饰自己的情感。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kim received the news without showing any visible sign of emotion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金接到消息时丝毫不露声色。

Sense.DEF: relating to your feelings or how you control them
Sense.EXAMPLE: She provided emotional support at a very distressing time for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我非常痛苦的时候﹐她是我的情感支柱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ann suffered from depression and a number of other emotional problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安患了抑郁症﹐还遇到一些其他的情绪问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the physical and emotional state of the patient
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 患者的生理和情绪状态

Sense.DEF: making people have strong feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: Abortion is a very emotional issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 堕胎是个非常敏感的话题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The funeral was a very emotional experience for all of us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次葬礼对我们大家来说都是一次无比伤感的经历。

Sense.DEF: having strong feelings and showing them to other people, especially by crying

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He became very emotional when we had to leave.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当我们不得不离开时﹐他非常伤感。

Sense.DEF: influenced by what you feel, rather than what you know
Sense.EXAMPLE: an emotional response to the problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对该问题的感性反应

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Nursing is an emotionally and physically demanding job.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 护理是一项对体力和感情都要求很高的工作。

Sense.DEF: a tendency to show or feel too much emotion
making people have strong feelings

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Child abuse is an emotive subject.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 虐待儿童是一个容易引起大家强烈愤慨的话题。

Sense.DEF: to choose the members of a jury in a court of law
to be able to understand someone else’s feelings, problems etc, especially because you have had similar experiences

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My mother died last year so I can really empathize with what he’s going through.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲去年过世了﹐所以我非常理解他的感受。

Sense.DEF: the ability to understand other people’s feelings and problems

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had great empathy with people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对人充满同情之心。

Sense.DEF: the man who is the ruler of an empire

this expression is often used to describe a situation in which people are afraid to criticize something because everyone else seems to think it is good or important. It is the title of a fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen about an emperor who pays a lot of money for some new magic clothes which can only be seen by wise people. The clothes do not really exist, but the emperor does not admit he cannot see them, because he does not want to seem stupid.
Sense.TRAN: 皇帝的新衣〔出自一则安徒生童话﹐常喻指因他人赞美或重视某事物而不敢对其提出批评〕

Sense.DEF: special attention or importance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In Japan there is a lot of emphasis on politeness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在日本人们非常注重礼节。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The course places emphasis on practical work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课程重视实践。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a change of emphasis in government policy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府政策重心的变化

Sense.DEF: special importance that is given to a word or phrase by saying it louder or higher, or by printing it in a special way
Sense.TRAN: 〔单词或短语的〕重读﹐重音﹔强调

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The emphasis should be on the first syllable.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 重音应落在第一个音节。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘And I can assure you,’ she said with emphasis, ‘that he is innocent.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我可以向你保证﹐”她加重语气说道﹐“他是无辜的。

Sense.DEF: to say something in a strong way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report emphasizes the importance of improving safety standards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告强调了改进安全标准的重要性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Logan made a speech emphasizing the need for more volunteers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗根发表演讲﹐强调需要更多的志愿者。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Prime Minister emphasized that there are no plans to raise taxes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相强调并无增税计划。

Sense.DEF: to say a word or phrase louder or higher than others to give it more importance
to make something more noticeable
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dress emphasized the shape of her body.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条连衣裙凸显了她的体形。

Exponent.DEF: to say strongly or show clearly that a fact, idea etc is especially important
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Our company emphasizes the need for good communication between staff.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我公司强调员工间良好沟通的必要性。

Exponent.DEF: to emphasize something when you are talking about a subject
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Most schools stress the importance of parental involvement in their child’s learning.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数学校强调家长参与对孩子学习的重要性。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He stressed the need for parents to listen to their children.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他着重指出﹐家长需要倾听孩子的心声。

Exponent.DEF: to show that something is important, so that people will pay special attention to it
Exponent.TRAN: 使突出﹐使注意力集中于
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This case highlights the need for tougher laws on gun ownership.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这宗案件突显出有必要对私人持枪制定更为严厉的法律。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The report highlights the decline in the numbers of native plants and insects.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告强调当地植物及昆虫的数量有所减少。

Exponent.DEF: to help to show clearly that a fact is true, especially a fact that is already known
Exponent.TRAN: 强调〔尤指已知事实〕﹐使突出
Exponent.EXAMPLE: These attacks underline the fact that the security situation here remains fragile.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些袭击案突显出这里的治安依然薄弱。

Exponent.DEF: to show something clearly and make it easier to notice
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The recent economic crisis has accentuated the gap between the rich and the poor.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的经济危机使贫富差距尤显突出。

Exponent.DEF: to emphasize something too much
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The relation between food and health is often overemphasized in my view.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我看来﹐食品与健康之间的关系被过分强调了。

Exponent.DEF: to emphasize something and make it seem more important than it really is, especially to get advantages for yourself
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The story has been played up by the media.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 此事被媒体大肆宣传。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Labour party had a great time playing up the Conservatives’ problems.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党抓住保守党的问题大做文章。

Sense.DEF: expressing an opinion, idea etc in a clear, strong way to show its importance
Sense.EXAMPLE: an emphatic denial
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 断然否认

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Wilde was emphatic that the event should go ahead.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 怀尔德强调活动应该继续进行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was pretty emphatic about me leaving.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坚决要我离开。

Sense.DEF: a win etc in which one team or player wins by a large amount
a serious disease that affects the lungs, making it difficult to breathe
a group of countries that are all controlled by one ruler or government
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Roman empire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗马帝国

Sense.DEF: a group of organizations controlled by one person
Sense.EXAMPLE: a business empire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大型企业集团

Sense.DEF: attempts to get more power within the organization you work for
based on scientific testing or practical experience, not on ideas
Sense.TRAN: 以实验[经验]为依据的﹔经验主义的
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实验证据

Sense.DEF: the belief in basing your ideas on practical experience
a place where a large gun is put and fired
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gun emplacement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炮台

Sense.DEF: to pay someone to work for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: The factory employs over 2,000 people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家工厂雇用了2,000多名员工。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kelly is employed as a mechanic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯利受雇当技工。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have been employed to look at ways of reducing waste.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们受雇研究减少浪费的方法。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say give someone a job rather than employ someone, and have a job rather than be employed .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说give someone a job不说employ someone ﹔ 说have a job﹐不说be employed
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They gave him a job delivering furniture.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们给了他一份送家具的工作。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He has a job at the factory.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在工厂工作。

Sense.DEF: to use a particular object, method, skill etc in order to achieve something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The report examines teaching methods employed in the classroom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个报告探讨了课堂教学方法。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say use a method rather than employ a method.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说use a method﹐不说employ a method。

Sense.DEF: to spend your time doing a particular thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her days are employed in gardening and voluntary work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的时间都花在搞园艺和做义工上。

Sense.DEF: working for someone
Sense.TRAN: 受雇于某人﹐为某人工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a number of servants in his employ.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他雇了几个仆人替他干活。

Sense.DEF: having skills or qualities that are necessary to get a job
Sense.TRAN: 具备受雇条件的﹐适合雇用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The training scheme aims to make people more employable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项培训计划旨在使人们更具备就业条件。

Sense.DEF: someone who is paid to work for someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: a government employee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府雇员

Sense.DEF: a person, company, or organization that employs people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shoe factory is the largest employer in this area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家制鞋厂是本地区最大的雇主。

Sense.DEF: the condition of having a paid job
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was offered employment in the sales office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她获聘在销售部工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: terms and conditions of employment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇用条款和条件

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The employment prospects for science graduates are excellent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 理科毕业生的就业前景非常好。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Steve’s still looking for full-time employment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫还在寻找全职工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the needs of women who combine paid employment and care for their families
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兼顾有薪工作和照料家庭的女性的需要

GramExa.EXAMPLE: 21.7% of all those in employment were in part-time jobs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有在业人员中有21.7%的人从事兼职工作。

Sense.DEF: the act of paying someone to work for you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mexican law prohibits the employment of children under 14.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 墨西哥的法律禁止雇用不足14岁的儿童。

Sense.DEF: the number of people who have jobs
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nationwide employment now stands at 95%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前全国就业率为95%。

GramExa.GLOSS: a situation in which everyone has a job
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many economists consider full employment an unrealistic goal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多经济学家认为全面就业是不现实的目标。

Sense.DEF: the use of a particular object, method, skill etc to achieve something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Was the employment of force justified?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用武力是正当的吗？

Sense.DEF: a business that makes money by finding jobs for people
a large shop
to give someone more control over their own life or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Voting Rights Act was needed to empower minority groups.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《选举权法案》对于赋予少数民族自主权是必不可少的。

Sense.DEF: to give a person or organization the legal right to do something
Sense.TRAN: 授权〔某人或某组织做某事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The President is empowered to appoint judges to the Supreme Court.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统有权任命最高法院的法官。

Sense.DEF: a female ruler of an empire, or the wife of an emperor
bottles or glasses that are empty
Sense.EXAMPLE: The barman collected the empties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒吧男招待把空瓶子收走了。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of great sadness and loneliness
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt an emptiness in her heart when he left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走后她心里感到空虚。

Sense.DEF: when there is nothing or nobody in a place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the silence and emptiness of the desert
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙漠的寂静和空旷

Sense.DEF: having nothing inside
Sense.EXAMPLE: an empty box
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空盒子
Sense.EXAMPLE: an empty bottle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空瓶子
Sense.EXAMPLE: an empty space behind the desk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 书桌后面的空位
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fuel tank’s almost empty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 燃油箱快要空了。

Sense.DEF: an empty place does not have any people in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate coming home to an empty house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我讨厌回家时屋子里空荡荡的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hall was half-empty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大厅有一半是空的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The streets were empty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大街上空无一人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building stood empty for several years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这大楼有好几年没人住了。

Sense.DEF: not being used by anyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spotted an empty table in the corner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现角落里有一张空桌子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He put his feet on an empty chair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把双脚搁在空椅子上。

Sense.DEF: unhappy because nothing in your life seems interesting or important
Sense.EXAMPLE: The divorce left him feeling empty and bitter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离婚使他感到空虚和痛苦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her life felt empty and meaningless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到生活既空虚又无聊。

Sense.DEF: not containing a particular type of thing, or not having a particular quality
Sense.TRAN: 没有某事物﹔缺乏某种特性
Sense.EXAMPLE: The beach was almost empty of people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海滩上几乎没人了。

Sense.DEF: words etc that are not sincere, or have no effect
Sense.TRAN: 空话/做样子/空头许诺等
Sense.EXAMPLE: His repeated promises to pay them back were just empty words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一再答应还钱给他们﹐但只是说空话而已。

Sense.LEXUNIT: do sth on an empty stomach
Sense.DEF: to do something without having eaten any food first
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t work properly on an empty stomach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我饿着肚子就做不好事情。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which parents become sad because their children have grown up and moved out of their house
Sense.TRAN: 空巢(综合征)〔指父母因子女长大离家而难过〕

Sense.DEF: a politician or manager who does not achieve much or does not have much ability
Sense.TRAN: 政绩平平的从政者﹔能力不强的管理者

Sense.DEF: to continue doing something even though you no longer have supplies of something you need in order to do it properly
Sense.TRAN: 没有了供给[储备]仍在运转
Sense.EXAMPLE: With the country running on empty, the president has no hope of winning the election.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国家已在空转﹐总统没有希望赢得竞选。

Section.SECHEADING: WITH NOTHING IN IT OR ON IT 里面或上面没有东西

Exponent.DEF: used about something that has nothing inside
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an empty can of hair spray
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 空的喷发胶罐
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The fridge is almost empty.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰箱里几乎什么都没有。

Exponent.DEF: used about a computer screen or a piece of paper that has no writing or pictures on it, or a CD, DVD etc with nothing recorded on it
Exponent.TRAN: 〔计算机屏幕﹑纸张﹑唱片等〕空白的﹐无内容的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a blank sheet of paper
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张白纸
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He stared at the blank screen for a few minutes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他盯着空白屏幕看了好几分钟。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a blank tape
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 空白磁带

Exponent.DEF: used about a room or cupboard that has very little in it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His room was bare except for a bed and a wardrobe.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他房间里除了一张床和一个衣橱﹐几乎空空如也。

Exponent.DEF: used about something that has an empty space inside
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a hollow tree
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 空心树
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The suitcase had a hollow bottom.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 手提箱底部是空心的。

Exponent.DEF: used about a place that has no one in it or no one using it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There were no lights on and the house looked empty.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋子里没开灯﹐似乎没有人在。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the empty streets
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 空荡荡的街道

Exponent.DEF: used about a seat, space, or room that is available to use because no one else is using it
Exponent.TRAN: 〔座位﹑地方或房间〕不在使用的﹐空着的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Is this seat free?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个座位没人吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There are never any parking spaces free at this time of day.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 每天这个时间从没有空的停车位。

Exponent.DEF: used about a room or building that is available for people to pay to use
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a vacant apartment
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 空着的公寓
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The next guesthouse we tried had a couple of rooms vacant.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们接下来找的那家家庭旅馆有几间空房。

Exponent.DEF: used about a place that is quiet because there is no one there, or because the people who used to be there have left
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a deserted village
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 荒弃的村庄
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was three o’clock in the morning and the streets were deserted.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 凌晨3点﹐街上空寂无人。

Exponent.DEF: used about a place that has no people living in it, especially permanently
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an uninhabited island
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 荒岛

Exponent.DEF: used about a house, room, or office that no one is living in or using at the moment
Exponent.TRAN: 〔房子﹑房间或办公室〕未被占用的﹐空着的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: unoccupied buildings
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 空置的大楼
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Burglaries frequently happen when people are on holiday and their house is unoccupied.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 主人外出度假﹑房屋空着的时候﹐经常会发生入室盗窃。

Sense.DEF: to remove everything that is inside something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you empty the dishwasher?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把洗碗机腾空了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Elinor emptied the contents of the envelope onto the table.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃莉诺把信封里的东西全倒在桌子上。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He emptied out the ashtray.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他倒空了烟灰缸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ruth emptied her glass drank all the liquid left in it in one gulp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露丝将玻璃杯里的东西一饮而尽。

Sense.DEF: if a place empties, everyone leaves it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stores were closing, and the streets began to empty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 商铺陆续关门﹐街道开始变得空荡荡的。

Sense.DEF: if a river empties into a larger area of water, it flows into it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Mississippi River empties into the Gulf of Mexico.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 密西西比河汇入墨西哥湾。

Sense.DEF: without getting what you hoped or expected to get

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I spent all morning looking for a suitable present, but came home empty-handed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我整个上午都在寻找一件合适的礼物﹐但最后还是空着手回家了。

Sense.DEF: silly and not intelligent
a large Australian bird that can run very fast but cannot fly
Sense.TRAN: 鸸鹋〔产于澳大利亚的一种鸟﹐跑得很快却不会飞〕

Sense.DEF: to do something or behave in the same way as someone else, especially because you admire them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He hoped to emulate the success of Wilder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他希望效仿怀尔德的成功。

Sense.DEF: a substance that is added, especially to food, to prevent liquids and solids from separating
to combine to become a smooth mixture, or to make two liquids do this
a mixture of liquids that do not completely combine, such as oil and water
the substance on the surface of photographic film or paper that makes it react to light
a type of paint used inside buildings on walls or ceilings that is not shiny when it dries
to make someone or something be in a particular state or have a particular quality
Sense.TRAN: 使处于某种状态﹔使具有某种特性
Sense.EXAMPLE: enlarge make something bigger
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扩大
Sense.EXAMPLE: endanger put someone in danger
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使处于险境

Sense.DEF: to go completely around something, or include all of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: encircle surround everything
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 围绕﹐环绕

Sense.DEF: made of a particular material or substance
Sense.EXAMPLE: a golden crown
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金冠
Sense.EXAMPLE: wooden seats
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木椅

Sense.DEF: to make something have a particular quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: darken make or become dark
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: (使)变黑
Sense.EXAMPLE: strengthen make or become stronger
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: (使)增强

Sense.DEF: to make it possible for someone to do something, or for something to happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The loan enabled Jan to buy the house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贷款使简有能力买下这房子。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are plans to enlarge the runway to enable jumbo jets to land.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有计划扩建飞机跑道﹐让大型客机可以降落。

Sense.DEF: a computer program that is Internet-enabled, Java-enabled etc can be used with that program or includes it as one of its features
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机程序〕能使用因特网/Java语言等的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Find out more about our free Internet-enabled software.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请了解更多有关我们的免费因特网软件的信息。

Sense.DEF: an enabling law is one that makes something possible or gives someone special legal powers
to act in a play, story etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a drama enacted on a darkened stage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在灯光暗淡的舞台上演的戏剧

Sense.DEF: to make a proposal into a law
Sense.EXAMPLE: Congress refused to enact the bill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会拒绝通过该法案。

Sense.DEF: a hard shiny substance that is put onto metal, clay etc for decoration or protection
the hard smooth outer surface of your teeth
a type of paint that produces a shiny surface when it is dry
to cover or decorate with enamel
liking something very much

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You don’t seem very enamoured with your job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你好像不太喜欢你的工作。

Sense.DEF: in love with someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was greatly enamoured of Elizabeth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对伊丽莎白十分倾心。

Sense.DEF: all together as a single unit, rather than separately
Sense.EXAMPLE: You cannot dismiss these stories en bloc.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能把这些说法一股脑儿全给否定了。

Sense.DEF: to make a camp or put people, especially soldiers, in a camp
Sense.EXAMPLE: The army was encamped near Damascus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队在大马士革附近安营。

Sense.DEF: a large temporary camp, especially of soldiers
Sense.EXAMPLE: a military encampment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军营

Sense.DEF: to express or show something in a short way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The words of the song neatly encapsulate the mood of the country at that time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这首歌的歌词言简意赅地表现出国家当时的氛围。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her whole philosophy can be encapsulated in this one sentence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她全部的人生哲学可以用这样一句话来概括。

Sense.DEF: to completely cover something with something else, especially in order to prevent a substance getting out

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The leaking fuel rods will be encapsulated in lead.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 泄漏的燃料棒要用铅来密封。

Sense.DEF: to cover or surround something completely

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His broken leg was encased in plaster.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他骨折的腿上打着石膏。

Sense.DEF: another form of the suffix -ance
Sense.EXAMPLE: existence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 存在
Sense.EXAMPLE: occurrence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发生

Sense.DEF: swelling of the brain
if something that you see or hear enchants you, you like it very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was enchanted by the way she smiled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她微笑时的样子让我着迷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The garden enchanted her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花园使她陶醉其中。

Sense.DEF: to use magic on something or someone
someone who is enchanted with someone or something likes them very much

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was enchanted with the flowers you sent her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你送的花让她欣喜不已。

Sense.DEF: an enchanted object or place has been changed by magic so that it has special powers
Sense.EXAMPLE: an enchanted castle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被施了魔法的城堡

Sense.DEF: someone who uses magic on people and things
very pleasant or attractive
Sense.TRAN: 令人愉悦的﹔令人陶醉的﹔迷人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an enchanting place
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迷人的地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: an enchanting story
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人陶醉的故事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The child looked enchanting in a pale blue dress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个孩子穿着浅蓝色连衣裙﹐十分可爱。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being very pleasant or attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: the enchantment of poetry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诗歌的魅力

Sense.DEF: a change caused by magic, or the state of being changed by magic
a woman who uses magic on people and things
a woman who men think is very attractive and interesting
a Mexican food consisting of a tortillaflat piece of bread that is rolled up and filled with meat or cheese, and covered with a spicy sauce
something that is the most important or biggest of its type
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re aiming our products at the big enchilada – the home computer market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正把我们的产品瞄准最大的市场——家用电脑市场。

Sense.DEF: all of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on. Let’s hear it – the whole enchilada.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来﹐让我们听一听整个事情的经过。

Sense.DEF: to surround someone or something completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: The island was encircled by a dusty road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座岛屿为一条尘土飞扬的公路所环绕。

Sense.DEF: a small area that is within a larger area where people of a different kind or nationality live
Sense.TRAN: 飞地〔较大区域内的一小块不同民族或人群的聚居地〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the former Portuguese enclave of East Timor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 东帝汶的前葡萄牙人聚居地

Sense.DEF: to put something inside an envelope as well as a letter
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please enclose a cheque with your order.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请随订单附上支票。

GramExa.GLOSS: used in business letters to say that you are sending something with a letter
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Please find enclosed an agenda for the meeting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 兹附上会议议程表。

Sense.DEF: to surround something, especially with a fence or wall, in order to make it separate
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用篱笆或围墙〕将⋯围起来
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pool area is enclosed by a six-foot wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游泳区用六英尺高的高墙围了起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an enclosed area
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有围墙的区域

Sense.DEF: an area surrounded by a wall or fence, and used for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: the bear enclosure at the zoo
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动物园中的熊园

Sense.DEF: the act of making an area separate by putting a wall or fence around it
Sense.EXAMPLE: the enclosure of arable land for pasture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将耕地圈起来用作牧场

Sense.DEF: something that is put inside an envelope with a letter
to put a message or other information into code
the expression of a lot of praise
to include a wide range of ideas, subjects, etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The study encompasses the social, political, and economic aspects of the situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项研究涵盖了这一局势的社会﹑政治和经济三方面。

Sense.DEF: to completely cover or surround something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The houses encompassed about 100 square metres.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些房屋占地约100平方米。

Sense.DEF: an additional or repeated part of a performance, especially a musical one
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band came back onstage for an encore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队回到台上加演了一曲。

Sense.DEF: said when you have enjoyed a musical performance very much and want the performer to sing or play more
to experience something, especially problems or opposition
Sense.TRAN: 遇到﹐遭遇〔尤指问题或反对〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They encountered serious problems when two members of the expedition were injured.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 远征队遇到了严重的问题﹐两名队员受伤。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government has encountered strong opposition to its plans to raise income tax.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府欲提高所得税的方案遭到了强烈反对。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor had encountered several similar cases in the past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位医生过去曾碰到过好几个类似病例。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say come across problems/difficulties rather than encounter problems/difficulties and come up against opposition/resistance rather than encounter opposition/resistance .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说come across problems/difficulties﹐而不说encounter problems/difficulties ﹔ 一般说come up against opposition/resistance﹐而不说encounter opposition/resistance
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Did you come across any problems?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你遇到过什么问题吗？
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We came up against quite a lot of opposition from local people.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们遭到了当地人的极大反对。

Sense.DEF: to meet someone without planning to
Sense.EXAMPLE: I first encountered him when studying at Cambridge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我第一次遇到他是在剑桥读书时。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you meet someone, or do something with someone you do not know
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t remember our encounter last summer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不记得我和她去年夏天那次邂逅了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His first encounter with Wilson was back in 1989.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他第一次遇到威尔逊是在1989年。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Bernstein began training the young musician after a chance encounter at a concert a meeting that happened by chance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一次音乐会上偶然相遇之后﹐伯恩斯坦便开始培养这位年轻的音乐家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: casual sexual encounters occasions when people have sex
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偶然发生的性关系

GramExa.EXAMPLE: hostile encounters between supporters of rival football teams
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 互为对手的足球队球迷之间的冲突

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you meet or experience something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a child’s first encounter with books
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子第一次接触书本
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a close encounter with a snake a frightening situation in which you get too close to something
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 险遇一条蛇

Sense.DEF: to give someone the courage or confidence to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want to thank everyone who has encouraged and supported me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要感谢每一位鼓励和支持过我的人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cooder was encouraged to begin playing the guitar by his father.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 库德在他父亲的鼓励下开始弹吉他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fleur encouraged Dana in her ambition to become a model.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗勒尔对达娜当模特的抱负给予了鼓励。

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cantor didn’t mind if they worked late; in fact, he actively encouraged it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坎托并不介意他们工作到很晚﹔事实上﹐他积极鼓励他们这样做。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A 10p rise in cigarette prices is not enough to encourage smokers to stop.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 香烟价格上涨十便士并不足以促使吸烟者戒烟。

Sense.DEF: to make something more likely to exist, happen, or develop
Sense.EXAMPLE: Violent TV programmes encourage anti-social behaviour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力的电视节目助长反社会行为。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She felt encouraged by the many letters of support.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么多支持信使她很受鼓舞。

Sense.DEF: when you encourage someone or something, or the things that encourage them
Sense.TRAN: 鼓励﹐鼓舞﹔起激励作用的事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: With encouragement, Sally is starting to play with the other children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨莉受到了鼓励﹐开始和其他孩子玩起来。
鼓励的话

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She needed no encouragement to continue did not need any encouragement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不需要鼓励也会继续做下去。

Sense.DEF: giving you hope and confidence
Sense.TRAN: 令人鼓舞的﹐振奋人心的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The encouraging news is that typhoid is on the decrease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人鼓舞的消息是伤寒发病率在下降。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The signs are encouraging – but there’s a long way to go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些迹象令人振奋﹐但是还有很长的路要走。

Sense.DEF: to gradually take more of someone’s time, possessions, rights etc than you should

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bureaucratic power has encroached upon the freedom of the individual.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 官僚权力已经侵犯了个人的自由。

Sense.DEF: to gradually cover more and more land

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fighting encroached further east.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战斗进一步向东推进。

Sense.DEF: covered with a hard layer of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a gold crown encrusted with diamonds
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一顶镶满钻石的金皇冠

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 沾满泥土的/镶满珠宝的等

Sense.DEF: to protect information by putting it into a special code that only some people can read, especially information that is on a computer
Sense.TRAN: 把〔尤指计算机中的资料〕加密

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 用加密形式储存的文件

Sense.DEF: to make it difficult for you to do something or for something to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: He died in 1874, heavily encumbered by debt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他于1874年去世﹐负债累累。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole process was encumbered with bureaucracy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个进程受到官僚主义的阻碍。

Sense.DEF: a letter sent by the Pope to all Roman Catholic bishops
a book or cd, or a set of these, containing facts about many different subjects, or containing detailed facts about one subject
Sense.TRAN: 百科全书﹔〔某一学科的〕专科全书﹐大全
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Encyclopedia of Music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐百科全书

Sense.DEF: having a lot of knowledge or information about a particular subject
Sense.TRAN: 百科全书式的﹐知识渊博的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an encyclopedic knowledge of medieval literature
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 广博的中世纪文学知识

Sense.DEF: the last part of a period of time, event, activity, or story

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Costs are expected to double by the end of 2017.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 预计到2017年底成本将翻倍。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What would she find at the end of her journey?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在旅程结束时会有些什么发现？

Sense.EXAMPLE: Hooker’s death marked the end of an era.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胡克的逝世标志着一个时代的终结。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I played the tape from beginning to end.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把磁带从头到尾播放了一遍。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which something is finished or no longer exists

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s hoped the talks may bring an end to the violence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望会谈可以结束暴力。

GramExa.PROPFORM: call for/demand an end to sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The EU is demanding an end to the ivory trade.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧盟要求停止象牙贸易。

Sense.EXAMPLE: At last it seemed the war might be coming to an end.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 终于战争似乎即将结束。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The spacecraft is nearing the end of its useful life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该航天器的使用寿命快要终结。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He rose to indicate that the conversation was at an end.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站起身﹐示意谈话结束。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, I hope that’s the end of the matter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好啦﹐我希望事情就到此为止。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Another year has passed, with no end in sight to the suffering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 又过了一年﹐痛苦还是看不到尽头。

Sense.DEF: the part of a place or object that is furthest from its beginning or centre

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We sat at opposite ends of the table.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们分别坐在桌子两头。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He wore spectacles perched on the very end of his nose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的眼镜架在鼻尖上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The end of the pencil snapped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铅笔的笔尖啪的一声断了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jo joined the end of the line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔排到了队尾。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the far endfurthest from you of the room
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间的另一头
Sense.EXAMPLE: The channel measures 20 feet from end to end.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条管道全长为20英尺。

GramExa.GLOSS: in an upright position
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He stood the box on end to open it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把箱子竖起来好打开。

GramExa.GLOSS: in a line, with the ends touching
GramExa.EXAMPLE: bricks laid end to end
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 首尾连接铺成一行的砖头

Sense.DEF: one of the two points that begin or end a scale

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the cheaper end of the price range
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格范围内的最低点

Sense.EXAMPLE: At the opposite end of the political spectrum are the Marxist theories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在政治领域与之截然相反的是马克思主义理论。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some teenagers are just a nuisance, but at the other end of the scale there are kids who pose a real threat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些少年只不过是讨人嫌﹐而有些孩子则相反﹐他们根本就是个威胁。

Sense.DEF: one of two places that are connected by a telephone call, journey etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sometimes, all you need is a calm voice on the end of the phone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候你只需要电话另一端有一个平静的声音和你说说话。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll get a bus connection at the other end.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到了那边终点站会转乘公共汽车的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any problems at your end where you are?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你那边有什么问题吗？

Sense.DEF: a small piece of something that is left after you have finished with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: cigarette ends
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟蒂

Sense.DEF: an aim or purpose, or the result you hope to achieve

GramExa.EXAMPLE: 40% of all research is undertaken for military ends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在进行的所有研究项目中﹐40%用于军事目的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She’ll do anything to achieve her own ends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为了实现自己的目标﹐什么都会去做。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every task has a clear end in view.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每一项任务都要有明确的目标。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He wants to cut costs, and to that end is looking at ways of cutting the company’s operations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想降低成本﹐并在为此设法削减公司的经营项目。

GramExa.GLOSS: something you do because you want to, not in order to get other advantages
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 自发想做的事情﹐本身就是目的
GramExa.EXAMPLE: IT is a tool for learning, not merely an end in itself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 信息技术本身不是目的﹐而是一种学习工具。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that doing bad things is acceptable if they achieve an important result
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 只要能达到目的﹐可以不择手段

Sense.DEF: part of a job, activity, or situation that involves or affects one person or group of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: She works in the sales end of things.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她做销售方面的工作。

Sense.DEF: one of the two halves of a sports field
a word meaning death – used to avoid saying this directly
Sense.TRAN: 生命的尽头 〔死亡的委婉说法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He met his end died in a car accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一次车祸中丧生。

Sense.LEXUNIT: at the end of the day
Sense.DEF: used to give your final opinion after considering all the possibilities
Sense.TRAN: 最终﹔到头来﹔不管怎么说
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the end of the day, it’s his decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管怎么说﹐这是他的决定。

Sense.DEF: for many days, weeks etc without stopping
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was tortured for days on end.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他连续好几天饱受煎熬。

Sense.DEF: after a period of time, or after everything has been done
Sense.EXAMPLE: What did you decide in the end?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最终你作了什么决定？

Sense.DEF: used to mean that you will not say any more about something, or that the situation cannot be changed
Sense.TRAN: 情况就是这样﹔就这么办〔用于表示不想再说某事﹐或情况无法改变〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not going – end of story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不去﹐就这样。

Sense.DEF: the point at which you are so angry and tired of a situation that you can no longer deal with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Frustrated and bitter, Hogan had reached the end of his tether with politics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍根遭受了挫折和痛苦﹐在政治上已经走到了穷途末路。

Sense.DEF: the end of a process, activity, or state
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our marriage had reached the end of the line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的婚姻走到了尽头。

Sense.DEF: to have only just enough money to buy the things you need
Sense.EXAMPLE: When Mike lost his job, we could barely make ends meet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克失业以后﹐我们几乎难以维持生计。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it’s not the end of the world
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that a problem is not as bad as they think
Sense.TRAN: 还未到世界末日〔用于告诉某人事情并不那么可怕〕

Sense.DEF: to stay brave and hopeful in a difficult situation
very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your letter cheered me up no end.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的来信让我非常高兴。

Sense.DEF: a lot of trouble etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: This will cause no end of trouble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这会引起无穷无尽的麻烦。

Sense.DEF: used as an expression of slight disapproval — often used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLE: What will she do next? She’s the living end!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她下一步要干什么？ 她这混蛋！

Sense.LEXUNIT: go to the ends of the earth
Sense.DEF: to do everything possible to achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d go to the ends of the earth to be with him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪怕走到天涯海角﹐我也要和他在一起。

Sense.DEF: forever

Crossrefto.REFLEX: burn the candle at both ends
jump/be thrown in at the deep end
go off at the deep end
make sb’s hair stand on end
be on/at the receiving end (of sth)
get the wrong end of the stick

Subsense.DEF: if an event, activity, or story ends, it stops happening
Subsense.EXAMPLE: World War II ended in 1945.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二次世界大战于1945年结束。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The festival will end with a spectacular laser show.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 节庆活动将以壮观的激光表演结束。

Subsense.DEF: to make something stop happening
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The talks are aimed at ending the conflict.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判旨在结束冲突。

Sense.DEF: to finish what you are doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think we’ll end there for today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看我们今天就到这儿吧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d like to end by inviting questions from the audience.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最后想请观众提问。

Sense.DEF: if a road, path, line etc ends, it reaches its final point
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is where the line ends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条线就到此为止。

Sense.DEF: to reach the final point in a period of time in a particular condition
Sense.TRAN: 〔以某种状态〕到〔一段时间〕的终点
Sense.EXAMPLE: They ended the game with a score of 63-42.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们以63比42结束了比赛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company ended the year with record profits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到年底时公司获得了创纪录的收益。

Sense.DEF: to spend the last part of your life in a particular place or doing a particular thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ended his days in prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在监狱里度过了余生。

Sense.DEF: to kill yourself
used to describe something that is the best, most important, or most exciting of its kind
Sense.TRAN: 最佳的…﹔最重要的…﹔最激动人心的…
Sense.EXAMPLE: the movie with the car chase to end all car chases
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有极其刺激的汽车追逐场面的影片

Sense.DEF: used to refer to the year etc that ends on a particular date
Sense.TRAN: 到某一天为止的那一年/那一周等
Sense.EXAMPLE: the financial results for the year ending 31 Dec 2008
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 截至2008年12月31日的年度财务报告

Exponent.DEF: if an event, activity, or story ends, it stops happening
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How does the story end?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 故事的结局是怎样的？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The school year ends in June.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 学年于6月结束。

Exponent.DEF: to end – use this about an organized event such as a meeting, party, or lesson, especially when saying what time it ends
Exponent.TRAN: 〔会议﹑聚会或课程等有组织的活动在某时间〕结束
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The meeting will finish at 5.30.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议将于5点半结束。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What time does your Spanish class finish?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的西班牙语课几点结束？

Exponent.DEF: if an event, activity, or period of time is over, it has ended
Exponent.TRAN: 〔事情﹑活动或一段时间〕完结﹐结束
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I can’t wait for our exams to be over.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我迫不及待地希望考试快点结束。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The long summer vacation was almost over.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 漫长的暑假就快结束了。

Exponent.DEF: to finally end – used about a period of time, a situation, or an activity that has continued for a long time
Exponent.TRAN: 〔持续很久的一段时间﹑某状况或活动〕结束﹐终止
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The war finally came to an end six years later.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 六年后战争终于结束。

Exponent.EXP: draw to an end/to a close
Exponent.DEF: written to end gradually over a period of time – used in written descriptions
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The problem remained as the century drew to an end.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 本世纪渐近尾声﹐这个问题依然存在。

Exponent.DEF: if time is up, you are not allowed any more time to do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t able to finish the test before the time was up.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没来得及做完测验题目﹐时间就到了。

Exponent.DEF: if time runs out, there is no more time available to do something, especially something important
Exponent.TRAN: 时间耗尽了〔尤指没时间做重要事情〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The desperate search for survivors continues, but time is running out.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不惜一切搜寻幸存者的工作仍在继续﹐但是时间所剩无几。

Exponent.DEF: if a ticket, bank card, legal document etc expires, the period of time during which you can use it has ended
Exponent.TRAN: 〔票﹑银行卡﹑法律文件等〕失效﹐到期
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid we can’t accept this credit card – it expired last week.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕我们不能接受这张信用卡——它上星期到期了。

Exponent.DEF: if something is at an end, it has ended
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We both knew that our marriage was at an end.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我俩都知道我们的婚姻走到了尽头。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The long wait was at an end.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 漫长的等待结束了。

Sense.DEF: to finish in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: One in three marriages ends in divorce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三分之一的婚姻以离婚告终。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something will have a bad result or not be successful
to be in a particular situation, state, or place after a series of events, especially when you did not plan it
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指经历一系列意外后〕最终处于﹐到头来
Sense.EXAMPLE: He came round for a coffee and we ended up having a meal together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是来喝咖啡的﹐到后来我们却一起吃了顿饭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wondered where the pictures would end up after the auction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想知道那些画拍卖后的最终去处。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most slimmers end up putting weight back on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数减肥的人最后又发胖了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anyone who swims in the river could end up with a nasty stomach upset.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在河里游泳的人可能会出现严重的肠胃不适。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He could end up as President.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没准儿哪天会当上总统。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to end up like my parents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可不想到最后和我父母一样。
