Sense.DEF: to put someone or something in danger of being hurt, damaged, or destroyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smoking during pregnancy endangers your baby’s life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孕期吸烟会危及胎儿生命。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The lizards are classed as an endangered species one that soon may no longer exist.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种蜥蜴被归为濒危物种。

Sense.DEF: to make someone popular and liked

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The emperor saw an opportunity to endear himself to the Athenians.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 皇帝看到一个能赢得雅典人民爱戴的机会。

Sense.DEF: making someone love or like you
Sense.TRAN: 惹人喜爱的﹐引人爱慕的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shyness is one of her most endearing qualities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 腼腆是她最可爱的特质之一。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an endearing smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迷人的微笑

Sense.DEF: actions or words that express your love for someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: nicknames and other terms of endearment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绰号和其他昵称

Sense.DEF: to try very hard

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We always endeavor to please our customers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们总是竭尽全力让顾客满意。

Sense.DEF: an attempt to do something new or difficult

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 科学的/创造性的等尝试

Sense.EXAMPLE: an outstanding example of human endeavor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类努力进取的突出例证

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They made every endeavour to find the two boys.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们竭尽全力寻找那两个男孩。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite our best endeavours, we couldn’t start the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们虽然尽了最大努力﹐但还是无法发动汽车。

Sense.DEF: an endemic disease or problem is always present in a particular place, or among a particular group of people
Sense.TRAN: 〔疾病或问题〕地方性的﹐某些人常有的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Violent crime is now endemic in parts of Chicago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芝加哥一些地区暴力犯罪成患。

Sense.DEF: the final stage of a war, disagreement etc when everyone is trying to gain an advantage for themselves
Sense.TRAN: 〔战争﹑争论等的〕结束阶段﹐尾声

Sense.DEF: the way that a story, film, activity etc finishes
Sense.TRAN: 〔故事﹑电影﹑活动等的〕结局﹐结尾

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a story with a happy ending
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 结局美满的故事

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Coffee is the perfect ending to a meal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 咖啡是餐后的最佳饮品。

Sense.DEF: when a process stops or is finished, or when you finish it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the first elections since the ending of the dictatorship
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 独裁统治结束后的首次选举

Sense.DEF: the last part of a word
Sense.EXAMPLE: Verbal nouns have the ending -ing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动名词以-ing结尾。

Sense.DEF: a vegetable with curly green leaves that you eat raw
a vegetable with long white bitter-tasting leaves that you eat raw or cooked
very large in amount, size, or number
Sense.TRAN: 无止境的﹔无数的﹔无限的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an endless stream of visitors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 川流不息的游客
Sense.EXAMPLE: The possibilities are endless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有无限的可能性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been in a lot of trouble – drugs, guns, blackmail – the list is endless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他麻烦太多了——毒品﹑枪支﹑敲诈——说都说不完。

Sense.DEF: something that is endless seems to continue forever
Sense.TRAN: 无休止的﹔无穷尽的﹔永久的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an endless round of boring meetings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一轮没完没了的无聊会议

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城市充满了无穷的魅力。

Sense.DEF: relating to the system in your body that produces hormones
Sense.EXAMPLE: the endocrine glands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内分泌腺

Sense.DEF: a chemical produced by your body that reduces pain and can make you feel happier
Sense.TRAN: 内啡肽〔一种体内生成的化学物质﹐能止痛并让人产生快感〕

Sense.DEF: to express formal support or approval for someone or something

GramExa.PROPFORM: endorse a proposal/an idea/a candidate etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Prime Minister is unlikely to endorse this view.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相不可能赞同这一观点。

Sense.DEF: if a famous person endorses a product or service, they say in an advertisement that they use and like it
Sense.TRAN: 〔名人在广告中〕宣传〔某一产品或服务〕

Sense.DEF: to sign your name on the back of a cheque to show that it is correct
if your driving licence is endorsed for a driving offence, an official record is made on it to show that you are guilty of the offence
Sense.TRAN: 在〔驾驶执照〕上记录违章事项

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the official endorsement of his candidacy
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他候选人资格的官方认可

Sense.DEF: an instrument used by doctors who are performing a medical operation on someone. It is a very small camera with a powerful lens, which is pushed into the body through a very small hole and sends pictures back to the doctor.
the medical examination of the inside of the body, using an endoscope
Sense.TRAN: 内镜检查术﹐内窥镜检查

Sense.DEF: to give a college, hospital etc a large sum of money that provides it with an income
to make someone or something have a particular quality, or to believe that they have it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her resistance to the Nationalists endowed her with legendary status.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对抗民族主义者的事迹使她享有盛名。

Sense.DEF: to naturally have a good feature or quality
Sense.TRAN: 天生具有〔某种好的特点或品质〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was endowed with good looks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她天生丽质。

Sense.DEF: to give someone something
a sum of money given to a college, hospital etc to provide it with an income, or the act of giving this money
Sense.TRAN: 捐赠的款项﹔捐款﹐资助(的行为)

Sense.DEF: a natural quality or ability that someone has
an insurance arrangement that pays you a sum of money after an agreed period of time
Sense.TRAN: 养老保险﹐定期人寿保险〔指保险公司应允在一段时间后支付一笔约定的钱款〕

Sense.DEF: something that is produced by a particular process or activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: a high-quality end product
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优质产品
Sense.EXAMPLE: the end product of years of practice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过多年实践的最终产品

Sense.DEF: the final result of a process or activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: If tasks are too challenging, the end result is that learners are discouraged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果作业太具挑战性﹐最终结果是学习者会灰心丧气。

Sense.DEF: if a bad situation is endurable, you can accept it, even though it is difficult or painful
the ability to continue doing something difficult or painful over a long period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was pushed beyond her powers of endurance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被逼得忍无可忍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The marathon is a test of endurance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马拉松赛跑是对耐力的考验。

GramExa.GLOSS: designed to test or improve your endurance

Sense.DEF: to be in a difficult or painful situation for a long time without complaining
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seemed impossible that anyone could endure such pain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 似乎谁都不可能忍受这样的疼痛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He can’t endure being apart from me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不能忍受和我分开。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say stand rather than endure .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说stand﹐而不说 endure
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t stand the pain.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我痛得受不了了。

Sense.DEF: to remain alive or continue to exist for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: friendships which endure over many years
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保持多年的友谊

Sense.DEF: continuing for a very long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: the enduring appeal of Shakespeare’s plays
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莎士比亚戏剧经久不衰的感染力
Sense.EXAMPLE: enduring hatred
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宿仇

Sense.DEF: the person who uses a particular product, rather than the people who make or develop it
one of the areas at each end of an American football field where you carry or catch the ball to score
a liquid that is put into someone’s rectumto make their bowels empty
someone who hates you and wants to harm you
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a dangerous enemy to have.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与她为敌很危险。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cats and dogs have always been natural enemies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫和狗向来是天敌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an old enemy of her father
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父亲的一个宿敌

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a ruthless businessman who made a lot of enemies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个树敌众多的无情商人

Sense.EXAMPLE: the unforgettable sight of the president shaking hands with his sworn enemy an enemy you will always hate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 董事长与其死敌握手的难忘情景

GramExa.GLOSS: the person they hate most

Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t wishthis on my worst enemy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使是我的死对头﹐我也不愿看到他发生这样的事情。

Sense.DEF: someone who opposes or competes against you
Sense.EXAMPLE: political enemies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政敌
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was imprisoned for being ‘an enemy of the revolution’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他作为“革命的敌人”被监禁了。

Sense.DEF: the country against which your country is fighting in a war
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was accused of collaboration with the enemy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被控通敌。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a town behind enemy lines
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在敌后的城镇

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: In British English, you can use either a singular verb or a plural verb after the enemy .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在英国英语中﹐the enemy后既可用单数动词﹐也可用复数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The enemy has ( OR have ) suffered a major defeat.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 敌军遭到惨败。

Sense.DEF: something that people think is harmful or damaging
Sense.EXAMPLE: The usual enemies, cigarettes and alcohol, are targeted for tax rises.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 常见危害物﹐如香烟和酒类﹐将成为增税的对象。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The common enemy that united them was poverty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把他们团结起来的共同敌人是贫穷。

Sense.DEF: to behave in a way that causes problems for yourself
someone famous who has done something bad and who a lot of people do not like
Sense.EXAMPLE: His views made him public enemy number one in the eyes of the media.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的观点使他成为媒体眼中的头号公敌。

Sense.DEF: people in a society etc that other people think are trying to secretly destroy or damage it
Sense.TRAN: 〔试图在暗地里搞破坏活动的〕内部敌人﹐内奸
Sense.EXAMPLE: efforts to label environmentalists as the enemy within
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想给环境保护论者贴上“内奸”标签的行为

Sense.DEF: if one thing is the enemy of another, the second thing cannot exist because the first thing destroys it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Boredom is the enemy of learning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厌倦情绪是学习的大敌。

Sense.DEF: having or needing a lot of energy or determination
Sense.TRAN: 精力充沛的﹐充满活力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an energetic man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精力旺盛的男子
Sense.EXAMPLE: an energetic drive to get more customers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 争取更多客户的十足干劲

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We need to be more energetic in promoting ourselves abroad.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要更积极地向国外宣传自己。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他积极与种族隔离作斗争。

Exponent.DEF: having a lot of energy
Exponent.TRAN: 精力充沛的﹐充满活力的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If you’re feeling energetic, we could go out for a run.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是觉得有精力﹐我们可以出去跑步。

Exponent.DEF: energetic and ready to work hard or do a lot of things
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I admire her because she’s so full of energy and enthusiasm.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我欣赏她﹐因为她活力四射﹑充满热情。

Exponent.DEF: very energetic and always wanting to do new things
Exponent.TRAN: 精力充沛的﹔有创新思想的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What this country needs is a dynamic new leader.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家需要的是一位有活力且勇于创新的新领袖。

Exponent.DEF: having more energy than is normal or good, because you cannot keep still or quiet for very long – used especially about children
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指儿童〕过分活跃的﹐多动的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Our youngest daughter was hyperactive, and it had a damaging effect on the whole family.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的小女儿太好动了﹐全家人都不得安宁。

Exponent.DEF: working with a lot of energy in a determined way, especially to achieve a particular thing
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指为做成某事〕不知疲倦的﹐孜孜不倦的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was a tireless campaigner against apartheid in South Africa.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坚持不懈地投身于南非反种族隔离运动。

Exponent.DEF: feeling energetic and happy and showing this in the way you behave
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s one of those people who leap out of bed full of beans every morning.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是那种每天早晨都精神百倍地跳下床的人。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel more determined and energetic
Sense.TRAN: 使增强决心﹔使充满活力
Sense.EXAMPLE: The charity hopes the campaign will energise its volunteers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该慈善机构希望此活动会激起志愿者的参与热情。

Sense.DEF: to make a machine work
power that is used to provide heat, operate machines etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The water is heated using energy from the sun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水是利用太阳能加热的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The problem with nuclear energy is dealing with the waste.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 核能的问题就是要处理核废料。

Sense.DEF: the physical and mental strength that makes you able to do things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where do those kids get their energy from?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些孩子哪来这么多精力？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you suffering from a lack of energy?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是不是觉得精力不足？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city is full of creative energy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城市充满了创造力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I really put a lot of energy into what I do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我做起事来总是投入很大精力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wants to conserve his energy for next week’s game use as little energy as possible now, so that you have more energy to use later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想为下周的比赛保存体力。

Sense.DEF: a special power that some people believe exists in their bodies and in some buildings
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a lot of energy in the room this morning – did you feel it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天早上这房间里充满活力﹐你感觉到了吗？

Sense.DEF: in physics, the ability that something has to work or move
Sense.EXAMPLE: kinetic energy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动能

Sense.DEF: the effort and interest that you use to do things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s devoting all her energies to the wedding plans.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把所有精力都花在筹备婚礼上了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: a power plant that generates energy from household waste
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 利用家庭垃圾发电的发电站

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The wind farm will provide enough energy for 100,000 homes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个风力发电场将足以为十万户家庭供电。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Batteries store the energy from the solar panels.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 电池储存太阳能电池板的能量。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Washing machines use a lot of energy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗衣机能耗很大。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not waste any energy
Collocate.EXAMPLE: An efficient boiler will conserve energy and save you money.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 高效锅炉节能又省钱。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The water pump is powered by solar energy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个水泵由太阳能驱动。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: a report on the cost of nuclear energy
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一篇关于核能成本的报告

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The windmill uses wind energy to crush grain and pump water.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 风车利用风能碾磨谷物和抽水。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: energy such as solar or wind energy that can be replaced naturally
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Switching to sources of renewable energy will reduce carbon emissions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 改用可再生能源可以减少碳排放量。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: energy from sources other than oil, coal, or nuclear energy
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It is the first form of public transport to be powered by alternative energy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是第一种由替代能源提供动力的公共交通工具。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: which does not cause pollution
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Iceland possesses sufficient quantities of clean energy sources that it does not need to rely on fossil fuels.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰岛拥有足够的清洁能源﹐无需依赖矿物燃料。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: 30% of all our energy use is in the home.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭能耗占总能耗的30%。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: This guide provides advice on ways of improving energy efficiency.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 本指南为如何提高能效提供建议。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We all need to reduce our energy consumption.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都应减少能耗。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: 65% of the country’s energy needs are met by imported oil.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国能源需求量的65%依靠石油进口。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: hydro-electricity and other methods of energy production
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 水力发电及其他能源生产方式

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The world's energy resources are being used up at an alarming rate.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界能源以惊人的速度逐渐耗尽

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Coal is more expensive than other sources of energy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 煤比其他能源价格高。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The demand for energy in developing countries will continue to grow.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 发展中国家的能源需求将继续增长。

Sense.DEF: to make you feel tired and weak
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hot sun enervated her to the point of collapse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热辣辣的太阳把她晒得快要晕过去了。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: David felt too enervated to resist.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维感到太虚弱﹐无力反抗。

Sense.DEF: a young successful person who behaves in a way that is shocking but also amusing
Sense.TRAN: 少年得志离经叛道的人

Sense.DEF: very weak or ill
to cover or surround someone or something completely
Sense.TRAN: 搂抱〔某人〕﹔围住﹐包住〔某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wizard screamed as the darkness enfolded him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑暗罩住了巫师﹐他尖叫起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He reached out to enfold her in his arms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他伸手把她拥在怀里。

Sense.DEF: to make people obey a rule or law

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Governments make laws and the police enforce them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府制定法律﹐警察负责执行。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Parking restrictions will be strictly enforced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 停车限制将会严格执行。

Sense.DEF: to make something happen or force someone to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is unlikely that a record company would enforce its views on an established artist.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 唱片公司未必能强迫一位已出名的艺人接受他们的意见。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The recommendations are not legally enforceable.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些建议不能用法律手段强制执行。

Sense.DEF: made to happen, especially by things you cannot control

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a period of enforced isolation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 强制隔离期

Sense.DEF: when people are made to obey a rule, law etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 执法

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to make sure people do the things they should
Sense.EXAMPLE: a law enforcer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 执法人员
Sense.EXAMPLE: an enforcer for a drugs gang
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贩毒集团的打手

Sense.DEF: to give a group of people the right to vote

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧盟公民享有的选举权
刚刚获得选举权的股东

Sense.DEF: to be doing or to become involved in an activity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Only 10% of American adults engage in regular exercise.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有10%的美国成年人定期进行锻炼。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two parties engaged upon an escalating political struggle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两党之间的政治斗争日益加剧。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr Armstrong was engaged in prayer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿姆斯特朗先生在祷告。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Despite her illness, she remains actively engaged in shaping policy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管有病在身﹐她还是积极参与政策的制定。

Sense.DEF: to attract someone’s attention and keep them interested

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The toy didn’t engage her interest for long.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个玩具对她的吸引力没有维持多久。

GramExa.GLOSS: start talking to them

Sense.DEF: to get involved with other people and their ideas in order to understand them
Sense.TRAN: 与某人/某事物建立密切关系
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you so tired you don’t have the energy to engage with your kids?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你难道累得都没有精力陪你的孩子们了吗？

Sense.DEF: to employ someone to do a particular job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her father engaged a tutor to improve her maths.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她爸爸请了一位家庭教师给她补习数学。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’d be able to engage local people as volunteers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以请当地人做志愿者。

Sense.DEF: if you engage part of a machine, or if it engages, it moves so that it fits into another part of the machine
Sense.EXAMPLE: She engaged the clutch and the car moved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她踩下离合器﹐汽车便开动了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wheel engages with the cog and turns it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮子咬住轮齿并带动它转动。

Sense.DEF: to begin to fight an enemy
Sense.EXAMPLE: American forces did not directly engage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美军没有直接参战。

Sense.DEF: if two people are engaged, they have agreed to marry
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you heard? Sally and Ray are getting engaged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你听说了吗？萨莉和雷要订婚了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is engaged to be married.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已经订婚了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kate’s engaged to Mark.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特和马克订婚了。

Sense.DEF: if you call someone on the telephone and their line is engaged, they are already speaking to someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: She rang Mrs Tavett but the line was engaged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她打电话给塔韦特夫人﹐但电话占线。

GramExa.GLOSS: the sound you hear when the phone is engaged

Sense.DEF: a public toilet that is engaged is being used
to be unable to do something because you are doing something else
an agreement between two people to marry, or the period of time they are engaged
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their engagement was announced in the paper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们订婚的消息在报上公布了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tony was stunned when Lisa suddenly broke off their engagement finished it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尼对莉萨突然解除他俩的婚约感到震惊。

GramExa.GLOSS: a ring that a man gives a woman to show that they are engaged

Sense.DEF: an official arrangement to do something, especially one that is related to your work
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指与工作有关的〕约定﹐约会

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The princess will continue to carry out royal engagements.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公主将继续履行王室的约定。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This is his only public speaking engagement on the tour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他此行唯一一场公开演讲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His excuse of a prior engagement was accepted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他事先另有安排的理由被接受了。

Sense.DEF: when you become involved with someone or something in order to understand them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a strategy of engagement and cooperation with China
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 与中国保持联系和合作的策略
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many students pass without any real engagement in learning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多学生没怎么学习就通过了考试。

Sense.DEF: fighting between armies etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: military rules of engagement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 交战的军事规则

Sense.DEF: an official arrangement to employ or pay someone to do a particular job
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please sign to indicate your acceptance of the terms of engagement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请签名表示你接受聘用条款。

Sense.DEF: the fitting together of the working parts of a machine
pleasant and attracting your interest
Sense.EXAMPLE: an engaging smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迷人的微笑

Sense.DEF: to be the cause of a situation or feeling
Sense.TRAN: 引起﹐产生〔某种情形或感觉〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the changes in society engendered by the war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争造成的社会变化

GramExa.EXAMPLE: relationships that engender trust in children
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让孩子产生信任的关系

Sense.DEF: the part of a vehicle that produces power to make it move

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The engine won’t start.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 引擎发动不起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He switched off the car’s engine and waited.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他关掉汽车的发动机等着。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Is the engine running smoothly?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发动机运转平稳吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an old steam engine
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老式蒸汽发动机

Sense.EXAMPLE: We were stranded with engine trouble on a deserted highway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们因发动机故障而被困在空无一人的公路上。

Sense.DEF: a vehicle that pulls a railway train
something powerful that causes great changes in society

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Marshall Plan was the engine of post-war economic growth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马歇尔计划是战后经济发展的原动力。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Rome’s deadly war engine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗马的致命战争机器

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to design or build roads, bridges, machines etc

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 机械/电气/软件等工程师

Sense.EXAMPLE: He trained as a civil engineer one who designs and builds roads, bridges etc.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他接受过土木工程师培训。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to take care of the engines on a ship or aircraft
Sense.TRAN: 〔船上的〕轮机手﹔〔飞机上的〕机械师

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to repair electrical equipment or machines
someone whose job is driving a train
to make something happen by skilful secret planning
Sense.EXAMPLE: powerful enemies who engi-neered his downfall
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 密谋导致他垮台的强大敌人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps she could engineer a meeting between them?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 或许她可以好好安排一下让他们见一面？

Sense.DEF: to change the genetic structure of a plant, animal etc
Sense.TRAN: 改变〔动植物等〕的基因结构
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dangers of engineering native plants
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改变本地植物基因结构的风险
Sense.EXAMPLE: genetically engineered crops
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 转基因农作物

Sense.DEF: to design and plan the building of roads, bridges, machines, etc
the work involved in designing and building roads, bridges, machines etc
the language used in Britain, the US, Australia, and some other countries
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you speak English?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会说英语吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: leaflets written in plain English English that is easy to understand
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用简单英语写的传单

Sense.DEF: people from England
literature written in English, studied as a subject at school or university
Sense.EXAMPLE: She decided to major in English.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决定主修英语。

Sense.DEF: relating to England or its people
Sense.EXAMPLE: the English countryside
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰乡村
Sense.EXAMPLE: under English law
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按照英格兰法律

Sense.DEF: relating to the language used in Britain, the US, Australia and some other countries
Sense.EXAMPLE: English grammar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英语语法

Sense.DEF: a large cooked breakfast consisting of bacon, eggs, toast etc
Sense.TRAN: 英式早餐〔包括熏肉﹑蛋和烤面包等〕

Sense.DEF: a long wooden musical instrument which is like an oboe but with a lower sound
a man from England

Sense.LEXUNIT: an Englishman’s home is his castle
Sense.DEF: used to say that your home is a place where you can feel safe and do whatever you want
Sense.TRAN: 英国人的家就是他的城堡〔用于表示在家里可以感到安全并做自己想做的事情〕

Sense.DEF: a round thick flat piece of bread with small holes inside
a woman from England
swollen and full of liquid
to cut words or designs on metal, wood, glass etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在金属﹑木头﹑玻璃等上〕雕刻〔文字或图案〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their names are engraved on a stone tablet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的名字刻在石匾上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pendant engraved with a simple design
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 刻有简单图案的吊坠

Sense.DEF: to be impossible to forget
Sense.TRAN: 铭刻在记忆里/脑海中/心中

Sense.DEF: a picture made by cutting a design into metal, putting ink on the metal, and then printing it
the skill of engraving things
if something engrosses you, it interests you so much that you do not notice anything else
Sense.TRAN: 使全神贯注﹐ 吸引〔注意力〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The scene was stunning, and for a time engrossed all our attention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 景色非常美丽﹐一时间把我们都完全吸引住了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Take your mind off it by engrossing yourself in a good book.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 弄本好书埋头去看﹐不要再想它了。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Dad was engrossed in the paper.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸在专心致志地看报。
RunOn.EXAMPLE: Who’s that guy Ally’s been engrossed in conversation with all night?
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾丽整夜都专注地跟那个家伙说话﹐他究竟是谁呀？

Sense.DEF: if an unpleasant feeling engulfs you, you feel it very strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: despair so great it threatened to engulf him
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎要将他压垮的绝望情绪

Sense.DEF: to completely surround or cover something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building was engulfed in flames.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幢楼被大火吞没了。

Sense.DEF: to improve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good lighting will enhance any room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 良好的照明能给房间增色不少。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The publicity has enhanced his reputation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次宣传提高了他的声誉。

Sense.DEF: improved or better
Sense.EXAMPLE: enhanced access to information
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有更多机会接触资料

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is strange and difficult to understand
Sense.TRAN: 不可理解的人﹔费解的事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The neighbours regarded him as something of an enigma.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邻居们把他当成谜一样的人。

Sense.DEF: mysterious and difficult to understand

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: “你会明白的。”他神秘地回答道。

Sense.DEF: to order or try to persuade someone to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The organisation has been enjoined to end all restrictions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该组织已被责令解除所有限制。

Sense.DEF: to legally prevent someone from doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The defendant was enjoined from using the patent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被告被禁止使用这项专利。

Sense.DEF: to get pleasure from something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sandra enjoys her job in the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑德拉很喜欢她在城里的这份工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I enjoyed every minute of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每一分钟都很享受。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Young children enjoy helping around the house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子喜欢在家里帮着做点事。

GramExa.GLOSS: be happy in a particular situation
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Julia was just starting to enjoy herself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱莉娅刚开始有了兴头。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Enjoy always has an object and is never followed by a preposition or an infinitive with ‘to’. enjoy 必定带有宾语﹐后面绝对不接介词或带to的不定式: Did you enjoy it (NOT 不说 Did you enjoy)? 你玩得开心吗？ | I enjoyed my trip (NOT 不说 I enjoyed to/with my trip). 这次旅行我很开心。 | He enjoys playing football (NOT 不说 He enjoys play football). 他喜欢踢足球。

Sense.DEF: to have a particular ability or advantage
Sense.EXAMPLE: These workers enjoy a high level of job security.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些工人的工作非常稳定。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you hope someone gets pleasure from something you give them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here’s your steak – enjoy!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的牛排来了﹐好好享用吧！

Sense.DEF: something enjoyable gives you pleasure
Sense.TRAN: 使人愉快的﹐令人快乐的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Games can make learning more enjoyable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游戏可以寓教于乐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an enjoyable experience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人愉快的经历

Sense.DEF: the feeling of pleasure you get from having or doing something, or something you enjoy doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Acting has brought me enormous enjoyment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 演戏给我带来莫大的快乐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unfortunately, a small minority want to spoil everyone else’s enjoyment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很遗憾﹐少数几个人想令其他所有人扫兴。

Sense.DEF: the fact of having something
if you enlarge something, or if it enlarges, it increases in size or scale
Sense.EXAMPLE: an operation to enlarge her breasts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的丰胸手术
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police will have the pictures enlarged in an attempt to identify the thief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了确认窃贼的身份﹐警方会将这些照片放大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A good way to enlarge your vocabulary is to read a daily newspaper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个扩大词汇量的好方法是阅读日报。

Sense.DEF: to provide more information about something you have already mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Maughan did not enlarge on what she meant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫恩夫人并未细说她是什么意思。

Sense.DEF: a photograph that has been printed again in a bigger size
an increase in size or amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: enlargement of the EU
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧盟的扩大

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment used to make photographs bigger
to explain something to someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Baldwin enlightened her as to the nature of the experiment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍德温给她讲解了这个实验的性质。

Sense.DEF: someone with enlightened attitudes has sensible modern views and treats people fairly and kindly
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Empowerment’ is the new buzz-word in enlightened management circles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “授权”是开明的管理层所使用的时髦新语。

Sense.DEF: showing a good understanding or knowledge of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We don’t actually know, but I can make an enlightened guess.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们其实并不知道﹐但我可以作个明智的猜测。

Sense.DEF: when you understand something clearly, or when you help someone do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Isabel looked to Ron for enlightenment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊莎贝尔希望得到罗恩的启发。

Sense.DEF: the final stage reached in the Buddhist and Hindu religions when you no longer suffer or feel desire and you are at peace with the universe
Sense.TRAN: 〔佛教和印度教的〕觉悟﹐般若〔指摆脱苦难或欲望﹐与天地万物和平相处的最终境界〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the quest for spiritual enlightenment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对心灵觉悟的追求

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone to help you to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has enlisted the help of a sports psychologist for the team.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为球队请了一位运动心理学家来帮忙。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The public are being enlisted to help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众正受邀相助。

Sense.DEF: to join the army, navy etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He enlisted as a private.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他入伍当了二等兵。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At the outbreak of war, he was enlisted in the army.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争爆发后﹐他参加了陆军。

Sense.DEF: having a rank below that of an officer in the army, navy etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: officers and enlisted men
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军官和士兵

Sense.DEF: to make something more interesting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Humour can help enliven a dull subject.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幽默有助于使枯燥的话题变得比较有趣。

Sense.DEF: if people do something en masse, they do it together
Sense.EXAMPLE: The management team resigned en masse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理层全体辞职了。

Sense.DEF: very involved in an unpleasant or complicated situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Congress worried about becoming enmeshed in a foreign war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会担心会陷入一场对外战争。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of hatred towards someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the enmity between the two communities
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个团体间的敌视

Sense.DEF: to improve your character
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕高尚﹔使〔某人〕崇高
Sense.EXAMPLE: art which ennobles the human race
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使人类更为崇高的艺术

Sense.DEF: to make someone a member of the nobilitythe people in society who have a high rank, such as princes etc
a feeling of being tired, bored, and unsatisfied with your life
the great size, seriousness, or difficulty of a situation, problem, event etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔处境﹑问题﹑事件等的〕艰巨﹔严重性

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Even now, the full enormity of his crimes has not been exposed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 甚至到现在为止﹐他那些罪行的严重性还是没有被揭穿。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the enormity of the task
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项任务的艰巨性

Sense.DEF: a very evil and cruel act
very big in size or in amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: an enormous bunch of flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨大的花束
Sense.EXAMPLE: an enormous amount of money
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨款
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team made an enormous effort.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该队付出了巨大的努力。

Sense.DEF: very or very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: an enormously successful actor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极其成功的男演员
Sense.EXAMPLE: The project has benefited enormously from Jan’s knowledge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目深深得益于简的学识。

Head.GRAM: always after a verb adjective or adverb
Head.GRAMTRAN: 总是用于动词﹑形容词或副词之后

Sense.DEF: to the degree that is necessary or wanted
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are the carrots cooked enough?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胡萝卜煮熟了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: He just hadn’t thought enough about the possible consequences.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他就是没有充分考虑可能造成的后果。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can go to school when you’re old enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你够年龄就可以上学了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is the water warm enough for you?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看这水够热吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Will Evans be fit enough to play?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃文斯的身体状况能够参加比赛吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rooms are all large enough to take a third bed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些房间都很大﹐足够放下第三张床。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Surely no one would be foolish enough to lend him the money?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯定没有人会傻到把钱借给他吧？

Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re late. It’s just not good enoughnot satisfactory or acceptable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你迟到了﹐这确实不像样。

Sense.DEF: fairly but not very
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was happy enough in Bordeaux, but I missed my family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在波尔多过得不错﹐但还是想家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a nice enough young man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是一个相当不错的小伙子。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a situation is already bad and you do not want it to get any worse
Sense.TRAN: (已经)够糟糕/困难/艰苦(的)等〔用于表示不希望情况变得更糟〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Life’s difficult enough without you interfering all the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有你成天搅和﹐生活就已经够艰难的了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: lucky/unfortunate etc enough to be/do sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is lucky or unlucky that something happens to them
Sense.TRAN: 幸运/不幸等遇到/做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were unlucky enough to be caught in the storm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不幸遇到了暴风雨。

Sense.LEXUNIT: would you be good/kind enough to do sth?
Sense.DEF: used to ask someone politely to do something for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you be good enough to hold the door open?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帮忙把住门﹐别让它关上好吗？

Sense.DEF: used to say that a fact or something that happens is strange or surprising
Sense.EXAMPLE: Strangely enough, I didn’t feel at all nervous when I faced the audience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奇怪的是﹐我面对听众时一点也不感到紧张。

Sense.DEF: used when you are guessing a number, amount, time etc because you cannot be exact
Sense.TRAN: 几乎﹐差不多〔用于猜测数字﹑数量﹑时间等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The full cost comes to £3,000, near enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全部费用差不多有3,000英镑。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Enough comes after adjectives and adverbs, never before them. enough
F2NBox.TRAN: 置于形容词及副词之后﹐绝对不可 放在 二者之前
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The printer is light enough (NOT 不说 enough light) to move easily.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这台打印机挺轻的﹐方便移动。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Their business wasn’t growing fast enough.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的业务发展得不够快。

Sense.DEF: as many or as much as is needed or wanted
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have I given you enough money?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给你的钱够吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not enough is known about what happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对所发生的事情了解得还不够多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There aren’t enough chairs for everyone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些椅子不够每人一把。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Erica was worried that the children weren’t getting enough to eat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃丽卡担心孩子们会吃不饱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police didn’t have enough evidence to convict him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方没有足够的证据给他定罪。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He didn’t even earn enough to pay the rent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他挣的钱甚至连付房租都不够。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’ve had more than enough time to make all the preparations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你已经有足够多的时间来做好一切准备。

GramExa.GLOSS: enough of something for everyone to have some
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you think we’ve got enough pizza to go round?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得我们的比萨饼每人一份够吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: much less than you need
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We only had $500, and that was nowhere near enough to buy a new camcorder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只有500美元﹐要买一台新的便携式摄像机是远远不够的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Come on – there’ll be time enough to chat later.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐以后有的是时间可以再聊。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a situation is already bad and you do not want it to get any worse
Sense.TRAN: 够多(的)〔用于表示情况已经很糟﹐不想再添乱了〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has enough problems without you two getting into fights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们俩就算不打架﹐她面对的问题也够多的了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to bother him – he has enough to worry about.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想麻烦他﹐他要担心的事够多的了。

Sense.DEF: used to say you are tired or angry about a situation and want it to stop
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I got home I just sat down and cried. I’d had enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我回到家就坐下哭了起来。 我受够了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve just about had enough of your stupid remarks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的蠢话我快听够了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something that is happening should stop
Sense.TRAN: 够了〔用于表示正在发生的事情应当停止〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There comes a point when you say enough is enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是时候了﹐你不该再忍下去了。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to stop doing something
Sense.TRAN: 行了〔用于叫某人停止做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now, you two, that’s quite enough. Sit down and be quiet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂﹐你们俩﹐到此为止吧。 坐下来安静一会儿。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they do not need to say any more because you understand the point they are making
Sense.TRAN: 不用再说了〔表示都明白了〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘He’s the sort of man who wears a lot of jewellery.’ ‘Enough said.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他是那种浑身戴满首饰的人。”“不用再说了。

Sense.DEF: to enjoy something so much that you want more and more of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her millions of fans can’t get enough of her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的无数崇拜者对她如痴如狂。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Enough comes after adjectives and adverbs, never before them.
F2NBox.TRAN: enough置于形容词及副词之后，绝对不可放在二者之前。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The printer is light enough (NOT 不说 enough light) to move easily.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这台打印机挺轻的﹐方便移动。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Their business wasn’t growing fast enough.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的业务发展得不够快。

Exponent.DEF: as much or as many as necessary, or as you want
Exponent.TRAN: 〔必需或想要之物〕足够(的)﹐充足(的)﹐ 充分(的)
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My family never had enough money for holidays abroad.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们家从来都没有足够的钱去国外度假。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Have you had enough to eat?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的食物够吃吗？

Exponent.DEF: enough for a particular purpose
Exponent.TRAN: 〔为达到某一目的〕足够的﹐充足的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The police did not have sufficient evidence to justify a charge.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方没有足够证据提出指控。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The accuracy of the older technique was sufficient for our needs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧技术的精确程度足以满足我们的需要。

Exponent.DEF: enough in quantity or good enough in quality for a particular purpose
Exponent.TRAN: 〔数量〕足够的﹔〔质量〕合乎需要的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: All staff must be given adequate training in health and safety.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有员工都必须接受健康及安全方面的适当培训。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The heating system was barely adequate.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 暖气设备只是勉强能用。

Exponent.DEF: more than enough for what is needed
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Local residents will be given ample opportunity to express their views.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地居民会有充分的机会表达意见。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People used to think that 1 GB of memory was ample for the average personal computer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们过去认为普通个人电脑有1G内存就足够了。

Exponent.DEF: an amount that is enough or more than enough
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Allow yourself plenty of time to get to the airport.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 预留出充足的时间去机场。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Your daughter won’t need much cash at camp ($20-$25 will be plenty).
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你女儿参加野营无需太多现金(20到25美元已足够)。

Exponent.DEF: used to say that a particular number or amount will be enough for what you need
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘How many envelopes do you want?’ ‘Ten should do.’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “你要多少信封？”“十个就够了。”

Sense.DEF: another spelling of inquire
another spelling of inquiry
to make someone very angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many readers were enraged by his article.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多读者被他的文章激怒了。

Sense.DEF: enjoying something so much that you can think of nothing else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The orchestra played before an enraptured audience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管弦乐队的演奏使听众如醉如痴。

Sense.DEF: to improve the quality of something, especially by adding things to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add fertilizer to enrich the soil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 施上肥料使土壤肥沃。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Education can greatly enrich your life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育可以大大充实生活。

Sense.DEF: to make someone richer
to increase the number of atoms in a nuclear fuel so that it produces more power
to officially arrange to join a school, university, or course, or to arrange for someone else to do this
Sense.TRAN: 招(生)﹐吸收(成员)﹔注册(课程)

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I decided to enrol for ‘Art for Beginners’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定注册修读“艺术入门”课程。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Californians are rushing to enroll in special aerobics classes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加利福尼亚人在争先恐后地报名参加专门的有氧运动课。

Sense.DEF: the process of arranging to join a school, university, course etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Enrolment will take place in September.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 注册将于9月进行。

Sense.DEF: the number of people who have arranged to join a school, university, course etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Student enrolments have more than doubled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生注册人数翻了一倍多。

Sense.DEF: on the way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a flight en route from Tokyo to Sydney
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从东京飞往悉尼途中的航班

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We stayed there en route for London.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去伦敦的途中﹐我们在那里停留。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t we stop for lunch en route?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在途中停下来吃午餐怎么样？

Sense.DEF: to settle yourself in a place where you feel comfortable and safe

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nick was comfortably ensconced in front of the TV set.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克舒舒服服地安坐在电视机前面。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Agnes had ensconced herself in the best bedroom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿格尼丝在最好的卧室里安顿下来。

Sense.DEF: a small group of musicians, actors, or dancers who perform together regularly
Sense.TRAN: 〔经常在一起演出的小型〕乐团﹐剧团﹐舞剧团

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 器乐/弦乐器/铜管乐器等演奏组

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an ensemble of Mexican artistes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 墨西哥艺人乐团

Sense.DEF: a set of things that go together to form a whole
a set of clothes that are worn together
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attractive ensemble
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套漂亮的服装

Sense.DEF: if something such as a tradition or right is enshrined in something, it is preserved and protected so that people will remember and respect it
Sense.TRAN: 铭记﹔珍藏〔指传统或权利被保留下来以使人铭记﹑珍视〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The right of free speech is enshrined in the Constitution.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 言论自由的权利被载入宪法。

Sense.DEF: to cover or surround something so that it is not possible to see, understand, or explain it
Sense.EXAMPLE: hills enshrouded in mist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雾气笼罩的山峦
Sense.EXAMPLE: the mystery that enshrouds their disappearance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 笼罩在他们失踪事件上的谜团

Sense.DEF: a flag on a ship that shows what country the ship belongs to
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Russian ensign
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 俄罗斯舰旗

Sense.DEF: a low rank in the US navy, or an officer who has this rank
to make someone a slave
if something enslaves you, it completely controls your life and your actions
Sense.EXAMPLE: She seemed enslaved by hatred.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她似乎被仇恨所左右。

Sense.DEF: to trap someone in an unpleasant or illegal situation, from which they cannot escape
Sense.TRAN: 使落入圈套﹐使落入陷阱

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Young girls were ensnared in prostitution rings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 少女们落入了卖淫团伙的手中。

Sense.DEF: to catch an animal in a trap
to happen after or as a result of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: problems that ensue from food and medical shortages
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 食品和药品短缺引起的问题

Sense.DEF: happening after a particular action or event, especially as a result of it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the ensuing fighting, two students were killed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在随后的打斗中﹐有两名学生送了命。

GramExa.GLOSS: the days, months etc after an event
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 随后的几天/几个月/几年等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The situation deteriorated over the ensuing weeks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在随后几周里形势恶化了。

Subsense.DEF: an en suite bathroom is joined onto a bedroom
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Both bedrooms have en suite bathrooms.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两间卧室都配有浴室。

Subsense.DEF: an en suite bedroom has a bathroom joined onto it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: 57 bedrooms, all en suite
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 57间卧室﹐全都配有浴室

Subsense.DEF: a bathroom that is joined onto a bedroom, especially in a hotel
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Each room has an ensuite and a balcony.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个房间都有浴室和阳台。

Subsense.DEF: a bedroom that has a bathroom joined onto it, especially in a hotel
Subsense.EXAMPLE: All the en suites have a log fire and a private garden or terrace.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有带浴室的房间都有烧木柴的壁炉和独立的花园或露天平台。

Sense.DEF: to make certain that something will happen properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: facilities to ensure the safety of cyclists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 确保骑车人安全的设施

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hospital tries to ensure that people are seen quickly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家医院尽量确保人们可以迅速就诊。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say make sure rather than ensure .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说make sure﹐而不说ensure
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Please make sure all the windows are closed.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 请一定要把所有的窗户都关上。
F2NBox.EXPL: Make sure is followed by a clause (with or without that ), never a direct object. make sure
F2NBox.TRAN: 后接 从 句(that可有也可无)﹐绝对不跟直接 宾语
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔regulations to make sure (that) they are safe
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 确保他们安全的规定

Sense.DEF: someone or something that does something, or that has a particular quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: local residents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地的居民

Sense.DEF: to involve something as a necessary part or result
Sense.EXAMPLE: A new computer system entails a lot of re-training.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用新的计算机系统需要大量的再培训。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some foreign travel is entailed in the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做这份工作有时要到国外出差。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The journey will entail changing trains twice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这趟旅程要转两次火车。

Sense.DEF: if you entail property, you arrange for it to be given to a specific person, usually your oldest son, when you die

Head.GRAMTRAN: 一般用被动态 always + adv/prep

Sense.DEF: to make something become twisted and caught in a rope, net etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Small animals can get entangled in the net.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小动物会被网套住。

Sense.DEF: to involve someone in an argument, a relationship, or a situation that is difficult to escape from

GramExa.EXAMPLE: fears that the US could get entangled in another war
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对美国可能卷入另一场战争的恐惧

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I didn’t want to become entangled with my best friend’s wife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想和我最好的朋友的妻子有瓜葛。

Sense.DEF: a difficult situation or relationship that is hard to escape from
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had always been afraid of any emotional entanglements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是害怕陷入感情纠葛。

Sense.DEF: when something becomes entangled in something
a fence made of barbed wire that prevents enemy soldiers from getting too close
Sense.TRAN: 〔阻止敌人接近的〕带刺铁丝网围栏

Sense.DEF: a situation in which two countries have friendly relations with each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Anglo-Russian entente
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英俄友好关系

Subsense.DEF: to go or come into a place
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Silence fell as I entered the room.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一进去﹐屋里就静下来了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Few reporters dared to enter the war zone.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有几个记者敢进入战区。

Subsense.DEF: if an object enters part of something, it goes inside it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The bullet had entered his brain.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 子弹打入了他的大脑。

Sense.DEF: to start working in a particular profession or organization, or to start studying at a school or university
Sense.TRAN: 开始从事〔某职业〕﹔加入〔某组织〕﹔考上〔学校或大学〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both the boys entered the army.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个男孩都参了军。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She entered politics in 1996.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她于1996年进入政界。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He entered the Church became a priest as a young man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他年轻时就领了圣职。

Sense.DEF: to start to take part in an activity, or become involved in a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: He entered the election as the clear favourite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他参加竞选时显然最有希望获胜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rebels were prepared to enter negotiations start discussing something.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛乱分子愿意参加谈判。

Subsense.DEF: to put information into a computer by pressing the keys
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Press the return key to enter the information.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按回车键输入信息。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The names are entered into a database.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 姓名被输入数据库。

Subsense.DEF: if you enter a computer system, you are given permission to use it by the computer
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It won’t let you enter without a password.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有密码你就无法登录。

Sense.DEF: to write information on a particular part of a form, document etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget to enter your postcode.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别忘了填上你的邮政编码。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Enter your name in the space provided.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在空白处填上你的姓名。

Sense.DEF: to arrange to take part in a race, competition, examination etc, or to arrange for someone else to take part
Sense.TRAN: 报名参加〔赛跑﹑竞赛﹑考试等〕﹔安排〔某人〕参加
Sense.EXAMPLE: At least 30 schools entered the competition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 至少有30所学校参加了竞赛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Decisions about when he or she is entered for an examination should be taken very carefully.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 应慎重决定其何时参加考试。

Sense.DEF: to begin a period of time when something happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: The economy has entered a period of recession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济步入了衰退期。

GramExa.PROPFORM: enter its third week/sixth day/second year etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The talks have now entered their third week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 会谈已进入第三周。

Sense.DEF: if a new idea, thought etc enters your head, or a new quality enters something, it suddenly starts to exist there
Sense.TRAN: 〔新的想法﹑观念等〕突然产生﹔〔新的特质〕突然出现
Sense.EXAMPLE: A note of panic entered her voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的声音突然透出一丝恐慌。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that someone never considered a particular idea, especially when this is surprising
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It never entered his head that she might be seeing someone else.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从未想到过她或许会另有相好。

Sense.DEF: if someone or something enters your life, you start to know them or be affected by them
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the time Angie entered his life, he was almost 30.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安吉走进他的生活时﹐他已差不多30岁了。

Sense.DEF: to make an official statement
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wilson entered a plea of not guilty said that he was not guilty at the beginning of a court case.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威尔逊在法庭上否认有罪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Residents entered a number of objections to the scheme.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 居民对该方案提出了一些反对意见。

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of enter and go/come in in spoken and written English. enter和go/come in在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。
Enter is more formal than go in and come in. enter比go in和come in更为正式。

Exponent.DEF: to go or come into a place. Enter is more formal than go in.
Exponent.TRAN: 进入〔某处﹐enter比go in更为正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It appears the burglars entered the house through a back window.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 窃贼似乎是从后窗进入室内的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Occupying troops entered the town on 8th April.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 占领军于4月8日进入该城。

Exponent.DEF: to enter a place – usually used in everyday English
Exponent.TRAN: 进入某处〔常用于日常英语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was getting cold so we went in.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 天渐渐冷了﹐于是我们进去了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He went into the cafe and ordered a drink.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走进咖啡馆﹐点了一杯饮料。

Exponent.DEF: to enter a place – used when you are already in that place
Exponent.TRAN: 进入某处〔说话人已在该处时使用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Come in and sit down.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 进来坐吧。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When you come into the village, you’ll see the church on your right.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一进村子﹐就会看到右边的教堂。

Exponent.DEF: to succeed in entering a place, especially when it is difficult or it takes a long time
Exponent.TRAN: 进入某处〔尤指很难进入或费时许久才能进入的地方〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’d lost my key so I couldn’t get in.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把钥匙弄丢了﹐进不了门。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You can’t get into the club if you are under 18.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不满18岁者不能进入该俱乐部。

Exponent.DEF: to enter a building using force, for example in order to steal something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If anyone tries to break in, the alarm will go off.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是有人试图闯入﹐警报器会响。

Exponent.DEF: to enter a room or building very suddenly and noisily
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Two men with guns burst in and told us to lie on the floor.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名持枪男子突然闯入﹐叫我们躺在地上。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He burst into my office laughing and screaming like a maniac.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然闯入我的办公室﹐像疯子一样又笑又叫。

Exponent.DEF: to suddenly enter a room where you are not wanted because you are interrupting someone or you were not invited
Exponent.TRAN: 闯入某处〔指打扰了别人或不请自来〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She just barged into my room without knocking.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她门也不敲﹐径直闯进我的房间。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You can’t just go barging in.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能就这么直接闯进去。

Exponent.DEF: to enter a place quietly and secretly hoping that no one will notice you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If you’re late, just try and sneak into the back of the class.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是迟到了﹐就尽量从教室后面溜进来。

Exponent.DEF: to enter a place quietly and quickly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Maggie opened the door silently and slipped in.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛吉悄悄打开门﹐溜了进来。

Exponent.DEF: to enter an area of land that belongs to someone else without permission
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The sign said ‘Trespassers will be prosecuted’.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 告示牌上写着“非请莫入﹐违者必究”。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Trespassing on the railway is a criminal offence in the UK.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 擅闯铁路线在英国是违法行为。

Sense.DEF: to make an official agreement to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some local authorities have entered into partnership with private companies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些地方当局与私营企业结成了合作关系。

Sense.DEF: to start discussing or dealing with something
Sense.EXAMPLE: It could be a problem, but we don’t need to enter into that just yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这可能是个问题﹐但我们还不必马上处理。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government refused to enter into discussions with the opposition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府拒绝和反对党商谈。

Sense.DEF: to affect a situation and be something that you consider when you make a choice
Sense.EXAMPLE: He always buys the best – money doesn’t enter into it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是买最好的﹐钱根本不成问题。

Sense.LEXUNIT: enter into the spirit of it/things
Sense.DEF: to take part in a game, party etc in an eager way
Sense.TRAN: 急切地参加﹐兴致勃勃地参与﹔进入角色

Sense.DEF: to start doing something or being involved in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: countries newly entering upon industrialization
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚开始工业化的国家

Sense.DEF: a painful infection in your intestines
a company, organization, or business
Sense.EXAMPLE: commercial enterprises such as banks and food manufacturers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行和食品制造厂等商业企业

GramExa.GLOSS: one owned by the government
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 国有企业/公共事业单位

Sense.DEF: the activity of starting and running businesses
Sense.EXAMPLE: the management of state enterprise done by the government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国有企业的管理

Sense.DEF: a large and complicated project, especially one that is done with a group of other people
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指与其他团队合作的〕大型而复杂的项目﹐事业
Sense.EXAMPLE: The programme is a joint enterprise with the London Business School.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一计划是与伦敦商学院的合作项目。

Sense.DEF: the ability to think of new activities or ideas and make them work
Sense.TRAN: 创业精神﹔事业心﹔进取心
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re looking for young people with enterprise and creativity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在寻找有事业心和创造力的年轻人。

Sense.DEF: a society or attitude which encourages people to start new businesses and be successful
Sense.TRAN: 经商文化〔鼓励人们成功创业的社会或态度〕

Sense.DEF: an area where the government is encouraging business activity. New businesses there usually pay lower taxes and companies are given money to encourage them to move to the area.
Sense.TRAN: 企业振兴区〔区内新成立的企业一般可获减税﹐迁往区内的公司可获奖励金〕

Sense.DEF: having the ability to think of new activities or ideas and make them work
Sense.TRAN: 有创业精神的﹔有事业心的﹔有进取心的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some enterprising students are designing software.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些有创业精神的学生在设计软件。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an enterprising scheme to provide interest-free loans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项提供无息贷款的创业计划

Sense.DEF: to amuse or interest people in a way that gives them pleasure

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She entertained the children with stories, songs and drama.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她又讲故事又唱歌﹐还演戏﹐把孩子们逗得很开心。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A museum should aim to entertain as well as educate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 博物馆应该致力于成为娱乐和教育功能并重的场所。

Sense.DEF: to invite people to your home for a meal, party etc, or to take your company’s customers somewhere to have a meal, drinks etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark usually does the cooking when we entertain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们招待客人时通常都是马克下厨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you get an allowance for entertaining clients?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你招待客户有补助吗？

Sense.DEF: to consider an idea etc, or allow yourself to think that something might happen or be true
Sense.TRAN: 怀有某种想法/希望/看法等
Sense.EXAMPLE: She could never entertain the idea of living in the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她绝不可能有住到乡下去的想法。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to tell jokes, sing etc in order to entertain people
Sense.TRAN: 〔以讲笑话﹑唱歌等来娱乐他人的〕表演者﹐艺人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sinatra remains one of the top entertainers of all time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西纳特拉一直是最著名的艺人之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: street entertainers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 街头艺人

Sense.DEF: amusing and interesting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children’s TV nowadays is much more entertaining.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今的儿童电视节目要比过去有趣多了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an entertaining evening
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人愉快的夜晚

Sense.DEF: when you invite people for meals or to parties, at home or for business reasons
Sense.EXAMPLE: simple recipes for easy entertaining
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 方便宴客的简单食谱
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel is used for corporate entertaining for business reasons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店可举办商务宴请。

Sense.DEF: things such as films, television, performances etc that are intended to amuse or interest people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The town provides a wide choice of entertainment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该镇提供各式各样的娱乐活动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There will be live entertainment performed then, not recorded throughout the day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现场表演将持续一整天。

GramExa.GLOSS: comedy

Sense.EXAMPLE: The dolphins give good entertainment value a lot of amusement and interest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海豚具有很高的娱乐价值。

Sense.DEF: when you entertain someone at home, or for business
Sense.EXAMPLE: the entertainment of friends
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 招待朋友

Sense.DEF: to make someone very interested and excited, so that they listen or watch something very carefully
Sense.TRAN: 迷住〔某人〕﹐使 某人〕着迷

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children were enthralled by the story she was telling.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们被她讲的故事迷住了。

Sense.DEF: extremely interesting
Sense.EXAMPLE: an enthralling experience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常有趣的经历

Sense.DEF: if a king or queen is enthroned, there is a ceremony to show that they are starting to rule
to talk about something in a very interested or excited way
Sense.TRAN: 津津乐道地讲述﹐兴奋地说

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rick was there, enthusing about life in Australia.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 里克在那里兴致勃勃地大谈在澳大利亚的生活。

Sense.DEF: to make someone interested in something or excited by it
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕对…感兴趣﹐激起〔某人〕的热情

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The owners were certainly enthused by the offer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些业主当然对这一报价感兴趣。

Sense.DEF: a strong feeling of interest and enjoyment about something and an eagerness to be involved in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gillian and Darren greeted the speakers with great enthusiasm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉利恩和达伦非常热情地接待了演讲者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We went along to the local diving club, full of enthusiasm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们兴高采烈地去了当地的潜水俱乐部。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They go about their tasks with little enthusiasm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们执行任务时没多大干劲。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Britain’s apparent lack of enthusiasm for such a scheme
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国对这样的计划显然兴趣不大
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Employers showed little enthusiasm for the new regulations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇主们对新法规显得比较冷淡。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He shares your enthusiasm for jazz.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和你一样热爱爵士乐。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I left university fired with enthusiasm for work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我大学毕业时对参加工作充满了热情。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A delay of two hours did not dampen their enthusiasm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 耽误了两小时没有减弱他们的热情。

Sense.DEF: an activity or subject that someone is very interested in
Sense.TRAN: 热衷的活动﹔热爱的事物

Sense.DEF: someone who is very interested in a particular activity or subject
Sense.TRAN: 热衷者﹐爱好者﹐热心的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a keep-fit enthusiast
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 健身迷

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an enthusiast for the latest management thinking
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 热衷于最新管理思想的人

Sense.DEF: feeling or showing a lot of interest and excitement about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the staff are enthusiastic about the project.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全体员工对这个项目都很感兴趣。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The singer got an enthusiastic reception.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位歌手受到了热烈欢迎。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an enthusiastic supporter of reform
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改革的热心支持者

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone to do something or go somewhere, usually by offering them something that they want

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The birds were enticed back into Britain 40 years ago.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些鸟在40年前被引回英国。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our special offers are intended to entice people to buy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的特价优惠是为了吸引人们购买。

Sense.DEF: something that is enticing attracts or interests you a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a hot day and the water looked enticing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气热﹐水看起来很诱人。

Sense.DEF: used when you want to emphasize that you mean all of a group, period of time, amount etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the worst day in my entire life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是我一生中最糟糕的一天。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The entire staff agreed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全体员工都同意了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you drunk the entire bottle?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把整瓶酒都喝了吗？

Sense.DEF: completely and in every possible way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our situation is entirely different.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的处境完全不同。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ridge consists entirely of volcanic rock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这处山脊完全由火山岩构成。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her reasons were not entirely clear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的理由不是很明确。

Sense.DEF: including every part
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film has been shown in its entirety for the first time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影是第一次完整地放映。

Sense.DEF: the whole of sth
Sense.TRAN: 某事物的全部﹐某事物的整体
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stayed in the hotel throughout the entirety of the weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们整个周末都待在酒店里。

Sense.DEF: to give someone the official right to do or have something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Full-time employees are entitled to receive health insurance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全职雇员都有资格享受健康保险。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Membership entitles you to the monthly journal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凭会员身份可以获取月刊。

Sense.DEF: if a book, play etc is entitled something, that is its name
Sense.EXAMPLE: a documentary entitled ‘The Price of Perfection’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部名为《完美的代价》的纪录片

Sense.DEF: the official right to have or do something, or the amount that you have a right to receive
Sense.TRAN: 〔拥有或获得某物的〕权利﹔应得的数额

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you need advice on your entitlement to state benefits?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于你可享受的国家津贴﹐你是否需要一些建议？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The paid holiday entitlement is 25 days.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可享有的带薪假期为25天。

Sense.DEF: a US government programme or system that gives money or help to people who need it
something that exists as a single and complete unit
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mind exists as a separate entity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 思想作为一个独立的实体存在。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good design brings a house and garden together as a single entity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优秀的设计能把一所房子和花园合为一体。

Sense.DEF: to bury or trap someone in something or under the ground
the scientific study of insects
a group of people who travel with an important person
Sense.EXAMPLE: the president and his entourage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统和他的随行人员

Sense.DEF: the inside parts of an animal’s or person’s body, especially their intestines
a door, gate etc that you go through to enter a place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the main entrance to the school
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校的正门

Sense.EXAMPLE: the station entrance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车站的入口处

Sense.DEF: the act of entering a place or room, especially in a way that people notice
Sense.TRAN: 进入﹐进门〔尤指以人们注意到的方式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bridget made a dramatic entrance into the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布里奇特动作夸张地进了房间。

Sense.DEF: the right or ability to go into a place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Entrance to the museum is free.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家博物馆免费开放。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Reporters even managed to gain entrance to her hotel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记者们甚至设法进入了她入住的酒店。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How much is the entrance fee money you pay to get in somewhere?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 入场费是多少？

Sense.DEF: permission to become a member of or become involved in a profession, university, society etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔某行业﹑大学﹑社团等的〕进入许可
Sense.EXAMPLE: the initial interview for entrance to the Civil Service
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报考公务员的面试初试
入学考试

Sense.DEF: when a person, country, organization etc first becomes involved in a particular area of activity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The referendum blocked Switzerland’s entrance into the European Economic Area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全民投票阻止了瑞士加入欧洲经济区。

Sense.DEF: to come onto the stage in a play
if someone or something entrances you, they make you give them all your attention because they are so beautiful, interesting etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was entranced by the sweetness of her voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她甜美的嗓音令我陶醉。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她停下来﹐被深深地迷住了。

Sense.DEF: someone who takes part in a competition
someone who has recently started studying at university, or working

GramExa.EXAMPLE: new entrants to higher education
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高等院校的新生

Sense.DEF: to trap someone or something, or make it impossible for them to escape from a situation, especially by tricking them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt that she was trying to entrap him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得她在设法让他上当。

Sense.DEF: the practice of trapping someone by tricking them, especially to show that they are guilty of a crime
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤为证明某人犯了罪而实施的〕诱捕

Sense.DEF: to ask someone, in a very emotional way, to do something for you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His friends entreated him not to go.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的朋友们恳求他不要去。

Sense.DEF: a serious request in which you ask someone to do something for you
the main dish of a meal, or a dish served before the main course — used in restaurants or on formal occasions
Sense.TRAN: 主菜﹔正餐前的开胃菜〔用于餐馆或正式场合〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an entrée of roast duck
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主菜烤鸭

Sense.DEF: the right or freedom to enter a place or to join a social group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My family name gave me an entrée into upper class Boston society.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的姓氏使我得以进入波士顿上流社会。

Sense.DEF: strongly established and not likely to change — often used to show disapproval

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ageism is entrenched in our society.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对老年人的歧视在我们这个社会根深蒂固。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a deeply entrenched belief in male superiority
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 根深蒂固的大男子主义观念

Sense.DEF: when an attitude, belief etc becomes firmly established
a system of trencheslong deep holes dug by soldiers for defence or protection
used humorously to tell someone that what you are going to say is secret and they must not tell anyone else
someone who starts a new business or arranges business deals in order to make money, often in a way that involves financial risks
a lack of order in a system, including the idea that the lack of order increases over a period of time
to make someone responsible for doing something important, or for taking care of someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She entrusted her son’s education to a private tutor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把儿子的教育托付给了一位私人教师。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was entrusted with the task of looking after the money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我受托保管这笔钱。

Sense.DEF: the act of going into something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was dark and their entry into the camp had gone unnoticed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 天很黑﹐没人看见他们进入营地。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Harry made his entry into the village.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈里进了村子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There was no sign of a forced entry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有强行闯入的迹象。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How did the thieves gain entry get in?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窃贼是怎样进入的？

Sense.DEF: when someone starts to take part in a system, a particular kind of work etc, or the permission they need in order to do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Britain’s entry into the European Union
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国加入欧盟
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the minimum height for entry into the police force
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加入警队的最低身高要求
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This enabled European banks to gain entry into new markets.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这使得欧洲各银行能够进入新的市场。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the entry requirements for a degree course
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学位课程的入学要求

Sense.DEF: the right to enter a place, building etc
Sense.TRAN: 进入某地[某建筑物等]的权利

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Entry to the gardens is included in the price of admission.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 进入花园的费用包括在门票里。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The refugees were repeatedly refused entry into not allowed in the country.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民一再被拒绝进入该国。

GramExa.GLOSS: written on signs to show that you are not allowed to go somewhere

Sense.EXAMPLE: an entry visa
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 入境签证

Subsense.DEF: something that you write, make, do etc in order to try and win a competition
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The winning entry will be published in our April issue.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获胜作品将登在我们的四月刊上。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What’s the closing date for entries?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提交参赛作品的截止日期是几号？

Subsense.DEF: the number of people or things taking part in a competition
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’ve attracted a record entry this year.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年我们吸引来的参赛者数量空前。

Sense.DEF: a piece of writing in a diary, or in a book containing information such as a dictionary
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dictionary entry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 词典的条目

Sense.DEF: the act of putting information into a computer
Sense.EXAMPLE: data entry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数据录入

Sense.DEF: a door, gate, or passage that you go through to enter a place
a product etc that is the most basic or simple of its kind, making it suitable for people who do not have much money to spend or who do not have experience using the product
Sense.TRAN: 入门级产品/型号/计算机等

Sense.DEF: a type of telephone outside a building that allows visitors to ask someone inside to open the door
Sense.TRAN: 〔供楼房外访客呼叫楼内人开门的〕应门对讲机﹐门铃电话

Sense.DEF: a door, gate, room, or passage that you go through to enter a place
to twist two things together or to wind one thing around another
Sense.EXAMPLE: They walked together with their arms entwined.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们挽着胳膊一起走。

Sense.DEF: to be closely connected with something in a complicated way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our views of leadership are entwined with ideas of heroism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们认为领导才能与英雄品质是紧密相连的。

Sense.DEF: a number representing a chemical that has been added to a food, shown on the outside of a container
Sense.TRAN: E数〔标于食品容器外侧﹐说明内盛食品所含的特定化学品〕

Sense.DEF: to name a list of things one by one
to pronounce words clearly and carefully
to express an idea clearly and exactly
Sense.EXAMPLE: ideas that he was to enunciate decades later
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他将于数十年后清晰阐述的想法

Sense.DEF: another spelling of inure
to cover or wrap something or someone up completely

GramExa.EXAMPLE: mountain peaks enveloped in mist
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 笼罩在薄雾中的群峰

Sense.EXAMPLE: the enveloping darkness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 笼罩四周的黑暗

Sense.DEF: a thin paper cover in which you put and send a letter
Sense.EXAMPLE: envelopes and stamps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信封和邮票
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tore open the envelope and frantically read the letter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她撕开信封慌忙看信。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He got a job stuffing envelopes filling them with letters at the campaign headquarters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他找了一份在竞选总部装信封的工作。

Sense.DEF: a layer of something that surrounds something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an envelope of gases around the planet
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 包围着行星的大气层

Sense.DEF: to try to go beyond the normal limits of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a musician who pushes the envelope of improvisation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突破即兴演奏界限的音乐家

Sense.DEF: an enviable quality, position, or possession is good and other people would like to have it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now he was in the enviable position of not having to work for a living.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在他已不必为生计而工作﹐着实令人羡慕。

Sense.DEF: wanting something that someone else has

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Colleagues were envious of her success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 同事都羡慕她的成功。

Sense.EXAMPLE: envious looks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妒忌的神色

Sense.DEF: the air, water, and land on Earth, which is affected by man’s activities
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of these chemicals are very damaging to the environment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些化学品中有些对环境非常有害。
Sense.EXAMPLE: legislation to protect the environment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保护环境的法规
Sense.EXAMPLE: the effects of acid rain on the environment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酸雨对环境的影响
Sense.EXAMPLE: the government minister for the environment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 负责环境事务的政府部长

Sense.DEF: the people and things that are around you in your life, for example the buildings you use, the people you live or work with, and the general situation you are in
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company had failed to provide a safe environment for its workers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司没有为员工提供安全的工作环境。

Sense.DEF: the natural features of a place, for example its weather, the type of land it has, and the type of plants that grow in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a forest environment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 森林环境
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very adaptable creature that will eat different foods in different environments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种能在不同环境中吃不同食物的适应能力很强的生物

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We need to take drastic steps to protect the environment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要采取严厉措施来保护环境。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: protect it and prevent it from changing or being damaged
Collocate.EXAMPLE: People need to live in harmony with nature and conserve the environment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们应该与大自然和谐共存并保护环境。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government insists that the dam will not harm the environment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府坚称这座水坝不会损害环境。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We need to find ways of producing energy without destroying the environment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要找到不破坏环境的能源生产方式。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Nuclear waste will pollute the environment for centuries.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 核废物对环境的污染将持续几个世纪。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s about time that we started cleaning up the environment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们该整治环境了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Current methods of farming are damaging the natural environment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前的耕作方式对自然环境造成破坏。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the sea and the creatures that live there

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Plastic bags are bad for the environment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 塑料袋对环境有害。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Emissions from cars are harmful to the environment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车尾气对环境有害。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: In developing countries, protection of the environment is not a primary concern.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在发展中国家﹐环境保护不是人们主要关注的问题。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There are many organizations dedicated to conservation of the environment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有许多组织致力于环境保护。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A lot of chemicals used in industry cause harm to the environment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多工业用化学品会对环境造成损害。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Logging has led to the destruction of the natural environment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 采伐树木对自然环境造成了破坏。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The waste material must be stored safely to avoid pollution of the environment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 废料必须妥善存放以防污染环境。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The building’s design will minimize its impact on the environment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大楼的设计将其对环境的影响减至最小。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说‘hurt the environment’. Say 而要说 harm the environment or 或 damage the environment .

Sense.DEF: concerning or affecting the air, land, or water on Earth
Sense.TRAN: 自然环境的﹔生态环境的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the environmental damage caused by the chemical industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 化学工业对环境造成的破坏
Sense.EXAMPLE: an international meeting to discuss environmental issues
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 探讨环境问题的国际会议
Sense.EXAMPLE: the environmental impact of pollution from cars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车造成的污染对环境的影响
Sense.EXAMPLE: an environmental group group of people who want to protect the environment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境保护组织

Sense.DEF: concerning the people and things around you in your life, for example the buildings you use, the people you live or work with, and the general situation you are in
Sense.EXAMPLE: environmental risks to employees’ health
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影响雇员健康的环境隐患

Sense.DEF: the harmful effects of your activities on the environment
Sense.TRAN: 环境足迹〔指人类活动对环境造成的有害影响〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can reduce your environmental footprint by recycling as much as you can.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量对废物回收利用﹐可减少环境足迹。

Sense.DEF: someone who is concerned about protecting the environment
Sense.TRAN: 环境保护主义者﹐环境保护论者

Sense.DEF: not harmful to the environment
Sense.TRAN: 对环境无害的﹐不损害环境的

Sense.DEF: the area surrounding a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: people living in Geneva and its environs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 居住在日内瓦及其周围地区的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: outside the environs of the college
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在学院周围地区以外

Sense.DEF: to think that something is likely to happen in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: The scheme cost a lot more than we had originally envisaged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该计划的花费大大超出了我们最初所预想的数额。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t envisage working with him again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想象不出有再和他共事的可能。

Sense.DEF: to imagine something that you think might happen in the future, especially something that you think will be good
Sense.TRAN: 想象﹔展望〔尤指美好的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I envisioned a future of educational excellence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我展望了一个有着优质教育的未来。

Sense.DEF: someone who is sent to another country as an official representative
Sense.EXAMPLE: The United Nations is sending a special envoy to the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国将向该地区派遣一位特使。

Sense.DEF: to wish that you had someone else’s possessions, abilities etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I really envy you and Ian, you seem so happy together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真是羡慕你和伊恩﹐你俩在一起看起来多幸福。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has a lifestyle which most people would envy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的生活方式会令大多数人感到羡慕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He envied Rosalind her youth and strength.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他羡慕罗莎琳德的青春和活力。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are glad that you are not in the bad situation that someone else is in
Sense.TRAN: 我庆幸自己没遇到你/她等所处的糟糕情况

Sense.DEF: the feeling of wanting something that someone else has

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He watched the others with envy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他羡慕地看着其他人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his envy of the young man’s success
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对那年轻人所获成功的羡慕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I felt a twinge of envy when I saw them together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到他们在一起就感到一阵嫉妒。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She could see that all the other girls were green with envyfeeling a lot of envy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看得出其他女孩都很眼红。

Sense.DEF: to be something that other people admire and want to have very much
Sense.TRAN: 是令某人羡慕[嫉妒]的事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: an education system that is the envy of all European countries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令所有欧洲国家羡慕的教育制度

Sense.DEF: a chemical substance that is produced in a plant or animal, and helps chemical changes to take place in the plant or animal
another spelling of aeon
a small piece of cloth attached to the shoulder of a coat or shirt, especially on a military uniform
a narrow sword with a sharp point, used in the sport of fencing
small cheap things that people use in their ordinary life
Sense.EXAMPLE: a collection of sporting ephemera
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一批体育用品
