Sense.DEF: existing or popular for only a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fashion is by nature ephemeral.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从本质上说﹐时尚不过是一时的潮流。

Sense.DEF: a book, poem, or film that tells a long story about brave actions and exciting events
Sense.TRAN: 长篇敍事性小说[诗歌﹐电影]﹔史诗般的作品
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Hollywood epic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好莱坞史诗电影

Sense.DEF: an epic book, poem, or film tells a long story about brave actions and exciting events
Sense.TRAN: 英雄的﹐英勇的﹔史诗般的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an epic tale of mutiny on the high seas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于公海哗变的惊心动魄的故事
Sense.EXAMPLE: epic poetry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史诗

Sense.DEF: an epic event continues for a long time and involves brave or exciting actions
Sense.EXAMPLE: his epic journey to South America
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他远赴南美洲的漫长而艰险的旅程

Sense.DEF: very large and impressive
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had produced a meal of epic proportions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他做了一顿丰盛的饭菜。

Sense.DEF: the place on the surface of the Earth that is right above the point where an earthquake begins inside the Earth
the place where the most important things happen and important decisions are made
Sense.EXAMPLE: London became the epicentre of the world fashion industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦成了世界时装业的中心。

Sense.DEF: someone who enjoys good food and drink
gaining pleasure from the senses, especially through good food and drink
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过美食〕享乐的﹔爱奢侈享受的

Sense.DEF: a large number of cases of a disease that happen at the same time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over 500 people died during last year’s flu epidemic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年流感大暴发期间有五百多人死亡。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an epidemic of cholera
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍乱的流行

Sense.DEF: a sudden increase in the number of times that something bad happens
Sense.TRAN: 〔坏事的〕发生次数陡增﹐频率突增

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Britain is suffering an epidemic of petty crime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前英国轻微罪案频发。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Violent crime is reaching epidemic proportions in some cities.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些城市的暴力犯罪活动几近泛滥。

Sense.DEF: the study of the way diseases spread, and how to control them
the outside layer of your skin
a drug that is put into your back using a needle, done to prevent you feeling pain, especially when having a baby
the scientific study of changes in the behaviour of genes that are caused by things that a living thing experiences
the piece of flesh that hangs down at the back of your throat
a short sentence that expresses an idea in a clever or amusing way
a short sentence written on a statue, or used as an introduction to a book
Sense.TRAN: 〔雕塑的〕刻文﹐铭文﹔〔书籍的〕引言

Sense.DEF: a medical condition affecting your brain, that can make you suddenly become unconscious or unable to control your movements for a short time
caused by epilepsy
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had an epileptic fit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他癫痫发作了。

Sense.DEF: someone who has epilepsy
a speech or piece of writing that is added to the end of a book, film, or play and discusses or explains the ending
Sense.TRAN: 〔书的〕跋﹐后记﹔〔电影﹑戏剧的〕收场白

Sense.DEF: something that happens at the end of a series of events
Sense.EXAMPLE: a disastrous epilogue to his career
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他事业的灾难性终结

Sense.DEF: a medical instrument shaped like a large thick pen with a needle at one end, designed so that someone can inject a special drug into their body quickly and easily if they are having a severe allergic reactionare extremely ill because of eating or touching a particular substance or an asthma attack that might kill them.
Sense.TRAN: 肾上腺素自动注射器〔用于缓解食物或接触性过敏以及致命的哮喘病发〕

Sense.DEF: a Christian holy day on January 6th that celebrates the day when the Three Kings came to see the baby Jesus
Sense.TRAN: 主显节〔1月6日﹐纪念三博士拜见圣婴耶稣的基督教节日〕

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you suddenly understand something
relating to a bishop
Sense.EXAMPLE: his episcopal duties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的主教职责

Sense.DEF: a group of Christians in the US and Scotland
an event or a short period of time during which something happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: She decided she would try to forget the episode by the lake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决心尽量忘掉湖边的那次经历。
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the most interesting episodes in his career
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他职业生涯中最有趣的时期之一

Sense.DEF: a television or radio programme that is one of a series of programmes in which the same story is continued each week
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视连续剧或广播连载节目中的〕一集
Sense.EXAMPLE: Watch next week’s thrilling episode!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请收看下周精彩的一集！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the first episode of a new drama series
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新电视连续剧的第一集

Sense.DEF: something that is episodic happens from time to time and then stops for a while, rather than happening all the time
Sense.EXAMPLE: his episodic involvement in politics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对政治的偶尔参与

Sense.DEF: an episodic story or memory is one in which a lot of different events happen that do not follow on from each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔故事或记忆〕由松散片段组成的﹐不连贯的

Sense.DEF: a long or important letter
one of the letters in the New Testament of the Bible
written in the form of a letter or a series of letters
Sense.EXAMPLE: an epistolary novel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 书信体小说

Sense.DEF: a short piece of writing on the stone over someone’s graveplace in the ground where someone is buried
a word or short phrase used to describe someone, especially when praising them or saying something unpleasant about them
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤用于褒贬某人的〕表述词语
Sense.EXAMPLE: He hardly deserves the epithet ‘fascist’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用“法西斯分子”这个词来形容他并不恰当。

Sense.DEF: the best possible example of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked the epitome of elegance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看上去像是优雅的典范。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was the very epitome of evil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是邪恶的典型。

Sense.DEF: to be a very typical example of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: This building epitomizes the spirit of the nineteenth century.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这栋建筑体现了19世纪的时代精神。

Sense.DEF: a period of history
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Victorian epoch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维多利亚时代
Sense.EXAMPLE: The king’s death marked the end of an epoch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位国王的去世标志着一个时代的结束。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the beginning of a new epoch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新纪元的开始

Sense.DEF: very important in changing the way people live or the way a society is organized
Sense.TRAN: 划时代的﹐开创新纪元的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the epoch-making social changes of the 1960s
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪60年代划时代的社会变化

Sense.DEF: the eponymous character in a book, film, or play is the character whose name is in its title
Sense.TRAN: 〔书﹑电影或戏剧中的角色〕与作品同名的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hester, the book’s eponymous heroine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与本书同名的女主人公赫斯特

Sense.DEF: a type of glue
a white powder that can be mixed with water and used as a medicine
the business of producing books, magazines, or newspapers that are designed to be read using a computer
someone who is equable remains calm and happy and does not often get annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young man with a naturally equable temperament
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生性温和的年轻人

Sense.DEF: equable weather is neither too hot nor too cold
Sense.EXAMPLE: a place with a pleasant, equable climate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 气候温和宜人的地方

Sense.DEF: the same in size, number, amount, value etc as something else
Sense.TRAN: 〔在大小﹑数字﹑数量﹑价值等方面〕相等的﹐相同的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Both candidates received an equal number of votes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两位候选人的得票数相等。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They believe that all work is of equal value.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们认为一切工作都有同等价值。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two towns are roughly equal in size.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个城镇的大小差不多。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 大小/长度/高度等相等的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rent was equal to half his monthly income.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这租金相当于他半个月的收入。

Sense.DEF: having the same rights, opportunities etc as everyone else, whatever your race, religion, or sex
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our constitution states that all men are equal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的宪法规定人人平等。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our education system should provide equal opportunities for all children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的教育制度应该为所有儿童提供平等的机会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government is committed to achieving equal rights for women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府承诺要为妇女争取平等的权利。

Subsense.DEF: to have the ability to deal with a problem, piece of work etc successfully
Subsense.TRAN: 能胜任某事﹐能应付难题[任务等]
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m not sure he’s equal to the task.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不确定他是否能胜任这项任务。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Are you equal to this challenge?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能应付这项挑战吗？

Subsense.DEF: to be as good as something else
Subsense.TRAN: 与某物同样出色﹐比得上某物
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The architecture here is equal to any in the world.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的建筑堪与世界上任何建筑媲美。

Sense.LEXUNIT: on equal terms/on an equal footing
Sense.DEF: with neither side having any advantage over the other
Sense.EXAMPLE: This law will help small businesses to compete on equal terms with large multinational corporations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项法规有助于小公司与跨国大公司展开平等的竞争。

Sense.DEF: if things are as you normally expect them to be
Sense.TRAN: 如果所有(其他)条件相同
Sense.EXAMPLE: All things being equal, a small car will cost less than a larger one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在同等的条件下﹐小汽车要比大一点的汽车便宜。

Sense.DEF: to be exactly the same in size, number, or amount as something else
Sense.TRAN: 〔在大小﹑数字﹑数量上〕等于﹐与…相同
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two plus two equals four.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 二加二等于四。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prices become more stable when supply equals demand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 供需相当时价格就变得较为稳定。

Sense.DEF: to be as good as something else, or get to the same standard as someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thompson equalled the world record.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤普森平了世界纪录。

Sense.DEF: used to say that two things are as strong or as important as each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her distaste for books was equalled only by her dislike of people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她讨厌书﹐其程度之深只有她对人的厌恶可以相比。

Sense.DEF: to produce a particular result or effect
Sense.TRAN: 产生﹐得出〔特定结果或效果〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A highly-trained workforce equals high productivity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 训练有素的劳动力能创造高生产力。

Sense.DEF: someone who is as important, intelligent etc as you are, or who has the same rights and opportunities as you do
Sense.EXAMPLE: He treats all his staff as equals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对所有员工都一视同仁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a friendship between equals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同等者之间的友谊

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She wasn’t his equal in intelligence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在智力上﹐她没法和他相比。

Sense.DEF: to be as good as someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company proved to be the equal of its US rivals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事实证明该公司可与其美国竞争对手抗衡。

Sense.DEF: to be better than everyone or everything else of the same type
Sense.EXAMPLE: His paintings are without equal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的画无与伦比。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which people have the same rights, advantages etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All people have the right to equality of opportunity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都有获得均等机会的权利。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Women have yet to achieve full equality with men in the workplace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性仍未在职场中实现与男性完全平等。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: equality between men and women
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 男女平等

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government must promote racial equality.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府必须促进种族平等。

Sense.DEF: to make two or more things the same in size, value, amount etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在大小﹑价值﹑数量等上〕使相等﹐使平等
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have tried to equalize the workload between the different teachers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们力求把工作量平均分配给各位老师。

Sense.DEF: to get a point in a game, so that you have the same number of points as your opponent
Sense.EXAMPLE: England equalized ten minutes later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰队在十分钟后将比分扳平。

Sense.DEF: a point that you score in a game, that gives you the same number of points as your opponent
Sense.EXAMPLE: England scored the equalizer with only ten minutes to go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰队在比赛只剩十分钟时进了一球﹐将比分扳平。

Sense.DEF: something that makes all people equal because everyone experiences it in the same way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sport is a great equalizer in schools.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体育运动是学校里参与机会人人平等的重要项目。

Sense.DEF: to the same degree or amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must have a good education, but practical training is equally important.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须接受良好的教育﹐不过实际培训也同样重要。

Sense.DEF: in equal parts or amounts
Sense.EXAMPLE: We agreed to divide the money equally between everyone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们同意把钱平分给每个人。

Sense.DEF: used when introducing a second idea or statement that is as important as your first one
Sense.EXAMPLE: We want the economy to grow, but equally we want low inflation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望经济发展﹐但也同样希望保持低通胀率。

Sense.DEF: the sign (=) that you use in mathematics to show that two things are the same size, number, or amount
calmness in the way that you react to things, which means that you do not become upset or annoyed
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某事反应的〕平和﹐镇静﹐沉着
Sense.EXAMPLE: He received the news with surprising equanimity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他得到消息时显得异常镇静。

Sense.DEF: to consider that two things are similar or connected

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most people equate wealth with success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数人把财富等同于成功。

Sense.DEF: to be equal to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rate of pay which equates to £6 per hour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相当于每小时6英镑的报酬

Sense.DEF: a statement in mathematics that shows that two amounts or totals are equal
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the equation 2x + 1 = 7, what is x?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在方程式2x+1=7中﹐x的值为多少？

Sense.DEF: the set of different facts, ideas, or people that all affect a situation and must be considered together
Sense.TRAN: 〔须综合考虑的〕影响因素﹔〔多种因素的〕综合体
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tourist industry forms a crucial part of the region’s economic equation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游业构成该地区经济总量中至关重要的一部分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The question of cost has now entered the equation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成本问题现已成为影响因素。

Sense.DEF: when you consider that two things are similar or connected
Sense.EXAMPLE: the equation of violence with power
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力与权力之间的联系

Sense.DEF: an imaginary line drawn around the middle of the Earth that is exactly the same distance from the North Pole and the South Pole

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a small village near the equator
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 赤道附近的小村庄

Sense.DEF: near the equator
Sense.EXAMPLE: equatorial rain forests
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赤道雨林

Sense.DEF: equatorial weather is very hot and wet
Sense.TRAN: 〔气候〕赤道地区特有的﹔非常湿热的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an equatorial climate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 湿热气候

Sense.DEF: relating to horse-riding
Sense.EXAMPLE: equestrian sports
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马术运动

Sense.DEF: at an equal distance from two places

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The city is equidistant between London and Glasgow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该市与伦敦和格拉斯哥距离相同。

Sense.DEF: a triangle whose three sides are all the same length
a balance between different people, groups, or forces that compete with each other, so that none is stronger than the others and a situation is not likely to change suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government is anxious not to upset the economic equilibrium.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府急切希望不要打乱经济平衡。

Sense.DEF: a state in which you are calm and not angry or upset
Sense.TRAN: 〔心情﹑情绪的〕平静﹐安宁﹔心理平衡
Sense.EXAMPLE: She struggled to recover her equilibrium.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她竭力恢复平静。

Sense.DEF: relating to horses, or looking like a horse
one of the two times in a year when night and day are of equal length
Sense.TRAN: 二分时刻﹐昼夜平分时〔指春分或秋分〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the spring equinox
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 春分

Sense.DEF: to provide a person or place with the things that are needed for a particular kind of activity or work

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They spent a lot of money equipping the school with new computers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们花了很多钱给学校配备新计算机。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He equipped himself with a hammer and nails.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他带了一把锤子和一些钉子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rooms are equipped with video cameras.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里都装有摄像头。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The emergency services are equipped to deal with disasters of this kind.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 应急服务机构的人员配有装备﹐可处理此类灾难事件。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a well equipped hospital
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 设备完善的医院

Sense.DEF: to give someone the information and skills that they need to do something
Sense.TRAN: 使有知识和技能﹐使能够胜任

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We equip students with the skills they will need once they leave college.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们向学生传授大学毕业后所需要的技能。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: training that will equip you for the job
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 能使你胜任这份工作的培训

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We must equip young teachers to deal with difficult children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须指导年轻教师如何应付不听话的孩子。

Sense.DEF: the tools, machines etc that you need to do a particular job or activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shop selling camping equipment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出售露营装备的商店
Sense.EXAMPLE: some brand new computer equipment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些全新的计算机设备
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very useful piece of equipment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件非常有用的设备

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Equipment is an uncountable noun and has no plural form. Use a singular verb after it. equipment
F2NBox.TRAN: 是不可数名词﹐没有复数形式﹐其后要用单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Make sure all equipment is properly labelled.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 务必正确标示所有设备。
F2NBox.EXPL: You can refer to one or more pieces/items/bits of equipment.
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示一件或多件设备可以说 piece(s)/ item(s)/bit(s) of equipment
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: All items of equipment remain the property of the company.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有设备均属公司财产。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say stuff or, in British English, things rather than equipment.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说 stuff﹐在英国英语中说 things﹐而不说 equipment
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Have you got your tennis stuff?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 打网球的东西你带了吗？

Sense.DEF: the process of equipping someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某人或某物的〕装备过程﹔配备

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A lot of money was spent on the equipment of the new hospital.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新医院的装备花费巨大。

Sense.DEF: treating all people in a fair and equal way
Sense.EXAMPLE: an equitable distribution of food supplies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所供应食品的合理分配

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The work should be shared more equitably.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项工作应该更公平合理地分担。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which all people are treated equally and no one has an unfair advantage
Sense.EXAMPLE: a society run on the principles of equity and justice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以公平﹑正义为原则的社会

Sense.DEF: the amount of money that you would have left if you sold your house and paid off the money you borrowed to buy the house
shares in a company from which the owner of the shares receives some of the company’s profits rather than a fixed regular payment
Sense.TRAN: 〔分享红利而非固定股息的〕股票

Sense.DEF: the principle that a fair judgment must be made in a situation where the existing laws do not provide an answer
Sense.TRAN: 衡平法〔一种原则﹐指现存法律不适用时﹐应当作出公正的裁决〕

Sense.DEF: having the same value, purpose, job etc as a person or thing of a different kind

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a qualification which is equivalent to a degree
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 相当于学位的资历

Sense.EXAMPLE: I had no dollars, but offered him an equivalent amount of sterling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有美金﹐但给了他等值的英镑。

Sense.DEF: something that has the same value, purpose, job etc as something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The word has no equivalent in English.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个单词在英语中没有对应词。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had drunk the equivalent of 15 whiskies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他相当于喝了15杯威士忌酒。

Sense.DEF: if you are equivocal, you are deliberately unclear in the way that you give information or your opinion
Sense.TRAN: 〔所给的信息或意见〕模棱两可的﹐含糊的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His answer was equivocal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的回答模棱两可。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was rather equivocal about her work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她谈到她的工作时有点含糊其词。

Sense.DEF: information that is equivocal is difficult to understand or explain because it contains different parts which suggest that different things are true
Sense.TRAN: 〔信息〕难以理解的﹐难以解释的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The results of the police enquiry were equivocal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方的调查结果令人费解。

Sense.DEF: to avoid giving a clear or direct answer to a question
Sense.TRAN: 含糊其词﹐作模棱两可的回答

Sense.DEF: a sound you make when you do not know exactly what to say next
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, er – I’m not really sure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个﹐哦——我不太有把握。

Sense.DEF: forms the comparative of many short adjectives and adverbs
Sense.TRAN: 〔附在许多短小的形容词或副词后﹐构成比较级〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: hot, hotter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热﹐更热
Sense.EXAMPLE: dry, drier
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干燥﹐更干燥
Sense.EXAMPLE: fast, faster
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快﹐更快

Sense.DEF: someone who does something or is doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dancer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舞蹈演员﹔跳舞的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a driver
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 驾驶员

Sense.DEF: something that does something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scraper a tool you use for scraping
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刮刀﹔刮削器

Sense.DEF: a period of time in history that is known for a particular event, or for particular qualities

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We live in an era of instant communication.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们生活在一个信息即时交流的时代。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new era of world peace
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界和平的新时代

Sense.EXAMPLE: His death marked the end of an era.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的去世标志着一个时代的终结。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Victorian era
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维多利亚时代

Sense.DEF: to completely get rid of something such as a disease or a social problem

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We can eradicate this disease from the world.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们能把这种疾病从世界上根除。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to eradicate inflation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为消除通货膨胀所作的努力
Sense.EXAMPLE: This problem has now been completely eradicated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题现已彻底杜绝。

Sense.DEF: to remove information from a computer memory or recorded sounds from a tape
Sense.TRAN: 删除〔计算机文件〕﹔抹去〔磁带录音〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The computer crashed, and all our records were erased.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机瘫痪了﹐我们所有的记录都被删除了。

Sense.DEF: to remove writing from paper
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the names had been accidentally erased.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个名字无意中被擦掉了。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of something so that it has gone completely and no longer exists
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their dream is to erase poverty and injustice from the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的梦想是消除世上的贫困和不公。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He couldn’t erase the image from his mind.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他无法忘却那个画面。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She had tried to erase the memory of that day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她试图忘记那天的事情。

Sense.DEF: a small piece of rubber that you use to remove pencil or pen marks from paper
when you erase something, or when something is erased
Sense.EXAMPLE: a way to avoid accidental erasure of data from your computer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 避免无意中删除计算机资料的方法

Sense.DEF: before
in a straight upright position
Sense.EXAMPLE: Martin stood erect on the platform.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马丁在讲台上笔直地站着。

Sense.DEF: an erect penis or nipple is stiff and bigger than it usually is because a person is sexually excited
to build something such as a building or wall
Sense.EXAMPLE: an imposing town hall, erected in 1892
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座气势宏伟的市政厅﹐建于1892年
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police have erected barriers across the main roads into the town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察在进城的主要道路上设立了路障。

Sense.DEF: to fix all the pieces of something together, and put it in an upright position
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took a couple of hours to erect the tent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 搭帐篷花了几个小时。

Sense.DEF: to establish something such as a system or institution
if a man has an erection, his penis increases in size and becomes stiff and upright because he is sexually excited
the act of building something or putting it in an upright position

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the erection of a new temple
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 建造新寺庙

Sense.DEF: an electronic written record of your education and previous jobs that you send to an employer over the Internet when you are looking for a new job

an ergative verb can be either transitive or intransitive, with the same word used as the object of the transitive form and as the subject of the intransitive form, such as ‘cooked’ in the sentences ‘He cooked the potatoes’ and ‘The potatoes cooked quickly’
Sense.TRAN: 作格的〔作格动词可以及物也可以不及物﹐即同一个名词既可以作它的宾语也可以作它的主语﹐如He cooked the potatoes 和 The potatoes cooked quickly 这两个句子中的cooked〕

Sense.DEF: therefore
the way in which the careful design of equipment helps people to work better and more quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were very impressed with the machine’s ergonomics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对这台机器的工效印象颇深。

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写=exchange rate mechanism汇率机制

Sense.DEF: an expensive white fur, used especially for the formal clothes of judges, kings, and queens
Sense.TRAN: 白鼬皮〔尤用于法官﹑国王和女王的正式服饰〕

Sense.DEF: a small animal whose fur is white in winter
if the weather erodes rock or soil, or if rock or soil erodes, its surface is gradually destroyed
Sense.TRAN: 〔气候〕侵蚀﹐腐蚀﹔〔岩石﹑土壤〕风化
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cliffs are being constantly eroded by heavy seas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 悬崖正不断受到汹涌海浪的侵蚀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rocks have gradually eroded away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 岩石逐渐风化。

Sense.DEF: to gradually reduce something such as someone’s power or confidence
Sense.TRAN: 逐步损害﹐渐渐削弱〔权力或信心〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our personal freedom is being gradually eroded away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的个人自由正逐渐受到限制。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Repeated exam failure had eroded her confidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考试屡屡不及格削弱了她的自信心。

Sense.DEF: a part of your body that gives you sexual pleasure when it is touched
the process by which rock or soil is gradually destroyed by wind, rain, or the sea
Sense.EXAMPLE: the problem of soil erosion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水土流失的问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: the erosion of the coastline
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海岸线受到的侵蚀

Sense.DEF: the process by which something is gradually reduced or destroyed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the gradual erosion of our civil liberties
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的公民自由逐渐受到侵害

Sense.DEF: an erotic book, picture, or film shows people having sex, and is intended to make people reading or looking at it have feelings of sexual pleasure
erotic thoughts, feelings, or experiences involve sexual excitement
Sense.EXAMPLE: an erotic dream
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 春梦

Sense.DEF: erotic pictures, films, and writing
Sense.TRAN: 色情书画﹔色情电影﹔色情(文学)作品

Sense.DEF: a style or quality that expresses strong feelings of sexual love and desire, especially in works of art
Sense.EXAMPLE: the eroticism of his early love poems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他早期爱情诗中的色情描写

Sense.LEXUNIT: err on the side of sth
Sense.DEF: to be more careful or safe than is necessary, in order to make sure that nothing bad happens
Sense.TRAN: 宁愿过于谨慎也不冒险犯错
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s always best to err on the side of caution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过于谨慎永远比冒风险强。

Sense.DEF: to make a mistake
a short journey in order to do something for someone, for example delivering or collecting something for them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I seemed to spend my life running errands for people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我好像一辈子都在为别人跑腿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was always sending me on errands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她老是支使我。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t stop because I was on an errand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能逗留﹐因为我有差事在身。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He quickly set out on his errand of mercy journey to help someone in danger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他迅速启程参加救援行动。

Sense.DEF: behaving badly, usually by not obeying your parents or not being faithful to your husband or wife
Sense.TRAN: 〔孩子〕不听话的﹔〔丈夫或妻子〕对配偶不忠的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an errant wife
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不忠的妻子
Sense.EXAMPLE: their errant son
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不听话的儿子

Sense.DEF: something that is erratic does not follow any pattern or plan but happens in a way that is not regular
Sense.TRAN: 不规则的﹔不确定的﹔不稳定的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His breathing was becoming erratic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的呼吸越来越不均匀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: his erratic behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他难以捉摸的行为

Sense.DEF: a mistake in a book, shown in a list added after the book is printed
erroneous ideas or information are wrong and based on facts that are not correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: His economic predictions are based on some erroneous assumptions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的经济预测是基于错误假设之上的。

Sense.DEF: a mistake

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There must be an error in our calculations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的计算肯定有错。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Error is rather formal and is mainly used when talking about computers or in some fixed expressions such as human error . In everyday English, people usually use mistake . error
F2NBox.TRAN: 相当正式﹐主要用于与计算机相关的语境中﹐或用于 human error 等固定搭配。在日常英语中﹐人们一般用 mistake
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: There must be a mistake somewhere.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定是哪里出了错。

Sense.DEF: a mistake when you are working on a computer, which means that the computer program cannot do what you want it to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: an error message
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出错信息

Sense.DEF: a mistake in the way that you examine a situation and decide what to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: The decision to expand the company was an error of judgement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扩展公司业务的决定是判断失误。

Sense.DEF: to have made a mistake, especially when making an official decision
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在作正式决定时〕犯错﹐失误
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor has admitted that he was in error.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生承认了他的失误。

Sense.DEF: if you do something in error, you do it by mistake
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wrong man was arrested in error.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那人是被误抓的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: see the error of your ways
Sense.DEF: to realize that you have been behaving badly and decide to stop
Sense.TRAN: 意识到自己的过失并准备改正﹐知错即改

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We made too many errors, and that cost us the game.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们失误太多﹐输掉了这场比赛。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make an error, especially a serious one
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 犯错误〔尤指严重的错误〕
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He knew he had committed a grave error of judgement.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他知道自己犯了个严重的判断错误。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: If the data contains errors, the results will be wrong.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是数据有误﹐结果就会出错。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His accountant spotted several errors in his tax return.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的会计发现他的纳税申报单有几处错误。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: By the time she realized her error, it was too late.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 等她意识到自己的错误时﹐为时已晚。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We will rectify the error as soon as possible.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会尽快纠正错误。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make it worse
happens

Collocate.EXAMPLE: a common error which students often make when writing essays
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生写作文时常犯的错误

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The police made a serious error, which resulted in a young man’s death.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方犯了严重的错误﹐导致一名年轻男子死亡。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The letter contained some minor spelling errors.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 信中有几处小的拼写错误。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very bad and very noticeable
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is a glaring error on page 10, where his date of death is given as 2053, not 1003.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 第10页有一个明显错误﹐他的卒年写成了2053年﹐应该是1003年。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very serious
extremely serious, with serious results
extremely serious, so that you are certain to fail
which includes a fact that is wrong
one that may cause a plan to fail
one that is not like others or part of a pattern
errors made by people
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Automatic checks reduce the danger of human error.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 自动核查可以自动降低人为失误的风险。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: An on-board computer error meant that the plane’s systems shut down for a few vital seconds.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 机载计算机出错意味着机上各系统在关键时刻关闭了几秒钟。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 飞行员/驾驶员操作失误

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the degree to which a calculation might be wrong
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We have to allow for a small margin of error in the calculations.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得考虑计算中的细微误差。

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the nouns error and mistake in spoken and written English. 名词 error 和 mistake 在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。

This graph shows that the word mistake is more common in spoken English than the word error. This is because error is not used in a very general way. It is used when describing particular types of mistake, for example in the expressions computer error or error of judgement, and sounds formal when used on its own. It is therefore more common in written English. 本图表显示﹐mistake 在英语口语中比 error 常用。 这是因为 error 不用于泛指﹐而用于描述某种特定的错误﹐如 computer error 或 error of judgement 等﹐单独使用时听起来也很正式。 因此﹐error 在英语书面语中更为常用。

Sense.DEF: artificial, and not as good as the real thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: ersatz coffee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 代用咖啡

Sense.DEF: former or in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: She found herself ostracized by erstwhile friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发现自己被以前的朋友排斥。
Sense.EXAMPLE: his erstwhile allies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以前的盟友

Sense.DEF: showing a lot of knowledge based on careful study
if fighting, violence, noise etc erupts, it starts suddenly
Sense.TRAN: 〔搏斗﹑暴力事件﹑噪音等〕突然发生﹔爆发
Sense.EXAMPLE: Violence erupted after police shot a student during the demonstration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察向示威人群中的一名学生开枪﹐暴乱随之发生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A political row erupted over the MP’s comments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名下院议员的评论引发了一场政治论战。

Sense.DEF: if a volcano erupts, it explodes and sends smoke, fire, and rock into the sky
if a place or situation erupts, there is a sudden increase in activity or emotion

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were angry to the point of erupting into riot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们气得几乎要闹事了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their conversations often erupted into squabbles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们谈话时经常会突然争吵起来。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly start laughing, shouting etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He erupted into loud, desperate sobs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然拼命地大声抽泣起来。

Sense.DEF: if spots erupt on your body, they suddenly appear on your skin
Sense.TRAN: 〔丘疹等在皮肤上〕突然出现﹐冒出

Sense.DEF: a quality or condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: bravery the quality of being brave
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 勇气
Sense.EXAMPLE: slavery the condition of being a slave
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奴隶身份

Sense.DEF: things of a particular kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: machinery different types of machines
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机械
Sense.EXAMPLE: all her finery beautiful clothes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她所有的华丽衣服

Sense.DEF: a place where a particular activity happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bakery where bread is baked
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面包房
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oil refinery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炼油厂

Sense.DEF: if fighting, violence, or a bad situation escalates, or if someone escalates it, it becomes much worse
Sense.TRAN: (使)〔战斗﹑暴力事件或不好的情况〕升级﹔(使)恶化

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her fear was escalating into panic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她越来越害怕﹐最后变得惊慌失措。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The fighting on the border is escalating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 边境地区的战事在不断升级。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We do not want to escalate the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不想让战争升级。

Sense.DEF: to become higher or increase, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The costs were escalating alarmingly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成本在以惊人的速度增长。
Sense.EXAMPLE: policies that escalate their own costs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 促使其自身成本增加的政策
Sense.EXAMPLE: escalating crime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愈演愈烈的犯罪活动

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the escalation of fighting in June 6

Sense.DEF: a set of moving stairs that take people to different levels in a building
a thin piece of meat with no bones in it, especially vealmeat from a young cow, cooked in hot oil
Sense.TRAN: 油煎薄肉片〔尤指小牛肉〕

Sense.DEF: an adventure or series of events that are exciting or contain some risk
Sense.EXAMPLE: their dangerous escapades in the Great War
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在第一次世界大战中的冒险行为

Sense.DEF: a sexual relationship that is exciting or risky, but that is not considered serious
Sense.TRAN: 〔不当真的〕刺激[冒险]的性关系

Sense.DEF: to leave a place when someone is trying to catch you or stop you, or when there is a dangerous situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: He broke down the locked door and escaped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他砸开上锁的门﹐逃走了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He escaped from prison in October.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在10月份越狱逃跑了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She escaped to Britain in 1938.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她于1938年逃到了英国。

Sense.DEF: to get away from a dangerous or bad situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔从危险或糟糕的处境中〕逃离﹐逃避﹐摆脱

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He escaped with minor injuries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他逃了出来﹐受了点轻伤。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A boy escaped unhurt when the fire in his room exploded.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名男孩在其房间失火引发爆炸时安然逃脱。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They went to the hills to escape the summer heat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们去山中避暑了。

GramExa.GLOSS: escape from someone

Sense.EXAMPLE: The youth was trying to escape the clutches of two drunken female companions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个小伙子试图摆脱两名醉酒女伴的纠缠。

Sense.DEF: to avoid something bad or that you do not want to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: He narrowly escaped death in an avalanche.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一次雪崩中死里逃生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two passengers escaped serious injury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那两名乘客逃过一劫﹐未受重伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They must not be allowed to escape justice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 决不能让他们逃脱法律的制裁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seemed impossible he would escape detection.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他似乎不可能不被发现。

Sense.DEF: if gas, liquid, light, heat etc escapes from somewhere, it comes out
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vents allow any steam to escape if the system overheats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果系统过热﹐排放口可使蒸汽逸出。

Sense.DEF: if a sound escapes from someone, they accidentally make that sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: A small laugh escaped her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不由得轻声笑了出来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Holman let a weary sigh escape from his lips.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍尔曼不由得疲惫地叹了口气。

Sense.DEF: if something escapes your attention or notice, you do not see it or realize that it is there
Sense.TRAN: 逃过某人的注意﹔被某人忽视

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone cannot remember something
Sense.TRAN: 某人记不起某个名字/日期/名称等
Sense.EXAMPLE: For some reason which escapes me, we had to take a taxi.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 忘记是为什么了﹐我们只好坐了出租车。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is definitely important or will definitely happen
Sense.TRAN: 不可否认的是﹔毫无疑问
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no escaping the fact that work has profound effects on emotions and health.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毫无疑问﹐工作会对情绪和健康产生极大的影响。

Exponent.DEF: to leave a place when someone is trying to catch you or stop you, or when there is a dangerous situation
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The thief escaped through an upstairs window.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 窃贼从楼上的一扇窗户逃走了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She managed to escape from her attacker and call the police.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她设法逃离袭击者并报了警。

Exponent.DEF: to escape from someone who is chasing you, especially when there is no chance that you will be caught. Get away is more informal than escape.
Exponent.TRAN: 逃脱﹐摆脱〔追捕者﹐尤用于不可能被抓住时﹔get away不如escape正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The robbers got away but left plenty of clues at the scene.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 劫匪逃走了﹐却在现场留下许多线索。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Don’t let him get away!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 别让他跑了！

Exponent.DEF: to escape from someone who is holding you
Exponent.TRAN: 逃脱﹐挣脱〔抓着自己的人〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She broke free and started running.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她挣脱开后撒腿就跑。

Exponent.DEF: to leave somewhere very quickly in order to escape from danger
Exponent.TRAN: 〔为避开危险而〕迅速离开﹐逃走
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many people were forced to flee the country.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人被迫逃离这个国家。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The two men fled before police arrived.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那两名男子在警察赶到之前逃走了。

Exponent.DEF: to escape from a building or room
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was locked in the room and couldn’t get out.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被锁在房间里﹐逃不出去。

Exponent.DEF: to escape from prison
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The jail is so secure that no one has ever broken out of it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所监狱戒备森严﹐从未有人越狱成功。

Exponent.DEF: to escape from a prison or institution where you are supposed to stay
Exponent.TRAN: 〔从监狱或应留守的机构中〕逃走
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Three prisoners who absconded have still not been found.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 三名越狱的犯人依然下落不明。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He absconded from a psychiatric hospital.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从精神病院逃跑了。

Sense.DEF: the act of getting away from a place, or a dangerous or bad situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The girl had no chance of escape.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那女孩没有机会逃跑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Christina hoped it wouldn’t be too long before she could make her escape.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯蒂娜希望她很快就能逃脱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the firm’s narrow escape from bankruptcy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司险些破产

Sense.EXAMPLE: an escape route
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 逃跑的路线
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had a lucky escape were lucky not to be hurt or killed when a car crashed into the front of their house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆汽车迎面撞上了他们的房子﹐他们没有受伤真是幸运。

Sense.DEF: a way of forgetting about a bad or boring situation for a short time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Travel can be an escape from the routine drudgery of life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅行可让人暂时从乏味的日常生活中解脱出来。

Sense.DEF: an amount of gas, liquid etc that accidentally comes out of the place where it is being kept, or an occasion when this happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lid prevents the escape of poisonous gases.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这盖子可以防止毒气泄漏。

Sense.DEF: an escaped person or animal has escaped from somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: an escaped prisoner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 逃犯

Sense.DEF: someone who has escaped from somewhere
the speed at which a rocket must travel in order to get into space
Sense.TRAN: 逃逸速度〔火箭进入太空所需的速度〕

Sense.DEF: activities or entertainment that help you forget about bad or boring things for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Books were a form of escapism from the real world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看书是一种逃避现实世界的消遣。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 逃避现实的纯娱乐性活动

Sense.DEF: someone who escapes from ropes, chains, a cage etc to entertain people
a high steep slope or cliff between two levels on a hill or mountain

a legal process in which someone’s money and property are given to the state after they die if they do not have a will, or if there is nobody else with a legal right to receive their money or property
Sense.TRAN: 财产转归国家〔在某人死后无遗嘱或无法定继承人的情况下执行〕

Sense.DEF: to deliberately avoid doing or using something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had eschewed politics in favour of a life practising law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我选择从事律师职业﹐有意避开了政治。

Sense.DEF: to take someone somewhere, especially when you are protecting or guarding them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shipment was escorted by guards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 货物的运输由卫兵护送。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two Marines escorted Benny inside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名美国海军陆战队士兵护送本尼进去。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I escorted her to the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我送她到门口。

Sense.DEF: to go with someone and show them a place
Sense.TRAN: 陪同〔某人〕游览﹐给〔某人〕当导游

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company escorts prospective buyers around the property.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司派人陪同有购买意向的买家参观房产。

Sense.DEF: to go with someone to a social event
Sense.TRAN: 陪同〔某人〕参加社交活动
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bill escorted Ellie to the opera.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔陪埃莉去看歌剧。

Sense.DEF: a person or a group of people or vehicles that go with someone in order to protect or guard them
Sense.EXAMPLE: a police escort
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察护卫队

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was driven away to prison under armed escort protected or guarded by an escort.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被武装人员用车押送到监狱。

Sense.DEF: someone who goes with someone to a formal social event
Sense.TRAN: 陪伴某人参加正式社交活动的人

Sense.DEF: someone who is paid to go out with someone socially
Sense.TRAN: 受雇陪同某人参加社交活动的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: an escort agency
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社交陪伴服务社

Sense.DEF: a prostitute, especially one who goes to social events or on trips with the person who pays them
a small writing desk
money, land, or a written contract etc that is held by someone who is not directly involved in an agreement while the agreement is being achieved
Sense.TRAN: 〔协议未达成期间〕暂由第三方保管的资金[地产﹐合约等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a property held in escrow
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暂由第三方保管的财产

Sense.DEF: the standard unit of money used in Portugal before the euro
Sense.TRAN: 埃斯库多〔葡萄牙在使用欧元之前的标准货币单位〕

Sense.DEF: a shield on which someone’s coat of armsfamily sign is painted
the people or language of a particular country or place
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Viennese people from Vienna
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维也纳人
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m learning Japanese the language of Japan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在学习日语。

Sense.DEF: belonging to a particular country or place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chinese music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中国音乐

Sense.DEF: language or words used by a particular group, especially when it sounds ugly or is difficult to understand
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指难听或难懂的〕特定人群的语言[用词]
Sense.EXAMPLE: journalese language used in newspapers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻文体
Sense.EXAMPLE: officialese language used in official or legal writing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公文[法律]文体﹔官腔

Sense.DEF: an inuitsomeone who belongs to a race of people living in the very cold northern areas of North America. Many people now consider this word offensive.
Sense.TRAN: 爱斯基摩人〔现在许多人认为该词具有冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF: the teaching of English to people who are living in an English-speaking country but whose first language is not English
Sense.TRAN: 作为第二语言的英语教学
the abbreviation of 缩写=English for Speakers of Other Languages对操其他语言者的英语教学

Sense.DEF: the American spelling of oesophagus
known and understood by only a few people who have special knowledge about something
Sense.TRAN: 深奥的﹐只有内行才懂的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the esoteric world of scientific supercomputing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 深奥的科学超级计算领域

Sense.DEF: the ability to know what will happen in the future, or to know what another person is thinking
Sense.TRAN: 超感知觉〔即可预知未来或感知他人所思的能力〕

Sense.FULLFORM: English for Specific Purposes or English for Special Purposes
Sense.DEF: the teaching of English to business people, scientists etc whose first language is not English
Sense.TRAN: 〔针对专业人员的〕专门用途英语教学
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=especially尤其﹔格外

Sense.DEF: a light shoe that is made of cloth and rope
Sense.TRAN: 〔用布和绳带制成的〕轻便鞋﹐帆布便鞋

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is more important or happens more with one particular thing than with others
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never liked long walks, especially in winter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向来不喜欢长距离散步﹐尤其在冬天。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Art books are expensive to produce, especially if they contain colour illustrations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美术类书籍制作成本很高﹐尤其是那些带彩色插图的。

Sense.DEF: to a particularly high degree or much more than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was especially fond of chocolate biscuits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我特别爱吃巧克力饼干。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Feedback is especially important in learning skills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反馈意见在学习技能的过程中特别重要。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A depreciation of the dollar would make US exports cheaper and especially so in Japan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美元贬值会致使美国出口商品价格降低﹐这一影响在日本特别明显。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Graphics are especially well handled in the book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 书中对图表的处理尤为恰到好处。

Sense.DEF: for a particular person, purpose etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She bought a new pair of trainers especially for the trip.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她特地为那次旅行买了一双新的运动鞋。

Sense.DEF: not very, or not very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: Accidents aren’t especially common, but you never know.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事故不是特别频繁﹐不过也说不准。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He didn’t especially want to learn to dance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不怎么想学跳舞。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use especially before the subject of a sentence to emphasize it. Put especially after the subject.
F2NBox.TRAN: 不要将 especially置于句子主语之前以示强调﹐而应置于主语之后
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Older voters especially (NOT 不说 Especially older voters) are concerned about crime.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 尤其是年纪大一些的选民很关注犯罪问题。

Sense.DEF: an artificial language invented in 1887 to help people from different countries in the world speak to each other
the activity of secretly finding out secret information and giving it to a country’s enemies or a company’s competitors
Sense.EXAMPLE: a campaign of industrial espionage against his main rival
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对他主要竞争对手展开的商业间谍活动

Sense.DEF: a wide street next to the sea in a town
to support an idea, belief etc, especially a political one
Sense.TRAN: 支持﹐拥护〔某观点﹑信仰等﹐尤指政治主张〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He espoused a variety of scientific, social and political causes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他支持各种科学﹑社会和政治事业。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对自由主义改革的拥护

Sense.DEF: strong black Italian coffee, or a cup of this coffee
Sense.TRAN: (一杯)蒸馏咖啡〔一种意大利浓咖啡〕

Sense.DEF: feelings of loyalty towards people who are all involved in the same activity as you
to suddenly see someone or something
a title that is sometimes written after a man’s name in the address on an official letter instead of using mr before the name
Sense.TRAN: …先生〔写公函地址时用于男子姓名后的尊称﹐可代替 Mr〕

Sense.DEF: a title of respect that is sometimes put after a lawyer’s name
Sense.TRAN: …律师〔用于律师姓名后的尊称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Franklin Taylor Esq.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富兰克林·泰勒律师

Sense.DEF: in the manner or style of a particular person, group, or place …
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kafkaesque in the style of the writer Franz Kafka
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡夫卡式的〔指具有小说家卡夫卡的风格〕

Sense.DEF: having a particular quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: picturesque pleasant to look at
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: (风景)如画的

Sense.DEF: a formal title that can be written after a man’s name, especially in the address on an official letter …
Sense.TRAN: 先生〔写在男子姓名后的尊称﹐尤用于公函地址中〕

Sense.DEF: a female
Sense.EXAMPLE: an actress a female actor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女演员
Sense.EXAMPLE: two lionesses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两头母狮

Sense.DEF: a short piece of writing about a particular subject by a student as part of a course of study
Sense.TRAN: 〔学生为某门课程所写的〕短文﹐论说文

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an essay on Bernard Shaw
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于萧伯纳的文章

Sense.DEF: a short piece of writing giving someone’s ideas about politics, society etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔关于政治﹑社会等的〕小品文﹐散文

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rousseau’s ‘Essay on the Origin of Languages’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卢梭的《论语言的起源》

Sense.DEF: an attempt to do something

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a 3,000 word essay to write before Friday.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得在星期五之前完成一篇3,000字的文章。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Half the class failed to hand in their essay on time.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 班里有一半学生没有按时把作文交上去。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He got a good grade for his English essay.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那篇英语作文得了高分。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that judges how good a book, writer etc is

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We practised essay questions from previous exam papers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们做以前的试卷来练习回答论述题。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She published a collection of essays on philosophy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她出版了一部哲学文集。

Sense.DEF: to attempt to do something
someone who writes essays giving their ideas about politics, society etc
Sense.TRAN: 论说文[散文﹐小品文等]作者

Sense.DEF: the most basic and important quality of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The essence of Arsenal’s style of football was speed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿森纳队足球风格的精髓是强调速度。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She seems the very essence of kindness she seems very kind.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看来非常友善。

Sense.DEF: used when talking about the most basic and important part of something, especially an idea, belief, or argument
Sense.EXAMPLE: In essence his message was very simple.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实质上他想表达的意思很简单。

Sense.DEF: a liquid obtained from a plant, flower etc that has a very strong smell or taste and is used especially in cooking
Sense.EXAMPLE: vanilla essence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香草香精

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is very important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good communications are of the essence to remain competitive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 良好的沟通对于保持竞争力是极为重要的。

GramExa.GLOSS: it is very important to do something quickly
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 时间/速度是至关重要的

Sense.DEF: extremely important and necessary
Sense.TRAN: 极其重要的﹔必不可少的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A good diet is essential for everyone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 良好的饮食对于每个人都极为重要。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is essential that our pilots are given the best possible training.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的飞行员要受到最好的培训﹐这是必不可少的。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is essential to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is essential to book in advance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 提前预订是完全必要的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Window locks are fairly cheap and absolutely essential.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗锁相当便宜﹐绝对有必要安装。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even in small companies, computers are an essential tool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使在小公司里﹐计算机也是不可或缺的工具。

Sense.DEF: the essential part, quality, or feature of something is the most basic one
Sense.EXAMPLE: The essential difference between Sam and me was the fact that I took life seriously.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和萨姆的根本区别在于我是认真对待生活的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The essential point of relay racing is that it is a team effort.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接力赛跑的基本要点是讲究团队配合。

Sense.DEF: something that is necessary to do something or in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 必需品﹔必不可少的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: She packed a few essentials.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把几件生活必需品装进箱子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We only had the bare essentials the most necessary things.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只有几样最要紧的东西。

Sense.DEF: the basic and most important information or facts about a particular subject

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have no reason to doubt the essentials of the girl’s story.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没有理由怀疑这个女孩描述中的要点。

Sense.DEF: used when stating the most basic facts about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ballet is essentially a middle-class interest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芭蕾舞基本上是中产阶级感兴趣的东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suicide rates have remained essentially unchanged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自杀率基本上保持不变。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Essentially, we are talking about the cold war period.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们基本上是在谈论冷战时期。

Sense.DEF: an oil from a plant that has a strong smell and is used for making perfume or in aromatherapy
Sense.TRAN: (香)精油〔用于香水制造或芳香疗法〕
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=established建立于
Sense.EXAMPLE: H. Perkins and Company, est. 1869
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: H.珀金斯公司﹐成立于1869年

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=estimated估计的

Sense.DEF: forms the superlative of many short adjectives and adverbs
Sense.TRAN: 〔附在许多短小的形容词和副词后面﹐构成最高级〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: cold, colder, coldest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冷﹐更冷﹐最冷
Sense.EXAMPLE: early, earlier, earliest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早﹐更早﹐最早

Sense.DEF: forms the second person singular of verbs
Sense.EXAMPLE: thou goest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你走

Sense.DEF: to start a company, organization, system, etc that is intended to exist or continue for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city of Boerne was established by German settlers in the 1840s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 博恩市是德国移民于19世纪40年代建立的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our goal is to establish a new research centre in the North.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的目标是在北方建立一个新的研究中心。

Sense.DEF: to begin a relationship with someone or a situation that will continue

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hungary established diplomatic relations with Chile in 1990.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 匈牙利于1990年与智利建立了外交关系。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wondered why he should bother to try and establish contact with me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想知道他为何要费心设法和我取得联系。

Sense.DEF: to find out facts that will prove that something is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police must establish the facts of the case before proceeding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方必须在起诉前确定案件事实。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The autopsy established that he had been murdered.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尸体剖检证实他是被谋杀的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was never able to establish whether she was telling the truth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来都无法确定她是否在说实话。

Sense.DEF: to make people accept that you can do something, or that you have a particular quality

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had three years in which to establish himself as Prime Minister.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有三年时间来确立自己首相的地位。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He’d already begun to establish quite a reputation as a journalist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身为记者﹐他已经声名鹊起。

Exponent.DEF: to start a company or organization, especially one that exists for a long time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company was established in 1899.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司成立于1899年。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He established a new research centre in Dublin.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在都柏林建立了一个新的研究中心。

Exponent.DEF: to start a new company or organization. Set up is less formal than establish, and is the usual phrase to use in everyday English.
Exponent.TRAN: 建立﹐设立〔公司﹑机构﹔set up 不如 establish 正式﹐是日常英语中的常用短语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Kate and her partner are setting up their own printing business.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特和她的搭档要自己开办印刷公司。

Exponent.DEF: to start a business that provides services to the public, such as a shop, restaurant, or hotel
Exponent.TRAN: 开设﹐开办〔向公众提供服务的企业﹐如商店﹑餐馆﹑酒店等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He opened his first restaurant in 1995.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他于1995年开设了自己的第一家餐馆。

Exponent.DEF: to start a company or an organization such as a school or a hospital, especially by providing the money for it – used about something that was started a long time ago
Exponent.TRAN: 创立〔公司﹑学校﹑医院等机构﹐尤指为其提供资金〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Who originally founded the college?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所学院最初是谁创立的？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bank was founded 60 years ago in Munich.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该银行于60年前成立于慕尼黑。

Exponent.DEF: to start an organization with an official ceremony
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Twenty years after the airport was inaugurated, it introduced its first transatlantic flights.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 机场启用20年后﹐首次开通了横越大西洋的航班。

Sense.DEF: already in use or existing for a long period of time
Sense.TRAN: 早已确立的﹔早已投入使用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Competition from established businesses can be formidable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自老牌企业的竞争可能会异常激烈。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: teaching methods
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被广泛采用的教学方法

Sense.EXAMPLE: By 1969 the civil rights movement was already an established fact.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时至1969年﹐民权运动早已成为既定事实。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every once in a while, the established order people who rule is overthrown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 统治阶层有时会被推翻。

Sense.DEF: known to do a particular job well, because you have done it for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: an established professor of French literature
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 资深的法国文学教授

Sense.DEF: the official church or religion in a particular country
an organization or institution, especially a business, shop etc
Sense.TRAN: 机构﹐单位〔尤指企业﹑商店等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a top class training establishment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一流的培训机构

Sense.DEF: the group of people in a society or profession who have a lot of power and influence and are often opposed to any kind of change or new ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young people are supposed to rebel against the Establishment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按理说﹐年轻人应该反抗当权者。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The public is treated with contempt by the art establishment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众被艺术界的当权派轻视。

Sense.DEF: the act of starting an organization, relationship, or system

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the establishment of NATO in 1949
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1949年北约组织的建立

Sense.DEF: law all of someone’s property and money, especially everything that is left after they die
Sense.TRAN: 个人全部财产〔尤指遗产〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The property is part of the deceased’s estate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该产业是死者遗产的一部分。

Sense.DEF: a large area of land in the country, usually with one large house on it and one owner
Sense.TRAN: 〔乡村里带有宅邸的〕大片私有土地﹐庄园
Sense.EXAMPLE: a country estate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乡村的庄园

Sense.DEF: an area where houses or buildings of a similar type have all been built together in a planned way
Sense.TRAN: 有计划地建有同类建筑物的地区

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 市建住宅区/工业园区/住宅区等

Sense.DEF: someone whose business is to buy and sell houses or land for people
a car with a door at the back, folding back seats, and a lot of space at the back
a tax in the US on the money and possessions of a dead person
a feeling of respect for someone, or a good opinion of someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The critics held him in high esteem as an actor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为演员﹐他深受评论家敬重。

GramExa.GLOSS: a sign of their respect
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Please accept the small gift we enclose as a mark of our esteem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 附上薄礼﹐聊表敬意﹐请笑纳。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: my father’s complete lack of esteem for actors
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲对演员的全然不敬

Sense.DEF: to respect and admire someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peden was greatly esteemed by the people of Ayrshire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 佩登深受艾尔郡人的尊敬。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was esteemed as a literary wit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被尊为文学才子。

Sense.DEF: respected and admired
Sense.EXAMPLE: the esteemed French critic Olivier Boissiere
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受人尊敬的法国评论家奥利维耶·布瓦西埃
Sense.EXAMPLE: highly esteemed scholars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极受敬重的学者

Sense.DEF: an American spelling of aesthete
deserving respect and admiration
Sense.TRAN: 值得尊敬的﹔值得敬佩的

Sense.DEF: a calculation of the value, size, amount etc of something made using the information that you have, which may not be complete
Sense.EXAMPLE: We just need an estimate of the number of people who will come.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只需估算一下有多少人会来。

Sense.DEF: a statement of how much it will probably cost to build or repair something
Sense.TRAN: 〔对建造或修理费用的〕估价﹐报价

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The garage said they’d send me an estimate for the work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车修理厂说他们会给我寄来维修报价。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Insurers have to make an estimate of the risk involved.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 保险公司须评估所涉及的 风险。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The builder gave me an estimate of £10,000.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 承建人给我作的估价是10,000英镑。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Could you ask him if he can provide us with an estimate?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你问问他能否给我们一个估价？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say the amount that you think something is
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 估计某事物的数量[价值]
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It is impossible to put an estimate on the value of the manuscript.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部手稿的价值无法估量。

Collocate.COLLOC: an estimate puts sth at sth
Collocate.EXAMPLE: … Independent estimates put the number of refugees at 50,000.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 据独立估计﹐难民人数为50,000。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: use something as information to give an estimate
not exact
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Can you give me a rough estimate of how much the repairs will cost?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能不能替我粗略估算一下修理费用？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: fairly exact
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s hard to put an accurate estimate on the number of people affected.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难准确估计受影响人数。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: deliberately low
Collocate.EXAMPLE: By conservative estimates, 2.5 million people die each year from smoking cigarettes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 据保守估计﹐每年有250万人死于吸烟。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: accepted by people in authority
Collocate.EXAMPLE: According to official army estimates, more than 500 rebels had been killed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 据军方估计﹐有五百多名叛乱分子丧命。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: ones that are accepted now
the most recent ones
the one given at the beginning of a process

Collocate.EXAMPLE: According to some estimates, an acre of forest is cleared every minute.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 据估计﹐每分钟有一英亩森林消失。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Estimates of the number of homeless people in the city range from 6,000 to 10,000.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该市无家可归者的人数估计在6,000至10,000之间。

Sense.DEF: to try to judge the value, size, speed, cost etc of something, without calculating it exactly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tree is estimated to be at least 700 years old.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这棵树估计至少有700年树龄。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Organizers estimated the crowd at 50,000.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 组织者估计聚集人数有50,000。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Scientists estimate that smoking reduces life expectancy by around 12 years on average.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家估计吸烟平均缩短寿命约12年。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is not easy to estimate how many people have the disease.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难估计有多少人患有这种病。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: heroin with an estimated street value of £50,000
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑市价值估计为50,000英镑的海洛因

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say put sth at an amount rather than estimate sth at.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们常说 put sth at an amount﹐而不说 estimate sth at
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The damage was put at thousands of dollars.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 损失估计有数千美元 。

Sense.DEF: a judgment or opinion about someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In your estimation, who’s going to win?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据你的判断﹐谁会赢？

GramExa.PROPFORM: go up/come down in sb’s estimation
GramExa.GLOSS: be respected or admired more or less by someone
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 在某人心目中的地位提高/降低

Sense.DEF: a calculation of the value, size, amount etc of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Estimations of total world sales are around the 50 million mark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全球的总销售额估计在5,000万左右。

Sense.DEF: someone’s husband or wife whom they are no longer living with, used especially in newspaper reports
Sense.TRAN: 某人已分居的丈夫/妻子〔尤用于新闻报道中〕

Sense.DEF: no longer seeing or talking to a relative or good friend, because of an argument
Sense.TRAN: 〔因争吵而与亲戚或好友〕疏远的﹐不再联系的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mill became estranged from his family after the marriage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 米尔结婚后便与家人疏远了。

Sense.DEF: no longer feeling any connection with something that used to be important in your life
Sense.TRAN: 〔与曾经珍视的事物〕脱离的﹐决裂的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: young adults who feel estranged from the church
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 感到脱离了教会的青年人

Sense.DEF: the usual American spelling of oestrogen
the wide part of a river where it goes into the sea
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Thames estuary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰晤士河河口

Sense.DEF: the time when a plane, ship etc is expected to arrive
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机﹑舰船等的〕估计到达时间

Sense.DEF: a business that sells products or services on the Internet, instead of in a shop
written after a list of names to mean that other people are also involved in something
Sense.TRAN: 以及其他〔有关的〕人﹔等人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Boers et al, 2001
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯尔斯等著﹐2001年

Sense.DEF: used in writing after a list to show that there are many other similar things or people that you could have added
Sense.TRAN: 等等﹔以及类似的事物[人]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shop which sells cards, calendars, wrapping paper etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出售贺卡﹑日历﹑包装纸等物品的商店

GramExa.GLOSS: used when you are rather bored or annoyed by the list you are giving
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 等等﹐等等〔用于表示对所列出的事物感到厌烦〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The letter says pay at once, they’ve reminded us before etc. etc.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 信中说要立刻付款﹐他们以前已提醒过我们了﹐等等等等。

Exponent.DEF: used when you want to say that there are many other examples of things of the same kind. The full form is et cetera, but this is rarely used. Don’t use etc. in essays or formal writing.
Exponent.TRAN: 等等﹔以及类似的事物[人] 〔完整形式为et cetera﹐但该形式很少使用。etc.不用于论文或正式书面语中〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They asked me about my past experience, qualifications etc.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们询问我以往的经验﹑学历资格等等。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Precise details of times, dates etc. should be recorded.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 时间﹑日期等确切细节都应予以记录。

Exponent.DEF: used before one or more nouns to say that there are many other examples of the same kind. It is better to use such as rather than etc. in essays and formal writing.
Exponent.TRAN: 像﹐诸如﹐例如〔在论文或正式书面语中最好用 such as﹐而不要用 etc.〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It is best to avoid drinks such as tea, coffee or alcohol.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好不要喝茶﹑咖啡或酒类饮品。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a distressing event such as the break-up of a marriage
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚姻破裂之类的伤心事

Exponent.DEF: used after examples of something when saying that there are many more you could have mentioned
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Our daily activities include tennis, swimming, darts, snooker to name but a few.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 就举几个例子吧﹐我们的日常活动包括打网球﹑游泳﹑掷飞镖﹑打落袋台球。

Exponent.DEF: used in spoken English when you want to say that there are other examples of things of the same kind. Don’t use and so on in essays or formal writing – it sounds too vague.
Exponent.TRAN: 等等﹔诸如此类〔and so on 用于英语口语﹐不用于论文或正式书面语中﹐因为其语气太含糊〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You can do things to look after yourself in the way of diet, exercise, not smoking and so on.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以通过多种方式实现健康生活﹐比如节食﹑锻炼﹑不吸烟等等。

Exponent.DEF: and many other people or things
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The book includes poems by Christina Rossetti, William Blake and many others.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该书收录了克里斯蒂娜·罗塞蒂﹑威廉·布莱克及其他许多诗人的作品。

Sense.DEF: the full form of etc.
to cut lines on a metal plate, piece of glass, stone etc to form a picture or words

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a gravestone with three names etched on it
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上面刻有三个名字的墓碑

Sense.EXAMPLE: A laser is used to etch a pattern in the smooth surface of the disc.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激光器用于在光盘的光滑表面刻录图案。

Sense.DEF: if an experience, name etc is etched on your memory or mind, you cannot forget it and you think of it often
Sense.TRAN: 〔经历﹑姓名等〕铭刻在记忆中/脑海里
Sense.EXAMPLE: The island remained etched in my memory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座岛屿一直让我铭记在心。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s face is etched with pain, sadness etc, you can see these feelings from their expression

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her face was etched with tiredness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她满脸疲惫。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Craig saw lines of pain etched around her mouth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克雷格看见她嘴边的皱纹流露出痛苦。

Sense.DEF: to make lines or patterns appear on something very clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: etched glass
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刻花玻璃

Sense.DEF: a picture made by printing from an etched metal plate
continuing for ever and having no end
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Christian promise of eternal life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基督教承诺的永生
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s an eternal optimist she always expects that good things will happen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她永远是个乐观主义者。

Sense.DEF: seeming to continue for ever, especially because of being boring or annoying
Sense.TRAN: 似乎无休止的﹔没完没了的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the eternal arguments between mother and son
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母子间没完没了的争吵

Sense.DEF: principles that are always true
for ever
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be eternally grateful very grateful to you for this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我将为此永远感激你。

Sense.DEF: always or very often
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a player who’s eternally arguing with the referee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个老和裁判争执的球员。

Sense.DEF: the difficult situation that occurs when two people have a sexual relationship with the same person
a period of time that seems very long because you are annoyed, anxious etc
Sense.TRAN: 似乎很漫长的一段时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here she waited for what seemed like an eternity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在此等了似乎很漫长的一段时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That week was an eternity of solitude and boredom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一周孤独和无聊的感觉无穷无尽。

Sense.DEF: the whole of time without any end
Sense.EXAMPLE: a little animal preserved for all eternity as a fossil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成为化石而得以永久存世的小动物

Sense.DEF: the state of existence after death that some people believe continues for ever
a ring, usually with many jewels, that someone gives their wife or partner as a symbol of lasting love
Sense.TRAN: 永恒戒指〔象征永恒的爱情〕

Sense.DEF: forms the third person singular of verbs
Sense.EXAMPLE: he giveth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给

Sense.DEF: the type of alcohol in alcoholic drinks, which can also be used as a fuel for cars
a clear liquid used in the past as an anaesthetic to make people sleep before an operation

Subsense.DEF: the space through which radio waves or computer signals travel
Subsense.EXAMPLE: voices coming through the ether
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿越以太空间的声音

Subsense.DEF: the upper part of the sky

Sense.DEF: very delicate and light, in a way that does not seem real
Sense.EXAMPLE: ethereal beauty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超凡的美丽
Sense.EXAMPLE: His music is ethereal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的音乐超凡脱俗。

Sense.DEF: a system used for connecting computer networks
a general idea or belief that influences people’s behaviour and attitudes
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old ethic of hard work has given way to a new ethic of instant gratification.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧有的崇尚勤勉的道德观已被及时行乐的新观念所取代。

Sense.DEF: moral rules or principles of behaviour for deciding what is right and wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: a report on the ethics of gene therapy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于基因疗法的伦理学问题的报告

GramExa.GLOSS: the moral rules relating to a particular profession
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 职业道德/商业道德/医德
GramExa.EXAMPLE: public concern about medical ethics
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众对医德的关注

Sense.EXAMPLE: a code of ethics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 道德准则

Sense.DEF: relating to principles of what is right and wrong

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The use of animals in scientific tests raises difficult ethical questions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用动物做科学实验引发了棘手的伦理问题。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The president must have the highest ethical standards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统必须具备最高的道德水准。

Sense.DEF: morally good or correct
Sense.TRAN: 合乎道德的﹔道德上正确的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think it’s ethical for you to accept a job you know you can’t do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得接受一份自知无法胜任的工作是不道德的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ethical investment policies investing only in businesses that are considered morally acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合乎道德的投资策略

Sense.DEF: relating to a particular race, nation, or tribe and their customs and traditions
Sense.TRAN: 种族[民族﹐部落]的﹔具有种族[民族﹐部落]特色的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school teaches pupils from different ethnic groups.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该校教授不同种族的小学生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ethnic Russians in Estonia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 居住在爱沙尼亚的俄罗斯人

GramExa.GLOSS: violence etc between people from different races or cultures

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The students are from a variety of ethnic backgrounds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生的种族背景各不相同。

Sense.EXAMPLE: plans to partition the republic along ethnic lines in a way that keeps different ethnic groups apart
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按种族分割该共和国的计划

Sense.DEF: cooking, fashion etc from countries that are far away, which seems very different and unusual
Sense.TRAN: 具有异国风情的烹调/时尚/设计等
Sense.EXAMPLE: ethnic music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 具有异国风情的音乐

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Surinam is culturally and ethnically diverse.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏里南文化多样﹐种族多元。

Sense.DEF: someone who comes from a group of people who are a different race, religion etc or who have a different background from most other people in that country
Sense.EXAMPLE: In that neighborhood of New York, we were all ethnics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在纽约的那个街区﹐我们都是少数族裔。

Sense.DEF: the action of forcing people to leave an area or country because of their racial or national group
a group of people of a different race from the main group in a country
Sense.EXAMPLE: racial discrimination against doctors from ethnic minorities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对少数族裔医生的种族歧视

Sense.DEF: based on the idea that your own race, nation, group etc is better than any other — used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 种族[民族﹐集团]优越感的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ethnocentric history textbooks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 表露种族优越感的历史教科书

Sense.DEF: the scientific description of different races of people
the scientific study and comparison of different races of people
the set of ideas and moral attitudes that are typical of a particular group
Sense.TRAN: 〔某团体的〕精神特质﹐道德意识
Sense.EXAMPLE: a community in which people lived according to an ethos of sharing and caring
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们本着分享与关爱精神来生活的社区

Sense.DEF: a ticket, especially for a plane journey, that is stored in a computer and is not given to you in the form of paper
Sense.TRAN: 电子票证﹔〔尤指〕电子机票

Sense.DEF: pale and weak
a plant that is etiolated is weak and not very green because it has not received enough light
the cause of a disease or the scientific study of this
the formal rules for polite behaviour in society or in a particular group
Sense.EXAMPLE: strict rules of professional etiquette
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严格的行规

Sense.DEF: a small thing of a particular type
Sense.EXAMPLE: a kitchenette small kitchen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小厨房
Sense.EXAMPLE: a snackette a very small meal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小吃

Sense.DEF: a woman who is doing a particular job
Sense.EXAMPLE: an usherette female usher
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女引座员

Sense.DEF: something that is not real, but is imitation3
Sense.EXAMPLE: flannelette
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 棉法兰绒
Sense.EXAMPLE: leatherette chairs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人造革面的椅子

Sense.DEF: the study of the origins, history and changing meanings of words
a description of the history of a word
the european union
a tall tree that produces an oil with a strong smell, used in medicines
the holy bread and wine, representing Christ’s body and blood, used during a Christian ceremony, or the ceremony itself
Sense.TRAN: 〔基督教〕圣餐中的面包和葡萄酒﹔圣餐仪式

Sense.DEF: the study of methods to improve the mental and physical abilities of the human race by choosing who should become parents – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 优生学﹔人种改良学〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: to praise someone or something very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: The poem does not eulogize the dead soldiers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这首诗并未歌颂阵亡的士兵。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Commentators are eulogizing about the 17-year-old left-hander.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 解说员都在夸赞这位17岁的左撇子选手。

Sense.DEF: a speech or piece of writing in which you praise someone or something very much, especially at a funeral
Sense.TRAN: 颂词﹐颂文〔尤指葬礼上的悼词或悼文〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The minister delivered a long eulogy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长致长篇悼词。

Sense.DEF: a man whose testicles have been removed, especially someone who guarded a king’s wives in some Eastern countries in the past
Sense.TRAN: 阉人〔尤指旧时一些东方国家的宦官〕

Sense.DEF: a polite word or expression that you use instead of a more direct one to avoid shocking or upsetting someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Pass away’ is a euphemism for ‘die’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “去世”是“死”的委婉语。

Sense.DEF: euphemistic language uses polite words and expressions to avoid shocking or upsetting people
an extremely strong feeling of happiness and excitement which usually only lasts for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a general atmosphere of pessimism after the euphoria of last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年的狂喜过后出现了普遍的悲观气氛。

Sense.DEF: feeling very happy and excited
Sense.TRAN: 非常高兴的﹔极其兴奋的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scientists are euphoric at the success of the test.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 试验成功令科学家们兴奋不已。

Sense.DEF: relating to both Europe and Asia
Sense.TRAN: 欧亚大陆的﹔与欧亚有关的

Sense.DEF: having one European parent and one Asian parent
someone who has one European parent and one Asian parent
used to show how happy you are that you have discovered the answer to a problem, found something etc
Sense.TRAN: 我发现了〔因找到问题的解决方法或发现某物等而发出的欢呼〕

Sense.DEF: a unit of money that can be used in most countries of the European Union
Sense.TRAN: 欧元〔欧盟大部分国家使用的货币单位〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the value of the euro against the dollar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧元兑美元的币值
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prices are given in pounds and euros.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格用英镑和欧元标出。

Sense.DEF: European, especially relating to the European Union
Sense.EXAMPLE: next month’s Euro elections
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下月的欧盟选举

Subsense.DEF: relating to Europe, especially western Europe or the European Union
Subsense.TRAN: 欧洲的〔尤指西欧或欧盟的〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Euro-MPs
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲议会议员
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Europop
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲流行音乐

Subsense.DEF: European and something else
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the Euro-Asiatic area
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧亚地区

Sense.DEF: a word meaning a government official of the European Union, often one who makes decisions you do not like — used especially in newspapers
Sense.TRAN: 欧盟官员〔常指所作决定不受欢迎的官员﹐尤用于报纸〕

Sense.DEF: a US dollar that has been put in a European bank or lent to a European customer to help trade and provide an international money system
Sense.TRAN: 欧洲美元〔指存于欧洲银行或借给欧洲客户以促进贸易和建立国际货币体系的美元〕

Sense.DEF: the continent that is north of the Mediterranean and goes as far east as the Ural Mountains in Russia
Sense.EXAMPLE: eastern Europe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 东欧

Sense.DEF: the European Union
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Prime Minister’s stated aim of keeping Britain at the heart of Europe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相明确的目标使英国处于欧盟的中心地位

Sense.DEF: the continent of Europe not including Britain and Ireland
Sense.TRAN: 〔不包括英国和爱尔兰在内的〕欧洲大陆
Sense.EXAMPLE: British exports to Europe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国对欧陆国家的出口

Sense.DEF: someone from Europe
relating to Europe or its people
Sense.EXAMPLE: European languages
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲的语言
Sense.EXAMPLE: our European partners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的欧洲伙伴

Sense.DEF: a European political and economic organization that encourages trade and friendship between the countries that are members
someone, especially a politician, who is against the EU and closer relations with other European countries
Sense.TRAN: 欧洲怀疑论者〔指反对欧盟以及与其他欧洲国家加强友好关系的人﹐尤指政客〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Conservative Eurosceptics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保守党中的欧洲怀疑论者

Sense.DEF: the deliberate killing of a person who is very ill and going to die, in order to stop them suffering
to kill an animal in a painless way, usually because it is very sick or old
Sense.TRAN: 对〔动物〕施行无痛致死术﹐使〔动物〕安乐死
Sense.EXAMPLE: The decision to euthanase a pet is heartbreaking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对宠物施行安乐死的决定令人心碎。

Sense.DEF: to send people away from a dangerous place to a safe place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several families were evacuated from their homes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好几户人家从家里撤出。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: During the war he was evacuated to Scotland.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争期间他被撤离到苏格兰。

Sense.DEF: to empty a place by making all the people leave
Sense.TRAN: 使所有人撤离(某地)﹐撤空(某地)
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police evacuated the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方将该地区人员全部疏散。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The order was given to evacuate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下达了撤离的命令。

Sense.DEF: formal to empty your bowels

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the evacuation of British troops from the area
Police ordered the evacuation of the building.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方下令所有人从大楼撤离。

Sense.DEF: someone who is sent away from a place because it is dangerous, for example because there is a war
to avoid talking about something, especially because you are trying to hide something
Sense.TRAN: 回避谈论〔某事物﹐尤因试图隐瞒〕
