Sense.EXAMPLE: I could tell that he was trying to evade the issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看得出他在极力回避这个问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The minister evaded the question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长回避了那个问题。

Sense.DEF: to not do or deal with something that you should do
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t go on evading your responsibilities in this way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能这样继续逃避责任。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re simply trying to evade the problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你根本是在设法逃避问题。

Sense.DEF: to avoid paying money that you ought to pay, for example tax
Sense.EXAMPLE: Employers will always try to find ways to evade tax.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇主总是会想方设法逃税。

Sense.DEF: to escape from someone who is trying to catch you
Sense.EXAMPLE: She managed to evade the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她设法逃脱了警察的追捕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: So far he has evaded capture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前他尚未被擒。

Sense.DEF: if something evades you, you cannot do it or understand it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The subtleties of his argument evaded me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他论点中的一些微妙之处我无法理解。

Sense.DEF: to judge how good, useful, or successful something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should be able to evaluate your own work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该能够评估自己的工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to evaluate the success of the campaign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要评估一下这次运动是否成功。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It can be difficult to evaluate the effectiveness of different treatments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要对各种治疗方法的效果作出评估会很难。

Sense.DEF: a judgment about how good, useful, or successful something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to carry out a proper evaluation of the new system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要对新系统进行合理的评估。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They took some samples of products for evaluation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们抽取了一些产品样本以作评估。

Sense.DEF: something that is evanescent does not last very long
evangelical Christians believe that they should persuade as many people as possible to become Christians
Sense.TRAN: 福音传道者的﹐基督教福音派的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the evangelical church
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基督教福音派教会
Sense.EXAMPLE: evangelical missionaries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基督教福音派传教士

Sense.DEF: very eager to persuade people to accept your ideas and beliefs
Sense.TRAN: 狂热宣传自己的主张和信仰的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spoke with evangelical fervour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发表演说时强烈鼓吹自己的观念。

Sense.DEF: someone who travels to different places and tries to persuade people to become Christians
one of the four writers of the books in the Bible called the Gospels
Sense.TRAN: 《圣经》福音书的四位作者之一

Sense.DEF: to try to persuade people to become Christians
Sense.TRAN: 劝(人)信奉基督教﹐(向…)传播福音
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to evangelize the whole nation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 向全国民众传播福音的尝试

Sense.DEF: if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the water had evaporated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分的水都蒸发了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sun evaporates moisture on the leaves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳会蒸发叶子上的水分。

Sense.DEF: if a feeling evaporates, it slowly disappears
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hopes of achieving peace are beginning to evaporate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实现和平的希望开始消逝。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His courage had evaporated away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的勇气已经衰竭。

Sense.DEF: milk which has been made thicker and sweeter by removing some of the water from it
when you deliberately avoid doing something that you should do, or paying an amount of money that you should pay
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is in prison for tax evasion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因逃税而坐牢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She accused him of evasion of his responsibilities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她指责他逃避责任。

Sense.DEF: when you deliberately avoid talking about something or answering a question
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m tired of his lies and evasions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听腻了他的谎言和托词。

Sense.DEF: not willing to answer questions directly
Sense.TRAN: 模棱两可的﹐推托的﹐回避的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Paul’s being a bit evasive about this job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗对这份工作有点含糊其词。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an evasive reply
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 模棱两可的答复

Sense.DEF: to move or do something quickly to avoid someone being hurt
Sense.TRAN: 采取规避动作〔以避免受伤〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both pilots took evasive action and a collision was avoided.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两位飞行员都立即采取规避行动﹐避免了撞机事件的发生。

Sense.DEF: the night or day before an important day

GramExa.EXAMPLE: on the eve of the election
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在选举前夕

Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re arriving on Christmas Eve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将在平安夜到达。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a New Year’s Eve party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除夕之夜的派对

Sense.DEF: evening
Sense.EXAMPLE: one summer’s eve
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个夏日的傍晚

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize something that is unexpected or surprising in what you are saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most companies have suffered a drop in their profits, even very large companies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数公司的利润都出现下滑﹐甚至连很大的公司也不例外。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was quite difficult to see, even with the light on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这很难看得见﹐即使开着灯也没有用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He became quite successful and even appeared on a television show once.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他相当成功﹐甚至还上了一次电视节目。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She did not even bother to phone us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她甚至连电话都没打给我们。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He never even acknowledged my letter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他收到我的信甚至从不会告知一声。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone or something is bigger, better etc
Sense.TRAN: 甚至更大/更好/更明亮等
Sense.EXAMPLE: This will make our job even more difficult.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这会使我们的工作难上加难。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The news was even worse than we expected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那消息甚至比我们所预料的还要糟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new version is even better than the old one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新版本甚至比旧版本还要好。

Sense.DEF: used to add a stronger, more exact word to what you are saying
Sense.TRAN: 甚至可以说﹔更确切地说
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some patients become depressed, even suicidal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些患者情绪抑郁﹐甚至想自杀。

Sense.DEF: used to introduce something that is true although it is different from something that you have just said
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know he’s only a child, but even so he should have known that what he was doing was wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道他只是个孩子﹐但即便如此﹐他也应该知道自己做错了。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something will still be true if another thing happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s going to have problems finding a job even if she gets her A levels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使通过了高级程度考试﹐她以后找工作也还是成问题。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is true although something else has happened or is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even though he’s 24 now, he’s still like a little child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然他现在24岁了﹐但还是像个小孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can still remember, even though it was so long ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然是很久以前的事﹐但我还记得。

Sense.DEF: in spite of what has happened
Sense.TRAN: 即使到现在/那时﹔即使这样/那样
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even now I find it hard to believe that he lied.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使到现在我还是难以相信他撒了谎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They invested in new machinery and equipment, but even then the business was still losing money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使购置了新的机械设备﹐他们在生意上也还是赔钱。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something happens at the same moment as something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: He realized, even as he spoke, that no one would ever believe him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他刚一开口就意识到没有人会再相信他了。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Even usually goes before the word or phrase that you want to emphasize because it is surprising. even
F2NBox.TRAN: 通常用在单词或短语之前﹐以强调某事令人吃惊
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Even young students were aware of how things had changed.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 连年幼的学生都知道情况发生了什么变化。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: There is wildlife even in the centre of town.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使在市中心也有野生生物。
F2NBox.EXPL: With a verb, even goes after the first auxiliary, if there is one. even
F2NBox.TRAN: 和动词连用时﹐如有助动词﹐则用于第一个助动词之后
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I have even offered to pay for everything.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我甚至提出账都由我来付。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He can’t even spell his own name.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他连自己的名字都不会拼。
F2NBox.EXPL: Even is not used to introduce another clause. Use even if, even though, or even when.
F2NBox.TRAN: 引导从句不能用 even﹐要用 even if﹐ even though 或 even when
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Even if it’s raining (NOT 不说 Even it’s raining), we go for a walk every day.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使下雨﹐我们也还是每天散步。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They feel anxious even when things are going well.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使事情顺利﹐他们仍忧心忡忡 。
F2NBox.EXPL: You can use still in a main clause after a clause beginning with one of these expressions, but do not use ‘but’ or ‘yet’.
F2NBox.TRAN: 如主句位于由上述短语引导的从句之后﹐则主句中可用 still﹐但不可用 but 或 yet
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Even though we’re completely different, we’re still great friends (NOT 不说 but/yet we’re great friends).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管我们完全不同﹐但我们还是很好的朋友。

Sense.DEF: flat and level, with no parts that are higher than other parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: The floor must be completely even before we lay the tiles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地面必须完全平整后才能铺地砖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need a flat, even surface to work on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要在一个平整的台面上干活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had lovely white, even teeth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有一副洁白整齐的牙齿。

Sense.DEF: an even rate, speed, or temperature is steady and does not change
Sense.TRAN: 〔比率﹑速度或温度〕平稳的﹐均匀的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room is kept at an even temperature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个房间保持恒温状态。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wood burns at a fairly even rate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木头以匀速燃烧。

Sense.DEF: divided equally, so that there is the same amount of something in each place, for each person etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Divide the dough into three even amounts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把生面团分成三等份。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an even distribution of wealth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 财富均分

Sense.DEF: an even number can be divided exactly by two
Sense.EXAMPLE: 2, 4, 6 and 8 are even numbers.

Sense.DEF: having teams or competitors that are equally good so that everyone has a chance of winning
Sense.TRAN: 势均力敌的﹐水平相当的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first half was very even, and neither side scored.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上半场势均力敌﹐双方都没有得分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an even contest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 势均力敌的竞赛

Sense.DEF: if the score in a game is even, two teams or players have the same number of points
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the end of the first half the score is even.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上半场结束时双方战平。

Sense.DEF: to no longer owe someone something, especially money
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you give me $5, we’ll be even.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你给我5美元﹐我们就互不相欠了。

Sense.DEF: calm and controlled, and not extreme
Sense.EXAMPLE: He read most of the speech in an even tone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以平稳的语气念了大部分台词。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which it is just as likely that something will happen as not happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think we have an even chance of winning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得我们有一半的取胜可能性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We knew there was an even chance that the operation would fail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们知道手术有一半的可能性会失败。

Sense.DEF: to do something unpleasant to someone to punish them for something that they did to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll get even with him one day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总有一天会找他算账。

Sense.DEF: to neither make a profit nor lose money
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re hoping that we’ll at least break even, and perhaps make a small profit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望至少收支平衡﹐或许还能略有盈利。

Sense.DEF: if things even out, or if you even them out, the differences between them become smaller
Sense.EXAMPLE: The differences in their income should even out over time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假以时日﹐他们的收入差距应该会拉平。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Use a brush to even out the variations in colour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用刷子把色差刷均匀。

Sense.DEF: to make a situation or competition more equal
Sense.EXAMPLE: We put on a couple of more experienced players to even things up a bit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们增加了几个较有经验的球员﹐使实力略趋平衡。

Sense.DEF: giving fair and equal treatment to everyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was very even-handed in the way he treated his employees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对自己的雇员都一视同仁。

Sense.DEF: the early part of the night between the end of the day and the time you go to bed
Sense.EXAMPLE: I do most of my studying in the evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我学习大都在晚上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m usually out on Friday evenings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 周五晚上我通常都不在家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What are you doing tomorrow evening?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天晚上你打算做什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peter left yesterday evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得昨天晚上走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll see you this evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今晚和你见面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was early evening by the time we got home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到家时已经是傍晚了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had just finished our evening meal when the doorbell rang.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们刚吃完晚饭门铃就响了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a broadcast on the evening news
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚间新闻广播

Sense.DEF: a social event that takes place in the evening
Sense.EXAMPLE: a musical evening
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐晚会
Sense.EXAMPLE: an evening of music and poetry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐和诗歌晚会

Sense.DEF: used to greet someone when you meet them in the evening
used to greet someone when you meet them in the evening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Evening, Joe. Everything all right?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚上好﹐乔﹐一切都好吗？

Sense.DEF: a class where adults can go to study in the evening
Sense.TRAN: 〔为成人设立的〕夜校﹐夜间课程

Sense.DEF: clothes that people wear for formal meals, parties, and social events in the evening
an attractive dress that a woman wears to a formal meal, party, or social event in the evening
a plant with small flowers, whose seeds are used to make medicines
Sense.TRAN: 月见草﹐夜来香〔其花籽可用于制药〕

Sense.DEF: covering or affecting all parts of something equally
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure the surface is evenly covered with paint.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要确保表面的油漆涂刷均匀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Spread the butter evenly over the toast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把黄油均匀地涂在烤面包上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Support for the Liberals is fairly evenly spread across the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自由党的支持者在全国分布相当均匀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure the weight is evenly distributed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 务必让重量均匀分布。

Sense.DEF: divided in an equal way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The profits will be split evenly between the three of us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利润将由我们三人平分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Government ministers are fairly evenly divided on this issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府部长们在这个问题上争执不下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prospects for the country are fairly evenly balanced between peaceful reform and revolution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国是要和平改革还是进行革命﹐这两种意见不相上下。

Sense.DEF: in a regular or steady way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was breathing more evenly now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在他的呼吸比较平稳了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: rows of evenly spaced desks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一排排间距均等的书桌

Sense.DEF: if two competitors are evenly matched, they are as good as each other and so have an equal chance of winning
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two teams are very evenly matched.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两支球队的实力非常接近。

Sense.DEF: if you say something evenly, you say it in a calm way without getting angry or upset
when there is an equal chance that an animal or person will win or lose a race, and the money that someone can win by betting on the race is the same as the amount they risk
Sense.TRAN: 均等的输赢机会﹔一比一的赔率

Sense.DEF: the evening religious ceremony in the Church of England
something that happens, especially something important, interesting or unusual
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指重要﹑有意思或不寻常的〕事件
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the most important events in the history of mankind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类历史上最重大的事件之一

Sense.DEF: a performance, sports competition, party etc at which people gather together to watch or take part in something
Sense.TRAN: 活动〔指演出﹑体育比赛﹑聚会等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The conference was an important social event an event at which people can meet each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次会议是一次重要的社交活动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the major sporting events of the year
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年度重大体育赛事之一

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The school raises money by organizing fundraising events.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校举办捐款活动来筹集资金。

Sense.DEF: one of the races or competitions that are part of a large sports competition
Sense.TRAN: 〔大型体育比赛中的〕比赛项目
Sense.EXAMPLE: The next event will be the 100 metres.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下一个项目为100米赛跑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The 800 metres is not his best event. 800
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米赛跑不是他的强项。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something will definitely happen or be true in spite of anything else that may happen
Sense.TRAN: 不管是哪种情况﹐无论如何
Sense.EXAMPLE: I might see you tomorrow, but I’ll phone in any event.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我明天或许会与你见面﹐但不管怎样我都会给你打电话。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize what actually happened in a situation as opposed to what you thought might happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Extra police officers were brought in, although in the event the demonstration passed off peacefully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然又增派了警察﹐但结果示威游行以和平的方式进行。

Variant.LEXVAR: in the event that sth happens

Sense.DEF: used to tell people what they should do if something happens
Sense.TRAN: 如果某事发生﹔万一…﹐假若…
Sense.EXAMPLE: He left a letter for me to read in the event of his death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他留了一封信给我﹐万一他去世﹐我可以看。

Sense.LEXUNIT: in the normal course of events
Sense.DEF: if things happen in the normal way
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the normal course of events, the money is released within about three months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果一切正常﹐大约在三个月之内即可放款。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: important
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Getting married is a major event in anyone’s life.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 结婚对谁来说都是人生的一桩大事。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s natural to be nervous before such an important event.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这样一件大事到来之前感到紧张是很自然的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very important
Collocate.EXAMPLE: the momentous events of 9/11
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: “九一一”重大事件

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very important in a country’s history
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The signing of the peace treaty was a historic event.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项和平条约的签订是一个历史性事件。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very exciting
very sad
very upsetting

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Recent events in the country have caused great concern.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国近来发生的事件引起了人们的极大关注。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We will be bringing you news of all the latest events.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将为您报道所有最新的新闻事件。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There are some similarities between what happened in the 1920s and current events in the US.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国当前发生的事件和20世纪20年代的情况有一些相似之处。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The event took place last year.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事是去年发生的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: happen, usually in an exciting or unexpected way
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 事情发生〔一般指激动人心或出乎意料的事件〕
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I watched the dramatic events unfold from my window.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在窗边看着一件件激动人心的事发生。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: cause something
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 若干事情导致某事发生
Collocate.EXAMPLE: His assassination was one of the events that led to the First World War.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的遇刺是导致第一次世界大战爆发的若干事件之一。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the events that are closely related to a situation
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 与某事密切相关的事件
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The events surrounding her death remain a mystery.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关她死亡的种种事件始终是未解的谜团。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do something to show that you remember it
see it happen
write down or photograph what happened
related events that happen one after the other
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The incident was the first in a series of events that finally led to his arrest.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一系列事件导致他最终被捕﹐而这是其中的第一起。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a series of events where each one causes the next
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He set in motion a chain of events that he couldn’t control.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他惹出一串连锁事件﹐自己都无法控制。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the way in which a series of events happens
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Nothing you could have done would have changed the course of events.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管你能做什么﹐都无法改变事情的发展过程。

Exponent.DEF: something that happens, especially something important, interesting, or unusual
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指重要﹑有趣或不寻常的〕事件
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He spoke of the tragic event in which more than 100 people died.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说起了那宗有一百多人死亡的不幸事件。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: recent political events
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的政治事件

Exponent.DEF: something that happens – used especially when saying how often something happens
Exponent.TRAN: 事件〔尤在说明其频繁与否时使用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Storms like this one are fortunately a rare occurrence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸好这样的暴风雨很少发生。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Accidents are almost a daily occurrence on this road.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条路上几乎每天都有事故发生。

Exponent.DEF: something that happens, especially something that is unusual or unpleasant, or something that is one of several events
Exponent.TRAN: 发生的事情〔尤指不寻常﹑不愉快的事或若干事件中的一起〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He died after a violent incident outside a nightclub.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因一起夜总会外的暴力事件而丧命。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This latest incident could put an end to his career.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的这一事件可能会毁了他的事业。

Exponent.DEF: an important social event or celebration
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She only wore the dress for special occasions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条裙子她只在特殊场合才穿。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was his 100th birthday, and friends and family gathered to mark the occasion.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天是他的百岁诞辰﹐家人朋友齐聚一堂﹐庆祝这一特别时刻。

Exponent.DEF: something that happens, especially something shocking in political or public life which involves several people and events
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指令人震惊的〕政治[公共]事件
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The affair has caused people to lose confidence in their government.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一事件令人们对政府失去了信心。

Exponent.DEF: something that happens or exists in society, science, or nature, especially something that is studied because it is difficult to understand
Exponent.TRAN: 〔社会﹑科学﹑自然界中存在的难以理解的〕现象
Exponent.EXAMPLE: natural phenomena such as earthquakes
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 地震等自然现象
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Homelessness is not a new phenomenon.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 无家可归并不是新现象。

Sense.DEF: someone who is even-tempered is calm and does not easily become angry
full of interesting or important events
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s led an eventful life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一生历尽沧桑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an eventful day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不平静的一天

Sense.DEF: evening
a sport in which horses do three different sorts of competition, usually over three days
happening at the end of a long period of time or after a lot of other things have happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sweden were the eventual winners of the tournament.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瑞典队是锦标赛的最后赢家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both sides were happy with the eventual outcome of the talks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方对会谈的最终结果都感到满意。

Sense.DEF: something that might happen, especially something bad
Sense.TRAN: 可能发生的事件[结果]〔尤指坏事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We are prepared for every eventuality.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们准备应付任何可能出现的情况。

Sense.EXAMPLE: That is an unlikely eventuality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是不大可能发生的事情。

Sense.DEF: after a long time, or after a lot of things have happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: He eventually escaped and made his way back to England.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他终于逃脱并返回英格兰。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eventually, she got a job and moved to London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最终﹐她找到了工作并移居伦敦。

Sense.DEF: a word meaning at any time; used mostly in questions, negatives, comparisons, or sentences with ‘if’
Sense.TRAN: 〔一般用于疑问句﹑否定句﹑比较结构或带 if 的句子中〕在任何时候
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nothing ever seems to upset him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 似乎从来没有什么事情会使他烦恼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you ever been to Paris?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你去过巴黎吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think I’ve ever been here before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得我以前从未到过这里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’re ever in Seattle, come and see me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你什么时候到了西雅图﹐就来看我吧。

Sense.DEF: always
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ever optimistic, I decided to take the exam again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一向乐观﹐所以决定再考一次。

Sense.DEF: not very often
Sense.EXAMPLE: We hardly ever go out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们几乎从不出门。

Sense.DEF: never
Sense.EXAMPLE: You never ever offer to help!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你从来都不主动帮忙！

Sense.DEF: for all time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nothing lasts for ever.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有什么是永恒的。

Sense.DEF: as always happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: As ever, Joe was late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同往常一样﹐乔又迟到了。

Sense.DEF: continuously since
Sense.EXAMPLE: My back has been bad ever since I fell and hurt it two years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从我两年前摔伤后﹐后背就一直疼。

Sense.DEF: for all time after something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I suppose they’ll get married and live happily ever after.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想他们要结婚了﹐从此将过上幸福的生活。

Sense.DEF: even hotter etc than before
Sense.TRAN: 比以前任何时候都热/冷/好等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Last night’s show was better than ever.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚的演出比以前任何一场都好看。

Sense.DEF: as friendly etc as someone or something usually is
Sense.TRAN: 与往常一样友好/快活/痛苦等
Sense.EXAMPLE: George was as miserable as ever.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治和往常一样痛苦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The food was as bad as ever!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那食物和平常一样糟糕！

Sense.DEF: very cold, wet etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The assistant was ever so helpful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个助手帮了大忙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thanks ever so much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常感谢。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize what someone or something is like
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s ever such a nice girl.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是一个如此可爱的姑娘。

Sense.DEF: increasing, present etc all the time
Sense.TRAN: 不断增加的/始终存在的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ever-increasing problem of drugs in the inner cities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧城区不断加剧的毒品问题

Sense.DEF: used at the end of a letter above the signature
Sense.TRAN: 你永远的〔书信末尾签名前的套语〕

Sense.DEF: informal used to say that someone or something is a typical example of something
Sense.TRAN: 确实〔用于表示某人或某物是个典型的例子〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a natural comedian if ever there was one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他确实是个天生的喜剧演员。

Sense.DEF: an evergreen tree or bush does not lose its leaves in winter
an evergreen sportsman, singer etc is still good and popular even though they are fairly old
Sense.TRAN: 〔运动员﹑歌手等〕事业经久不衰的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the evergreen Cliff Richard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐坛常青树克里夫·理查德

Sense.DEF: a tree or bush that does not lose its leaves in winter
continuing for ever, even after someone has died
Sense.EXAMPLE: everlasting fame
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 永久的名声
Sense.EXAMPLE: a symbol of God’s everlasting love
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上帝永恒之爱的象征
Sense.EXAMPLE: a belief in life everlasting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对永生的信念

Sense.DEF: for ever
Sense.EXAMPLE: I will love you for evermore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我将永远爱你。

Head.GRAM: always followed by a singular countable noun
Head.GRAMTRAN: 总是后接单数可数名词

Sense.DEF: used to refer to all the people or things in a particular group or all the parts of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We looked carefully at every car that drove past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们仔细地看着驶过的每一辆汽车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every child will receive a certificate at the end of the course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 课程结束时﹐每一个孩子都可以获得证书。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I enjoyed every minute of the film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那部电影我从头到尾都看得很过瘾。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I listened carefully to every word he said.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说的每一个字我都听得很仔细。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to emphasize that you mean ‘all’
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He seems to know every single person in the school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他好像认识学校里的每一个人。

GramExa.GLOSS: all of something, including even the smallest amount of it
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 每一滴/一点/一片等〔指全部﹐没有遗漏〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They made us pick up every last scrap of paper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们让我们把所有的小纸片都捡起来。

Subsense.DEF: used to say how often something happens
Subsense.TRAN: 每﹐每逢﹐每隔〔用于表示某事发生的频率〕

GramExa.GLOSS: at least once on each day, in each week etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They see each other every day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们每天都见面。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Richard visits his mother every week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 理查德每周都去看望他母亲。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Re-apply your sunscreen every two hours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每隔两小时重抹一次防晒霜。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Freda had to stop to rest every hundred metres or so each time she had gone 100 metres.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗蕾达每走一百米左右就得停下来休息。

Subsense.DEF: used to say how much distance there is between the things in a line
Subsense.TRAN: 每隔〔用于表示间隔距离〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were traffic lights every ten yards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每隔十码就有红绿灯。

Sense.DEF: whenever
Sense.EXAMPLE: The roof leaks every time it rains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每逢下雨屋顶都会漏水。

Sense.DEF: sometimes, but not often or regularly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I still see her every now and then.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我偶尔还会见到她。

Sense.DEF: the first, third, fifth etc or the second, fourth, sixth etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: You only need to water plants every other day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你只需要隔天给植物浇浇水。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I visit my parents every other weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每隔一个周末去看望父母。

Sense.LEXUNIT: one in every three/two in every hundred etc
Sense.DEF: used to show how common something is
Sense.TRAN: 每三个中的一个/每一百个中的两个等
Sense.EXAMPLE: In Britain, one in every three marriages now ends in divorce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今在英国﹐每三桩婚姻中就有一桩以离婚告终。

Sense.DEF: the strongest or greatest possible
Sense.TRAN: 可能最强[最大]的〔表示可能达到的最大程度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We wish you every happiness in your new home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们祝你在新居生活幸福美满。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is every chance that he will recover.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他完全有希望康复。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have every reason to believe that the operation will be a success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有充分理由相信手术会成功。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have every intention of winning this competition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一心想赢下这场比赛。

Sense.DEF: in all ways
Sense.TRAN: 在各个方面﹐在所有方面
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school’s much better now in every way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校目前在各个方面都大有改善。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is equally as good, important etc as something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Taking regular exercise is every bit as important as having a healthy diet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经常锻炼和健康饮食一样重要。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I loved him every bit as much as she did.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她爱他多少﹐我也爱他多少。

Sense.DEF: used to mean ‘everyone’ or ‘anyone’, especially when you disapprove because there is no limit on who can be included
Sense.TRAN: 所有人﹐任何人〔尤用以表达说话者因谁可以包括在内而产生的不满〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t want every Tom, Dick and Harry knowing about my private life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想让张三李四都知道我的私生活。

Sense.DEF: in every direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids ran off every which way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们四散逃开。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Every is used before a singular noun. Use a sing ular verb after it. every
F2NBox.TRAN: 用于单数名词之前﹐其后要用单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Every member wears a uniform.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 每名成员都穿着制服 。
F2NBox.EXPL: Every is usually used with a singular pronoun or determiner (he, she, it, his, himself etc). every
F2NBox.TRAN: 一般和单数代词或限定词( he, she, it, his, himself等)连用
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Every player did his best.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 每名球员都尽了力。
F2NBox.EXPL: However, you can use ‘they’, ‘them’, ‘their’ etc when you do not want to say whether people are male or female.
F2NBox.TRAN: 但若不想指明是男性或女性﹐则可用 they﹐ them﹐ their 等
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Every child has their own room.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个孩子都有自己的房间 。

Sense.DEF: everyone
ordinary, usual, or happening every day
Sense.EXAMPLE: the problems of everyday life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日常生活中的问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: wearing everyday clothes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿平常衣服
Sense.EXAMPLE: a simple, everyday object
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简单的日常物品
Sense.EXAMPLE: Describe it in ordinary everyday language.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用一般的日常语言把它描述一下。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse with every day(=each day). 不要与 every day 混淆: I see him every day. 我每天和他见面。

Sense.DEF: a typical, ordinary person who is not very rich and has the problems and difficulties that all people have
every person
Sense.EXAMPLE: If everyone is ready, I’ll begin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果大家都准备好了﹐我就开始。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Send my best wishes to everyone in the family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请向全家人致以最美好的祝愿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Of course everyone else thought it was hilarious!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当然其他所有人都觉得好笑极了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not everyone enjoys sport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 并不是谁都喜欢体育运动的。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Use a singular verb after everyone.
F2NBox.TRAN: everyone后用单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Everyone admires her.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都很敬佩她。
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not say ‘everyone of us/them’. Use all.
F2NBox.TRAN: 不要说everyone of us/them，而要用all。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We all (NOT 不说 Everyone of us)
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: enjoyed the film. 这部电影我们都看得很过瘾。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He had written to all of them (NOT 不说 to everyone of them).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给他们一一写了信。
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not confuse with every one (=each one). You can use ‘of’ after this, to emphasize that you are talking about a whole group.
F2NBox.TRAN: 不要与every one混淆﹐ every one后可以用of来强调所指的是全体
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I wish to thank every one of you.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要感谢你们每一个人。

Sense.DEF: everywhere
Sense.TRAN: 在各个地方﹔到各个地方﹔处处

Sense.DEF: each thing or all things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everything was covered in a thick layer of dust.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有东西上面都蒙着厚厚一层灰。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I decided to tell her everything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定把一切都告诉她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Apart from the bus arriving late, everything else seemed to be going according to plan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了公共汽车晚点之外﹐其他一切似乎都在按计划进行。

Sense.DEF: all the things in your life, work etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everything’s fine at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前一切都好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt that everything was going wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得一切都不顺利。

Sense.DEF: to be the most important thing in someone’s life
Sense.EXAMPLE: Money isn’t everything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金钱不是一切。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His children mean everything to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子对他来说意味着一切。

Sense.DEF: to have all the things that people want in their lives
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you buy for the man who has everything?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对那个样样都有的人来说﹐你能买些什么呢？

Sense.DEF: and a lot of other similar things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tina’s worried about her work and everything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂娜担心她的工作以及其他事情。

Sense.DEF: to have all the qualities that are likely to make you succeed
Sense.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t worry so much – you’ve got everything going for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不该这么担心﹐一切都对你有利。

Sense.DEF: all the equipment that you need and also a lot of things that you do not need — used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 需要的一切物品和许多不需要的东西〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think we’ve packed everything but the kitchen sink!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们把有用的没用的都装上了！

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Use a singular verb after everything.
F2NBox.TRAN: everything后用单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Everything is ready.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 一切就绪。

Sense.DEF: in or to every place
Sense.TRAN: 在各个地方﹔到各个地方﹔处处
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve looked everywhere but I can’t find the map.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我到处都找过了﹐但就是找不到地图。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s travelled everywhere in Europe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走遍了欧洲各地。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The south should remain dry, but everywhere else will have heavy rain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 南部持续干旱﹐但其他地区会下暴雨。

Sense.DEF: to be very common
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must have seen the posters, they’re everywhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你肯定看到海报了﹐贴得到处都是。

Sense.DEF: a sweet dessert food, consisting of cooked apples with a layer of sponge cake on top
to tell someone legally that they must leave the house they are living in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were unable to pay the rent, and were evicted from their home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们付不起房租﹐所以被赶出了门。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They refused to leave and were forcibly evictedevicted by force.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们拒绝离开﹐结果被强行赶走。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: All attempts to have them evicted so far have been unsuccessful.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到目前为止已多次试图将他们赶走﹐但均未成功。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: : The family now faces eviction from their home.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家人现正面临被赶出家门的处境。

Sense.DEF: facts or signs that show clearly that something exists or is true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At present we have no evidence of life on other planets.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前我们还没有其他行星上存在生命的证据。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is no evidence for these claims.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些说法没有根据。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you have evidence that this treatment works?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有证据证明这种治疗有效？

Sense.DEF: information that is given in a court of law in order to prove that someone is guilty or not guilty
Sense.TRAN: 〔法庭上证明某人有罪或无罪的〕证据﹐证词
Sense.EXAMPLE: Murrow’s evidence was enough to convict Hayes of murder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 默罗的证词足以证明海斯犯了谋杀罪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He refused to give evidence at the trial.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拒绝出庭作证。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was very little evidence against the two men.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎没有证据可以证明这两名男子有罪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The documents may be used in evidence at the trial.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些文件可以在庭审时用作证据。

Sense.DEF: to be present and easily seen or noticed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police are always in evidence at football matches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察在足球比赛中总是很显眼。

F2NBox.EXPL: Evidence is an uncountable noun and has no plural form. Use a singular verb after it.
F2NBox.TRAN: evidence是不可数名词﹐没有复数形式﹐其后要用单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Vital evidence was destroyed.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 关键证据被毁。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Do the police have any evidence against him?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方有什么对他不利的证据吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The authorities failed to obtain enough evidence to convict him.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 当局未能获取足够证据给他定罪。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Police experts are still collecting evidence at the scene of the crime.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方专家仍在犯罪现场收集证据。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The investigation will look for evidence of financial mismanagement.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次调查将寻找财务管理不善的证据。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The killer may have tried to burn the bodies in an attempt to hide the evidence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 凶手可能为了掩盖证据而试图焚烧尸体。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: deliberately put evidence somewhere to make someone look guilty
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He claims the evidence was planted there by the police.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他声称是警方栽赃。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: find evidence and prepare it for a court case
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The case was adjourned to allow the police time to produce further evidence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 案件暂缓审理﹐给警方时间以提供进一步证据。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: tell a court about what you have seen or know to be true
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Ms White has agreed to give evidence at their trial.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 怀特夫人已同意在他们庭审时出庭作证。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Having considered all the evidence, the court found him not guilty.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭研究了所有证据后判他无罪。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 充分的/明显的/有力的证据
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is clear evidence that smoking causes heart disease.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有明显证据表明吸烟导致心脏病。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very clear evidence which proves that something is true
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They have no hard evidence to support their claim.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没有确凿证据证明自己的说法。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: new evidence
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The police say they may have found fresh evidence which proves Tilly was at the scene of the crime.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方称他们可能已经找到新的证据﹐证明蒂莉当时在案发现场。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There isn’t any medical evidence to support the claim.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有医学证据支持这种说法。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: which people can trust or believe
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Do you think their evidence is reliable?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为他们的证词可信吗？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not good enough to make you believe something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Their conclusions are drawn from some very flimsy evidence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们是根据一些很不可信的证据得出结论的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: making you feel sure that something is true
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The data provides compelling evidence that the climate is changing.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些数据令人信服地证明了气候在变化。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when there is so much evidence that you are sure that something is true
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The evidence against him was overwhelming.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 指控他的证据无可辩驳。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very strong evidence which cannot be disproved
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 不容置疑的/无可辩驳的证据

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: pieces of evidence that support different conclusions
evidence which makes something seem likely, but does not prove it
based on what people believe, rather than on facts
based on scientific testing or practical experience

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The study produced one interesting piece of evidence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 此研究提供了一项有趣的证据。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: no evidence at all
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is not one scrap of evidence against our client.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有丝毫证据能证明我们的委托人有罪。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘true evidence’. Say 而要说 reliable evidence.

Sense.DEF: to show that something exists or is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: The volcano is still active, as evidenced by the recent eruption.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的喷发证明﹐这座火山依然活跃。

Sense.DEF: easy to see, notice, or understand

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was evident that she was unhappy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她显然不开心。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It soon became evident that she was seriously ill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家很快就明白她病得很重。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was clearly evident that the company was in financial difficulties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很明显﹐公司陷入了财务困境。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was evident to me that he was not telling the truth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我十分清楚他没说实话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The growing popularity of the subject is evident in the numbers of students wanting to study it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课程越来越受欢迎﹐从想修读此课程的学生人数上即可明显看出这一点。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Bob ate his lunch with evident enjoyment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然鲍勃吃午饭吃得津津有味。

Sense.DEF: able to be used as evidence, or relating to evidence
Sense.TRAN: 用作证据的﹔与证据有关的
Sense.EXAMPLE: All jury members should have a copy of the evidential data.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有陪审团成员都应该有一份证据资料。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is true because you can see that it is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was evidently a heavy smoker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她显然烟瘾很大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was evidently in pain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他显然很痛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was evidently upset by what she saw.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她显然对所见到的事情感到不快。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Evidently, the builders had finished and gone home early.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很明显﹐建筑工人干完活后早早回家了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you have been told that something is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was evidently a rude, unpleasant child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说他是个粗鲁而讨厌的孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Evidently, the local authority are planning to close the school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说地方当局打算关闭该学校。

Sense.DEF: someone who is evil deliberately does very cruel things to harm other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: an evil dictator responsible for the deaths of millions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应对数百万人之死负责的邪恶独裁者
Sense.EXAMPLE: his evil deeds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的恶行

Sense.DEF: something that is evil is morally wrong because it harms people
Sense.EXAMPLE: They condemned slavery as evil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们谴责奴隶制是不道德的。

Sense.DEF: very unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: an evil smell
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恶臭
Sense.EXAMPLE: a puddle of evil black liquid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑色的臭水坑

Sense.DEF: connected with the Devil and having special powers to harm people
Sense.EXAMPLE: evil spirits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恶鬼
Sense.EXAMPLE: an evil spell
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恶咒

Sense.DEF: the power, which some people believe exists, to harm people by looking at them
Sense.TRAN: 〔据说可以伤害人的〕邪毒眼光
Sense.EXAMPLE: He claimed to have the power of the evil eye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他声称自己能用邪恶眼光伤人。

Sense.DEF: a time when you expect something unpleasant or difficult to happen
Sense.TRAN: 不祥的时刻﹐倒霉的时候
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t delay, you’re only putting off the evil hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别耽误时间了﹐你不过是在把倒霉的时候往后拖一拖而已。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Jeff grinned evilly as he picked up the phone.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰夫拿起电话时狞笑了一下。

Sense.DEF: something that is very bad or harmful
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wanted to protect her children from the evils of the outside world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想保护她的孩子不受外界的不良影响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Poverty is one of the greatest social evils of our time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫困是当代最大的社会弊端之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the evils of capitalism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 资本主义的种种祸害

Sense.DEF: cruel or morally bad behaviour in general
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is too much evil in the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世上的罪恶太多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the eternal struggle between good and evil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 善恶之间永无休止的斗争

Sense.DEF: someone who commits crimes or does evil things
immoral and cruel, and likely to cause a lot of harm or damage
Sense.EXAMPLE: an evil-minded dictator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 心术不正的独裁者

Sense.DEF: to show a feeling or have a quality in a way that people can easily notice
Sense.EXAMPLE: She evinced no surprise at seeing them together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到他们在一起﹐她没有表露出惊讶。

Sense.DEF: to cut the organs out of a person’s or animal’s body
making people remember something by producing a feeling or memory in them
Sense.TRAN: 引起记忆的﹔唤起感情的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a picture that is wonderfully evocative of a hot, summer’s day
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 唤起人们对炎炎夏日切身感受的图画

Sense.EXAMPLE: evocative music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 勾起回忆的音乐

Sense.DEF: to produce a strong feeling or memory in someone
Sense.TRAN: 引起﹐唤起〔某人强烈的感情或回忆〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The photographs evoked strong memories of our holidays in France.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些照片勾起了我们到法国度假的深刻回忆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His appearance is bound to evoke sympathy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的外表肯定会引起人们的同情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her speech evoked a hostile response.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的讲话引起了敌对的反应。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The poem is an evocation of lost love.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这首诗是对逝去爱情的追忆。

Sense.DEF: the scientific idea that plants and animals develop and change gradually over a long period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the evolution of mammals
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哺乳动物的进化

Sense.EXAMPLE: the theory of evolution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 进化论

Sense.DEF: the gradual change and development of an idea, situation, or object

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the evolution of the computer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机的发展

Sense.DEF: relating to the way in which plants and animals develop and change gradually over a long period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: the evolutionary development of birds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸟类的进化过程
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some scientists have rejected evolutionary theory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些科学家拒绝接受进化论。

Sense.DEF: relating to the way in which ideas or situations gradually change and develop over a long period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is in favour of gradual, evolutionary social change.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他支持渐进的社会变革。

Sense.DEF: if an animal or plant evolves, it changes gradually over a long period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fish evolved from prehistoric sea creatures.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鱼是从史前的海洋生物进化而来的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Animals have evolved camouflage to protect themselves from predators.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动物进化形成了伪装﹐以保护自身不被捕食性动物所捕食。

Sense.DEF: to develop and change gradually over a long period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school has evolved its own style of teaching.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校逐步形成了自己的教学风格。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Businesses need to evolve rapidly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各项业务需要快速发展。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The idea evolved out of work done by British scientists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一观点是从英国科学家的研究工作中逐步形成的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The group gradually evolved into a political party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该团体逐步发展成了一个政党。

Sense.DEF: a female sheep
a large container for water, that was used in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时使用的〕大口水罐﹐大口水壶

Sense.DEF: used to show that you think something is extremely unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: She kissed him? Eww!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她亲他啦？真恶心！

Sense.DEF: someone’s former wife, husband, girlfriend, or boyfriend
Sense.TRAN: 前妻﹔前夫﹔前女友﹔前男友
Sense.EXAMPLE: I bumped into my ex in town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在城里遇见了我以前的那位。

Sense.DEF: former and still living
Sense.TRAN: 以前的﹐前任的〔指仍然在世的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: his ex-wife
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的前妻
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ex-England cricketer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前英格兰板球队队员

Sense.DEF: to make a bad situation worse
Sense.EXAMPLE: The recession has exacerbated this problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济衰退使这个问题更加严重。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to exacerbate the situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想使情况变得更糟。

Sense.DEF: completely correct in every detail
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police are still investigating the exact cause of the accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方还在调查这起事故的确切原因。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What were his exact words?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的原话是什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The timing had to be exact.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对时机的把握必须精确。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The exact location of the hostages is unknown.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人质所处的确切位置并不清楚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I know her birthday’s in July, but I can’t remember the exact date.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道她的生日是在7月﹐但想不起确切的日子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s not an exact copy, but most people wouldn’t notice the difference.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 它不是一模一样的复制品﹐但大多数人不会察觉到不同之处。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Some concepts in Chinese medicine have no exact equivalent in Western medicine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中医的一些概念在西医中没有完全一样的对应观念。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that what you are saying is exact
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has worked at the bank for many years, nine to be exact.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已在银行工作多年﹐确切地说是九年。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that the same thing is involved
Sense.TRAN: 一样的颜色/时刻/类型等
Sense.EXAMPLE: the exact colour I was looking for
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正是我在找的那种颜色
Sense.EXAMPLE: He came into the room at the exact moment I mentioned his name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我提到他名字时他恰好进了房间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s the exact same thing my dad said.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那跟我爸爸说的一模一样。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is as different as possible from another person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gina’s the exact opposite of her little sister.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉娜和她的小妹妹截然不同。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sth is not an exact science
Sense.DEF: if you say that an activity is not an exact science, you mean that it involves opinions, guessing etc
Sense.TRAN: 某事物不是一门精密的科学
Sense.EXAMPLE: Predicting the weather is not an exact science.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气预报不是一门精准的科学。

Sense.DEF: someone who is exact is very careful and thorough in what they do
to demand and get something from someone by using threats, force etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I exacted a promise from Ros that she wouldn’t say a word.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要求罗斯保证不提一个字。

Sense.DEF: if someone exacts revenge, they punish a person who has harmed them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leonard was determined to exact revenge on his wife’s killer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦纳德决心报复杀害他妻子的凶手。

Sense.DEF: if something exacts a high or a heavy price, it has a very bad effect on a person or on a situation
Sense.TRAN: 迫使付出昂贵/沉重的代价
Sense.EXAMPLE: The years of conflict have exacted a heavy price.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多年的冲突造成了惨重的损失。

Sense.DEF: demanding a lot of effort, careful work, or skill
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was an exacting woman to work for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是一位对下属要求严格的女性。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He could never live up to his father’s exacting standards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从来都无法达到他父亲的严苛标准。

Sense.DEF: the state of being exact
used when emphasizing that something is no more and no less than a number or amount, or is completely correct in every detail
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s exactly half past five.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一分不差﹐正好5点半。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The figures may not be exactly right, but they’re close enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些数字可能不是非常精确﹐但也相当接近。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t remember exactly what she said.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她确切说了些什么﹐我想不起来了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a tragic situation and no one will ever know exactly what happened.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 场面很悲惨﹐没有人会知道究竟发生了什么。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Where exactly did you stay in Portugal?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在葡萄牙究竟待在什么地方？

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is the same or different
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s exactly what we’ve been trying to tell you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那正是我们一直想告诉你的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s exactly the kind of work I’ve been looking for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这正是我一直在找的那种工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tries to be exactly like her older sister.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想使自己和姐姐一模一样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kevin’s teachers saw him as quiet and serious, but with his friends he was exactly the opposite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯文在老师眼中既文静又严肃﹐但他和朋友在一起时却截然相反。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two candidates responded to the question in exactly the same way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两位候选人对那个问题的回答一模一样。

Sense.DEF: spoken

Subsense.DEF: used as a reply to show that what someone has said is not completely correct or true
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘You hate Lee, don’t you?’ ‘Not exactly. I just think he’s a bit annoying, that’s all.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你恨李﹐是不是？” “不完全是这样。 我只是觉得他有一点讨厌﹐如此而已。”

Subsense.DEF: used to show that you mean the complete opposite, either humorously, or when you are annoyed
Subsense.TRAN: 并不是﹐可不是〔表示幽默或厌烦〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t bother asking Dave – he’s not exactly Einstein he is stupid.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我才懒得去问戴夫﹐他又不是什么爱因斯坦。

Sense.DEF: used as a reply to show that you think what someone has said is completely correct or true
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘So you think we should sell the house?’ ‘Exactly.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这么说你认为我们应该卖掉房子？” “正是。”

Exponent.DEF: used when emphasizing that something is no more and no less than a number or amount, or is completely correct in every detail
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bill came to exactly $1,000.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 账单金额总共1,000美元整。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Police are still trying to find out exactly how the accident happened.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方仍在设法查明事故究竟是如何发生的。

Exponent.DEF: exactly – used when it is important to be sure that something is completely correct in every detail
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We need to know precisely how much this is going to cost.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得知道这究竟要花多少钱。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can you tell us precisely where he is?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能不能告诉我们他到底在哪里？

Exponent.DEF: exactly – used especially when saying that things are exactly right, exactly the same, or exactly in a particular position
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The frame is just the right size for the picture.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个画框配这幅画大小正合适。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He and his brother are just the same.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和他弟弟一模一样。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The hotel is just next to the station.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家宾馆就在车站旁边。

Exponent.DEF: exactly in a particular position or direction
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The ball hit me right in the eye!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 球正好打中我眼睛！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s the house, right in front of you.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子在那儿﹐就在你面前。

Exponent.DEF: exactly in a particular position or direction. Directly is more formal than right.
Exponent.TRAN: 恰好﹐正好〔在某个位置或方向﹔directly比right更为正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Amy was sitting directly opposite me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃米坐在我正对面。

Exponent.DEF: at exactly a particular time, and no earlier or later than that time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She always leaves the office at 5.30 p.m. on the dot.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是5点半准时离开办公室。

Exponent.DEF: exactly – used especially in the following very informal expressions
Exponent.TRAN: 准确地﹐正巧﹐恰恰〔尤用于下列非正式的表达方式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The train was bang on time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车准点到达。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The shot was bang on target.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 子弹正中目标。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Cockatoo Island is right bang in the middle of Sydney harbour.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 科克图岛在悉尼港的正中央。

Sense.DEF: to make something seem better, larger, worse etc than it really is
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t sleep for three days – I’m not exaggerating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我三天没睡觉了——一点不夸张。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to exaggerate the importance of sleep.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 睡眠的重要性怎么说也不为过。

Sense.DEF: if something is exaggerated, it is described as better, larger etc than it really is
Sense.EXAMPLE: The revenue figures may be slightly exaggerated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收益数字可能有点夸大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The danger had been greatly exaggerated.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 危险被过分夸大了。

Sense.DEF: an exaggerated sound or movement is emphasized to make people notice
Sense.TRAN: 〔声音或动作〕夸张的﹐引人注目的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an exaggerated sigh
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做作的叹息
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made an exaggerated bow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他夸张地鞠了个躬。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spoke with an exaggerated New York accent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说话带有夸张的纽约口音。

Sense.DEF: a statement or way of saying something that makes something seem better, larger etc than it really is
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would be an exaggeration to say that we were close friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说我们是密友不免言过其实了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is no exaggeration to say that everyone will be affected by the new policy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说人人都会受到新政策的影响一点也不夸张。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The situation can be described, without exaggeration, as disastrous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以毫不夸张地说﹐这是灾难性的局面。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That sounds like a slight exaggeration.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那听上去有点夸张。

Sense.DEF: to put someone or something into a high rank or position
to praise someone, especially God
Sense.EXAMPLE: Exalt ye the Lord.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赞美你﹐我的主。

Sense.DEF: a very strong feeling of happiness
the state of being put into a high rank or position
having a very high rank and highly respected
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt shy in such exalted company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我与如此显贵的人在一起觉得拘束。

Sense.DEF: filled with a great feeling of joy
Sense.TRAN: 异常兴奋的﹐兴高采烈的

Sense.DEF: a spoken or written test of knowledge, especially an important one
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the end of each level, there’s an exam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在每一级别结束时都有一次考试。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How did you do in your exams?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你考试考得怎么样？

Sense.DEF: the paper on which the questions for an exam are written
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do not open your exams until I tell you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听到指令前不要打开试卷。

Sense.DEF: a set of medical tests
Sense.EXAMPLE: an eye exam
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼睛检查

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We have to take exams at the end of each year.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年年底我们都得参加考试。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: succeed in it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Did you pass your final exam?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 期末考试你通过了吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: If you fail the exam, you can retake it.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果考试不及格﹐可以重考。
Maria always did well in her exams at school. 玛丽亚读书时考试成绩一向不错。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She has to study for her exams.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她得复习功课﹐准备考试。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: pass it easily
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry – I’m sure you’ll sail through all your exams.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心——我敢肯定你能顺利通过每一门考试。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: only just pass it
fail it
take it again because you did not do well the first time

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I knew I wouldn’t pass the German exam.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道自己通不过德语考试。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is a written exam at the end of the course.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 课程结束时有一次笔试。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in which you answer questions by speaking
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I have my French oral exams next week.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 下周我有法语口试。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that you do to practise for the real exams
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He did well in the mock exams.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 模拟考试他考得不错。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in which you have to make or do things
at the end of a course
in order to enter a school or university
to qualify in a profession, for example to be an accountant
in order to become a lawyer
in order to become a nurse or doctor

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The school achieves consistently good exam results.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该校考试成绩一向不错。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’ve still got dozens of exam papers to mark.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还有好多试卷要评分。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Read the exam questions carefully before writing your answers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 仔细阅读试题﹐然后再下笔作答。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: good ways to succeed in exams

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘make an exam’. Say 而要说 take an exam or 或 do an exam.

Sense.DEF: a spoken or written test of knowledge, especially an important one
Sense.EXAMPLE: The examination results will be announced in September.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考试成绩将于9月公布。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s already taken the entrance examination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已经参加了入学考试。

Sense.DEF: the process of looking at something carefully in order to see what it is like

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a detailed examination of population statistics
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对人口统计数据的细致审查

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The proposals are still under examination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些提案还在审查之中。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The issues need further examination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些问题需要进一步考察。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On closer examination the vases were seen to be cracked.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经进一步检查发现﹐那些花瓶上有裂纹。

Sense.DEF: a set of medical tests
Sense.EXAMPLE: All patients had a complete physical examination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有患者都接受了全面的体检。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A post-mortem examination an examination on a dead body showed that he died from head injuries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 验尸结果显示他死于头部受伤。

Sense.DEF: the process of asking questions to get specific information, especially in a court of law
to look at something carefully and thoroughly because you want to find out more about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: A team of divers was sent down to examine the wreck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一组潜水员被送到水下检查沉船。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hegel’s philosophy will be examined in detail in Chapter 4.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑格尔的哲学将在第4章作详细探讨。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the course, we will examine how and why Spain became a democracy in 1931.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本课程将探讨西班牙于1931年成为民主国家的方式和原因。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police will have to examine the weapon for fingerprints.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察得检查凶器﹐看有没有指纹。

Sense.DEF: if a doctor examines you, they look at your body to check that you are healthy
to ask someone questions to test their knowledge of a subject

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You will be examined on American history.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要参加美国历史的考试。

Sense.DEF: to officially ask someone questions in a court of law

Exponent.DEF: to look at something carefully and thoroughly because you want to find out more about it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Experts who examined the painting believe it is genuine.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 仔细看过这幅画的专家认为它是真迹。

Exponent.EXP: have a look at/take a look at
Exponent.DEF: to quickly examine something to find out what is wrong with it or to find out more about it. Have a look at is less formal than examine, and is the usual phrase to use in everyday English.
Exponent.TRAN: 看一看〔have a look at没有examine正式﹐常用于日常英语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll have a look at your car if you like.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你愿意﹐我来看一下你的车。

Exponent.DEF: to examine something carefully to make sure that it is correct, safe, or working properly, especially when it is your job to do this
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指出于工作需要而〕仔细检查
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The building is regularly inspected by a fire-safety officer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢大楼由消防安全官定期检查。

Exponent.DEF: to examine something carefully, especially detailed information about something, so that you can understand it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Researchers analyzed the results of the survey.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究人员分析了调查结果。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We’re still analysing all the data.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还在对所有数据进行分析。

Exponent.DEF: to spend a lot of time examining something very carefully, for example a problem or situation
Exponent.TRAN: 〔花大量时间〕仔细研究〔问题﹑情况等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A team of scientists has been studying the effects of global warming on Antarctica.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个科学家小组一直在研究全球变暖对南极洲的影响。

Exponent.DEF: to examine something such as a situation or process to see if any changes are necessary
Exponent.TRAN: 审查﹐检讨〔以确定是否需要进行必要的修改〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bank will review its security procedures after last week’s attack.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 上周的袭击案发生后﹐该银行将检讨其保安措施。

Exponent.DEF: to examine something very carefully to find out if there is anything wrong with it
Exponent.TRAN: 仔细检查﹐认真查看﹐详审
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Congress is currently scrutinizing the deal.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会目前正在仔细审查该协议。

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the verbs examine, take/have a look at, and inspect in spoken and written English. 动词 examine﹐take/have a look at 和 inspect 在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。

This graph shows that the expressions have a look at and take a look at are much more common in spoken English than the words examine or inspect. This is because have a look at and take a look at are much more general than examine or inspect, which mean ‘to look at something carefully in order to find out about it or check if it is satisfactory’. They are more common in written English. 本图表显示﹐在英语口语中短语 have a look at 和 take a look at 的使用频率远远高于 examine 和 inspect﹐因为 have a look at 和 take a look at的含义更广﹐而examine和inspect则表示仔细检查某事物以找出信息或核查其是否令人满意。这两个词在书面语中更为常用。

Sense.DEF: someone from a university, college, or professional institution who tests students’ knowledge or ability
a specific fact, idea, person, or thing that is used to explain or support a general idea, or to show what is typical of a larger group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can anyone give me an example of a transitive verb?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁能给我举个及物动词的例子吗？

Sense.DEF: used before mentioning a specific thing, person, place etc in order to explain what you mean or to support an argument
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many countries, for example Mexico and Japan, have a lot of earthquakes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多国家﹐例如墨西哥和日本﹐经常发生地震。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Car prices can vary a lot. For example, in Belgium the VW Golf costs $1,000 less than in Britain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车的价格会大不相同﹐例如﹐在比利时大众高尔夫轿车的价钱比在英国要低1,000美元。

Sense.DEF: someone whose behaviour is very good and should be copied by others, or this type of behaviour

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her courage is an example to us all.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的勇气是我们大家的榜样。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Parents should set an example for their children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母应该为孩子树立榜样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I suggest you follow Rosie’s example copy her behaviour and start doing regular exercise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我建议你学学罗西﹐开始经常性的锻炼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team captain leads by example.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 队长以身作则。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a shining example a very good example of what a mother should be.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是为人母者的光辉榜样。

Sense.DEF: to punish someone so that other people are afraid to do the same thing
Sense.TRAN: 惩罚某人以儆戒他人﹐杀鸡儆猴

Collocate.EXAMPLE: This painting is a good example of his early work.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画是他早期作品的范例。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The house is a fine example of a medieval building.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢房屋是典型的中世纪建筑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: extremely good
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The garden is one of the most outstanding examples of traditional Japanese garden design.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座花园是日本传统园艺设计的一个典范之作。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very typical
Collocate.EXAMPLE: This is a classic example of how not to run a business.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对于如何经营公司是个绝佳的反面教材。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Our climate is changing at an alarming rate. The melting of the polar ice caps is an obvious example of this.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的气候正以触目惊心的速度发生变化﹐极地冰冠的融化就是一个明显的例子。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very obvious and very bad
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 公然的/显而易见的坏例子
Collocate.EXAMPLE: His case is a blatant example of the unfairness of the current system.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的情况是当前制度不公的一个明显例子。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: important and worth mentioning
very clear and full of unpleasant details

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Let me give you an example of how this might happen.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来给你举个例子说明一下这种情况怎么会发生。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Our brochure provides examples of the different villas on offer.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的小册子提供了多种待售别墅的实例。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: consider it or talk about it
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 以…为例〔进行考虑或讨论〕
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Let’s take the example of a family with two school-age children.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我们以一个有两名学龄儿童的家庭为例。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He used several examples to illustrate his point.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用了几个例子来说明自己的观点。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: mention an example
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The report cites the example of Sweden, where there is a complete ban on advertising on children’s television.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告援引瑞典为例﹐该国彻底禁止在儿童电视节目中播放广告。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We found examples of people being overcharged by as much as 50%.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们发现一些事例﹐有人竟被多收了高达50%的钱。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The exhibition also contains some examples of his book illustrations.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 展览中还有一些他画的书籍插图。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: These examples show how the disease can be passed on to humans.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些例子说明了该疾病会以何种方式传染给人类。

Section.SECHEADING: WHAT YOU SAY WHEN GIVING EXAMPLES 举例用语

Exponent.DEF: used when giving an example
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Prices have risen sharply. The price of gasoline, for example, has risen by over 50%.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 物价大幅度上涨﹐例如﹐汽油价格涨幅已超过50%。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Nepal has many attractions for visitors. For example, you can go trekking in the Himalayas, or see tigers in Chitwan National Park.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼泊尔有许多旅游的好去处。例如﹐可以去喜马拉雅山远足﹐或去奇德湾国家公园看老虎。

Exponent.DEF: used when giving an example. For instance is slightly less formal than for example and is used more in spoken English.
Exponent.TRAN: 例如〔for instance比 for example略为不正式﹐更多用于英语口语中〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There were many unanswered questions. For instance, where was the money going to come from?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 还有许多问题没有得到解答。例如﹐从哪儿弄钱?
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some people are really good at languages. Take Katie, for instance.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人很擅长语言﹐例如凯蒂。

Exponent.DEF: used when giving an example or a list of examples. Don’t use eg in formal writing – use the full phrase for example.
Exponent.TRAN: 例如〔正式文章中不用eg﹐要用全拼形式for example〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Make sure you eat foods that contain protein, e.g. meat, fish, eggs, milk, or cheese.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要吃含蛋白质的食物﹐例如肉﹑鱼﹑蛋﹑牛奶或干酪。

Exponent.DEF: used when giving one or two typical examples when there are many others
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It is difficult to get even basic foods such as bread and sugar.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 甚至连面包和糖等基本食物都很难弄到。

Exponent.DEF: used when giving a particular example as a way of proving that what you are saying is correct
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Take John – he has a good job but he didn’t go to university.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 就拿约翰来说吧——他有份好工作﹐可他没上过大学。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It is possible to recover from some types of cancer. Take skin cancer, for example.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些癌症是可以治愈的﹐比如皮肤癌。

Exponent.DEF: used when emphasizing that someone or something is a good or typical example of what you have just mentioned
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some birds have returned to Britain after once being extinct here. The return of the osprey is a case in point.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些鸟类一度在英国绝迹﹐现又重返故地。 鹗的回归便是一个明证。

Sense.DEF: to make someone very annoyed by continuing to do something that upsets them
Sense.EXAMPLE: It exasperates me to hear comments like that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听到那样的评论令我恼怒。

Sense.DEF: very annoyed and upset

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was becoming exasperated with the child.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始对那孩子感到恼火。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an exasperated look
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恼怒的神色

Sense.DEF: extremely annoying
Sense.TRAN: 令人极其厌烦的﹐使人恼怒的
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have this exasperating habit of never looking at me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你从来都不看我一眼﹐真叫人恼火！

Sense.DEF: when you feel annoyed because someone continues to do something that is upsetting you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carol sighed in exasperation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡罗尔恼怒地叹了口气。

Sense.DEF: if a scientist or archaeologist excavates an area of land, they dig carefully to find ancient objects, bones etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔科学家或考古学家〕发掘﹐挖出〔古物等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Schliemann excavated the ancient city of Troy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢里曼发掘出特洛伊古城。

Sense.DEF: to make a hole in the ground by digging up soil etc
a large machine that digs and moves earth and soil
someone who digs to find things that have been buried under the ground for a long time
to be more than a particular number or amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: Working hours must not exceed 42 hours a week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作时间每周不得超过42小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His performance exceeded our expectations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的表现出乎我们的预料。

Sense.DEF: to go beyond what rules or laws say you are allowed to do
Sense.TRAN: 超越〔规则或法律的规定〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was fined for exceeding the speed limit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因超速驾驶而被罚款。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The riot police had exceeded their authority.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防暴警察超越了他们的权限。

Sense.DEF: extremely
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thank you. You’ve been exceedingly kind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢﹐你真是太好了。

Sense.DEF: to do something very well, or much better than most people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rick has always excelled at foreign languages.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 里克一向擅长外语。

Sense.DEF: to do something better than you usually do
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have excelled yourself with the new exhibition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你新办的这次展览特别成功。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being excellent

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the excellence of the performance
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 表现优异

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the university’s reputation for excellence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该大学的卓越声誉

Sense.EXAMPLE: centres of academic excellence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成就卓著的学术中心

Sense.DEF: a way of talking to or about people who hold high positions in the state or the church
Sense.EXAMPLE: His Excellency the Spanish ambassador
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西班牙大使阁下

Sense.DEF: extremely good or of very high quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: an excellent suggestion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极好的建议
Sense.EXAMPLE: His car is in excellent condition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的汽车状况极佳。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Second-hand computers can be excellent value.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 二手计算机买得好会非常合算。

Sense.DEF: said when you approve of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ll bring the books over tonight.’ ‘Excellent.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我今晚就把书带来。” “太好了。”

Sense.DEF: used to introduce the only person, thing, action, fact, or situation about which a statement is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: The office is open every day except Sundays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 办事处除星期天之外天天开门。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can have any of the cakes except this one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以拿任何一块蛋糕﹐但这块除外。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everyone went except for Scott and Dan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了斯科特和丹之外﹐大家都去了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt fine except for being a little tired.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感觉很好﹐只是有点累。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Clarissa could think of nothing to say except that she was so sorry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了表示很抱歉之外﹐克拉丽莎想不出有什么话好说。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Staff are not permitted to make personal phone calls except in an emergency.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了有急事﹐员工是不允许打私人电话的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Benson kept the studio locked except when he was working there.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本森总是把工作室上锁﹐除非是他在里面工作的时候。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had nothing to do except spend money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她除了花钱便无所事事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He wouldn’t talk about work, except to say that he was busy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他并不想谈论工作﹐只是说自己很忙。

Sense.DEF: used to give the reason why something was not done or did not happen
Sense.TRAN: 要不是由于〔用于说明某事没做成或没发生的原因〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Liz would have run, except that she didn’t want to appear to be in a hurry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要不是因为不想显得很匆忙﹐利兹就会跑起来。

Sense.DEF: used to mention a fact that makes what you have just said seem less true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have earrings just like those, except they’re blue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有一对耳环跟那一对很像﹐只是我的是蓝色的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A date book would make a great gift, except that a lot of people already have one.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 赠送记事簿本来是很不错的﹐只是许多人都已经有一本了。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not say ‘except of something’ or ‘except from something’.
F2NBox.TRAN: 不要说except of something或except from something
F2NBox.EXPL: Except is not used by itself to introduce a clause. Useunless or except when/where/if.
F2NBox.TRAN: except不可单独引导从句﹐要用unless或except when/where/if
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We won’t go unless you really want to (NOT 不说 except you really want to).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 除非你实在想去﹐否则我们就不去了。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I cycle to work, except when it rains (NOT 不说 except it rains).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我骑车去上班﹐除非下雨。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that a statement does not include a particular person or thing. At the beginning of a sentence, you must use except for, not just except, before a noun.
Exponent.TRAN: 除…之外〔在句子开头﹐须用 except for 接名词﹐不可只用except〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The office is open every day except Sundays.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 办事处除星期天之外天天开门。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Except for a man walking his dog, the park was empty.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了有个男人在遛狗﹐公园里空无一人。

Exponent.DEF: used when mentioning one or two things that do not fit the main thing that you are saying
Exponent.TRAN: 除…以外〔用于少数例外情况〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Aside from one or two minor errors, this is an excellent piece of research.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了有一两处小差错之外﹐该研究非常成功。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The films were all made in Hollywood, apart from one, which was made in the UK.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些影片除了有一部摄于英国﹐其余各部都是在好莱坞拍摄的。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that something, especially a total number or amount, does not include a particular thing or person. Excluding is more formal than not including.
Exponent.TRAN: 除去﹐不包括〔excluding比not including 更正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The software costs $49.95, not including tax.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个软件的价格为49.95美元﹐不含税。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Excluding students, the total number of unemployed rose from 2 million to 2.3 million.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不包括学生﹐总失业人数从200万增至230万。

Exponent.DEF: except for one particular person or thing
Exponent.TRAN: 除〔特定的某人或事物〕之外
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Denmark has more wind turbines than any other place in the world, with the exception of California.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了加利福尼亚﹐丹麦拥有的风力涡轮机数量比世界上任何地方都要多。

Exponent.DEF: used especially after words such as nothing, all, any, anyone, everything or everyone when saying that something is the only thing, or someone is the only person
Exponent.TRAN: 除…以外〔尤用于nothing, all, any, anyone, everything 或everyone等词之后〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There is nothing but trees, for mile after mile.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 绵延几英里﹐除了树木别无他物。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The garment covers everything but the eyes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这衣服把什么都遮住了﹐只露出眼睛。

Exponent.DEF: used for mentioning the only person or thing which is not included in what you are saying
Exponent.TRAN: 除…外〔用于唯一的例外情况〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Every man she had ever loved, save her father, was now dead.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了父亲﹐她爱过的每个男人都已离开人世。

Sense.DEF: to not include something
Sense.TRAN: 不包括﹐不计算﹐把…排除在外

GramExa.EXAMPLE: High technology equipment would be excepted from any trade agreement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何贸易协定都不会把高科技设备包括在内。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are not including a particular person or thing in a statement about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: History excepted, Peter has made good progress in all subjects this term.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了历史之外﹐彼得这学期各门功课都有很大进步。

Sense.DEF: used to introduce the only thing or person in a group about which a statement is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: O’Rourke answered all the questions excepting the last one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥罗克回答了所有问题﹐除了最后一个之外。

Sense.DEF: something or someone that is not included in a general statement or does not follow a rule or pattern
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s been cold, but today’s an exception.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气一直寒冷﹐但今天是个例外。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We all laughed, with the exception of Maggie.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了玛吉﹐我们都笑了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Each plant, without exception, contains some kind of salt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每一种植物都含有某种盐分﹐无一例外。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: With one or two notable exceptions, there are few women conductors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很少有女性指挥﹐除了一两位是明显的例外。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: With a few minor exceptions, the new edition is much like the previous one.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了有几处细小的改动之外﹐新版本与前一版没有什么两样。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The law applies to all EU countries; Britain is no exception.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项法律适用于所有欧盟国家﹐英国也不例外。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We don’t usually accept checks, but for you we’ll make an exception not include you in this rule.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一般不接受支票﹐但对你我们就破个例。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The spelling of this word is an interesting exception to the rule.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个单词的拼法是该规则一个有趣的例外。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Successful two-career couples are still the exception, not the rule used to emphasize that something is unusual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夫妇俩都事业有成的仍不常见。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb/sth is the exception that proves the rule
Sense.DEF: used to say that the fact that something is not true or does not exist in one situation emphasizes the fact that it is true or exists in general
Sense.TRAN: 某人/某事物是证明普遍性的例外
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most people here are very dedicated; I’m afraid Rhea’s the exception that proves the rule.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的大多数人都很敬业﹐恐怕雷亚是其中的例外。

Sense.DEF: to be angry or upset because of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom took great exception to my remark about Americans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆对我有关美国人的评论极为不满。

Sense.DEF: unusually good
Sense.EXAMPLE: an exceptional student
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出类拔萃的学生
Sense.EXAMPLE: exceptional bravery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非凡的勇气

Sense.DEF: unusual and likely not to happen often
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is an exceptional case; I’ve never seen anything like it before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个不寻常的案例﹐我以前从没见过这样的事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Promotion in the first year is only given in exceptional circumstances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 入职第一年就升职的事只有在特殊情况下才会发生。

Sense.DEF: extremely
Sense.EXAMPLE: She defended her position exceptionally well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她出色地捍卫了自己的立场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Theo Walcott is an exceptionally talented player.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西奥·沃尔科特是一名极有天分的球员。
