Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由经验得来的学习方法

Sense.DEF: a scientific test done to find out how something reacts under certain conditions, or to find out if a particular idea is true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: experiments with alcohol-fuelled cars
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究以酒精作燃料的汽车实验
GramExa.EXAMPLE: experiments on sleep deprivation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于睡眠剥夺的实验

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many small birds guide themselves by the stars, as has been verified by experiment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多小鸟靠星星导航﹐这已被实验所证实。

Sense.DEF: a process in which you test a new idea or method to see if it is useful or effective

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an experiment in state socialism
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国家社会主义的试验

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They carried out a series of experiments to test the theory.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们进行了一系列实验来验证这个理论。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do an experiment
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The laboratory began conducting experiments on rats.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该实验室开始用老鼠进行实验。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His experiment showed that lightning was a kind of electricity.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的实验表明闪电是一种电。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Astronauts performed scientific experiments during the flight.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 宇航员在航行期间进行了科学实验。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: experiments using animals
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I think most animal experiments are cruel and unnecessary.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为大多数动物实验是残酷且不必要的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that takes place in a laboratory
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They did a series of laboratory experiments on human sleep patterns in the 1960s.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在20世纪60年代就人类睡眠模式进行了一系列实验室实验。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that takes place in the real world, not in a laboratory
one that is done using correct scientific methods
one that relates to real situations or events, not scientific theories

Collocate.COLLOC: an experiment to test/measure/find out sth
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 旨在检测/测量/发现某事物的实验
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We did an experiment to test the acidity of the soil.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们做了一项实验以检测土壤酸度。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘make an experiment’.Say 而要说 carry out an experiment or 或 do an experiement.

Sense.DEF: to try using various ideas, methods etc to find out how good or effective they are

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He experimented with lighter-than-air flight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试验了气球飞行。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The teacher provided some different materials and left the children to experiment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师提供了几种不同的材料让孩子们试验。

Sense.DEF: to do a scientific test to find out if a particular idea is true or to obtain more information

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I would defend the right of scientists to experiment on animals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会为科学家做动物实验的权利进行辩护。

Sense.DEF: to try doing something to find out what it feels like, for example having sex or using illegal drugs

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She admitted she had experimented with cocaine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她承认自己试吸了可卡因。

Sense.DEF: used for, relating to, or resulting from experiments
Sense.TRAN: 用于做实验的﹔实验(性)的﹔实验得出的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A hypothesis is tested by finding experimental evidence for it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 假设经由实验证据检验。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: experimental studies on birds and animals
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关鸟类和动物的实验性研究

Sense.EXAMPLE: experimental animals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用于实验的动物

Sense.DEF: using new ideas or methods
Sense.EXAMPLE: an experimental theatre group
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实验剧团

Sense.DEF: relating to experiments
Sense.EXAMPLE: data obtained experimentally
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实验获得的数据

Sense.DEF: in a way that involves using new ideas or methods
Sense.EXAMPLE: The drugs are being used experimentally on patients suffering from breast cancer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些药正试用于乳腺癌患者。

Sense.DEF: if you do something experimentally, you do it in order to see or feel what something is like
Sense.EXAMPLE: He moved his shoulder experimentally; it still hurt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试着活动了一下肩膀﹐还是疼。

Sense.DEF: the process of testing various ideas, methods etc to find out how good or effective they are

GramExa.EXAMPLE: experimentation with computer-assisted language learning
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机辅助语言学习的试验

Sense.DEF: the process of performing scientific tests to find out if a particular idea is true or to obtain more information
Sense.EXAMPLE: The issue of animal experimentation is an emotive subject.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动物实验问题是个敏感的话题。

Sense.DEF: when you try doing something to find out what it feels like, for example having sex or using illegal drugs

GramExa.EXAMPLE: experimentation with cannabis
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 试吸大麻

Sense.EXAMPLE: There is often a period of sexual experimentation during adolescence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人在青春期常会经历一个体验性爱的阶段。

Sense.DEF: someone who has a special skill or special knowledge of a subject, gained as a result of training or experience

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s a world expert on marine mammals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是研究海洋哺乳动物的世界权威。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an expert in statistics
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 统计学专家

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tests should be administered by a medical expert.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 试验应该由一位医学专家来进行。

Exponent.DEF: someone who has a lot of knowledge about something or skill at doing something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a computer expert
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机专家
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an expert on beetles
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究甲虫的专家
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s best to ask an expert.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好去问问专家。

Exponent.DEF: an expert who has studied a particular medical or technical subject for a long time and knows much more about it than other people
Exponent.TRAN: 专科医生﹔〔某技术领域的〕专家
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She is a specialist in corporate finance.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是企业融资方面的专家。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My doctor sent me to see a heart specialist.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的医生叫我去看心脏专科医生。

Exponent.DEF: an expert whose knowledge and opinions are greatly respected
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The professor is one of the world’s leading authorities on African art.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位教授是研究非洲艺术的世界权威。

Exponent.DEF: an expert on food, art, literature, or design, who has had a lot of experience and knows when something is of very good quality
Exponent.TRAN: 〔美食﹑艺术﹑文学﹑设计等的〕鉴赏家﹐鉴定家
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was a connoisseur of fine wines.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是美酒品鉴家。

Exponent.DEF: someone who is very interested in a subject and knows a lot about it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a wine buff
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对葡萄酒很在行的人
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jazz buffs will be familiar with the band’s first album.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 爵士乐迷会很熟悉该乐队的首张专辑。

Exponent.DEF: an expert player or performer
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The piece was played by violin virtuoso Pavel Sporcl.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这首乐曲是由小提琴大师帕维尔 · 施博尔策演奏的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a virtuoso pianist
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 钢琴演奏大师

Sense.DEF: having a special skill or special knowledge of a subject

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police are expert at handling situations like this in strict confidence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察处理这类事情很在行﹐可以绝对保密。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He cast his expert eye on the gardener’s work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用内行的眼光看了看园丁干的活。

Sense.DEF: relating to or coming from an expert
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ministers depend on civil servants for expert advice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长们依靠公务员获取专家建议。

Sense.DEF: special skills or knowledge in a particular subject, that you learn by experience or training

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What he’s bringing to the company is financial expertise.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给公司带来的是金融专业知识。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: trainee engineers with varying degrees of computer expertise
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机专业技能参差不齐的实习工程师

GramExa.EXAMPLE: expertise in the management of hotels
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店管理的专门知识

Sense.DEF: a computer system containing a lot of information about one particular subject, so that it can help someone find an answer to a problem
Sense.TRAN: 专家系统 〔指储存大量某方面信息以助人解决问题的计算机系统〕

Sense.DEF: someone with special knowledge about a subject who is asked to give their opinion about something relating to that subject in a court of law
Sense.EXAMPLE: He appeared as an expert witness before several government inquiries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以专家证人身份多次出席政府调查。

Sense.DEF: to show you are sorry for something you have done wrong by accepting your punishment willingly, or trying to do something to improve what you did
Sense.TRAN: 为〔做错事而〕甘愿受罚﹔弥补
Sense.EXAMPLE: She expiated her crime by becoming a nun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她出家以赎罪。

Sense.DEF: the ending of a fixed period of time
the American form of expiry date
if an official document expires, it can no longer be legally used
Sense.EXAMPLE: My passport expires next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的护照下周就到期了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: players whose contracts expire this summer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合约于今年夏天到期的运动员

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My driving licence expires in March.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的驾照3月到期。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The lease on the flat expired on June 14th.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公寓的租约6月14日到期。

Sense.DEF: if a period of time when someone has a particular position of authority expires, it ends
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chairman’s term of office has already expired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主席任期已满。

Sense.DEF: if someone expires, they die
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ophelia expires in Act IV of Hamlet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥菲莉娅在《哈姆雷特》第四幕中死去。

Sense.DEF: the end of a period of time during which an official document can legally be used, or the end of a period of authority
Sense.TRAN: 〔正式文件的〕到期﹔〔任期的〕届满

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the formal expiry of the presidential term in September
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统任期9月正式届满
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Only seven minutes remained before the expiry of the noon deadline.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 离中午截止时间只剩7分钟了。

Sense.DEF: the date after which something is not safe to eat or can no longer besed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Check the expiry date on your passport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看一下你的护照什么时候到期。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eggs must be marked with an expiry date that is ten days from the date of packing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸡蛋应标明到期日﹐即自包装日起10天。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone about something in a way that is clear or easy to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: He carefully explained the procedure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他仔细解释了程序。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The librarian will explain how to use the catalogue system.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 图书馆管理员将说明如何使用目录系统。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let me explain what I mean.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来解释一下我的意思。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He explained that it had been a difficult film to make.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他解释说这部电影很难制作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I explained the situation to my bank manager.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向我的银行经理说明了情况。

Sense.HINTTRAN: You explain something to someone 向某人说明某事用to: He explained the system to me (NOT 不说 explained me the system). 他向我介绍了这个系统。

Sense.DEF: to give a reason for something or to be a reason for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wait! I can explain everything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等一下！ 我可以解释一切。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How can you explain that sort of behaviour?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你如何解释那种行为？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She explained that she had been ill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她解释说她病了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll explain why I don’t believe your story.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会解释我为何不相信你说的情况。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: That still doesn’t explain how he was able to hide the body.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那还是没有说明他怎么能够藏尸的。

Subsense.DEF: to tell someone who is angry or upset with you the reasons why you did something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m going to give you five seconds to explain yourself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给你五秒钟时间解释自己的行为。

Subsense.DEF: to say clearly what you mean
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, I’m not explaining myself very well.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我没把自己的意思说得很清楚。

Exponent.DEF: to give someone the information they need to understand something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She explained how to use the software.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她解释了怎么使用这个软件。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Doctors usually explain the risks of the treatment to patients.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生一般都会向患者说明治疗有何风险。

Exponent.DEF: to explain something. People often use tell instead of explain in everyday conversation.
Exponent.TRAN: 告诉﹔说明〔在日常对话中﹐人们常用tell﹐而不用explain〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He told me how to get to his house.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他告诉我去他家怎么走。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The book tells you how to improve your health through diet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书告诉你怎样通过饮食改善健康状况。

Exponent.DEF: to explain to someone how to do something by doing it while they watch you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Ellen showed me how to work the coffee maker.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃伦教我怎样使用煮咖啡机。

Exponent.DEF: to explain to someone how to do something by doing it while they watch you, especially when it is part of your job
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指出于工作职责而〕示范﹐演示
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The cabin crew demonstrated the safety procedures to the passengers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 客舱乘务员向乘客演示了安全规程。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A qualified instructor will demonstrate how to use the equipment properly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 将有一名合格的教练示范如何正确使用这些设备。

Exponent.DEF: to explain something carefully, especially one step at a time
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指一步步地〕详细说明某事物
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Mrs. Riddell went through the homework assignment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 里德尔夫人仔细地讲解家庭作业。

Exponent.DEF: to explain a series of ideas, reasons or opinions in an organized way in writing or in a speech
Exponent.TRAN: 〔有条理地以书面或口头形式〕陈述[阐明]某事物
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In his speech, he intended to set out the party’s policies on education.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的发言旨在陈述该政党的教育方针。

Sense.DEF: to make something seem less important or bad by giving reasons for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The difference in the treatment they receive is hard to explain away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难为他们受到的不同待遇辩解。

Sense.DEF: the reasons you give for why something happened or why you did something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you think of any explanation for this failure?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这次失败你能想出什么解释吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The concert was cancelled without explanation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐会被无故取消。

Sense.DEF: a statement or piece of writing intended to describe how something works or make something easier to understand
Sense.TRAN: 解释性说法﹔说明性文字

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ability to give clear explanations is the most important quality of the ideal teacher.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 清晰讲解的能力是优秀教师最重要的素质。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll try and give you a quick explanation of how the machine works.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我争取给你快速解释一下这机器的工作原理。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Does the hospital have any explanation for why he died?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院有没有对他的死因作出什么解释？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The police gave no explanation for their actions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方未对自己的行动作出解释。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: This theory may provide an explanation for the origins of the universe.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一理论或许可以解释宇宙的起源。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: When I asked for an explanation, the people at the office said they didn’t know.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要求一个解释﹐可办公室里的人说他们并不知情。

Collocate.COLLOC: find/think of/come up with an explanation
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Scientists have been unable to find an explanation for this phenomenon.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家尚无法解释这一现象。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I think you owe me some kind of explanation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为你得向我解释一下。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: believe that it is true or correct
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The court accepted her explanation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭接受了她的理由。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Can anyone think of a possible explanation for why this is happening?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么发生这样的情况﹐有谁能想出合理的解释吗？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is probably true
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The most likely explanation is that John missed the bus.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 最有可能的原因是约翰没有赶上公共汽车。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is easy to see or notice
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is no obvious explanation for his strange behaviour.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的奇怪行为没有显而易见的理由。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is easy to believe
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Pilot error is the most plausible explanation for the crash.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞行员失误是这次失事最合理的解释。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that explains something completely
one that you can believe is true
one that is based on facts
additional reasons

Sense.DEF: giving information about something or describing how something works, in order to make it easier to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are explanatory notes at the end of each chapter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每一章末尾都有注释。

Sense.DEF: a rude word that you use when you are angry or in pain, for example ‘shit’
able to be easily understood or explained
Sense.TRAN: 易于理解的﹔容易解释的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The success of the Revolution is explicable in terms of the weakness of the king’s government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 革命的成功可归因于国王政府的软弱。

Sense.DEF: to explain an idea in detail
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is essentially a simple notion, but explicating it is difficult.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它实质上是一个简单的概念﹐但要详细解释还是很难。

Sense.DEF: expressed in a way that is very clear and direct
Sense.TRAN: 清楚明确的﹔直截了当的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The contrast could not have been made more explicit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个对比再清楚不过了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: explicit knowledge of grammar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清楚易懂的语法知识
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kidnappers gave us explicit instructions not to involve the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绑匪明确告诉我们不许报警。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be explicit when you talk about money with your family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与家人谈钱的问题要直截了当。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He made the rules without being explicit about them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他制定的规则并不明确。

Sense.DEF: language or pictures that are explicit describe or show sex or violence very clearly
Sense.TRAN: 〔描绘性或暴力的语言或画面〕清晰露骨的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film contains some very explicit love scenes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片中有一些非常露骨的性爱镜头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: sexually explicit language
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露骨的色情言语

Sense.DEF: to burst, or to make something burst, into small pieces, usually with a loud noise and in a way that causes damage
Sense.EXAMPLE: The device was thrown at an army patrol but failed to explode.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸弹投向了陆军巡逻队﹐但没有爆炸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Far sooner than anyone thought possible, the Russians exploded an atomic bomb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏联引爆了一颗原子弹﹐大大早于任何人的预期。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly increase greatly in number, amount, or degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: Florida’s population exploded after World War II.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二次世界大战后﹐佛罗里达州的人口急剧增长。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly express strong feelings such as anger
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul exploded. ‘What has it got to do with you?’ he yelled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗大发雷霆。“这和你有什么关系？”他大声喊道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She exploded with grief and anger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她悲愤交加﹐大发雷霆。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He told a joke which made Hank explode with laughter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他讲了个笑话﹐逗得汉克哈哈大笑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He exploded into a screaming, kicking rage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他勃然大怒﹐又是叫又是踢。

Sense.DEF: if a situation explodes, it is suddenly no longer controlled, and is often violent
Sense.EXAMPLE: Riots may explode at any time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴乱随时可能发生。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The continued tension could explode into more violence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 持续的紧张局势会引发更多的暴力事件。

Sense.DEF: to prove that something that is believed by many people is actually wrong or not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: The programme sets out to explode the myth that some delicate tropical fish are impossible to keep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这节目一心要推翻关于某些娇弱的热带鱼不可能养活的错误观点。

Sense.DEF: to make a very loud noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: A clap of thunder exploded overhead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一声惊雷在头顶炸响。

Exponent.DEF: v [I] if a bomb explodes, it bursts suddenly and violently with a loud noise
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A bomb exploded in a crowded metro station this morning, killing five people.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晨一枚炸弹在拥挤的地铁站爆炸﹐造成五人身亡。

Exponent.DEF: if a bomb goes off, it explodes. Go off is less formal than explode and is the usual phrase to use in everyday English
Exponent.TRAN: 〔炸弹〕爆炸〔go off不如explode正式﹐是日常英语中的常用短语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Luckily the station was empty when the bomb went off.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸好炸弹爆炸时车站空无一人。

Exponent.DEF: if a building, car, plane etc blows up, it bursts suddenly and violently into pieces, causing a lot of damage
Exponent.TRAN: 〔建筑物﹑汽车﹑飞机等〕炸毁﹐炸得粉碎
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The plane blew up in mid-air, killing all the passengers and crew.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机在半空炸毁﹐所有乘客及机组人员均罹难。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In early 1986, a US space shuttle blew up shortly after launch.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 1986年年初﹐一架美国航天飞机发射后不久即炸毁。

Exponent.DEF: if a volcano erupts, it explodes and sends smoke and rock into the sky
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The volcano has erupted at least fifteen times since 1883.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 1883年以来﹐这座火山至少已喷发了15次。

Exponent.DEF: if something that has air or liquid inside it bursts, it explodes and the air or liquid comes out
Exponent.TRAN: 内有气体或液体的物体〕爆裂﹐胀破
Exponent.EXAMPLE: One of the water pipes had burst.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中一根水管爆裂了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The plane caught fire after its tyre burst on landing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机着陆时轮胎爆裂﹐机身起火。

Section.SECHEADING: TO MAKE SOMETHING EXPLODE 使某物爆炸

Exponent.DEF: to make a bomb burst suddenly and violently with a loud noise
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The terrorists planned to explode a car bomb outside the US embassy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖分子计划在美国大使馆外引爆一枚汽车炸弹。

Exponent.DEF: to make a bomb explode, either deliberately or accidentally. Set off is less formal than explode and is the usual phrase to use in everyday English.
Exponent.TRAN: 使〔炸弹〕爆炸〔set off不如explode正式﹐常用于日常英语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The group set off a bomb outside a crowded cafe in Izmir last September.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年9月该组织在伊兹密尔一家拥挤的咖啡馆外引爆了一颗炸弹。

Exponent.DEF: to make a bomb explode, especially by using special equipment. Detonate is a more technical word than set off.
Exponent.TRAN: 引爆〔detonate一词比set off 更专业〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Army experts detonated the bomb safely in a nearby field.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 军方专家在附近一处野地安全引爆了炸弹。

Exponent.DEF: to deliberately make a bomb explode
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Terrorists let off a bomb in the city centre.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖分子在市中心引爆了一颗炸弹。

Exponent.DEF: to make a building, car, plane etc explode
Exponent.TRAN: 炸毁〔建筑物﹑汽车﹑飞机等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was involved in a plot to blow up a passenger jet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他参与了一起炸毁喷气式客机的阴谋。

Sense.DEF: an exploded drawing, model etc shows the parts of something separately but in a way that shows how they are related or put together
Sense.EXAMPLE: an exploded diagram of an engine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发动机的分解图

Sense.DEF: to treat someone unfairly by asking them to do things for you, but giving them very little in return – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: Homeworkers can easily be exploited by employers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在家工作的人容易被雇主剥削。

Sense.DEF: to try to get as much as you can out of a situation, sometimes unfairly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The violence was blamed on thugs exploiting the situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力事件归咎于这一局面被暴徒所利用。

Sense.DEF: to use something fully and effectively
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new TV companies are fully exploiting the potential of satellite transmission.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新创立的电视公司在充分利用衞星传输的潜力。

Sense.DEF: to develop and use minerals, forests, oil etc for business or industry
Sense.EXAMPLE: the urgent need to exploit the resources of the Irish Sea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开发爱尔兰海资源的迫切需要

Sense.DEF: a brave and exciting adventure that someone has had

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the daring exploits of the British Parachute Regiment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国伞兵团的英勇行为

Sense.DEF: a situation in which you treat someone unfairly by asking them to do things for you, but give them very little in return – used to show disapproval

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The film industry thrives on the sexual exploitation of women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影业的繁荣是建立在对女性性剥削的基础之上的。

Sense.DEF: the development and use of minerals, forests, oil etc for business or industry

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the controlled exploitation of resources
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有节制的资源开发

Sense.DEF: the full and effective use of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: greater exploitation of these data
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这些资料更充分的利用

Sense.DEF: an attempt to get as much as you can out of a situation, sometimes unfairly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the exploitation of religion for political ends
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出于政治目的而对宗教的利用

Sense.DEF: taking as much as possible from someone or something and giving very little in return
Sense.EXAMPLE: the exploitative nature of multinational companies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跨国公司的剥削本质

Sense.DEF: the act of travelling through a place in order to find out about it or find something such as oil or gold in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: oil exploration facilities in the North Sea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北海的石油勘探设施
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can then use this hut as a base for explorations into the mountains around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你到时可以把这间小屋当大本营﹐去周围的山里探险。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the exploration of space
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对宇宙空间的探索

Sense.DEF: when you try to find out more about something by discussing it, thinking about it etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an exploration into how an abused child becomes an abuser
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对受虐待的孩子如何变成施虐者的研究
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the exploration of literary texts
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对文学文本的研究

Sense.DEF: done in order to find out more about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s going to have exploratory surgery on his knee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的膝盖要做探查性手术。

Sense.DEF: to discuss or think about something carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: Management need to explore ways of improving office security.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理层需要探讨如何加强办事处的安全措施。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going to explore the possibility of a part-time job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要好好想想兼职工作的可能性。

Sense.DEF: to travel around an area in order to find out about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Venice is a wonderful city to explore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威尼斯是一个美妙的城市﹐值得好好探究一番。

Sense.DEF: to look for something such as oil, minerals etc
to feel something with your hand or another part of your body to find out what it is like
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gingerly she explored the bump on her head with her fingers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她小心翼翼地用手指摸了摸头上的肿块。

Sense.DEF: someone who travels through an unknown area to find out about it
a loud sound and the energy produced by something such as a bomb bursting into small pieces

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several people were injured in a bomb explosion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有数人在炸弹爆炸中受伤。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We heard a loud explosion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们听到一声巨大的爆炸声。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A massive explosion ripped through the building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 强烈的爆炸严重损毁了大楼。

Sense.DEF: a process in which something such as a bomb is deliberately made to explode
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police carried out a controlled explosion of the device.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察对炸弹进行了控制引爆。

Sense.DEF: a sudden or quick increase in the number or amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the population explosion in India
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度人口的激增

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the recent explosion of interest in Latin music and dance
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近对拉丁音乐和舞蹈的兴趣陡增

Sense.DEF: a sudden expression of emotion, especially anger
a sudden very loud noise

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an explosion of laughter
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵大笑

Sense.DEF: able or likely to explode
Sense.EXAMPLE: Because the gas is highly explosive, it needs to be kept in high-pressure containers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于这种气体极易爆炸﹐因此需要保存在高压容器内。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A small explosive device bomb was set off outside the UN headquarters today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天有一枚小型炸弹在联合国总部外爆炸。

Sense.DEF: relating to or like an explosion
Sense.EXAMPLE: the explosive force of volcanoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火山的爆发力

Sense.DEF: likely to become violent or to cause feelings of violence
Sense.TRAN: 易引发暴力的﹔易引起暴力情绪的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s good at defusing potentially explosive situations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他擅长缓和可能一触即发的形势。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the explosive issue of uncontrolled immigration
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 移民入境失控这一极易引发暴力的问题

Sense.DEF: showing sudden strong or angry emotion
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both men suddenly spoke in the same explosive tone of voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个男人突然都用同样暴躁的腔调说话了。

Sense.DEF: increasing suddenly or quickly in amount or number
Sense.EXAMPLE: the explosive growth of microcomputers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微型计算机的迅猛发展

Sense.DEF: an explosive sound is sudden and loud
a substance that can cause an explosion
an exposition2
an exponent of an idea, belief etc tries to explain it and persuade others that it is good or useful
Sense.TRAN: 〔想法﹑信仰等的〕倡导者﹐鼓吹者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a leading exponent of desktop publishing
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 桌面出版的主要倡导者

Sense.DEF: an exponent of a particular skill, idea, or activity is someone who is good at it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The most famous exponent of this approach to art was probably Charles Rennie Mackintosh.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 运用这种艺术手法的最著名的大师恐怕当属查尔斯·伦尼·麦金托什。

Sense.DEF: a sign written above and to the right of a number or letter to show how many times that quantity is to be multiplied by itself
exponential growth, increase etc becomes faster as the amount of the thing that is growing increases
Sense.TRAN: 指数式增长/增加﹐越来越快的增长/增加等
Sense.EXAMPLE: an exponential increase in travel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游的指数式增长

Sense.DEF: using a small number or letter slightly above and to the right of a number or letter that shows how many times a quantity is to be multiplied by itself
the business of selling and sending goods to other countries

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a ban on the export of toxic waste
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有毒废料的出口禁令

GramExa.EXAMPLE: bales of cloth for export to the continent
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 向该洲出口的大捆布料

Sense.DEF: a product that is sold to another country
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wheat is one of the country’s main exports.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小麦是该国的主要出口商品之一。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The US is Scotland’s second largest export market after France.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国是苏格兰的第二大出口市场﹐仅次于法国。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Most of its export trade is with Russia.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 其出口贸易多与俄罗斯进行。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the money a company or country makes from exports
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Oil and gas provide 40% of Norway’s export earnings.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 出口石油和天然气的收入占挪威出口收益的40%。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the total number of products that are sold to other countries
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Export sales exceeded 50% of the company’s total turnover.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司的出口销售额超过其总营业额的50%。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an official document giving you permission to sell something to another country
official limits on the number of exports

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Agricultural products are the country’s principal exports.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 农产品是该国的主要出口商品。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 石油/农产品/制造业产品出口
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Oil exports from Iraq have resumed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊拉克已恢复石油出口。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Higher tariffs will affect a wide range of British exports.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 提高关税将对多种英国出口商品产生影响。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: services that are exported, such as banking or insurance, rather than a product
increase them
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The measures should boost exports and create employment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些措施应能促进出口﹐创造就业岗位。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make them more likely to exist
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Kenya used subsidies to encourage exports.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯尼亚通过补贴鼓励出口。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: OPEC has threatened to reduce exports of oil to the West.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油输出国组织威胁要减少对西方的石油出口。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: limit or control them
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government threatened to restrict exports because of weak demand.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 因需求疲软﹐政府威胁要限制出口。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: stop them completely

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The electronics sector has seen a 16% growth in exports.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子产品出口额增长了16%。

Sense.DEF: to sell goods to another country

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company exports tuna to the US.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司向美国出口金枪鱼。

Sense.DEF: to introduce an activity, idea etc to another place or country
Sense.EXAMPLE: Italian food has been exported all over the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意大利食品已传遍世界。

Sense.DEF: to move computer information from one computer to another, from one computer document to another, or from one piece of software to another
a person, company, or country that sells goods to another country
Sense.TRAN: 出口商﹔出口公司﹔出口国

GramExa.EXAMPLE: With the expanded production of North Sea oil and gas, the UK has become a net exporter of fuel it exports more fuel than it imports.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着北海石油和天然气产量的扩大﹐英国已成为燃料的净出口国。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Japan is a leading exporter of textiles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 日本是纺织品的一大出口国。

Sense.DEF: to show something that is usually covered or hidden
Sense.TRAN: 显露﹐露出〔一般予以掩盖或隐藏的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lifted his T-shirt to expose a jagged scar across his chest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他撩起T恤衫﹐露出横贯胸部的锯齿状伤疤。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Potatoes turn green when exposed to light.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马铃薯在光照下会变绿。

Sense.DEF: to put someone in a situation where they are not protected from something dangerous or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 使暴露〔于险境〕﹐使置身〔于危险〕当中

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The report revealed that workers had been exposed to high levels of radiation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告披露工人们受到了高强度的辐射。

GramExa.GLOSS: say or do something that may make people laugh at you, criticize you etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 使自己受到嘲笑/批评等

Sense.DEF: to show the truth about someone or something, especially when it is bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film exposes the utter horror of war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影揭示了战争的极端恐怖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report exposes the weaknesses of modern medical practice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报道揭露了现代医疗的不足之处。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The baron was exposed as a liar and a cheat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个工商业巨头说谎和欺骗的真面目被揭穿了。

Sense.DEF: to make it possible for someone to experience new ideas, ways of life etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some children are never exposed to classical music.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些孩子从来没有接触过古典音乐。

Sense.DEF: if a man exposes himself, he shows his sexual organs to someone he does not know in a public place, usually because he is mentally ill
Sense.TRAN: 〔男性通常因病态心理〕当众露阴

Sense.DEF: to allow light onto a piece of film in a camera in order to take a photograph
to show other people feelings that you usually hide, especially when this is not planned
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid I might expose my real feelings for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕我会流露出对他的真实感情。

Sense.DEF: a story in a newspaper or on television that shows the truth about something, especially something dishonest or shocking

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an exposé of corrupt practices by lawyers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对律师们腐败行为的揭露性报道

Sense.DEF: not protected from the weather
Sense.TRAN: 无遮蔽的﹐不遮挡风雨的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an exposed coastline
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无遮蔽的海岸线
Sense.EXAMPLE: the side of the garden most exposed to wind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花园最向风的一边

Sense.DEF: not covered
Sense.EXAMPLE: All exposed skin should be covered with protective cream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有外露的皮肤都应该涂上防护霜。

Sense.DEF: not protected from attack
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old fort was very exposed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座古堡很容易受到攻击。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These developments leave the British government in an exposed position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事态的这些新发展使英国政府易受诟病。

Sense.DEF: a clear and detailed explanation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a lucid exposition of educational theories
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对教育理论的清晰阐述

Sense.DEF: a large public event at which you show or sell products, art etc
a law that makes a particular action into a crime, and then punishes people who took that action before it had legally become a crime
to express strong disapproval, disagreement, or annoyance with someone
when someone is in a situation where they are not protected from something dangerous or unpleasant

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Prolonged exposure to the sun can cause skin cancer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 长时间晒太阳会导致皮肤癌。

Sense.DEF: the action of showing the truth about someone or something, especially when it is bad

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the exposure of his underground political activity
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他地下政治活动的揭露

GramExa.EXAMPLE: her fear of exposure as a spy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对间谍身份被揭露的惧怕

Sense.DEF: the attention that someone or something gets from newspapers, television etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The failure of their marriage has got a lot of exposure recently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他俩婚姻失败一事最近被频频曝光。

Sense.DEF: the chance to experience new ideas, ways of life etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The visit to Germany gave them exposure to the language.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 德国之行使他们有机会接触到德语。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: her brief exposure to pop stardom
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对流行乐明星生活的短暂体验

Sense.DEF: the harmful effects on your body of being outside in very cold weather without protection
Sense.EXAMPLE: We nearly died of exposure on the mountainside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们差点冻死在半山腰。

Subsense.DEF: a length of film in a camera that is used to take a photograph
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I have three exposures left on this roll.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这卷胶卷还剩三张没拍。

Subsense.DEF: the amount of time that light is allowed to enter the camera when taking a photograph

Sense.DEF: the act of showing something that is usually hidden
the amount of financial risk that a company or person has
the direction in which a building, hill etc faces
Sense.EXAMPLE: My bedroom has a southern exposure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的卧室朝南。

Sense.DEF: to explain or talk about something in detail

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s always expounding on the latest dogmas of feminism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她老是在阐述女权主义的最新信条。

Sense.DEF: to tell or show what you are feeling or thinking by using words, looks, or actions

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bill’s not afraid to express his opinions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔并不害怕表达自己的观点。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Parents have expressed their concerns about their children’s safety.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母对自己孩子的安全表示忧虑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She expressed an interest in seeing York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她表示有兴趣见见约克。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Express your reasons for applying in simple terms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 简单说说你申请的理由。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She doesn’t express her emotions as much as he does.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不像他那样经常表露自己的情感。

GramExa.GLOSS: thank someone in a speech or by writing a letter
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: (因某事)(向某人)表示感谢/感激
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Finally, I’d like to express my sincere thanks to all those who have helped today.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后﹐我想对今天给予帮助的所有人表示诚挚的感谢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The USA expressed reservations before agreeing to sign the agreement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国在同意签署协议之前发表了保留意见。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people have expressed their opposition to the proposals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人反对这些提议。

GramExa.GLOSS: say what you think or feel
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Young children often have difficulty expressing themselves.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 幼儿常常很难将自己的想法清楚地表达出来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He first learnt to express himself through movement at hisdance classes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最初是在舞蹈班学会通过动作表达情感的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Words can’t express it is impossible to describe how angry we felt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的愤怒无以言表。

Sense.DEF: to show or describe a particular feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of Munch’s paintings express a deep feeling of despair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒙克的许多画作都表达了一种深深的绝望。

Sense.DEF: if something expresses itself, it becomes noticeable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Religious faith expresses itself in a variety of ways.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宗教信仰有各种各样的表现形式。

Sense.DEF: to change an amount or quantity into a different form, especially in mathematics

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Express three-quarters as a decimal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用小数来表示四分之三。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The value of the coffee becomes significantly higher when expressed in foreign currency.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种咖啡的价钱用外币标示会高得多。

Sense.DEF: if a woman expresses milk, she presses milk out of her breast in order to feed it to her baby later
deliberate and for a specific situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school was founded with the express purpose of teaching deaf children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所学校是专门为教授失聪儿童而创办的。

Sense.DEF: clear and definite

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is not to leave without my express permission.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有我的明确准许他就不得离开。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Matthew left express instructions to keep all doors locked.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马修明确指示过要把门都锁好。

Sense.DEF: a train or bus that does not stop at many places and can therefore travel more quickly
Sense.TRAN: 特快列车/长途汽车/公共汽车

Sense.DEF: a system that delivers letters and packages very quickly
designed to help you move through a place more quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: express lanes on the freeway
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高速公路上的快车道
Sense.EXAMPLE: an express line at a supermarket where people with only a few things to buy go to pay
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超市里的快速结账通道

Sense.DEF: a train or bus that does not stop in many places and therefore travels quickly

GramExa.GLOSS: a fast train or bus which does a particular journey regularly
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 伦敦﹣盖特威克快车/东方快车

Sense.DEF: a post service that delivers letters and packages very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Send these books by express.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这些书用快递寄出去。

Sense.DEF: to send or deliver a letter, package etc quickly using a special post service
something you say, write, or do that shows what you think or feel
Sense.TRAN: 〔用口头﹑书面或行动的〕表达﹐表示﹐表露

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I decided to go to the meeting as an expression of support.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定去参加会议以示支持。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The letter was a genuine expression of sympathy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 信中真诚地表达了同情。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Student leaders are demanding greater freedom of expression the right to say what you think without being punished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生领袖要求得到更多的言论自由。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Socialist Party was founded to give political expression to the working classes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会党的创立是为了表达工人阶级的政治意愿。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Another writer who seeks to give expression to popular oral culture is José María Arguedas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 另一位寻求展现大众口头文化的作家是何塞·马里亚·阿格达斯。

Sense.DEF: a look on someone’s face that shows what they are thinking or feeling

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an expression of surprise
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 惊讶的表情

Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a blank expression on her face no expression on her face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上毫无表情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the photograph he seemed devoid of facial expression having no expression on his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在那张照片上﹐他看上去面无表情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A pained worried expression crossed her face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上露出担心的神色。

Sense.DEF: a word or group of words with a particular meaning
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old-fashioned expression ‘in the family way’ means ‘pregnant’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过时的词组 in the family way 的意思是“怀孕的”。

GramExa.GLOSS: used when you think you may offend someone by using particular words
GramExa.EXAMPLE: After the climb we were absolutely knackered, if you’ll pardon the expression.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爬完山我们都累得要死了请原谅我的措辞。

Sense.DEF: when you put feeling or emotion into the music that you are making or into your acting
Sense.TRAN: 〔创作音乐或表演时的〕感情投入

Sense.DEF: a sign or group of signs that represent a mathematical idea or quantity
a style of painting, writing, or music that expresses feelings rather than describing objects and experiences
Sense.TRAN: 〔绘画﹑文学或音乐的〕表现主义

Sense.DEF: an expressionless face or voice does not show what someone thinks or feels
Sense.TRAN: 〔面孔或声音〕无表情的﹐无感情的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a blank expressionless stare
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面无表情的注视

Sense.DEF: showing very clearly what someone thinks or feels
Sense.TRAN: 富于感情的﹔明确表露想法的
Sense.EXAMPLE: her wonderfully expressive eyes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那双会说话的眼睛

Sense.DEF: showing a particular feeling or influence
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her poem is expressive of calm days and peace of mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的诗歌描绘了静谧的时光以及平和的心境。

Sense.DEF: if you say something expressly, you say it very clearly and firmly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was expressly forbidden to speak to the girl.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被明确禁止与那个女孩说话。

Sense.DEF: deliberately or for a specific purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building is expressly designed to conserve energy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座建筑经特别设计以节约能源。

Sense.DEF: a post service that delivers letters and packages very quickly
a wide road in a city on which cars can travel very quickly without stopping
Sense.TRAN: 〔城市里的〕快速干道﹐高速公路

Sense.DEF: if a government or someone in authority expropriates your private property, they take it away for public use
to take something from someone illegally in order to use it
Sense.TRAN: 侵占〔他人财物〕﹐把…据为己有

Sense.DEF: the act of forcing someone to leave a place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the expulsion of the protesters
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 驱逐抗议者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his expulsion from the Soviet Union in 1964
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1964年他被苏联驱逐出境

Sense.DEF: the act of stopping someone from going to the school where they were studying or from being part of the organization where they worked
Sense.EXAMPLE: The headmaster threatened the boys with expulsion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 校长警告这几名男生说要开除他们。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the expulsion from the party of its former leader
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 前任领导人被开除出党

Sense.DEF: the act of forcing air, water, gas etc out of something
to remove a name from a list, piece of information, or book
to make someone forget something unpleasant

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wanted to expunge the memory of that first race from my mind.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想把首次赛跑的记忆抹去。

Sense.DEF: an expurgated book, play etc has had some parts removed because they are considered harmful or offensive
Sense.TRAN: 〔书籍﹑剧本等因被认为有害或不雅而〕被删节的﹐经删改的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an expurgated version of her writings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的著作的删节本

Sense.DEF: extremely beautiful and very delicately made
Sense.EXAMPLE: the most exquisite craftsmanship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最精美的工艺

Sense.DEF: very sensitive and delicate in the way you behave or do things
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has exquisite taste in art.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有敏锐的艺术鉴赏力。

Sense.DEF: exquisite pain or pleasure is felt very strongly
a man who used to be in the army, navy, or air force
a woman who used to be in the army, navy, or air force

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=extension when you mean a particular telephone line (电话)分机

Sense.DEF: still existing in spite of being very old
Sense.EXAMPLE: Few of the manuscripts are still extant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手稿大都散佚无存。

Sense.DEF: spoken or done without any preparation or practice
Sense.EXAMPLE: an extemporaneous speech
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即席演讲

Sense.DEF: spok-en or done without any preparation or practice
Sense.EXAMPLE: an extempore speech
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即席演讲

Sense.DEF: to speak or perform without preparation or practice
Sense.TRAN: 临场[即席]讲话﹔即兴表演

Sense.DEF: to continue for a longer period of time, or to make something last longer
Sense.EXAMPLE: Management have agreed to extend the deadline.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理层已同意延长最后期限。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some of our courses extend over two years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有些课程修读期超过两年。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government has extended the ban on the import of beef until June.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府已经把进口牛肉的禁令延长至6月。

Sense.DEF: to continue for a particular distance or over a particular area

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The River Nile extends as far south as Lake Victoria.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼罗河一直往南延伸至维多利亚湖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The shelf extends 20 cms from the bookcase.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 搁板伸出书柜20厘米。

Sense.DEF: to make a room, building, road etc bigger or longer
Sense.EXAMPLE: We plan to extend the kitchen by six feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们打算把厨房扩建六英尺。

Subsense.DEF: to affect or include people, things, or places

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My duties at the school extend beyond just teaching.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在学校的职责不只是教书。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The vote was extended to all women aged 21 and over in 1928.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1928年投票权扩大至所有21岁及以上的妇女。

Subsense.DEF: to make something affect more people, situations, areas etc than before
Subsense.EXAMPLE: British Coal is planning to extend its operations in Wales.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国煤炭公司正计划扩展其在威尔士的业务。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We can extend our insurance cover to travel abroad.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以把保险服务的范围扩大至海外旅游。

Sense.DEF: to officially offer someone help, sympathy, thanks etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’d like to extend a warm welcome to our French visitors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对法国客人的到来表示热烈欢迎。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d like to extend my thanks to all the catering staff.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想对承办酒席的全体工作人员表示感谢。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Coroner extended his sympathy to the victim’s family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 验尸官慰唁受害者家人。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Headteacher has extended an invitation to the Prime Minister to visit the school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 校长向首相发出了参观该学校的邀请。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The banks have decided to extend credit to the company allow them to borrow more money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这几家银行已决定继续向该公司提供贷款。

Sense.DEF: to stretch out a hand or leg
Sense.EXAMPLE: George extended his hand offered to shake hands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治伸出手来握手。

Sense.DEF: to increase the number of points, games etc by which one person or team is ahead of other competitors
Sense.EXAMPLE: Manchester United extended their lead at the top of the table to 10 points.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼联队继续位列积分榜榜首﹐并将领先优势扩大到10分。

Sense.DEF: if a table or ladder extends, it can be made longer
made longer or bigger
Sense.EXAMPLE: an extended business trip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 延长了的出差行程
Sense.EXAMPLE: The computer uses extended memory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机使用扩展内存。

Sense.DEF: long or longer than expected or planned
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you are going abroad for an extended period of time, you should consider renting your house out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你要出国较长时间﹐应该考虑把房子租出去。

Sense.DEF: long and detailed
Sense.EXAMPLE: an extended analysis of the film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这部电影的详尽分析

Sense.DEF: a family group that consists not only of parents and children but also of grandparents, aunts etc
Sense.TRAN: 大家庭〔包括(外)祖父母﹑姑(姨)等在内〕

Sense.DEF: the process of making a road, building etc bigger or longer, or the part that is added
Sense.TRAN: 〔道路﹑建筑等的〕扩建﹔延长﹔增建部分

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the extension of the Jubilee underground line
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地铁银禧线的延伸

Sense.DEF: another room or rooms which are added to a building

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the planned extension to the National Museum
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国家博物馆计划扩建的部分

Sense.EXAMPLE: a loft extension
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 增建的阁楼

Sense.DEF: an additional period of time allowed for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Donald’s been given an extension to finish his thesis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唐纳德获准延期完成他的论文。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pub’s got an extension tonight it will stay open longer than usual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒馆今晚延时关门。

Sense.DEF: the development of something in order to make it affect more people, situations, areas than before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the extension of the copyright laws to cover online materials
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 著作权法向网络内容的延伸
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an extension of the powers of the European Parliament
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲议会权力的扩大

Subsense.DEF: one of many telephone lines connected to a central system in a large building, which all have different numbers
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Can I have extension 316, please?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能帮我接316号分机吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Do you know Mr Brown’s extension number?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道布朗先生的分机号码吗？

Subsense.DEF: one of the telephones in a house that all have the same number

Sense.DEF: used when you want to mention something that is naturally related to something else
Sense.TRAN: 自然地﹐当然地〔用于提及另一自然相关的事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My primary responsibility is to the pupils, and by extension to the teachers and parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我主要是对学生负责﹐当然也对教师和家长负责。

Sense.DEF: long pieces of artificial hair that can be attached to your hair to make it look longer
a set of three letters that follow the name of a computer file to show what it is. For example, the extension ‘.doc’ shows that a file is a written document.
Sense.TRAN: 〔三个字母组成的〕扩展名 ﹐类型名

Sense.DEF: an extension lead
the position of a part of the body when it is stretched, or the process of stretching it
part of a university or college that offers courses to people who are not full-time students
Sense.TRAN: 〔为非全日制学生开设的〕进修部

Sense.DEF: an additional piece of electric wire that you attach to another wire to make a very long one
large in size, amount, or degree
Sense.TRAN: 广阔的﹔大量的﹔大规模的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house stands in extensive grounds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这栋房子占地面积很大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fire has caused extensive damage to the island’s forests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大火严重毁坏了岛上的森林。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the extensive use of pesticides
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杀虫剂的大量使用

Sense.DEF: containing or dealing with a lot of information and details
Sense.EXAMPLE: Extensive research is being done into the connection between the disease and poor living conditions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们正在全面研究该疾病和恶劣居住条件之间的联系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The exhibition has received extensive coverage in the national press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次展览会被全国媒体广泛报道。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: As a student, he travelled extensively in the Middle East.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他学生时代游历过中东的许多地方。

Sense.DEF: used to say how true something is or how great an effect or change is

GramExa.PROPFORM: to a certain extent/to some extent/to an extent
GramExa.GLOSS: partly
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We all to some extent remember the good times and forget the bad.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在某种程度上都会记住美好时光而忘掉不愉快的事情。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I do agree with him to an extent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在一定程度上确实同意他的意见。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Its success will depend to a large extent on local attitudes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 此事的成功在很大程度上将取决于当地人的态度。

GramExa.GLOSS: less or more
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It will affect farmers in Spain and to a lesser extent in France.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这将影响到西班牙的农民﹐其次是法国农民。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They examined the extent to which how much age affected language-learning ability.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们调查了年龄会在多大程度上影响语言学习能力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: To what extenthow much did she influence his decision?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在多大程度上影响了他的决定？

GramExa.PROPFORM: to such an extent that/to the extent that
GramExa.GLOSS: so much that
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 达到如此程度/达到…的程度
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Violence increased to the extent that residents were afraid to leave their homes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力事件猛增﹐居民们都不敢出门了。

Sense.DEF: how large, important, or serious something is, especially something such as a problem or injury
Sense.TRAN: 程度〔问题或伤势等的大小﹑重要性和严重性〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Considering the extent of his injuries, he’s lucky to be alive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就他的伤势来说﹐他能活下来真是够幸运的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s too early to assess the full extent of the damage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要全面评估损失程度还为时过早。

Sense.DEF: the length or size of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They opened out the nets to their full extent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把渔网完全张开。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The region is over 10,000 square kilometres in extent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区的面积超过10,000平方公里。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He refused to reveal the full extent of his debts.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拒绝透露自己的详细债务情况。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Rescue workers still do not know the true extent of the disaster.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 救援人员依然不清楚灾难的真实情况。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 知道/意识到某事的程度
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We do not yet know the extent of the damage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还不知道受损程度。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Other people didn’t seem to understand the extent of his disability.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他人似乎并不了解他的残疾程度。

Collocate.COLLOC: discover/find out the extent of sth
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We were shocked when we discovered the extent of the fraud.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们发现诈骗情节有多严重时很震惊。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We are still trying to assess the extent of the problem.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们仍在设法评估问题的严重性。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: These pictures show the extent of the devastation caused by the earthquake.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些照片展示了这次地震造成的破坏程度。

Sense.DEF: facts or reasons which make you feel that it was reasonable for someone to break the usual rules, or make you have sympathy for someone who did something wrong or illegal
Sense.TRAN: 情有可原的情况/因素等

Sense.DEF: the outside of something, especially a building

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the exterior of the factory
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家工厂的外观

Sense.EXAMPLE: The dome is tiled on the exterior.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穹顶表面铺了瓦片。

Sense.DEF: behaviour that seems calm, unfriendly etc but which often hides a different feeling or attitude
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beneath that calm exterior, he has a fierce will to win.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他表面镇定﹐其实求胜心切。

Sense.DEF: on the outside of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The exterior walls need a new coat of paint.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外墙需要刷新漆了。

Sense.DEF: exterior scenes in a film are filmed outdoors
coming from or relating to facts, situations etc other than the one you are considering
Sense.EXAMPLE: information that is exterior to the text itself
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来源于文本以外的资料

Sense.DEF: to kill large numbers of people or animals of a particular type so that they no longer exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: Staff use the poison to exterminate moles and rabbits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工用毒药来消灭鼹鼠和野兔。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the extermination of the indigenous peoples

Sense.DEF: a university student who works in a particular type of job for a short time in order to gain experience of that type of work
Sense.EXAMPLE: a finance major who was an extern with Merrill Lynch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在美林证券公司实习的金融专业大学生

Sense.DEF: relating to the outside of something or of a person’s body
Sense.EXAMPLE: the external appearance of the building
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大楼的外观

GramExa.GLOSS: written on medicines which must be put on your skin and not swallowed

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say outside rather than external .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说outside﹐而不说external
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The outside walls of the building were painted yellow.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 大楼外墙刷成了黄色。

Sense.DEF: relating to your environment or situation, rather than to your own qualities, ideas etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Low birth weight may be caused by external factors, such as smoking during pregnancy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新生儿体重不足可能是外在因素造成的﹐如怀孕期间吸烟等。
Sense.EXAMPLE: influences from the external environment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外部环境的影响

Sense.DEF: coming from or happening outside a particular place or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: information from external sources
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自外部的信息

Sense.DEF: relating to foreign countries
Sense.EXAMPLE: China will not tolerate any external interference in its affairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中国不会容忍任何国家干涉其内政。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Minister of External Affairs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 外交大臣

Sense.DEF: coming from outside a particular school, university, or organization, and therefore independent
Sense.TRAN: 来自〔学校或机构〕以外的

GramExa.GLOSS: someone from outside who looks at an organization’s finances

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The job should be advertised internally and externally.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个岗位应该对内外同时征聘。

Sense.DEF: to express inner feelings
the outer appearance of a situation
a job that a university student does in order to gain experience in a particular area of work. Externships are usually not paid and usually last only a short time
Sense.TRAN: 〔一般无报酬的大学生〕短期实习
Sense.EXAMPLE: an externship in a law firm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在律师事务所的短期实习

Sense.DEF: an extinct type of animal or plant does not exist any more
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dinosaurs have been extinct for millions of years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐龙已灭绝数千万年了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pandas could become extinct in the wild.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 熊猫在野生环境中可能会绝种。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an extinct species
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已灭绝的一个物种

Sense.DEF: if a type of person, custom, skill etc is extinct, it does not exist in society any more
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种类型的人﹑习俗﹑技能等〕绝迹的﹐消亡的

Sense.DEF: an extinct volcano does not erupt any more
when a particular type of animal or plant stops existing
Sense.EXAMPLE: species in danger of extinction
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有灭绝危险的物种

GramExa.GLOSS: nearly extinct
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The breed was on the verge of extinction.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一物种濒临灭绝。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They were hunted almost to extinction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它们遭受猎杀﹐几近灭绝。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Conservationists are trying to save the whale from extinction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生态环境保护工作者正努力挽救鲸类以防止其灭绝。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many endangered species now face extinction.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多濒危物种现正面临灭绝。

Sense.DEF: when a type of person, custom, skill etc stops existing
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种类型的人﹑习俗﹑技能等的〕绝迹﹐消亡
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their traditional way of life seems doomed to extinction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的传统生活方式似乎注定要消亡。

Sense.DEF: to make a fire or light stop burning or shining
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please extinguish all cigarettes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请把香烟都熄灭了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Firemen were called to extinguish the blaze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人打电话叫消防队员来扑灭大火。

Sense.DEF: to make an idea or feeling stop
Sense.TRAN: 使〔想法或感情〕破灭﹔使消亡
Sense.EXAMPLE: All hope was almost extinguished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的希望都快要破灭了。

Sense.DEF: a fire extinguisher
to completely destroy something that is unpleasant or unwanted
to praise something very much

GramExa.PROPFORM: extol the virtues/benefits etc of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a speech extolling the merits of free enterprise
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 赞颂自由企业制优点的讲话

Sense.DEF: to illegally force someone to give you something, especially money, by threatening them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rebels extorted money from local villagers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛乱分子向当地村民勒索钱财。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He faces charges of kidnapping and extortion.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他面临绑架和勒索的指控。

Sense.DEF: an extortionate price, demand etc is unreasonably high
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many local taxi drivers charge extortionate rates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多当地出租车司机收费过高。

Sense.DEF: more of something, in addition to the usual or standard amount or number
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you get an extra loaf of bread?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能多拿一条面包吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Allow extra time for your journey.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要给你的旅程多留出点时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Drivers are advised to take extra care.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建议司机开车要格外小心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Residents can use the gym at no extra cost.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 住客不必另外付费即可使用健身房。

GramExa.PROPFORM: an extra ten minutes/three metres etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I asked for an extra two weeks to finish the work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要求再多给两周的时间来完成工作。

Sense.DEF: if something is extra, it is not included in the price of something and you have to pay more for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dinner costs $15 but wine is extra.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚餐费用为15美元﹐但酒费另计。

Sense.DEF: an amount of something, especially money, in addition to the usual, basic, or necessary amount

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I earn extra for working on Sunday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我星期天工作挣外快。

Sense.DEF: in addition to the usual things or the usual amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: They need to offer something extra to attract customers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们需要提供额外的东西以吸引顾客。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I got a few extra in case anyone else decides to come.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我另外准备了一些﹐以防其他人也决定要来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll be making $400 extra a month.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我将每月多挣400美元。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize an adjective or adverb
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re going to have to work extra hard to pass the exam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要格外用功才能通过考试。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an extra special effort
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格外的努力

Sense.DEF: something which is added to a basic product or service that improves it and often costs more
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tinted windows and a sunroof are optional extras something that you can choose to have or not.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有色玻璃窗和车顶天窗是备选的配件﹐要另收费。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be careful, there may be hidden extras additional charges which you are not told about.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要当心一点﹐可能会有隐藏的额外费用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s got lots of useful little extras.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它有不少实用小配件出售。

Sense.DEF: an actor in a film who does not say anything but is part of a crowd
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影里的〕临时演员﹐群众演员
Sense.EXAMPLE: He started his acting career as an extra.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的演艺生涯是从当临时演员开始的。

Sense.DEF: outside or beyond
Sense.EXAMPLE: extragalactic outside our galaxy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银河系外的
Sense.EXAMPLE: extracellular outside a cell
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 细胞外的

Sense.DEF: very or more than normal
Sense.EXAMPLE: extra-large
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常大的
Sense.EXAMPLE: extra-strong
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特别强壮的
Sense.EXAMPLE: extra-special
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十分特别的

Sense.DEF: to remove an object from somewhere, especially with difficulty
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to have that tooth extracted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得把那颗牙拔掉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He extracted an envelope from his inside pocket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从里面的口袋里抽出一个信封。

Sense.DEF: to carefully remove a substance from something which contains it, using a machine, chemical process etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oils are extracted from the plants.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从这些植物中提炼出油。

Sense.DEF: to get something which you want from someone, such as information, money, help etc, especially when they do not want to give it to you
Sense.TRAN: 套出〔信息〕﹔索取〔钱财〕﹔设法得到〔帮助〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had extracted a promise from him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她设法得到了他的许诺。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They used torture to extract information about their families.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们用严刑拷打逼问﹐以获取他们家庭成员的资料。

Sense.DEF: to take information or a short piece of writing from a book
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to extract the relevant financial data.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要摘录相关的财务数据。

Sense.DEF: to get an advantage or good thing from a situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They aim to extract the maximum political benefit from the Games.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们旨在通过举办运动会获得最大的政治利益。

Sense.DEF: a short piece of writing, music etc taken from a particular book, piece of music etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve only seen short extracts from the film.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是看过那部电影的一些小片段。

Sense.DEF: a substance obtained from something by using a special process

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Add one teaspoon of vanilla extract.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加入一茶匙香草精。

Sense.DEF: the process of removing or obtaining something from something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the extraction of salt from seawater
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从海水中提取盐
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the extraction of information from appropriate reference sources
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从合适的参考书中摘录资料

Sense.DEF: to be from a French, Russian etc family even though you were not born in that country
Sense.TRAN: 祖籍法国/俄罗斯/意大利等

Sense.DEF: a machine for removing air that is hot or smells unpleasant from a kitchen, factory etc
extracurricular activities are not part of the course that a student is doing at a school or college
an extraditable crime is one for which someone can be extradited
Sense.EXAMPLE: Possession of explosives is an extraditable offence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拥有炸药是足以被引渡的罪行。

Sense.DEF: to use a legal process to send someone who may be guilty of a crime back to the country where the crime happened in order to judge them in a court of law

GramExa.PROPFORM: extradite sb to/from Britain/the US etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They are expected to be extradited to Britain to face trial.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们可能会被引渡到英国接受审判。

Sense.DEF: beyond or outside the ordinary powers of the law
Sense.TRAN: 法律制裁范围以外的﹔法庭管辖以外的

Sense.DEF: an extramarital sexual relationship is one that a married person has with a person who is not their husband or wife
relating to a place or organization but happening or done outside it
Sense.TRAN: 某地点以外的﹔机构以外的
Sense.EXAMPLE: extramural activities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机构外的活动

Sense.DEF: extramural courses are for people who are not full-time students
Sense.TRAN: 校外的〔指课程为非全日制学生开设的〕

Sense.DEF: not belonging to or directly related to a particular subject or problem

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Such details are extraneous to the matter in hand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些细节与手头这件事并无直接联系。

Sense.DEF: coming from outside
Sense.EXAMPLE: extraneous noises
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外面传来的噪声

Sense.DEF: a computer system in a company that allows better communication between the company and its customers by combining Internet and intranet systems, so that some customers can view some of the company’s private information that is not normally available on the Internet
Sense.TRAN: 〔专供公司和客户联系的〕外联网

Sense.DEF: used, often humorously, to describe someone who is very good at doing something
Sense.TRAN: 卓越的﹐杰出的〔常为幽默用法〕

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 杰出的园丁/糕饼师/厨师等

Sense.DEF: extremely
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were extraordinarily lucky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们极其幸运。

Sense.DEF: in a way that seems strange
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why had James behaved so extraordinarily?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么詹姆斯的行为那么古怪？

Sense.DEF: very unusual or surprising
Sense.TRAN: 异乎寻常的﹔令人惊奇的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took an extraordinary amount of work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这费了相当多的功夫。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s extraordinary that he should make exactly the same mistake again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真想不到他又犯了完全相同的错误。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Chris’s behaviour that morning was quite extraordinary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯那天上午的行为极不寻常。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What an extraordinary thing to do!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么做多奇怪呀！

GramExa.GLOSS: used to express surprise

Sense.DEF: very much greater or more impressive than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: a woman of extraordinary beauty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 容貌出众的女子
Sense.EXAMPLE: an extraordinary talent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非凡的才华

Sense.DEF: a meeting which takes place in addition to the usual ones
an official employed for a special purpose, in addition to the usual officials
Sense.TRAN: 特使/特命大使/特命公使

Sense.DEF: the practice by a government of arranging for someone who is thought to be a terrorist to be taken to another country where more severe ways of getting information, for example torture, can be used
Sense.TRAN: 非常规引渡〔指一国政府将恐怖分子嫌疑犯送至可严刑逼供的国家的做法〕

Sense.DEF: to use facts about the present or about one thing or group to make a guess about the future or about other things or groups

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is possible to extrapolate future developments from current trends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从当前的趋势可以推断出未来的发展。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’re extrapolating from your own feelings to mine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这是依据自己的感受来推断我的感觉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These results cannot, however, be extrapolated to other patient groups.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 然而这些结果不能用来类推到其他各类病人身上。

Sense.DEF: a creature that people think may exist on another planet
relating to things that exist outside the Earth
Sense.TRAN: 地球外的﹔宇宙的﹔外星的

Sense.DEF: happening outside a particular country
a period, usually of 30 minutes, added to the end of a football game in some competitions if neither team has won after normal time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Beckham scored in extra time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝克汉姆在加时赛中射入一球。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The match went into extra time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛进入了加时赛。

Sense.DEF: spending or costing a lot of money, especially more than is necessary or more than you can afford
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would it be too extravagant to buy both?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把两个都买下会不会太奢侈了？
Sense.EXAMPLE: an extravagant lifestyle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奢侈的生活方式

Sense.DEF: doing or using something too much or more than is necessary
Sense.TRAN: 〔事情做得〕过度的﹔大手大脚的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t be too extravagant with the wine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要酗酒。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an extravagant display of loyalty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过分表露忠诚

Sense.DEF: if someone makes extravagant claims, promises etc, they make big claims or promises that are not true or real
Sense.EXAMPLE: extravagant claims about the drug’s effectiveness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对该药疗效的夸张说法

Sense.DEF: very impressive because of being very expensive, beautiful etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: extravagant celebrations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铺张的庆祝活动

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the extravagance of the Royal Palace
His only extravagance the only expensive thing he bought was fine wine.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他唯一的奢侈品是美酒。

Sense.DEF: a very large and expensive entertainment
Sense.EXAMPLE: a musical extravaganza
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐盛会

Sense.DEF: another spelling of extrovert
extra virgin olive oil comes from olives that are pressed for the first time, and is considered to be the best quality olive oil
very great in degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: Extreme poverty still exists in many rural areas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多农村地区仍处于赤贫状态。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is necessary to use extreme caution with chemicals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 接触化学品必须极其小心。

Sense.EXAMPLE: extreme cold
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严寒
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had extreme difficulty getting hold of the ingredients.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他费了极大的劲找配料。

Sense.DEF: very unusual and severe or serious
Sense.TRAN: 异乎寻常的﹔极端的﹔严重的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an extreme case of cruelty
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 极严重的虐待案例

Sense.EXAMPLE: Force is only justified in extreme circumstances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有在极端情况下才可以使用武力。

Sense.DEF: the part furthest to the west, nearest the end etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: on the extreme edge of the cliff
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在悬崖的最边上

Sense.DEF: extreme opinions, beliefs, or organizations, especially political ones, are considered by most people to be unacceptable and unreasonable
Sense.EXAMPLE: extreme right-wing nationalists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极右翼民族主义分子

Sense.DEF: an extreme sport is one that is done in a way that has much more risk and so is more dangerous than an ordinary form of the sport
someone who does extreme sports
Sense.TRAN: 极限运动员/冲浪者/滑雪者等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Extreme surfers will ride waves that reach heights of more than fifty feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极限冲浪者能在50多英尺高的海浪上滑行。

Sense.DEF: a situation, quality etc which is as great as it can possibly be – used especially when talking about two opposites
Sense.TRAN: 极端〔尤用于表示两个相反的事物〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bacteria can withstand extremes of heat and cold.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种细菌能承受酷热和严寒。

Sense.EXAMPLE: In fact, the truth lies between the two extremes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事实上﹐真理存在于两个极端之间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At the other extreme is a country like Switzerland with almost no unemployment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 另一个极端则是像瑞士这样几乎没有人失业的国家。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Advertisements seem to go from one extreme to the other change from one extreme thing to something totally opposite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 广告似乎从一个极端走到了另一个极端。

Sense.DEF: to a very great degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: This kind of experiment seems cruel in the extreme.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种实验好像极其残酷。

Sense.DEF: if someone does something to extremes, they do it to a point beyond what is normal or acceptable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Problems only occur when this attitude is taken to extremes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有当这种态度走向极端时﹐问题才会发生。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She had gone to extremes to avoid seeing him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了避免见到他﹐她已经采用极端手段了。

Sense.DEF: a competition, similar to boxing, in which two people are allowed to hit or kick each other and in which there are almost no rules
Sense.TRAN: 终极搏击﹐极限打斗〔类似于拳击但几乎没有规则〕

Sense.DEF: to a very great degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: Earthquakes are extremely difficult to predict.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地震非常难以预测。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m extremely sorry to have troubled you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给你添了麻烦﹐我十分抱歉。

Sense.DEF: opinions, ideas, and actions, especially political or religious ones, that most people think are unreasonable and unacceptable
Sense.TRAN: 极端主义﹔极端性〔尤指政治或宗教方面〕

Sense.DEF: someone who has extreme political opinions and aims, and who is willing to do unusual or illegal things in order to achieve them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bomb was planted by right-wing extremists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸弹是右翼极端分子放置的。

Sense.DEF: one of the parts of your body that is furthest away from the centre, for example your fingers and toes
the degree to which something goes beyond what is usually thought to be acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: The committee was uncomfortable about the extremity of the proposal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会因该建议太极端而感到不安。

Sense.DEF: the part that is furthest away from the centre of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the southern extremity of New Zealand
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新西兰的最南端

Sense.DEF: to escape from a difficult or embarrassing situation, or to help someone escape

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How was he going to extricate himself from this situation?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打算怎样摆脱这种局面？

Sense.DEF: to remove someone from a place in which they are trapped

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Firemen had to extricate the driver from the wreckage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防员得把司机从残骸中解救出来。

Sense.DEF: coming from outside or not directly relating to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Staff who complete extra qualifications receive no extrinsic rewards no extra money etc.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 取得额外资历的员工不会另外得到报酬。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a combination of intrinsic and extrinsic factors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内外因素的结合

Sense.DEF: someone who is active and confident, and who enjoys spending time with other people
Sense.TRAN: 性格外向的人﹐活泼自信的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her sister was always more of an extrovert.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她妹妹总是更外向些。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个友好而活泼开朗的澳大利亚青年

Sense.DEF: having a confident character and enjoying the company of other people
to push or force something out through a hole
to force plastic or metal through a hole so that it has a particular shape
happy and full of energy and excitement
Sense.TRAN: 兴高采烈的﹔精神焕发的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an exuberant personality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满活力的个性

Sense.DEF: exuberant decorations, patterns etc are exciting and complicated or colourful
Sense.TRAN: 〔装饰品﹑图案等〕充满生气的﹐鲜艳的
Sense.EXAMPLE: exube-rant carvings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满生气的雕刻品

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She needs to try and control her natural exuberance.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她需要尽力控制自己天生的旺盛精力。

Sense.DEF: if you exude a particular quality, it is easy to see that you have a lot of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She exudes self-confidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她显得信心十足。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He exuded an air of wealth and power.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他显露出一副有钱有势的派头。

Sense.DEF: to flow out slowly and steadily, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plant exudes a sticky liquid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种植物会分泌一种黏液。

Sense.DEF: to show that you are very happy and proud, especially because you have succeeded in doing something
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因做某事成功而〕欢欣鼓舞﹐扬扬得意

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She exulted in her new discovery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为自己的新发现而扬扬得意。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘We made the front page!’ Jos exulted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们上了头版！”乔斯欣喜若狂道。

Sense.DEF: very happy or proud, especially because you have succeeded in doing something
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因做某事成功而〕欢欣鼓舞的﹐扬扬得意的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an exultant mood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得意的心情
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ralph was exultant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉尔夫感到欢欣鼓舞。

Sense.DEF: the form used for -y, especially after y
Sense.TRAN: -y 的变体〔尤用于以 y 结尾的词后面〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: clayey soil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黏质土壤

Sense.DEF: one of the two parts of the body that you use to see with
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s got beautiful eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有一双漂亮的眼睛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were tears in her eyes as she listened to the story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听故事时眼里噙着泪水。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ow! I’ve got something in my eye!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀！我眼睛里进了什么东西！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a brown-eyed girl
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 棕色眼睛的女孩

PIC.HEADING: EYE 眼睛
PIC.PICCONTENT: eyebrow 眉毛；eyelid 眼睑；eyelashes 睫毛；pupil 瞳孔；iris 虹膜；eyeball 眼球

Sense.DEF: a particular way of seeing, judging, or understanding something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go through your shopping list with a critical eye for foods with a high fat content.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用谨慎的眼光仔细检查一下购物单上有没有含高脂肪的食品。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The magazine combines the accuracy of the scientist with the eye of the artist.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份杂志结合了科学家的准确和艺术家的眼光。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The picture quality, to my eye, is excellent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 图片质量在我看来非常好。

GramExa.GLOSS: from the point of view of a particular person
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The story is told through the eyes of a refugee child.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 故事是以一个避难儿童的视角讲述的。

GramExa.GLOSS: according to a particular person or group
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Carl could do no wrong in the eyes of his parents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡尔在他父母眼里是不会做错事的。

Sense.DEF: to look after someone or something and make sure that they are safe
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary will keep an eye on the kids this afternoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽今天下午会照看孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We keep a watchful eye on our elderly neighbors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们特别留意年长的邻居。

Sense.DEF: to carefully watch everything that someone does, especially because you do not trust them
Sense.TRAN: 监视[密切注意]某人(的举动)
Sense.EXAMPLE: We want Taylor in jail where we can keep an eye on him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们想把泰勒关进监狱﹐这样就可以监视他的行动。

Sense.DEF: when you look directly at someone at the same time as they are looking at you
Sense.EXAMPLE: People who are lying tend to avoid eye contact.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 撒谎的人往往会避开对视。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In a formal interview, try to maintain good eye contact with the interviewers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在正式面试时﹐要尽量与面试官保持适当的目光接触。

Sense.LEXUNIT: keep/have one eye/half an eye on sb/sth
Sense.DEF: to be watching someone or something at the same time that you are doing something else
Sense.TRAN: 做另一件事的同时注意着某人/某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Louise was stirring the soup with half an eye on the baby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路易丝边搅拌汤边留神看着婴儿。
