Sense.DEF: to want something that you think might become available
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has his eye on the bigger apartment next door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看中了隔壁那套更大的公寓。

Sense.DEF: if you can see something with the naked eye, you can see it without using any artificial help such as a telescope or microscope

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s just about possible to see the planet with the naked eye on a clear night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在无云的夜晚﹐用肉眼勉强能够看到这颗行星。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dust mites are tiny creatures, invisible to the naked eye.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尘螨是极小的生物﹐肉眼看不见。

Sense.DEF: if something happens before your very eyes, it happens where you can clearly see it
Sense.TRAN: 就在某人眼前﹐当着某人的面
Sense.EXAMPLE: The murder had apparently taken place before our very eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那起谋杀案显然就发生在我们眼皮底下。

Sense.LEXUNIT: can’t take your eyes off sb/sth
Sense.DEF: to be unable to stop looking at someone or something, especially because they are extremely interesting or attractive
Sense.TRAN: 无法将目光从某人身上/某物上移开
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked stunning. I couldn’t take my eyes off her all evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她太迷人了﹐整个晚上我都无法将目光从她身上移开。

Sense.LEXUNIT: under the (watchful/stern etc) eye of sb
Sense.DEF: while being watched by someone who is making sure that you behave properly or do something right
Sense.EXAMPLE: We went to dances, but only under the watchful eye of our father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去跳舞了﹐但只能在父亲的监视之下。

Sense.DEF: to look at something quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She cast her eye over the front page of the paper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她匆匆看了一下报纸的头版。

Sense.DEF: to see something or meet someone, especially for the first time
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指初次〕遇见某人/看见某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I loved that house from the moment I clapped eyes on it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一看见那栋房子就喜欢上了。

Sense.DEF: to watch carefully so that you will notice when someone or something appears
Sense.TRAN: 密切注意(某人/某物)﹐留神(某人/某物)
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep an eye out for rabbits in the field.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要留意田里的兔子。

Sense.DEF: if you do something with an eye to doing something else, you do it in order to make the second thing more likely to happen
Sense.TRAN: 着眼于(做)某事﹐指望某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most novels are published with an eye to commercial success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数小说的出版都希望获得商业上的成功。

Sense.DEF: to ignore something or pretend that you do not know it is happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most governments know that we’re heading for an environmental catastrophe but they shut their eyes to it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数政府明明知道我们正走向环境灾难﹐却对此视若无睹。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have an eye/a good eye for sth
Sense.DEF: to be good at noticing a particular type of thing, especially something attractive, valuable, of good quality etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ernest has an eye for detail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧内斯特观察事物细致入微。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s definitely got a good eye for a bargain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的确善于发现便宜货。

Sense.DEF: to watch carefully and continuously for something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She stumbled along, keeping her eyes peeled for a phone box.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一边跌跌撞撞地往前走﹐一边留意找公用电话亭。

Sense.DEF: knowing fully what the problems, difficulties, results etc of a situation might be
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve no-one to blame but myself — I went into this deal with my eyes open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不怪别人﹐只能怨自己我是明明知道这笔交易的后果的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: can do sth with your eyes shut/closed
Sense.DEF: to be able to do something very easily
Sense.TRAN: 能够轻而易举地做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Believe me, you could run that place with your eyes closed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相信我﹐你闭着眼睛都能把那地方经营好。

Sense.LEXUNIT: make eyes at sb/give sb the eye
Sense.DEF: to look at someone in a way that shows you think they are sexually attractive
Sense.TRAN: 向某人眉目传情[送秋波]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t look now, but that guy over there is really giving you the eye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在别看了﹐不过那边那个家伙确实在向你抛媚眼。

Sense.LEXUNIT: an eye for/on/to the main chance
Sense.DEF: if you have an eye for the main chance, you will take advantage of any possible opportunity to get what you want – used to show disapproval

Sense.LEXUNIT: one in the eye for sb
Sense.DEF: something that will annoy someone or give them a disadvantage – used especially when you think this is a good thing
Sense.TRAN: 令某人生气的事﹔对某人不利的事〔尤用于认为那是好事时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: This latest judgement will definitely be one in the eye for the fast food corporations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这最新的裁决肯定会对快餐公司不利。

Sense.DEF: the idea that if someone does something wrong, you should punish them by doing the same thing to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: An eye for an eye is no way to run a civilised justice system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 完善的司法制度不允许以眼还眼﹑以牙还牙的行为。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is secret and must only be seen by one particular person or group
Sense.EXAMPLE: The information is for police eyes only.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一情报只供警方参阅。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have eyes in the back of your head
Sense.DEF: to know what is happening all around you, even when this seems impossible
Sense.TRAN: 后脑勺长眼睛〔指知道身边发生的一切〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to be really careful — old Jonesey has eyes in the back of his head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得非常小心﹐老琼西脑袋后面都长着眼睛呢。

Sense.DEF: to practise or to continue practising an activity so that you become good at it
to notice every small detail or everything that is happening, and therefore be very difficult to deceive
Sense.TRAN: 有鹰一样的眼睛﹔目光犀利
Sense.EXAMPLE: We never got away with anything in Mrs. Podell’s class — she had eyes like a hawk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在波德尔夫人的课上﹐我们干什么都瞒不过她她眼睛尖着呢。

Sense.LEXUNIT: his/her etc eyes were popping (out of his/her etc head)
Sense.DEF: to be very surprised, shocked, or excited by something you see
Sense.TRAN: 双目圆睁〔表示惊讶﹑震惊或激动〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: be up to your eyes in sth
Sense.DEF: to be very busy doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s up to his eyes in paperwork.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他做文案工作忙得不可开交。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have eyes bigger than your belly
Sense.DEF: used to say that you have taken more food than you are able to eat
Sense.TRAN: 眼馋肚饱﹔眼睛大﹐肚子小〔形容贪吃〕

Sense.DEF: if someone only has eyes for someone, they love and are interested in that person only
Sense.TRAN: 只钟情于某人﹐眼睛里只有某人

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not believe something

Sense.LEXUNIT: all eyes are on/watching/fixed on etc

Subsense.DEF: used to say that everyone is looking at someone or something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: All eyes were on the speaker, and nobody noticed me slip into the hall.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有目光都集中在演讲者身上﹐因此没人察觉到我溜进了大厅。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that a lot of people are paying attention to a particular person or situation
Subsense.EXAMPLE: For the time being, all eyes are on the White House.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼下很多人都在关注白宫的态度。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you do not believe what someone is saying
Sense.TRAN: 不可能！〔表示不相信某人正在说的话〕

Sense.DEF: the eye of the camera is the way that you appear in photographs
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fashion models are completely comfortable with the eye of the camera.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时装模特面对镜头完全应付自如。

Sense.DEF: the hole in a needle that you put the thread through
a small circle or U-shaped piece of metal used together with a hook for fastening clothes
the calm centre of a storm such as a hurricane
a dark spot on a potato that a new plant can grow from

Crossrefto.REFLEX: see sth out of the corner of your eye
in the twinkling of an eye
keep a weather eye on sth
pull the wool over sb’s eyes

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 棕色的/蓝色的/灰色的/绿色的
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Both their children have blue eyes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的两个孩子都是蓝眼睛。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His eyes are dark brown.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的眼睛是深棕色的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She looked into his deep blue eyes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她凝视他深蓝色的眼睛。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: pale brown and slightly green or golden

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She looked at me with those big brown eyes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那双棕色的大眼睛看着我。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His small cold eyes seemed full of menace.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那冷酷的小眼睛里好像充满了威胁。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The children gazed at the screen, their eyes wide with excitement.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们盯着屏幕﹐兴奋地大睁着眼睛。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He has a thin face and narrow eyes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脸庞瘦削﹐一双眯缝眼。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: round and sticking far out
small round and bright, and noticing a lot of things
far back in someone’s face
close together
wide apart
having fallen inwards, especially because of age or illness

Section.SECHEADING: SHOWING YOUR FEELINGS/CHARACTER 表明情感/性格

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His eyes looked sleepy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他眼带倦意。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her beautiful eyes suddenly looked sad.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她美丽的眼睛蓦地现出悲伤。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: feeling that you want to cry
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 含泪的/湿润的/泪眼模糊的
Collocate.EXAMPLE: As she left a village, people waved at her with tearful eyes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 当她离开一个村子﹐人们含着泪与她挥手告别。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: happy or excited
Collocate.EXAMPLE: the bright eyes of the children
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们明亮的眼睛

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: unfriendly and not showing any emotion
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her eyes were cold and uncaring.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她眼神冷漠﹐满不在乎。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: red because you are upset, tired, ill etc
Collocate.EXAMPLE: My mother’s eyes were red from crying.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我妈妈哭红了双眼。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: swollen because you are ill or upset
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔因生病或心情不好而眼睛〕肿胀的
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The girl’s eyes were puffy and full of tears.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那姑娘的眼睛肿肿的﹐噙满了泪水。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: showing strong emotions, especially sadness
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The dog looked up at her with big soulful eyes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只狗用伤感的大眼睛仰视着她。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very angry, afraid etc
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He stared at them with wild eyes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他愤怒地瞪着他们。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: showing that you want something very much
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The men looked around the room with their greedy eyes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那几个男人用贪婪的眼神环顾室内。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I slowly opened my eyes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我慢慢地睁开眼睛。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Suddenly his eyes opened.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然睁开了眼睛。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Joe closed his eyes and tried to get back to sleep.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔闭上眼睛想继续睡。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She let her eyes close for just a moment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她闭了一会儿眼睛。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Anna rubbed her eyes wearily.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 安娜疲倦地揉揉眼睛。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: protect them from a bright light or the sun
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 挡住眼睛〔以遮住强光或阳光〕

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: partly close them, especially to show that you do not trust someone
become half closed, especially because someone does not trust another person
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人的眼睛眯起来〔尤因怀疑〕

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: become more open because they are surprised
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人的眼睛睁大〔因为惊讶〕

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: show that they are very happy
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人的眼睛闪闪发亮〔表示愉快〕

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: become excited
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人两眼放光〔指变得兴奋〕

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: look down at the ground
look away from something
prevent them from closing
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I was so tired I could hardly keep my eyes open.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我累得眼睛都快睁不开了。

Collocate.COLLOC: have/keep etc your eyes glued to sth
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be watching something with all your attention
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Ted sat with his eyes glued to the television.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 特德坐着﹐两眼紧盯着电视。

Collocate.COLLOC: sb’s eyes are full of tears
sb’s eyes are full of hatred/fear etc
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人的眼里充满仇恨/恐惧等

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say ‘black eyes’ when you mean dark brown eyes. You normally use ‘black eye’ when someone has a bruise around their eye, after being hit by someone. 表示眼睛是黑色的﹐不要说black eyes﹐要说dark brown eyes。black eye 一般表示挨打后眼周有瘀青。

Sense.DEF: to look at someone or something carefully, especially because you do not trust them or because you want something
Sense.TRAN: 端详﹐审视﹐细看〔尤因不相信某人或想得到某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The man behind the desk eyed us suspiciously.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 书桌后面的男子怀疑地注视着我们。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A crowd of local children gathered around, eying us in silence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群当地的孩子聚集在周围﹐默不作声地打量着我们。

Sense.DEF: to look at someone in a way that shows you think they are sexually attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a group of lads at the bar, eyeing up every girl who walked in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒吧里有一群小伙子﹐色迷迷地打量每一个走进来的姑娘。

Sense.DEF: the round ball that forms the whole of your eye, including the part inside your head
if two people are eyeball to eyeball, they are directly facing each other, especially in an angry or threatening way

Sense.LEXUNIT: up to the/your eyeballs in sth
Sense.DEF: if someone is up to their eyeballs in something, they have more than they can deal with
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s up to her eyeballs in debt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她债台高筑。

Sense.DEF: if someone is drugged up to the eyeballs, they have taken a lot of drugs so that their behaviour is severely affected
Sense.TRAN: 服用了大量毒品〔因而行为受到严重影响〕

Sense.DEF: to look directly and closely at something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: They eyeballed each other suspiciously.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们怀疑地互相打量。

Sense.DEF: the line of hair above your eye
Sense.EXAMPLE: thick bushy eyebrows
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浓密的眉毛

Sense.DEF: to move your eyebrows upwards in order to show surprise or disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 扬起眉毛〔表示惊讶或反对〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Really?’ she said, raising her eyebrows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “真的吗？”她扬起双眉说道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This decision caused a few raised eyebrows surprised some people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个决定令一些人感到惊讶。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be up to your eyebrows in sth
Sense.DEF: to have more of something than you can deal with
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m absolutely up to my eyebrows in work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的工作实在是忙得不可开交。

Sense.DEF: a special pencil you can use to make your eyebrows darker
someone or something that is attractive to look at, but is not serious or important
Sense.TRAN: 徒有其表的人﹔中看不中用的东西

Sense.DEF: something eye-catching is unusual or attractive in a way that makes you notice it
Sense.EXAMPLE: an eye-catching design
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引人注目的设计

Sense.DEF: special liquid which you put into your eyes because they are sore or dry, or as a medical treatment
informal

Subsense.DEF: if you get an eyeful of something interesting or shocking, you see it
something or someone, especially a woman, who is very attractive to look at
Subsense.TRAN: 引人注目的东西[人]〔尤指美女〕

Sense.DEF: an amount of liquid, dust, or sand that has got into someone’s eye
Sense.TRAN: 满眼〔的液体﹑灰尘或沙子〕

Sense.DEF: a lens for one eye, worn to help you see better with that eye
a pair of glasses
one of the small hairs that grow along the edge of your eyelids
if a woman flutters her eyelashes, she moves them up and down very quickly, in order to look sexually attractive
having no eyes
a hole surrounded by a metal ring that is put in leather or cloth so that a string can be passed through it
Sense.TRAN: 〔皮革或布上供穿线绳用的〕孔眼

Sense.DEF: a height equal to the level of your eyes

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your screen should be at eye level.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 屏幕应该与眼睛齐平。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an eye-level grill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与眼睛齐平的烤架

Sense.DEF: a piece of skin that covers your eye when it is closed
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyelids began to droop close, because he was sleepy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的眼皮开始往下垂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room spun. Her eyelids fluttered moved up and down quickly and she fainted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间快速旋转起来。她的眼皮上下翻动﹐然后便昏了过去。

Sense.DEF: coloured make-up that you put along the edges of your eyelids to make your eyes look bigger or more noticeable
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was wearing thick, black eyeliner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她描着浓浓的黑眼线。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an eyeliner pencil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼线笔

Sense.DEF: an experience from which you learn something surprising or new
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole trip has been a real eye-opener.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个旅行真让人大开眼界。

Sense.DEF: a piece of material worn over one eye, usually because that eye has been damaged
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常因眼睛受伤而戴上的〕眼罩

Sense.DEF: the glass piece that you look through in a microscope or telescope
eye exercises that are meant to improve how well you see

an examination of someone’s eye using special computer equipment in order to identify them. Eye scans are done by the police and immigration officials at some airports to check the information on someone’s passport or id card
Sense.TRAN: 眼扫描〔指用特殊计算机设备检查人的眼睛﹐警察和移民局官员借此核对其护照或身份证〕

Sense.DEF: coloured make-up that you put on your eyelids to make your eyes look more attractive
your ability to see

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Eagles have very keen eyesight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鹰的视力非常敏锐。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a problem with his eyesight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的视力有问题。

Sense.DEF: something that is very ugly, especially a building surrounded by other things that are not ugly
Sense.TRAN: 碍眼的事物﹐难看的东西〔尤指建筑〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The factory is an eyesore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家工厂很碍眼。

Sense.DEF: a pain you feel in your eyes, for example because you are tired or have been reading a lot

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb would give their eye teeth for sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone wants something very much
Sense.TRAN: 某人非常希望得到某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d give my eye teeth to be able to play the piano like that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我恨不得能那样弹钢琴。

Sense.DEF: one of the long pointed teeth at the corner of your mouth
something that you do not believe is true
glasses, sunglasses etc – used especially by companies who make them
Sense.TRAN: 眼镜﹐太阳镜〔尤为生产商所使用〕

Sense.DEF: someone who has seen something such as a crime happen, and is able to describe it afterwards

GramExa.EXAMPLE: According to eyewitness accounts, soldiers opened fire on the crowd.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据目击者描述﹐士兵向人群开了枪。

Sense.EXAMPLE: One eyewitness said he saw her talking to a man in a blue car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名目击者说他看见她在跟一个坐在蓝色汽车里的男子说话。

Sense.DEF: a present participle of eye2
a small island in a river
the nest of a large bird, especially an eagle, that is usually built high up in rocks or trees
Sense.TRAN: 〔常筑于岩石﹑树顶等高处的〕猛禽巢〔尤指鹰巢〕

Sense.DEF: a room or building that is very high up
Sense.TRAN: 位于高处的房间[建筑物]

Sense.DEF: a website that is like a magazine
